The good point is the burgers and fries were made fresh.Bad point is I just can't justify the price. One gets confused when you can go to a buffet for the price of a franchise chain hamburger.

For the price I paid the place should have been squeaky clean and everything should have been functional.

There is nothing to draw me back here.
Best service since we've been in town. Jorge was on point for sure. We love that we can have great food with superb service.   Thanks Jorge!!

Big burgers, big prices, fits right into this extravagant city.

I went for the self-seating outdoor bar, famished after a long night.  A quick check of the reviews said that largest size - XXXL - was almost unfinishable due to the size, so I ordered the XXL.  With no bun (paleo!).  And a fried egg.  And bacon.  Because it was technically breakfast.  

There is a bit of a wait, but it was bearable - large burgers grilled to order take a bit of time.

What came out was two huge patties, with the cheese, bacon and egg layered on top, resting on some greens, onions and tomatoes on the side.  Although it looked dry, it was juicy and flavorful.  The egg was cooked to over-hard, which was fine.  The bacon was just okay.  I knife and forked it easily (much easier to eat than In-N-Out's Protein style order).  I finished it all, but it was a lot of food - a very fat burger indeed.

The outdoor seating is enjoyable, more so for the view of the tvs by the bar, and the comely staff.  The people watching is a bit muted, from our time there.  Service is attentive.

If I wanted a gut-bomb of a breakfast/lunch, this could be a place I'd go back too.
My first and last try. I think the meat is tasteless and the tomato was almost green,  Enough said!
Good fast food burger. I just was ticked off there was nothing else open at a casino (Red Rocks) at 11PM.

I first went to this Fatburger a few months ago when I was in Vegas for a friend's bachelor party.  The burgers are AWESOME, especially for a fast food joint.  I used to think In-And-Out was the hidden fast food burger gem on the west coast...but Fatburger passed them up!  
Fast forward to last week.  I was back in Vegas with a few friends and one of my friends had a Triple King Burger (three 1/2 pound patties).  If you finish this monstrosity, they give you a free t-shirt and take your picture to put up on the wall.  He finished it and got his picture taken.  They were out of t-shirts though.  
A few nights later, we went back.  I ordered a QUAD King Burger (trip-King + 1 extra patty) to one-up my friend.  After consuming TWO POUNDS of delicious hamburger, I instantly regretted my decision.  The burger was awesome (as usual), but I was disgustingly full.  They were still out of t-shirts, and their camera was broken too, but I didn't care.  Right after we left, one of the cooks came outside after me to shake my hand.  I LOVE FATBURGER!

If you went to Fatburger in L.A. like I used to,you will likely be a bit disappointed. The charm and funky atmosphere have somehow been lost here. 

Pluses: The food is always good. Being able to add an egg or make your order custom is a welcome change. The menu is deliberately limited. This means their core products are spot on and well made. 

Minuses: The current pricing structure leaves a lot to be desired. $20 for 2 people to have burgers and fries is quite steep. The jukebox is gone,but some retro music is still played. Do not be in a hurry here, however long it takes for the food to arrive,is how long it will take. 

Summary: There are a lot of good burger places out there,and many of them are a better value.

Came here and hour before they closed and it took us about 7 mins to finally get our food which isn't bad. But once we got it my friends burger was completely wrong so we had to complain and get it remade. Then that took a little bit more time. So by the time we got that burger back they were trying to rush us so they could clean and get out of work. I'm sorry but I do work in the service industry and that is not good guest service. It's ok I won't be back to this location

When it takes 25 minutes to make 2 milk shakes to go that's a problem. The cashier didn't seem to happy when I ordered 2 chocolate milkshakes and said "there's 2 milkshakes ahead of you so" I mean what the heck? How long does it take to make a milkshake that is the same as Baskin Robbins. Maybe have more than 1 staff member working at this location if it's going to take over 20 minutes to make 2 milkshakes.

This location has some of the best burgers and we have eaten here a few times now. Most of the staff is always really friendly. This time we ate the person named Shannon took my order and seemed very standoffish and not friendly. Should have a better attitude - rest of the staff like I said is very friendly in the afternoon. She wouldn't even look at you while taking the order.

I love fatburger!!

Went here a couple of time during our 2 week holiday in Vegas and couldn't fault it.

Being a veggie I obviously had the veggie burger, so tasty! Boyfriend had the XL burger on his first visit with egg - it was huge! He couldn't finish it and he's had a 1lb burger and a 1/3lb burger in one sitting once in fuddruckers with no problem. But fatburger defeated him!
Chips/fries are great and the oreo milkshake. Only thing is they asked me first time if I wanted whipped cream on top to which I said no, but did't get asked second time. Didn't think anything of it unitl it arrived with a load of cream on top. yikes, not a fan of cream! 

I'm just gutted we couldn't find it on our first night! I had read it was behind the MGM, which it really isn't! So went off in the direction of Hooters looking for it (obviously wrong way!). Being hungry in a new city, which was unbelievably hot is not a good combo when all you've read about for months before going away is fatburger and other similar  burger joints and you just don't want the usual mcdonalds.

If only we had one in the UK!

I love Fatburger but Be carefull at the Las vegas Strip Fat Burger keep you reciept the employees are scamming customers. I was charged an extra $2.00 to my credit card without my authurization. My friend was charged $9.00 more to her credit card. At the the end of the day I bet the make some serious cash by all the people they rip off. Again keep your recipt. I hope they do something about this but I doubt it....

Had the XXL Burger which was great. The family also had burgers which they enjoyed. Our order was a little askew as 1 of the kids burgers were plain when we ordered it with cheese. Also we ordered 3 fat fries 1 regular fries. We got 2 fat fries and 2 regular. Our order was to go, was up in our room at Santa Fe Station and wasn't going back down. Food quality was very good! FYI milkshake size is a medium at most fast food places, but very very thick!

Best thick burger we have had in the Vegas/ Henderson area. Yes it is expensive but not anymore expensive than other burger places with crappy food. Burgers and fries were hot and fresh. We will be back. Thank you to the cook and the staff.

This location is so dirty, i felt sick after eating here.  There was no toilet paper or hand soap in the bathroom...what do they wash their hands with??!!! Just threw up in my mouth thinking of their filthy hands on my burger. Not to mention the sink hasn't been scrubbed in months.  The floors in the restaurant were filthy, along with the windows and walls.  Is there no manager on site?? If there is, you need to find a new career. You have no idea how to run a business.  I'm betting it's not long before they get shut down by the health dept.  DO NOT eat here for your own good!

Just moved near a location, haven't been to one in a while,  thought I'd give it a shot.  Never again,  service is horrible,  45 min wait in the drive through.  There wasn't anyone in the restaurant ordering to even slow them down. Over priced.
Best burger place in town! It reminds me of a really good Red Robins but without having to have a waiter.

Never going back.  First of all it's way too expensive for the crappy food we received.  The fries were nothing special and tasted worse than the kind that come frozen that you bake in the oven.  Customer service was rude and very unhelpful.  There's also a sign there that says they make all burgers medium well and mine had lots of pink in it (which I hate of course).

I love Fatburger, but this location is disgusting and the customer service is horrible!  I stopped by after a movie to grab a burger, fry and chocolate shake.  I walked right up and ordered, however 30 minutes later, I'm still waiting.  When I walked up to ask what was taking so long the blonde girl said, "Oh yeah, your shake...I'll get started on that."  Then someone walks up to order and she starts waiting on them before preparing my shake...LOL.  The customer is sweet and asks the employee to please make my shake before taking her order.  Meanwhile, my burger and fries are sitting under a heat lamp as they'd been done for 15 minutes!  I was being as patient as possible/trying to be understanding...I was just hungry and wanted to eat.  As the blonde girl hands me everything, the lady cook with frizzy hair starts openly sneezing everywhere!  She doesn't cover her face or anything and then has the nerve to look at me crazy when my face shows a look of disgust.  Whoever runs this Fatburger should be ashamed and I'm surprised the Fiesta Casino allows this type of business to run this way.  STAY AWAY from this Fatburger!

A good burger spot that's open 24hrs is definateLy convenient for any burger Lover!
5am after a night in the cLub, FatBurger is the pLace to be!

So I hold 5 to a high standard, and although I am giving this one a 3 that dose not mean its bad. With that being said this place was good, the service was fast and friendly. Food was fresh and hot, even after the 10 minute ride home.

I love a Fatburger!  Whenever we go to Vegas and stay in a place where there is one, you can find me sitting down and stuffing my face at least once during that trip.

The husband and I went last week to this one on the strip, I always get the medium burger with cheese, fat fries and a soda.  It does take a few minutes to get your food since it is cooked to order.  The staff here are always friendly and the food is always good.  It is super unhealthy, but damn, it's a good burger.  They also have really tasty onion rings which the husband always gets with his burger.

The restaurant is not the cleanest, as it is right on the strip and I think does a fair amount of business, but if you can get over that it's fine.  I used to be a huge In N Out fan, but they have gone down hill in the last few years and are more like a cheap cardboard burger with fries that are lacking.  Fatburger blows In n Out away!  

Between the burger and fries it's usually too much food for me, but I don't care, it's worth it.  You will pay more than $4-$5 for your meal, but you get what you pay for.

I walk in and there are a whopping 2 people in the place..... the cashier yells "gonna be a minute" with his back to me.  15 mins later without an apology finally asks me if "I was ready to order".  Place is run like shit....food was good though, unfortunately it isn't enough to bring me back!

This was my first time at this location and I probably should have read the reviews before going here. They clearly over charge from what's on the menu and management gets an attitude when you question it and tells you to call corporate. 

I ordered a kids meal which clearly said "choice of burger, chicken fingers, or hot dog $7.59". I ordered the burger with cheese and the cashier said without tax it would be $9 something so I opted out on the cheese. I pull up to the window (I was in drive thru) and the receipt still said $9.57 for a kids meal! I asked her again to explain why it was that much so she went and got a manager. After talking in circles saying that the burger was higher priced then the fingers,  she finally said it was because "they charge extra tax". On the receipt I had already been charged for tax so I asked why are we charged twice for tax??? She tells me to call corporate! 

Then to top it off the food was horrible. The burger was smashed and just thrown together. I used to love Fatburger and this location will make me second guess going to any other location again!

Definitely wouldn't recommend this place. Right after I ordered, a guy wanted his money back and had a huge hair hanging from his burger. NASTY!!! I asked for my money back too, it disgusted me so much. Not only that, the service was sooooooooo slow.

Woohoo!  AGAIG indeed!  My favourite burger joint.  So much goodness!  The menu is incredible and the burgers are so dope it'll blow your mind.  The staff at this location are excellent too; extra friendly and very efficient and courteous, making for a wonderful experience overall.  The prices are reasonable given the portions as well.  Loads of free toppings, I always add an onion ring!

Good food, great interior set up, and fun for everyone! I've tried a lot of the menu and any item is great. The burger itself is cooked well. While it may be tempting to order a larger burger when hungry I'd recommend trying a medium first as these burgers are pretty large.

There is good reason that this joint only has 2.5 out 5 stars for 53 reviews not counting mine: They suck!

I ordered a chocolate shake. At the wonder I was told the total was $4.75. Really? A full dollar more than the already overpriced menu? The guy says, "oh yah, we're waiting for corporate to send us an updated menu" uh... well isn't that called false advertising?

I wasn't in the mood to argue, the thought crossed my mind to just drive off but I went ahead and overpaid. Should have just driven away, worst, liquid, overpriced shake ever. 

Lesson learned, if you are going to have diet cheat treat, go to in n out and pay half for a MUCH better shake. 

This will be the final time I ever give Fatburger my business. They have failed to impress me every time I have tried them with their service (or lack therof), prices or food. I'm sure they'll go out of business soon.
Way overpriced from what it use to be. Food was just okay and fries where cold. Had to have the fries made fresh.
Overpriced dry burgers and frozen fries just doesn't cut it.  There's many better options in the GTA. .

Place is nice, but the prices aren't really worth it in comparison even to other burger places. There's also a couple traps to be careful of, like how the thousand island fatburger is 7.19, but you can get a medium for 5.19 and get a free addon of thousand island. The service is nice, but the prices themselves are almost deterrents on their own. The food does take longer to get, but it seems to be for quality, so I'm fine with it. In summary, pricier but higher quality, careful of the traps.

Went through the drive thru a later day, and their drive thru sign's prices are unreadable, which is a pretty big problem.
This place isn't even open 24/7 went in and stood in line and these cleaners were cleaning the kitchen

Not that great. I felt this place was a MAJOR let down. It was 23 dollars for two dry burgers and fries. They got my order wrong too. I'm only giving two stars because the fat fries were okay enough, even they didn't have much flavor. Wishing we went to Subway or McDonalds  instead. But at least we tried it ourselves.
I had a fried egg sandwich and a banana milkshake at 2 AM.  It was delicious. It's open 24/7 and in a great location.

Apparently they have new owners and want to charge for everything individually.  Bring the cost of a reg fat burger meal to over $13.  Yea sorry fat burger your dreaming of you think you can charge that for your burgers with 5 guys right across the street.  Fat burger you FIRED!  I doubt this location and its owners will be here very long. Bye Felicia !  5GUYS HERE I COME

A great place to grab a quick bite of food, especially late at night. I think they're 24 hours... The atmosphere is boisterous with the workers singing along with their fancy jukebox, bumpin at club volumes. I wouldn't recommend eating inside unless you like that kind of thing. Anyway, even though this place looks kind of fishy, their burgers actually tasted fresh. They make it right when you order it; so, it's nice and hot. It kind of reminded me of In-N-Out.

Me and a friend went to Fatburger for the first time on my friends birthday and we had such a great time! At first the parking was really confusing only because we've never been to this area before, but once we figured it out; smooth sailing.

The restaurant is clean and the person taking our orders was very pleasant and even throughout the meal she checked to see if we needed anything. We both ordered the double king burger with one large fry. To my friend's surprise, the XXL king burger is not on the menu.. We figured that perhaps you have to request it? Or maybe they just don't have it in Canada, don't matter though, the double was amazing!

I couldn't finish my burger, it was way too big but the beef was delicious well cooked and we only waited about 10 minutes for our food (mind you this is a Sunday afternoon when no one was around, can't guartunee you ain't gonna be waiting long lol). The French Fries were just as good, super crispy which I like. My friend ended up wolfing down his burger and half of mine along with some fries; which of course totally put him over the edge.. (it's a lot of meat)

The best part about this burger is that it's juicy. This ain't the 'got cooked a couple hours ago and it's sitting in a warm oven' type, it was cooked fresh just for me. The bun does get soggy fast but hey it's a huge ass burger with tons of grease, what're gonna do? Complain?! Get the hell outta here! Lol 

After we finished our meals we went and ordered two chocolate milk shakes

Let me tell you about these milkshakes okay..

Let me tell you. It was the most delicious shake I've ever had. No exaggeration! Considering I live in Scarborough and literally the only place to get a decent shake is Dairy Queen OR McDonald's yes, this is considerably the best damn shake that has entered my body (that sounded kinda weird but you get the point), it's also made with fresh ice cream!! 

Can't deny I returned approximately a week later just to get another shake lol! Well worth the trip if you don't reside in Thornhill (to my Scarbies) you won't regret it
My boyfriend loved this spot.  Nice service,  no wait time. Great value of food for the money. I love the fat fries.

I like these burgers.  It does cost more than In & Out, but you don't have to deal with the mob there.  Don't ever buy the milk shake without the combo.  I decided I wanted a milk shake to take home,,,,,,$4.16 for a one size of small.  It is hand made, but still,,,,,,

Good burger served with lukewarm fries. Service is good but a bit slow when comparing to in n out or even 5 guys. Beef just above average, barely. Maybe it was an off day, willing to try again some time soon.

$27 for a Burger, drink, and 2 fries, (one was chilli cheese) mmmm it just tasted "alright" just like every other fast food burger. ill pass next time and hit the dollar menu at Burger King lol i get the same satisfaction ;p
Great burger! I asked for ketchup and mayo for the base. The people working there did a great job. The grill is nice and clean and it hit the spot. Thank you!

Food was good, bartender fantastic, waitresses horrible. It was a great day so we decided to eat outdoors. We were told to sit at any table and a waitress would be with us shortly. Ten minutes later, after making eye contact and waving at 2 waitresses, we still had no menus. We decided to sit at the bar. Best decision every. The bartender, receipt said Lyman, took our order right away and got our drinks to us in no time. When the kitchen forgot one of our burgers he went to the kitchen and brought out the burger. The drinks were very potent. He really saved our lunch.

The only thing that holds this from being the best burger joint ever is the horrible onion rings , bland , tough , nasty 
Burgers are the best I've ever had .. double fat cheese is supreme , 
Staff is awesome, helpful , polite and deserve the tip someone else was bitching  about .
Restaurant is clean and comfy .... fix the onion rings and it's perfect !!!

Yeah, I know it's a chain. So what? The burgers are awesome. 

I don't eat beef, so the turkey burger is my meat on a bun choice. Most places don't know what to do with turkey- it's like a foreign substance they   try to rid themselves of as quickly as possible. Fatburger, though, knows how to do a dead turkey justice. The meat is seasoned and cooked perfectly, resulting in a very tasty sandwich. 

The fries are great too- especially the fat ones. Yum.

Well here we go, my first 1 star review in Yelp!

The biggest reason is because it took them 30 freaking minutes to cook a freaking Baby Fat burger. Yep, a fast food restaurant actually beating a fine dining restaurant when it comes to serving! And no, it was not as if they were crowded. There were, believe it or not, just 4, FOUR people on the line. The poor guy in front of me had to wait 15 minutes just to be served up his soda. Oh man, it was so sad I almost laugh. And those clueless idiots (Pardon me) keep asking our orders for probably 5-6 times throughout the 30-minute torture.

The burger itself isn't that great, and is overpriced like hell. It was overcooked, dry and not juicy at all. And I finished a $3.50 burger with just 3-4 bites. Wew.

Just go to In-N-Out. I've not been to their outlet in Vegas but it would take something extraordinary to be worse than these guys.
Although quite yummy, burger had some unchewable fatty parts. Onion rings left a pool of grease at the bottom of tray. Many great selections of toppings, but I don't think I'll be back.
California burger and sweet potato fries were really good. Guacamole and bacon on the burger was delicious

It's hit or miss here apparently.  Today, 8/25/12, the buns we're bordering on stale. That pretty much dampens the burger experience.  I know that it doesn't have to be this way because the Chase Field Fatburgers are always tasty.  I've had a good experience here before, but not today.

Hubby is originally from Southern California and absolutely loves Fatburger and since there aren't any close to where we live in the Bay he had to visit Fatburger on the strip while we were in Vegas. 

When we entered we noticed how small the space is and how you just know it is not clean. 

Mt husband ordered a fat king burger with egg and since I was not hungry I decided not to place an order. 

There was not very many people in the restaurant but it did take a little while for the food because the food is made to order. 

While we were waiting we met a very nice lady from Utah who was with her family. 

It is the typical fast food burger joint that has a lot a kids working. 

3 stars because my husband's burger was pretty good and typical of Fatburger. 

I bet we will be back when we visit Vegas again.

This place serves one of the best burgers I ever had!! I had the medium burger with everything and added cheese, guacamole, bacon and an egg! It was so good!! I had it with "skinny chili cheese fries which were good. The service was fast! Place was packed and me and my boyfriend got our food asap! I will make this a must stop when I come to Vegas

This place is very overrated. The hamburgers and sides are way overpriced. Sure,  the fried egg option is awesome but the burgers do not taste that great. I went to lunch here with a friend and between the two of us it was $28+ dollars. Way too much money for a fast food  hamburger stand. For that price, I could eat at Hubert Keller's Burger Bar. The service here sucks too, I was gambling around 4AM and went up to the counter. The guy cooking did not even acknowledge me.  So I just left. There are way better hamburger places than this dump!

Last great hamburger stand my A$$!!!!!!!!!!! --Very disappointed

What in the actual fresh hell is this? $17 for two burgers with no sides or drinks?? $1 for a slice of cheese? Holy ba-nae-naes! Avoid this location at all costs people. **I would like edit add, that we got the single patty burger, and not the double patty burger. For an even larger awe inspiring view of why this price is outrageous.
Staff is friendly. You can request a fax sheet and just pick up your order for lunch. Loved that!

Service was friendly and fast, especially for being fairly busy and only having one person start the cooking and take the orders. I guess the other person was on break? Fat Burger is just as good in AZ and Cali as it is in Nevada. I order the veggie burger meal, my daughter a medium burger meal and my boyfriend the large burger meal. It came out to $31, and it was worth every bite. To save money next time we'll share soda's and save about $2 per drink since it's bottomless. :). Also if you wanted to save on time, call in the order. Remember Hidden Valley Ranch packet isn't free BUT sometime if you wait till the end and smile while asking nicely, you just might get it for free. :)

Food is made fresh in front you, cashier Elizabeth friendly and trying her best to keep staff together. Not sure if they decides to train two new employees today (fries and shakes) but these two have no experience working in a fast paced environment. Wandering around or attempting to accomplish their tasks as slow as possible. Had three parties leave before their orders were completed or taken. Current observation is that both of the new employees are somehow both occupying the fryer.

Very meh. Didn't really care for the atmosphere. Very forgettable and bland. You'd be better off trying somewhere else for dinner and saving time, money, and your stomach. 

Not. Worth. It.

I went there on March 7th in the late afternoon.  My friend ordered before me and got a burger meal.  AND THE POWER WENT OUT RIGHT AS I WAS ORDERING!!  My friend ordered about 5 minutes before me so I got to eat some of her steak fries....the were awesome!!  Other than that not much else to say.  Gotta try them again some time.  The Nutter Butter Shake looked full of calories but delicious.  Better luck next time!

The high star rating is mostly because this is one of the few places in the Green Valley Resort that's open after 11pm.  The chili cheese fries hit the spot- great crispy thin fries, gooey cheese, and meaty, but not too chunky chili.  The different burger size options is genius.  The middle option (large burge) is really big.  I can't imagine how someone could polish off an XXL burger.  Well, actually I'm sure that Adam from Man vs. Food could eat one no problem.

Won't be returning. At least to this location or until they can find a competent person to work the counter and take orders. It's really not that difficult of a job but for some reason the woman at cash register couldn't seem to be able to process what I was trying to order. First strike, out of fat fries. Then, she wrang my order in wrong so I had to reorder missing items. Next, a man who ordered was given his food but informed the cook he hadn't paid yet so he had to wait for the woman to come from the back so he could pay and take his food. The cook told her he needed to pay cause his food was ready and she instead of taking care of him proceeded to make a milk shake. Then the plain cheeseburger I ordered for my son came out with chili on it which I only ordered on the side. So we had to wait for the burger to be remade. As we are eating right now I notice that all they've done to " fix" his burger was wipe the chili of and re-grill it. In total I was in there for 25 min.  Fatburger, please get rid of this incompetent worker and rehire someone who has at least half a brain. Very frustrating!!
Worst Fatburger experience ever.  A Fatburger, fries and chocolate shake was$17 + change.  Parking was $5.  $22 is way too much for Fatburger.  Some advice, go to InNOut up the street.

We've been here a few times to eat in and for take out. Fatburger is ok. Not awesome, not crap, but ok.

I think to be honest price has a lot to do with it. I should mention that I spent over 10 years working for a "gourmet burger" chain in Ontario, in the stores and later in the corporate offices. So  I get food cost, wanting to offer a better experience that McDonald's and be more upscale. And I think that is where Fat Burger falls down. While they are better than a "cheap burger place" but they fail to "wow" me. So then you become very aware you just spent $30 for a couple of burgers, fries and shakes. Better than McDonald? Yes. But I think they are over charging. They aren't THAT much better.

That being said, the food is decent. I would recommend eating in because they haven't quite mastered the art of packing up food to go-it comes out of the bag an absolute disaster. The burgers are good, the fries however leave a bit to be desired. The Chocolate shakes are also good and very filling. The turkey burger is a tasty choice if you are looking to avoid beef.

It would be nice to see Fatburger either lower their prices slightly, or improve their "wow" factor somehow to justify their prices a little more. We'd probably go more than once a year if they did that.

Hands down the best burger I've ever had. When we first got to Vegas we went immediately to get something to eat and my husband said you have to try these burgers, of course I was skeptical, but soon as I bit in my burger OMG I was moaning and he said I told you. Awesome burger!!

Terrible food.  Terrible service.  Very dirty establishment.  I don't know what all the hype is about over this place.  I believe its because of all the celebrities that endorse it.  But this place had a flat, dried out meat patty, much like one you would get at a Dennys.  Their choice of beef cut produced a mild flavored, non-juicy patty.  They burned my wife's burger, and when she tried to exchange it, they gave her attitude by trying to tell her it was just the cheese.  But they did end up making her another one.  "In n Out" or "5 Guys" are both much better choices.  Never again!
Went by their today 7/26/17 wed and place had been Red tagged & closed down by the Heath department ( Yuck gross) Never again will i go back!
Fatburger was good. Onion rings were okay. Lemonade was refreshing.

What did you do to my FATBURGER! This was, for years, my go to place for a great burger, great service, and ambiance. What happened!?

The last three times I've been here have been horrible. Two times ago, we were the only people in the place and there wasn't a clean table to be found. We had to ask someone to clean a table. A guy comes out with a dirty rag (smelled like dirty dishwater) and smeared the table "clean" and left with an attitude. Haven't seen him again, but still. After that, we've ordered takeout.

Last two times the service was TERRIBLE. Last night OVER THIRTY FIVE minutes to get three burgers and we were the only ones there. Now, that would be fine (it's not fast food) except they made our shakes first and they were all ruined before we even got our food. It's TAKEOUT! Are we supposed to drink our shakes before we leave? I guess I have to take the whole family with me to pick up our food, not sit down at the filthy table, drink our shakes at the counter while we wait over a half hour for a burger where the bread was hard, the meat was over cooked and the guy behind the counter looked like he wanted to be ANYWHERE else. If you're the owner of this Fatburger, please GET YOUR ASS IN THERE and straighten these guys out. Better yet, get the old guys back. You know? When your place had good service. So extremely disappointed.

I was told that you can't go to Las Vegas and not stop in Fatso Burger 

Well worth the stop, I grabbed a couple of burgers and fries at 3 am 

Fabulous !!
Last night I had Anthony as my server and he was amazing. He had great customer service and was so nice. I would defiantly come back to this location.

I read all the reviews are they are not good, so why do I like this place? It's old fashioned, the service was great - just nice and polite. It takes a bit longer to get your food (it's a good thing). Open kitchen. The burger was super messy in a yummy way. The meat was not a perfect flat circle it actually seemed like real beef. I drank a full sugar cherry coke and it was worth every calorie. I got the skinny fries, not because I thought they had less calories but I like skinny stick fries that are crispy and they were. 
I got a medium fatburger with cheese & grilled onions, medium skinny fries, drink, the kid got: small fatburger with cheese, fat fries and milk shake. It came to a little over $20. 
The only thing that would improve is beer. The only negative is a bit too salty but that might be why it was so good too.

This is great burger ever...I love fat fries!!!
Good serve and good fix my burger. Yummmm

I will never and I mean never go to Fat burger again. my roommate went to get us dinner he got home and they shorted us a burger. he called them to get it straightened out they said he was lying, therefore we are out of our money but that will be the last time. I suggest find a different place not worth the money anyways but if you do go be sure to check your bag before you leave n if they try to short your order smack the shit out of them.

Open 24 hours great! But because of its location it seemed like everyone in Vegas was hungry at the same time so the wait for food was long then once I ordered it was about a half hr until my number was called. So service was bad.

Cleanliness was not taught to any of the employees there and the bathroom was hideous and smelled horrible.

Only positive was how delicious the food was despite the high prices.

I come here every time I go to Vegas. I recommend this place highly. I always get the 1/2 pound chews and bacon burger with myshrooms on the side. ( they tend to make the burger bun wet) so input on after wards. But a solid choice in the strip. 

I actually saw pharrel roll in here with a bunch of guys and girls at 5 am Friday night. It was crazy!!

Wow - great experience! The burger was incredible and the service was even better. At the end of the meal, I was wrapping up what was left of my son's burger, and the cashier dropped by with a paper bag and bagged it for me. Outstanding job, Fatburger! You've earned a loyal customer.

If you get here and there are more than two people in line in front of you, don't expect to order for at least 10 minutes.  It took the cashier forever to enter the order into a computer and you have to speak slow and repeat it several times.  If you order a shake, she will make it before taking the next order in line.  

After we finally ordered, it took 20 minutes to get our burgers!  We were told the fries were taking longer to cook and would be a few minutes.  The burgers were good, but they had started to cool off by this point.  I had ordered the new Thousand Island Burger, they had apparently forgot that small detail.  It took so long to get this one that I didn't even bother having them redo it.

The fries arrived 8 minutes later and were slightly undercooked.  They were done, but not crispy yet.  you could tell right away because they were not that golden brown color.  We had ordered 3 orders of fat fries,  but she brought two fat and one skinny fries.  She told us that she gave us what was available and didn't want us to wait any longer.  She dropped the platter on the table and walked away.  I guess we did better than other people who ordered onion rings, they got the same skinny fries and were told that there was something wrong with the onion rings and that's all they had.  I guess the other people figured the same thing, the wait was so long why even bother fighting it.  The staff didn't even bother offering a refund for the extra dollar it costs for the onion rings!

The meal was ok, but not worth the 30 minutes it took to get part of the order.  The last straw was when my wife pointed out the water stained roof tiles above us.  They were painted black, but now some of the tiles had obvious water damage and one even looked like it had white mold growing on it.

I don't ever expect to be coming back, there are just too many choices out there, especially at their prices!

We have juicy delicious Fatburgers where I live in Escondido, CA so I thought I would impress my friend with the best burger of her life while we were in Vegas. But that didn't happen with four dry overcooked burgers and lame skinny fries. They put mayo on mine which I hate and never ask for. Then I jacked my car on the excessively long concrete guide on the way out of the drive thru. Be careful not to cut that corner! Very disappointing.
My first time eating Fat Burger and i must say i am impressed. Burger and fries were awesome. Definitely enough to share!

I love Fatburger...that being said, this location is awful. Somehow they have been able to hire the most inept and incompetent people on the planet. 3 people in line when i walked in...took close to 15 minutes to order. When I did order I had to repeat my order 4 times so that the girl could slowly enter it into the computer. It seemed like the only person who knew what was going on was the poor manager who was running around working the grill, fries, and register when the girl had a question every 35 seconds. The other 2 employees may have well just gone home. It pains me to see a place that has the potential to make such amazing burgers be butchered like this. All i can think of is..and they want $15/hr?? Ha!!
Burger for it self is not that good... Lack spice... And the price, not fair. To expensive, in my opinion.

Hubby and I visited LV recently and came to Fatburger to nurse our hangovers before we drove out.. Service SUCKED... we waited for THIRTY minutes and then they brought us pancakes when we ordered burgers... We knew something was up becasue ALL the cooks in the kitchen were fighting over the tickets the whole time we were there.. These people were SERIOUSLY disorganized and I can't be too sure but there was a large sweaty girl cook that appeared to be unable to read. Everyone kept pointing at the tickets and telling her what they said. 

It took a total of 40 minutes to make 2 burgers and 1 order of fries. I got a medium which was about the size of a wendys burger with a fluffy bun and it cost $5 for JUST THE BURGER! Nothing special about it.. Except for the relish... sooo... congrats you put a hotdog condiment on a burger and thought it was special.

First time ever going to a fat burger and the last time. 
For four meals with no add on's one of the meals being a kids meal all medium drinks and the smallest frys our total came to $47. I pulled up to the window and waited about 8 minutes for the employee to even come to the window and I asked him to repeat the order and total. I proceeded to tell him that he's best off canceling my order because I will not pay $47 for 3 adults and a kids meal. That averaged out to about $11.75 a meal He proceeds to ask if I am serious.  Of course I am. I could go sit down at a restaurant and pay that....this place is way over priced and the service is really slow. The place was about empty thus why I didn't not understand the delay. Don't waste your time and money here.

If I could give them zero stars I would.  Fatburger has great food. That being said, this location is horrible.  They can't get an order correct and the fries are always burnt to a crisp.  Customer service is nonexistent and they have an "oops" attitude when they forget food in your order or give you someone else's order.  Don't waste your money or time. Go to a different location.
The main thing I'm upset about is two people after me who ordered a burger and drinks got theirs before my one burger.   Bad business. ....  they suck with the service.

Eh.  This is the second Fatburger I have been to, as I usually like to give mediocre a second try in case it was a fluke.  Nope, sorry Fatburger- you are just bland.  The burger was lacking excitement.  Bland was the theme of the day here.  The prices were way out of line for the end product.  Oh well.
The service isn't the fastest but the food is great and they have never screwed up any of my orders like other fast food places.

Let me preface this by saying that.. if i could give this place 3.4 stars i would (not 3.5 because I didn't feel strongly about rounding up another star, unfortunately.)

Its true the burger here are delicious - the condiments were generously piled onto the burger, and it was so perfectly wrapped (yes, the ocd side of me lights up at things like this). The fries are some of the most delicious fries ever.  I just had some, and I kind of want some more already.  They're so perfectly cooked - crunchy on the outside without satisfying any of the soft interior (I'm referring to the skinny fries).

However, minus 1 star because I have to say that it unfortunately reminds me greatly of another burger joint that I love much more (rhymes with mud suckers).  I know it's not fatburgers fault, but it is unfortunate that the burger reminds me too much of another (better) one I've already tried.  Please save the hate mail, loyal fatburger fans.. this is my personal and honest opinion.

Minus another star because I asked for mayo on the side and I found my burger fully dressed with mayo in my burger.  I could have let it slide, but my friend also asked for a burger without some of the condiments, and unfortunately his burger also came as if he has asked for a burger with everything.

I will recommend this place though - if you're in the area.  It isn't good enough for me to drive all the way to the strip and park in a club parking lot and have to walk around a bunch of drunk jackasses eager to prove how macho they are to some girl who is not even interested in them and deal with parking specifically for it though.

Went by tonight because I was craving a burger....arrived at 9:14pm...mind you, they are still supposed to be open at this very moment according to the time as the door clearly stated 10:00pm ( I even checked online to see what time they closed to be sure) and the red open sign was still on which is why I went inside. However, when I walked in, there was a gentleman at the grill wiping it, lights were dimmed and chairs put up. I asked if they are already closed and he replied almost,I then asked if I could order something since it was only 15 after 9 and they are not due to close till 10pm.. instead of responding he turns and goes to the back....So I waited (mainly just to see if he was going to come back or wait, hoping I would leave) he then comes back out about 3 minutes later and I ask the same question...then I ask to speak to a manager he points to the a wall and says you can call.  I said what is the manager's and is there a number or card....he replies no...I again ask for the manager's name and he replied Eduardo.  I said, I saw another employee in the back when I walked in can I speak to him. The 2nd employee comes out and tells me he was cleaning the bathrooms and he was the acting manager.  He nonchalantly apologized for the other reps behavior and asked if he could help me...Sir, you have turned off the lights, picked up all the chairs, turned off all the grills and have bathroom hands...what exactly is it that you think you can do for me at this point?  I am in complete shock at the lack of anything that this place of business had to offer me, which was nothing.  I then ask him for the manager's name and info, he says I am the manager, I then said, the other gentleman just said it was Eduardo, he then said, "Eduardo is the GM I am acting manager".  I said, "can I please have the GM's info please", he again stated, in his nonchalant manner, "he will be in tomorrow".  I know it's the holiday season and everyone is trying to get home to their families but if your sign says open and your doors are not locked and I walk in, don't ignore me, just hoping I will go away, that is just horrible!! NEVER AGAIN Fatburger!!!!!

I should've just stuck with In N Out. They've never done me wrong. I decided to give Fatburger a try since I never had one. I didn't care for them. The patty was kind of crumbly and tasted a bit like the homemade ones I make. The bread was not good and I tossed one of them out. Also, they were too pricey, and I didn't like the fact that you had to pay extra for things such as cheese. This really jacks up the price. In & Out is just one low price for a delicious burger. Also, the staff were just standing around and yakking with each another. This was annoying when they were around me when I was eating. I had to also disturb their gossip time to wipe my table, which they should've taken care of instead of yakking.

we have eaten at this location  a couple of times now and both times amazing food, friendly staff & location is nice and they even have a bar for those who like beer with your burgers. this is our go to spot for burgers glad to have one in our niebourhood.

I got a turkey burger combo with a Maui shake and fat fries paid 20, waited in drive thru for 25 mins got my order. Once at home the burger was cold the onion rings were soggy and the fries looked like there were just dumped in the bag, mind you I only live 10 mins away. When I called the store some girl answered I asked for a manager she said no one was there and stated"umm I'm trying to work " and she HUNG UP ON ME!! I called back and she answered again once I said I wanted to talk to someone else She hung up on me again, I called once more got Brandon who was very nice and polite but when I asked for the rude girl name he said "I think it's Christina" (I mean don't you work there? You don't know who you working with) anyways ... never going to this location again.

Today i ordered Fatburger from UberEATS. I that is the best decision i have made since a couple of months ago when i decided to start going to the gym. Looking at the Uber driving towards my house was a sight for sore eyes. He was so nice and i gave him a big tip. 

Now flash forward to when he handed me the warm and greasy paper bag, i was so excited to dig in to this delicacy, the aromas had me hypnotized. I opened the bag and the first thing i saw was two baggies filled with 'moist' towelettes, mints, toothpicks, and ketchup. (How thoughtful!) after that i finally came in contact with the burger(s) that i ordered; a Veggie burger meal and  Cheeseburger for my smol brother. I greedily opened the wrapper like a toddler at Christmas and dug in. It wasn't what i expected. It was better! The burger was warm and tasted fresh! I loved it! The while experience was great. I even asked for them to put a scoop of vanilla ice cream into my root beer (in the comment section) and they did it. 

This is officially my favorite fast food place, and im vegetarian! 12/10
So very, very, very dirty.  People were nice but disgusting EVERYWHERE! I honestly don't know how they're able to stay open.

I have been to this Fatburger about 3-4 times now, and every time, my burger has been excellent.  I agree that the place does look like a dump - but I never go inside, I do the drive thru.  maybe they don't have air conditioning, but I don't care as long as they hand me out my burger!  I think it's the best tasting of all the fastfood burgers.  It is expensive, I agree, but I think it's worth it.  And so far, the drive-thru staff have always been very nice to me.  Don't go inside - just get your burger and head home!

It's been a long time since I've been to a Fatburger.  While it's freezing in here, and the place was deserted at 7:00 on a Saturday night, the guys here were quick and friendly.   The burgers were very good.   Wasn't exceptional, but way better than typical fast food.  I'd get the skinny fries next time.   Solid burger choice.
WAY OVERPRICED!! $15 for a burger, fries and drink. I could go to a full sit down restaurant and get a 3 course meal for this price. They need to seriously bring the prices down... way down!!

Ok so me and my wife go to fatburger inside the Santa fe casino and i have to say i was very very disappointed. I have eaten at fat burger several times so I can say definitely a bad experience at this location. So we ordered our hamburgers my a bat fat with cheese and a XXL no cheese as we're waiting for our food the manager approached our table and tells me they messed up and put cheese on my burger and if that was ok, I said NO nicely and they brought out our food minus my burger and I was ok with that since they were correcting there mistake. So now when they bring out my burger it has double patties so i open it up to salt it and the patties were completely broken apart and I figure it's ok since in not one to send food back so if that wasn't bad enough the patties were so overdone and dried out I didn't even eat the whole thing. I was very disappointed in my order especially when your spending over 10 bucks for a burger...was not happy and will not eat at that location again...I dont know if it was done out of spite since i said no to the cheese burger or if there cook is just bad at his job but i am not willing to find out again,

I went here my first night in Vegas with my mom who had talked this place up so much before we came. I was pretty disappointed when my burger arrived and the patty was burnt and tasted like someone poured the salt and pepper shakers over it for a good two minutes. The fries were the redeeming factor for this meal since they were sooo good! The service was great too which is my reason for the second star. Maybe I ate here on a fluke night, but next time I would prefer McDonalds to this place.
I had a veggie Burger here. It tasted good, but was a little bit messy when I unwrapped it. The price is the only reason it doesn't get more stars.

First, I feel like I should defend Fatburger from those who complain about the price or the length of wait for the food.  Yes, a fatburger costs more than a Quarter Pounder or a Whopper, and yes it takes longer to get.  That's because (A) it's a thicker (fatter) burger with fresher ingredients, and (B) it hasn't been sitting under a heat lamp waiting for you to come in and order it.  A fatburger is cooked to order, so they are fresh.  Quality is a positive thing, even if you have to pay for it, or wait for it.

In my high school days, when I had a little extra to spend, I used to go to Fatburger with a group of friends and get some chili-cheese fries covered with diced onions and a chocolate milk shake made with real ice cream.  We would hang out in the lobby, listening to that great old time rock 'n' roll and classic soul that they always play.  Those were good times.

Now that I try to eat healthier, it's been a couple of years since I've had their chili cheese fries or milk shake, but I still go to Fatburger once in awhile just for their veggie burger.  Kudos to Fatburger for offering a healthy alternative to standard fast food fare.  (If only In-N-Out Burger would introduce a burger with a veggie patty).  Fatburger uses a substantial Boca patty in their veggie burgers, and it makes for a tasty, satisfying meal.  It's probably the only thing I'll ever order from Fatburger anymore, so it's a really smart way to keep people like me coming back.

What's wonderful about a 24hr Fat Burger? Well if were like me and craved a juicy burger at 5am, this is a dream come true. I get here and I am met with fellow breakfast burger aficionados. I got myself a XXL with cheese, bacon, egg, and avocado. Sitting outside on the Vegas strip at 5am enjoying a well-made burger is pretty amazing.... It's American!

I had SUCH high hopes for Fatburger.  It was 4:30 in the morning and a nice big burger was just what the doctor ordered.  

First, this place was a MESS.  There was so much garbage on the floor, there was no way we would eat there.  I ordered the Fatburger and fries and we took it back to our room.  I definitely enjoyed the fries because I LOVE steak fries.  My burger was a disappointment.  It was super charred on the edges and the cheese was not melted at all.  The bun tasted a little stale too.  I may give Fatburger another chance if I'm ever around one...but that's only because my friend told me they have awesome chili cheese fries...

the burgers here are really good. Everything is made to order and comes to the table hot and fresh. They did some renovations to this location and that may explain their prices. The reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because of the price. If you buy two combo meals the price will run you close to $30.

Staff was friendly, burger was huge and fantastic. best burger I've had in a while.  Fat fries were piping hot. The only gripe was the Vegas prices but everything in Vegas is ridiculous. Don't hesitate get your burger here. Very casual diner feel.

Was in the neighborhood, so I decided to drop by again to try their bacon cheddar burger. Unlike McDonalds, they certainly don't cheap out on the actual bacons. 

Still had difficulty finishing the meal due to the sheer size of it, but can't really complain about the freshness of both the burgers and the salad.

Customer service was excellent as usual and the place was spotless!

This was the first time we ate at fat burger,,, the customer service was excellent and the food ! Wow so fresh and amazing I had the regular burger my hunny had the XXL he couldn't even finish it... truly a great place to eat and well worth the price! Our server LILI was awesome"

Oh this place is awesome I love the theme it's vintage and lovely , the burgers are huge and tasty , I love the fries as well super friendly staff. I would love to go again to try more food. Prices were reasonable as well it's a cool place for date night.

Wow i finally tried the famouse fat burger. And dam was it good. So so dam good. Makes a fat boy smile kinda good. Had the large with cheese and an egg. I was blown away with the great combo. I love this place.

Aparently they don't  how to put half a vanilla shake and half a strawberry shake together. What really upset me was that the girl who was helping us decided to talk shot about us (the customer) right in front of us. Extremely unprofessional. She also decided to tell me that the woman toasting buns in the back was her manager. What a joke.

Las hamburguesas estan comibles y saben a carne. Son completas pero Las Cobran bien. El personal correcto aunque las prisas hacen casi que si no entiendes muy bien ingles te den el tamaño grande.
Esta situado dentro del casinon Sunset Station y es desagradable llevarte todo el olor a aceite y fritanga en la ropa. Podrian invertir un poco mas en estraccion de aire.

We stayed at the MGM while in Vegas so this was a great find for the late night craving of a greasy burger.  Wide and I split a burger and fries and it was quite delicious...thin crispy diner style.  Beer is a bit pricey, but it's right on the strip so that's to be expected

First time at this location. Midnight snack and they were packed. We placed our order and right about when we were starting to wonder why it was taking so long they approached us and informed us they lost our ticket. The manager, Cisco, took care of the issue with excellent customer service.. Although delayed, the food was great.

We decided to go to Fatburger for lunch, since this is considered a popular location on the Vegas Strip. I had the Turkey Burger with guacamole and my husband and I split an order of fries (my husband had a regular bacon cheeseburger with a fried egg). Thirty-plus dollars later, I have to say I was a little disappointed. With all the hype, I expected something greater. The food wasn't spectacular; the food wasn't bad. It was just woefully average. It's definitely not somewhere I would visit more than once.

Need some grease and a cheaper option on the strip?  You need to try a Fatburger!  They have really fresh ingredients for a fast food joint.  They have some decent milkshakes as well.  There are a plethora of options that you can add to your burger as well.  Check out the menu and mix and match something that would fit you!

Don't waste your time in McD's or any of the other fast food places.  The only fast food restaurant I'd recommend in Vegas is In N Out but that's off the strip.

This place is full of shit...worst service ever!!!!!!! We order 6 burger and 3fries, they took over 1hour when is not busy at all.....when they bring ours foods, they were disrespectful. Bring your business some where else, worst Fat burger ever!!!!!!!!

Avoid this place! They don't need Groupon coupons to drive business, they need to fire their staff and hire people who actually want to work and be in the service industry.  Waited over 30 minutes while the server walked past us several times, used her cell phone twice and then continued to chat with the bartender and other staff. Other tables were getting same service and up and left.  3 other staff walked past our table several times and couldn't even bother to acknowledge. There's a lot of other great places if you are craving a burger.

Burger with tasty smoky grilled flavor and choice of toppings. May order different weight patties. Really enjoyed the crispy outside, soft inside "fat" fries (similar to steak fries). The"skinny" fries tasted like McD's if you prefer. The lemonade was made from real lemons with pulp in the tart and sweet drink. Only negative was the price (reason for 4 rather than 5 stars), but this Fatburger is on the Las Vegas Strip, so bet less expensive at other sites.

I can see why people will love this place while drunk, but sober me is reviewing it and I think other burger places do it better.

I'm currently comparing this to In N Out.  I'm from Florida, so we don't have Fatburger or In N Out, which is why I had to get both on my trip here (I'll try Shake Shack tomorrow).  First disclaimer, I love In N Out, so this would have had to be pretty darn good to beat that.  Unfortunately, it did not live up and it even somewhat disappointed.

First the good, the burger meat is solid.  I got the turkey burger, sans bun, with cheese, and it was delicious.  The shake is also pretty good.  It had a huge heaping of whipped cream on the top that I enjoyed.

The bad, the price is insane.  I got a turkey burger, chili cheese fries, and a milkshake.  Total was $20.  At In N Out, that same meal is $10.  I don't know if it is more expensive, since I'm in vegas, but holy cow.  Also, I was not impressed with the fries.  They were definitely not worth the calories.  I got the skinny fries and ended up throwing them out.  With In N Out I'm scrapping the bottom of everything to get the last remnants of cheese.  This cheese was just meh.

So overall, I wouldn't suggest wasting your calories or your money on this place.  But, then again, when you're drunk this place is probably heaven.

Shittiest service I've ever received in my entire life. Two female Mexican workers took 35 minutes making A SALAD and kept talking amongst themselves complaining about other customers and rolled their eyes at me when I looked at them. All they did was complain and chatter to themselves. I'm here right now, still waiting on that salad....
Love fat burgers they have the best turkey burgers. Best spot to watch the game. The waitress Lexi was very friendly, the prices are reasonable.

4 Stars for the price to food quality.  The food was great for the price you pay.  The bar has decent priced drinks as well.

HOWEVER....

This place is in the ghetto vortex of the strip.  You know that place from M&Ms world until Planet Hollywood?  That is the ghetto vortex.  Tattoo parlors, porn slappers galore, bums cursing at you for not smiling (really?), those creepy statue people, some lady at a stall trying to sell a towel that wraps around a woman's waist (reallyx2?), some dude with a shirt that has LEDs on it (kinda like an updated bedazzle), and another dude trying to get me to go to the Grand Canyon.  They will ask me "you wanna go to the Grand Canyon?"  The best thing to do is to reply with a "you wanna go to [insert horrible city here]?"  I usually use Port Arthur, TX.  This area of the strip reminds me of the part of the Thriller video where the zombies come out of nowhere and scare the hell out of the girl...then MJ turns into a zombie for some reason....everybody dances and things get annoying.  The ghetto vortex is like that.  Kinda creepy and very annoying.

Watch out for the ghetto vortex and eat a burger at Fatburger.  It is a nice change from the fine-dining expensive restaurants.

Came here because I wanted to try their Skinnyburger, which is shown on the company website as being a bunless burger with two patties on the outside and the fillings in the middle. I asked the countergirl if they had it, because I didn't see it on the menu, and she said yes but only in a medium size. So I ordered it, with all the fixins. What I got was a cheeseburger patty plopped atop a mishmash of lettuce, relish, and a tomato slice.

If you're a low-carb diner, don't eat here unless you want to pay $8 for a sorry cheeseburger salad.
Great fresh burgers. I had cheese burger with fried egg side of chili onion rings. Price kind of high. Original LA is much better.
long lines, made sloppily, take forever, bad service, however the drunken crowds that fill this place along with the never changing satisfying taste make this place a four star

Okay, this location is TERRRRIBLE. Waited in the drive-thru for almost 30 minutes, mind you, there was NOBODY here. No one in the drive thru, no one inside, we were the ONLY people here & it still took that long  everything on the menu was "non existent" & after i got my food, it wasn't even the correct order so i finally left & said F*#k it! never again will i come back to this location.

This was my first visit to fat burger it was a fat disappointment! Restaurant was dirty it took forever for the burger to come and when it did it had no taste very blan no seasoning at all only pepper. This place was over priced for the quality and service of the food in my opinion if you charge restaurant  prices you should serve restaurant quality. This place charges 10.00 for a burger and an extra 1.00 for cheese and 1.00 for every extra you get on the burger the meal did come with onion rings that were the only good part of this meal. They should call this place fat onion rings because the burger was dry and tasteless I will not return to this place I live close by and was really hoping this would be my new burger joint:(

The location of this location is awesome and I love that they are 24hr and they even have a bar! But the food wasn't as great as I thought it was going to be.  I was definitely disappointed and what really got me upset was the fact that I paid $20 for a cheese burger with fries and a drink. I don't know about you but that's too expensive and the food wasn't even great.

This is my favorite Burger 'joint' in Vegas. I prefer it over In-and-Out, I havent tried GR's BRGR yet but plan on it next week! Fatburger is one of those places that just tastes great along with their fried. This year when we went, they added a FATBAR which has an outdoro bar, outdoor seating and table service instead of the inside, where you place your order after waiting in line and what not. the inside portion still exists but the outside is a very nice new add on. Love the burgers and love the 24 hours! try to eat there 2-3 times in my 5 day stays!
Best burger I've ever had. Great affordable place to eat on the strip

We used a groupon deal 16 bucks for 2 burgers and fries, the restaurant itself is trendy, clean and theres parking in the back. I liked that the burgers come with set toppings that you can also omit as you wish, they also had a lot of free premium toppings like onion rings and fried onions that some burger joints charge extra for which was nice. I enjoyed my burger, it takes longer to get your food compared to fast food burgers but they do promote its fresh never frozen made to order angus beef burgers. One other thing id have to compliment them on is their custoner service... the staff actually walk up to you to check on your meal and she even offered to get refills to another customer.

I have always been a Fatburger fan. If you have never had a burger from here you have got to try it. The fat fries are awesome and the onion rings are always freshly made. I have never had anything I didn't like

In and Out kills this place, you gotta be kidding. Ok. Check this... 3 guys order normal hamburger meals.... 34 goddamn dollars. This place is expensive enough to be fine dining. It also takes forever to get your food. You wake up the next day feeling awful, not for all that whaskey you drank, but for the burger that waged a tiny war in your large intestine all night. Skip it.

wait. bonus star for the sweet jukebox. getting to put on some ol' willie and merle - pancho and lefty, at 4am in a public venue is almost more than a drunk man can take.

Poor service! They took long and aren't even as busy as In and Out. 
The ignorant cashier with tats on her hands took my order repeated back my order several times after I clarified NO ONIONS. She kept saying everything? I had to consistently clarify NO ONIONS. She finally said ok.

After waiting 15 mins for my order, I drive home to take a bite into a saturated burger full of uncooked white onions!
I specifically said NO onions! I hate raw onions on burgers! 
So call to tell her she messed up on my order. All I was asking for was for them to remake it but she insisted on arguing to justify she's right. She only heard what she wanted to hear and didn't want to admit wrong. Again all I was calling for was to have them simply fix and remake my burger. She was just wasting my time and breathe. 
Clearly nothing was going to get handled over the phone.
She lacks good work ethics and has no understanding of customer service skills. 

I'm so annoyed. 10 min drive, 15 min wait, had to drive back and wait for her to refund my card. That's about 40 wasted mins of my life I'll never get back! 

Why go here and pay more for their bad service and greasy I've priced burgers when Smashburger and In and Out are down the street on Tropicana and Forte Pache?
15 Bucks for a fast food burger and fries? it was ok but that's way too expensive.

FINALLY, I sample the notorious Fatburger, which we don't have up in the Bay Area.  And my reaction was--OK.

Yes, the burger was Fat.  The fries were also Fat, but that's the way I picked them, and I did like them.  Simple, potatoey, and no weird coating on the outside like some competitors' fries.

I guess if you desperately need a fast food burger and you're in the gravitational pull of a Fatburger, you could do worse.  I prefer it to Fuddruckers and might even take it over In-n-Out, but Jeffrey's and Val's in the Bay Area are far better burgers to my taste.

This particular Fatburger seems to be brand new and part of a sprawling outdoor mall here on the edge of the desert north of Scottsdale.  It won't be the edge of the desert for long, of course, since Great Phoenix seems to grow like creepy fingers of killer space fungus in a Sci-Fi movie of some kind.  By this time next year it will be 20 miles in from the northern edge of Greater Phoenix, and the locals will see it as a quaint relic of bygone times in an aging layer of this megalopolis.
not a big fan of burgers and i thought the burgers tasted like mcDonalds burgers. but i was hungry. it's a place seems like everyone after clubs and bars go to.

The food is the same as any other fat burger, meaning they are good. Why 2 stars? The service is just really really bad. They have a self seat system which would work great if they had a way of knowing who just sat down. Usually once you order the waitress puts a number on your table, well here.. You sit to numbers already assigned to the table. It's just weird. You have to seat in a dirty table to get seats since it's outside on the strip but it might confuse the waiters since it looks like you just ate. We had to stop one of them and ask if someone can clear the table. The waitress took a very long time to get our order, bring the food and the check and I actually didn't mind the wait since we had good seats watching bystanders at the strip but I did see 2 different groups of ppl leave because they were never acknowledged. I didn't mind the waiting game but don't expect to sit and get your food fast, for those that are hungry it's definitely not a good place. In total, we waited about 10-15 to get someone to clear the table we got, another 15 min to get the waitress to take our drinks & order, another 5-7min for her to bring the drinks, 40-45 min to get our food.

I am not sure I was at the same place as the other reviewers. 
My experience was pretty darn good. 
The customer service was great. The place was clean. 
The burgers were fresh and tasty. The service was rather quick. They cook to order so I would think this may be why it takes a few extra minutes.

After watching Jabbowakeez we needed sustenance and opted for something quick on the strip. This place isn't much better than any other fast food joint. It was good but nothing special.
 The fries were really nothing special and the beef patty was a sorry excuse to call a burger. My chicken sandwich was good though

It's a fat,  fast food burger.  You pick how many meat patties you want on it. It comes with shredded lettuce, diced onions,  pickles, and  mustard. The fries are nice and fat,  just don't let them get cold.

I ordered through post mates and they omitted onions and mustard from my soy burger, unfortunately the mustard and onion is what gives it all the flavor, so I was disappointed, especially bc when I called, they had the ingredients, they just didn't add it. They didn't season my fries either. I called and they offered me a redo it a refund.

I will say, I'm a big fan of fatburger (they started in LA) and I think they make the best burgers. 

Their soy patty is really thick, much thicker than a boca patty. & it was juicy, not dry.

Get the Maui banana shake and fries.
I love fat burger. I get a Medium with cheese, eggs, bacon with fat fries and a sprite. I get indigestion for 2 days after. Come hungry.
Absolutely love fatburger but I've had so many negative experiences at this location I refuse to patronize them again. No way.

I've only been here once so far and I thought it was a decent place.

I wasn't sure what to make of the sizes when I looked at the menu, but the burger I ended up ordering was humongous and probably the largest burger I can remember eating. I thought it was pretty good, although I'm not ready to call it a favorite just yet.

I had the turkey burger and it actually tasted really good. I added an egg and some mushrooms and just had lettuce , pickles and cheese. It was really nice. That being said not worth the 15 minute more wait. For a fast food burger joint it shouldn't really be acceptable. Especially not here in a place like Vegas.

These two women busting their butts for a dollar. They know how to cook. The one lady coughing all over the place. This probably happens all over the place but to sit at the counter and watch the lady cough made me uncomfortable. Great work ethic but for an open kitchen... that sucks for them. Tasty food. Sorry gals. Open kitchen concept is a disaster unless you own it.

As the rating says. I've experienced better. I will be reviewing the Veggie burger costing about $6. Good chunk of food. Big enough to fill out our stomach even if you skipped morning breakfast. But it was not as tasty. The soy patty was plain tasteless and the whole wheat bread doesn't fit a big burger. It could use more lettuce and less salt.

A lot of these reviews made me laugh because I'm not quite sure what people were expecting - it's FAST FOOD, (albeit pricy fast food)lol! I had a Groupon so my friends and I went all out so that we could get a variety of things.  I thought the staff here was really friendly, even bringing food to our table.  The shakes are amazing and I love all the topping options!  The veggie burger is tasty and my friends devoured their beef burgers.  Although the curly fries are the most popular, we decided the skinny fries are the best. Thumbs up!

Horrible service. Ordered a plain hamburger at 7:16 pm. At 7:30 pm they hadn't even put it on the grill (needless to say there was nothing on the grill for about 10 minutes). Not sure where the disconnect is between the cashier and the cook who is 8 feet away. Everyone is complaining and the customer in front was waiting even longer. Samantha did nothing about it until people started demanding a refund. Said she was sorry and couldn't give a reason why everyone's food was so delayed. 7:43pm we got our plain hamburger. Corporate please help before this location fails !!
Great greasy burgers with or without the works...this place is ALWAYS packed but after a long flight or a long night, it never disappoints.
The food was horrible at this location I don't mind eating at fat burger but this location the food was horrible every thing was old and smelled

Average Fatburger on the Vegas Strip. The only thing I liked was the outdoor patio that looked out to the strip and the space heaters to keep us toasty during the winter months. I'm not a fan of the service though. It seemed like the waitress was bitching at all her customers and basically encouraging them to leave. I'd come back for food or drinks but hopefully on a day that service is better.

The lack of concern about actually servicing customers is appalling, given there are many other places to eat in Sunset Station.  I'd prefer to give less than a one star rating, but your site doesn't allow that.

IMO, spend your money somewhere else...

I guess extremely outrageous prices come with eating in a casino, but this place is just flat out ridiculous. It's fast food for Christ sake, not a pass to the holy grail. They sale burgers by the oz here. 

I think the flavor of the food is lost  because I can't get over what I just paid for a burger. Luckily I was smart enough to eat my buddies fries and drink a couple swigs out of his drink. 

The atmosphere of the place is really cool with pictures of old R&B artist, but there was no music playing. Eat before you head to the casino.

Seriously? I had a fat check they didn't honor it at all. Than I tried calling the Lady that manages all the fat burgers in Vegas and all of a sudden they want change there answer. The manager of this fat burger (older Hispanic lady) I guess doesn't care about her job, I saw her making my food with no cap on idk if she washed her hands and always has an attitude. I give tips for good service and you guys suck. Don't complain when you guys don't have a job cause your business runs out do to your sh$!?y service.

As a Chicagoan, and a big supporter of the hamburger stand cause in general, I feel it my responsibility to make Fatburger one of the first places I go to when in the southwestern region of our country, as we are woefully void of classic hamburger joints in the Midwest. Really we are - go to the Chicago Yelp page and look up how often this condition is brought up in the talk threads.

I love Fatburger, I really do. This might not make sense to those of you who can go here whenever you want, but I assure you, this place was a big topic of conversation when talking about our impending trip to Las Vegas. It's a great burger, in a clean environment, with friendly service and great music on the jukebox. What else do you need? Nothing, that's what I say.

Was there 6/16/16.  Used a groupon for drinks and fries.  Got burgers too, since needed the food anyways. Their burgers are awesome.  The service was great. Not so much divey bar.  Indoor and outdoor seating.  Drinks were yummy too.  Try to go here everytime we come to vegas.  Highly recomend !!!

This place is well worth the price. The burgers are incredibly tasty and unique in the contents. It fills me up and the shakes are pretty good too. 8/10 would eat lunch here again. Price is discouraging to people who've never eaten here before.

This is the third time I show up to this place and no one is to be seen in the morning I work grave yard so a good burger after work is what I want but they can't give it to me. Don't claim 24 hours you freaking retards!!

I've come here three times now & I haven't even been able to eat anything.... why? Bc the asshats that work there never even acknowledged my existence in the drive thru!!!! I never got to place an order. I have a low tolerance for bullshit & this place is straight bullshit. Never again.

Because I'm a Cali girl and I grew up on this stuff we decided to stop by. The prices like any other place was really high. $22.00 for 2 people but okay. 

The guys working were extremely nice and gave excellent customer service! Burgers and fries were good like in Cali and the homemade milkshake was yummy too! 

Great choice for a spur of the moment dinner stop.

Fatburger, get the large burger with bacon, a handful of fresh veggies and a fried egg, your heart will hate you but you won't regret it.

After a late night of partying on the strip, my girlfriend and I, along with a buddy of mine, decided to check out FatBurger for a late night snack.

The atmosphere was really nice, its a fast food joint that looks like a diner serving up burgers made to order, pretty crafty!

Ordered their large 8oz burger with the works, cheese, fried egg and bacon with a side of fries.

I know it sounds like a lot but you live once, and you know what they say, what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas!

Burger was tasty but way too greasy, even if I were to take out the egg and bacon, by the time I got back to my hotel the bag was already soaked with grease.

It's awesome for those who want to try something new, they open 24/7 on the strip so its very convenient for those looking for a late meal.

I'd come back again if I'm hungry but definitely not something that I'd choose as a first option.

We purchased the $8 for $16 coupon & leaving the top half with code intact my wife cut off the very bottom thinking it unnecessary. Without any show concern they refused taking the voucher. The clerk asked manager & he confirmed this decision. The code would tell them everything needed knowing but even after ordering this technicality resulted in her denial & embarrassment. It's sometimes degrading enough using coupons without people using flimsy reasons for denial of their validity. Wouldn't Fatburger love seeing people walk away with nothing after investing this money in their product. I would never again patronize Fatburger at Green Valley Ranch. Reading other reviews I see many reviewers concur with my experience. There are much better hamburgers in the Las Vegas valley.

Food took too long.....and....
When we got it one burger was wrong other was cold.  Onion rings not cooked well either.  We asked for our money back and went to Jack in box instead
This place was a joke for the price and they had smart ass comments when we told the what was wrong

Never again! I enjoy Fatburger as a chain but the one on the strip (not so much) as it does not have the same values as the ones in LA. The customer service is horrible and the wait time is unrealistic. The burger was not good, the credit card machine didn't work and the food again taste more like they cooked it and had it waiting for prep only.
