My review is only based on this one location in Vegas not the chain, I am a Raving Fan and will contine to enjoy Fat Burgers in LA.

With a town that's full of gourmet or "upscale" burger joints, and tons upon tons of fast food places, one could easily forget about Fatburger. And if they did, I wouldn't blame them. So far, my experiences at this burger franchise could be summed up by the following word "Meh"

I've been to a Fatburger in Vegas, and in many other cities as well. Nothing that I have consumed at any location has warranted another visit. Like mentioned before, with a dearth of burger places here, as the saying goes.. Beggars can be extremely choosey. ;)

But when that green-eyed monster commonly known as Groupon reared its head towards me offering me 50% off on food at this location, I had to oblige.

So with 16 bucks worth of Groupon money, I had to find a way to get the most out of this single visit. And they had that option for me.

XXXL burger - a 1.5 pound burger of massive proportions. At 12$, I opted to add toppings rather than go with the combo, so I added bacon, guacamole, and a fried egg. Every time I have ordered a burger at Fatburger, one thing has always resonated with me, it is dry. They grill it to order from a raw patty, and it's dry, every single time. The guac was pretty tasteless as well. The egg is cooked hard, which is pointless because the only reason to put an egg on a burger is to see the runny yolk ooze onto the patty. The only thing I liked was the bacon.

With a price point similar to smashburger, I'd rather go to smash. But I would save some dolla's even further and stick to the in-n-out. The only good thing about this place is that it's open 24/7. But if all the other places are closed and you really needed a burger at that hour... I guess it would be alright (but only in those circumstances)

A bit on the expensive side for a fast food place, but the quality of food makes up for it if you aren't a fan of McJunk (and I am not).  

After a night out at the clubs, or working dealing with all of the myriad people out at night, sometimes one has to tear into something as substantial as a XXL to make it all worthwhile.  

The burgers are good and made to order, the shakes are decent (I like the Maui banana the best), and nothing tops off a giant meal like fat fries (eat them quickly as they are best while hot).

So far, my husband and I have made it a point to eat at this Fatburger on the LV Strip every time we come to Vegas. We were recently in Vegas and ate here on May 28. The burgers are great and we always enjoy it. My only criticism is that the sweet potato fries aren't as sweet as I'm used to, but that was no biggie. It has outdoor seating and they bring your order to you. There is usually always a bit of a crowd, which lets you know it's good. It's open 24 hours which is always a plus in Vegas, and it's affordable. Considering that we don't eat beef, they still have good burger options, even for us! Fatburger is a must for us whenever we are in Vegas!
Their famous Vegas slushies have no alcohol in them, just an unreal amount of sugar. The burger was good.

First tine at fatburger. 

Atmosphere: fast food Style restaurant 

Staff: friendly and prompt  

Food: burger was delish, bun was heavy in texture, fat fries (needed salt and lots of ketchup, still had very little flavor), soda fountain needed recalibrated (not enough flavor, too much soda water. )

Overall: I would eat it again, doubt I'd go out of my way for it.

If you like burgers, you're in Vegas and you've already been to In-N-Out, definitely give Fatburger a try.  Like In-N-Out the menu is simple yet tasty, but unlike the aforementioned burger mecca there are Banana shakes...awesome.  Being open 24 hours can be a good or bad thing, depending on who you are and whom you might be scared to see at 2 a.m....but then that kind of applies to the whole Strip, doesn't it?

My meal was very good. It was a garden burger. Not greasy at all even though I added an egg. The fries were nice and fat. I remember eating fatburger In LA but the menu was way better here. Can't wait to try other items. 
Update. 
I've had the fat fries, sweet potato fries, skinny fried, onion rings and they are all good. Today I had the fat fries with cheese. :) I've had the French toast.. I can say mine is better. ;)

I liken Fatburger to a more indulgent In-N-Out. It's fresh made-to-order burgers kicked up a notch (i.e. fat). 

Firstly, how do you pass by a place called Fatburger and not be curious? Needing a quick sustenance snack, I stopped in to find burgers ranging from Small to XXXL. "Ummm yes I would like a small please." Many have tried to finish the XXXL in one sitting I was told by my enthusiastic cashier. How could they? It's the size of a baby's head! The slightly larger than a slider Small Fatburger was more than enough for my snack. It was juicy and I love that you know it was made fresh and cooked on the flattop right after I ordered it. 

If you're wandering along the strip, especially late at night, you might want to pop by Fatburger if you're looking for some nosh. Heck go buck wild and add bacon, cheese, and a fried egg while you're at it.
Jorge at the bar is awesome. Great service, great drinks. Stop by!! We we're checking out the Blvd. Food court and this place had sweet drink specials!

My friend James and I are going to try the Fatburger due to Groupon promotion. 2 cheese burger and 2 small fries for $13.00. Not too shabby for this kind of promotional price. I substitute the beef patty into turkey patty for additional $1. Unfortunately, my turkey burger patty was too dry. The fries was perfectly cook, crispy outside not too soft inside. James ordered the chocolate strawberry mix milkshake. He said it was very strong flavour in it. Overall, I gave 3 out of 5 stars due to my dry turkey patty, and the restaurant concept was same as other American burger joint concept: Burger, fried food and milkshake. Nothing to spark my burger joint excitement. The remaining stars given to an awesome French fries and services.

"Brunched" at FatBurger after a late start to the day (who the hell is waking up early in Vegas anyway?!).  FATBURGER!!!  YUMMMMMYYYY!!!!

I remember ordering and the cashier suggesting I go all the way after I mentioned that I didn't want relish on my burger.  Thank you, Mr. Cashier!  The flavors on this "fast-food" burger go together like crazy!  The burgers are grilled to order and all of the toppings are fresh - probably because nothing gets a chance to sit around here.  The joint is jumping, we could barely find seats!

But back to the burger.  Just so fresh....and tasty......and not fast-foody, unsure of the meat species at all!  Fatburger is definitely all beef all the time.

And PLEASE don't get me started on the skinny chili cheese fries.  OMGeee!!!  I'm about to go on record as saying they were the best I've ever had...  At least definitely in recent memory.  Deliciously tart lemonade too.  Mmmm!!!

Dernit, now I've gotta make my way down to the one on South Beach.  Excuse me for a moment...

Overpriced fast food in vegas. Their "medium burger"-which is TINY(seriously, not even the size of a jr burger at Mc D's) is so expensive. 

My husband and I ordered 2 medium burgers, 1 small french fry, and 1 soda. (I just had water). Our bill was 19$- Seriously!! 

I don't plan on going back to Vegas for quite sometime, but when I do, I won't be going back to Fatburger.

Yeah its a 5.00 for the "fatburger," which wasn't that large- but it was good and the quality and flavor beats MCDONALDS next door. Although I find that the people who go here are ...well interesting is a nice way to put it.

This Fat Burger is constantly good. I eat here often. clean, friendly... burgers are always juicy can always count on a good burger. My only complaint would be the sometimes rotten egg smelll in the restaurant. But the food is great!

This location is located on the strip and it get busy. When we went we had the super large drinks that were okay but the food was not that great. basic burgers, fries, and drink. Also very pushy staff to order up.

Oh, how I love my Fatburger!  The first time I had a Fatburger was at the Thunder Valley Casino near Sacramento.  The second time was at this location and it's always a late night snack after a night on the town.  

I guess by late night, I am not really picky about my food but when it is good, I got to give extra shouts out.  So this is to you, MY FATBURGER.......

I am genuinely the most easiest person to please. I always drove past this location and asked myself, "Why have I NOT tried this place yet?" 
 
We stood in line waiting to order and there was this elderly women in front of us who obviously was trying her best to take an order being it was her first time too, the cashier lady immediately got frustrated and scold the lady to pick up the tone of her voice because she couldn't hear her order.  
If that wasn't rude enough a drive thru asked for her assistants and she snapped at them telling them that she's occupied, "Hold Up!"

Then it was my turn to order. I gave her the benefit of the doubt and did my best to order... I decided on a medium burger, and she rudely told me... "you mean the beef medium burger?" Long story short because I don't want to write an essay...

If she didn't love her job find a new one... or if she was having a bad day? Take a moment to go and breath. There should be no reason for her to mistreat her guest. Especially when you never know who that guest could be. 

Food came out, we noticed she missed a lot of things we requested.... disappointed because the food was actually tastey.

Fatburger has never had a problem with burgers, which is why I pay what I do for them.  Tonight however, was the worst chili (not one of their staples per se but if you offer it, own it) I've EVER had on the chili cheese fries and chili dog we ordered.  Burned is an understatement as you will see from the pic and I will say no more other than very disappointing and a waste of money.

I can't tell you how awesome the bartenders were. Any time we go to Vegas we will be at this establishment. The burgers were mouth watering good. It was such a great place we went back for breakfast. Which was amazing!

This Fatburger is always on point! Food is good and service is great. April has awesome customer service skills and suggested some add-one to our order to help our Fatburger cravings. This location is always courteous and fast considering that everything is made fresh. Will definitely keep coming and recommending this location to friends and family.

This Fatburger STEALS FROM CUSTOMERS!! I've never had such a bad experience getting fast food let alone from a Fatburger. When we got our food which was made unusually fast (when Fatburger makes everything fresh) we noticed the burgers were actually cold. So we parked, went inside and asked if everything could be made over since the fries would be cold by the time the new burgers were made. The shift leader then grabs their phone and walks in the back and has us waiting for about 10 minutes. We asked another employee what the hold up was and she tells us that they need to get approval from the owner. WHAT?? We hadn't touched the food at all. I've never seen or heard anything like this. But what happened next is really strange. He comes back and says they can remake the burgers, but not the fries. 

At this point I say I want a refund. I give him my card which he has for about 15 minutes. Once he comes back, he has a receipt for me to sign so the refund can go back on my card. The amount he has for the refund WAS LESS than the amount they debited. THIS FATBURGER FRANCHISE ARE THIEVES. 

This FATBURGER was dirty inside, they weren't even using Fatburger brown logo'd bags for the food and they seem to really lack franchisee health and quality standards. Also, to clarify they kept the money they owed me (A LITTLE OVER $8) with no concern or available recourse for me as a customer. 

I've contacted Fatburger corporate to inform them that this Fatburger rips-off customers and they're ruining the Fatburger name and should be terminated as a franchisee.

Stopped here for a bite to eat and was surprised to find out they had a brunch menu and $5 mimosas. I had the Eggs Benedict, which was pretty good. I would definitely have it again. The service was great and everyone working there seemed really nice.

Had the King burger today. For $7.99 it's one of the best burgers around. I noticed today they also sell a pulled pork sandwich which I'm going to try the next time I come here. I like the fact you can refill your drinks, and they have lemonade too !   If you have little ones they have a "treasure Chest" full of little toys ie; airplanes,stickers etc. they can pick from. I always go back to restaurants that treat our kids well.   Parents out there, you know what I'm talking about.
Good food!  The turkey burger with a egg and cheese and all the fixins and no relish is a prefect meal.

Picked up an order here for a delivery service.  They didn't begin preparing the order until I arrived, which was at least 15 min. after the order was placed.  The woman at the register didn't speak any English and didn't know how to find the receipt.  Once her manager found it for her and I began to walk back to my car, I realized they were missing the milkshake the customer had ordered.

Went back in, the woman made the milkshake (no apologies for missing it in the first place).  Then when I arrived at the home of customer, I discovered the lid was not secure on the milkshake and it had spilled all over the rest of the order.  Then he realized they'd forgotten the fries as well (how does a fast food burger joint forget the fries?).  I'd be surprised if he ever ordered from the delivery service again, but if he does, I hope he wouldn't order from Fatburger.  He was a lot nicer about the whole thing than I had any right to expect, but I was pissed off for both of us.

To sum up, they're careless, they don't care about customer service, and if they're not really stupid, they sure came across that way to me.  I know lots of people love the brand, but take my word: DON'T order via delivery service if you want any hope of the employees actually getting your order right.

I love fatburger always have-always will. They used to have a lot more locations open after midnight but not as many any more. Luckily I live close to red rock casino and the fatburger there is open till 2am. My favorite is actually their turkey burger.  Best one I'll had hands down. And don't forget the onion rings they take a little longer than the fat fries but are well worth the wait. This isn't news to anybody who's been to fatburger. If you don't know -now you know

I must admit that I love Fatburger.  I like that there are so many topping options.  My favorite is the junior fatburger (think that's what it's called) with bacon and cheese added.  

While I like the burgers, I must admit that my real love affair is with the onion rings.  They are made from real onions & are made fresh daily (shocking, I know!).  The breading is cornmeal instead of the fish & chip like breading some places use.  

I keep going back to Fatburger because these are the best onion rings I've found.

The last time a friend brought me takeout it seemed like the quality had dropped - did not taste as good. I will reluctantly try them again, but it was off-putting so they have gone down a star. 

Previous Review. The Turkey, chicken and veggie burger are a treat for me. They have a great kids meal that my daughter loves. It is great they have a generous variety of menu options. My friends and family all have enjoyed the food. The ambience is a bit gimmicky and it can be a bit loud but they have won me over with consistent service and quality.

This location is a disgrace to Fatburger. Received absolute sh*t service with an attitude from Corrine. Then, after she screwed up my order, she argued with me that it was my fault (I'd be the first to admit if it was my fault, but it wasn't in this case). Everyone makes mistakes, but damn... Live up to them. Then they actually made me run a separate credit card transaction to add the slice of cheese they failed to add. Honestly everyone working at this location seemed to high or drunk to be able to concentrate on anything specific. I know complaining about a messed up order sounds petty - and I know how petty it is, but it was the being berated by the cashier that blew me away. When you're wrong, just say "sorry" and put the damn cheese on - don't argue with the customer. Won't be back to this location. Hit up one of the station casino locations instead. At the Red Rock Station location they are always friendly and the location is always clean and they don't all seem like they would set measurement records on a drug test.

Who ever says burgers or anything on their menu are good are all FAT LIE! 2 something dollars for a flat drink is unacceptable and everything are over prized! $4 for onion rings and oh 10 bucks for a plain burger kids meal?! Are you kidding me?! Definitely NOT coming back and absolutely not recommending this place.

I bought food via drive-through because my peeps and I had a late night craving to satisfy. I thought their name sounded honest and drove there to check it out. 

We ordered the classic Fat burger with a  shake, a western burger, and onion rings. I liked my burger well enough but it wasn't by any means dazzling. My friend said her western burger (not super sure the exact name of the burger) was okay. The onion rings held up well during the ride home and stayed crispy. The best part was the shake which was thick and creamy. 

I would likely hit it up again for casual dining. It's a solid 3.5 stars but I can't give that. They'll have to deal with a 3. I forgot to take pictures this time, maybe next time!

On November 1st at 6:15 PM I went through your drive thru at the Flamingo and Rainbow location in Las Vegas Nevada. My family went to this location because after shopping at Smith's Food and Drug we received a coupon for a free medium fatburger with the purchase of a combo meal. The coupon has an expiration date of 12-31-2015 and is not the only coupon on the receipt tape. Upon ordering about $16 worth of food I mentioned the coupon. The woman working the drive thru asked if I had the whole receipt. I said no , I clipped your coupon. She said she won't take it because she needs to see the date on my receipt. I asked why since there is an expiration date for the Fatburger coupon and dots signifying to "clip" the coupon. The coupon doesn't mention that the whole receipt needs to be present for the offer. The coupon is also on a roll with other coupons for non affiliated businesses. Fatburger are you telling me that if I want to use your coupon I better use it before I use the other coupons? If I had eaten at Brooksy's the week before And their coupon was gone you wouldn't honor your coupon since the original receipt isn't intact? Your restaurant was dead and your drive thru empty. Are you really in a position to turn away coupons you personally put out? Hopefully this is the mistake of a poorly trained employee. I wouldn't doubt it considering when we ordered a number 1 combo (exact words) she asked if we wanted to make it a combo! I've never been a huge fan of Fatburger since this location seems to lack any sort of customer service.

Hello my name is Ocean Anders and I can't get that burger at exactly 12:15 PM and unbeknownst to me they had already closed hours before I had Yelp this particular location and found them to be open till 1 AM when I arrived at the destination they were fucking close. So if they say that there open till 1 am. They are lieing asswhole's

If you are in a hurry I do not recommend this place. Overall it is a great atmosphere with a old diner feel right on the strip. You can sit outside at the fat bar with water missed and umbrella shade. Directly next-door to a pharmacy and drugstore if you need to pick up any additional items before heading to your hotel room. You will spend about $20 per meal for a burger, fries, and soda.
Sat outside enjoyed the view of the strip. Burger was great with fat fries. Service was quick and very friendly.

No beating around the bushes, it's a fat burger! They're not trying to make a healthy statement with grain free buns, organic ingredients or grass fed beefs, just a really good tasting burger. 

First of all, my fiends and I were staying in the central strip and so walking here made all the sense in the world. Can't comment on parking. I remembered my dad saying that this was one of their favorite burgers in Vegas. So I dragged my hungry friends for a ten minute walk just past Planet Hollywood. They kept saying let's just settle for this and that, but I said do you have this place where you're from??? Nope.

When we got there, at the entrance some guy passing out cards, gave us a BOGO drink coupon each for this place. Then we sat and waited. They don't have enough servers, and we were hungry. It was nice out, so we sat outside. 

Finally a pleasant server came and took our orders and honored our fresh BOGO cards, score! Then we waited. Finally our drinks arrived, nothing special just a draft beer, but something to keep us company while yet again waiting. 

Our burgers arrived, and I must say they are huge! I got a 1/3 pounder and one of my friends got the 1/2 pounder! It's not cheap, but for the size of this masterpiece I thought it was worth it. It was delicious, and filling. Didn't feel like I had to eat again for 4-6 hours later. 

Overall the burgers we all agreed were excellent in taste, freshness, and ability to fill you up. The restaurant itself was kind of dirty because they didn't clear tables quick so it would blow on the ground. The wait was something not everyone would tolerate so well, but if you want a good burger and don't want to break the bank, this is a great spot for that.

We walked in and they had Tupac playing on the radio. I knew it was about to be on and poppin!

I was hopeful that Fatburger would live up to the hype and give my beloved In-And-Out burger a run for it's money. Sadly, I wasn't horribly impressed. 

I went for the small cheeseburger and split and order of fries with friends. While the burger was definitely better than McDonald's or Wendy's or something, it wasn't amazingly life changing. I love the menu, the music and the overall experience of being at Fatburger, but I think I'll stick with my beloved In-And-Out. 

When we walked out of Fatburger, Pac was still bumping on the speakers. Gotta love it! Nonstop Cali love!

Fabulous old school burger joint with lots of choice for toppings, different cheeses, onion rings, fries and poutine.

For those who don't want beef, chicken or turkey burgers are available. One of the best burgers I have had.

Its a bit more expensive than a typical fast food restaurant coming in at $12 all in but well worth every penny.

I am not sure what was wrong but the blond lady as a cashier was extremely rude. No customer service at all. She seem not to like the fact that we were coming in. Everyone seem to be nice but this lady was totally rude and i would never come here again. I love the food and the rest of the staff but she makes people not feel welcome. I love this burger place but i will just find a different location.

So bought drinks here paid for everyone's shot and tipped but I started to choke on my shot and threw up right after the bartender tried to go up to the rest of my party and tried accusing me of not paying  I tell him check the cameras he than accuses the next party that had just sat down not cool dude.what's up with bad employees in vegas trying to come up on tourist
Its a good place with really delicious burger. Its just a little bit too expensive for my taste but the shakes are the best I've ever tasted!

Everyone on the east coast has heard of In-N-Out or Jack in the Box. Its lesser known sibling Fatburger is worthy of recognition, however. A friend of mine hates In-N-Out and swears that Fatburger is the best, so he took us here. He pointed out their seasoned patty. Yum.... 

So the next time I ate at In-N-Out, I remembered the seasoned patty at Fatburger. Hm... I think I like them both equally. But I gotta admit, the Fatburger was pretty delicious. 

On the burger scale, it is as follows:
1. Custom Burger by Pat LaFrieda (still and probably forever #1)
2. 5 Guys
3. In-N-Out / Fatburger (tied)
4. Jack in the Box
Like the new remodel and I don't know what everyone is complaining about long wait times. All fat burgers take a little time. The food is always good and fresh and staff is friendly

Decided to grab some eats at this local Vegas establishment at about 1am after watching a kick ass show. I grabbed the chili cheese fries and an a medium fatburger (with extra bacon and cheese). I liked that they didn't scrimp on the delicious,tasty chili on the fries and as for the burger, well, it was full of flavour, fresh, hot and really quite a great bite.

 A decent meal and a yummy conclusion to a hectic Friday night.
found a large screw inside my mothers food. she bit down on the burger and it was in her first bite. took a closer look and it was a screw!!!

Great Classic Burger and an old time diner feel! Can be a bit inconsistent with over cooking the patties at times, but overall great job.  Love the unique chili and egg toppings and choice of skinny or fat fries.

All I wanted was a big fat burger, asked a few security and different people on the stripe the best place was sent here.  I walked in saw a group of firefighters there, so that was a good sign to see the locals still eat here.

My burger was actually two patties, which was fine. They were cooked excellently. I splurged the the $2 for bacon and cheese on my burger.  It was pretty messy, but what good burger with lots of fixings isnt?

I was a little disappointed in the onion rings. They were home made there, but fell apart easily and not all that flavorful.  

If you go, order a burger, stay away from the onion rings.

I ordered from this place and I have never been so disappointed, ordered 3 items and only got 1 out of the 3.. on top of that the one item was wrong and didn't come with what it said it did. When I called I was hung up on twice and when I was able to talk to someone they were extremely rude and unprofessional. I will never order from this place again.

I might have missed the sign that said, "No females allowed" or the one that said, "Big scary biker dudes only".  Either way, it was a pretty intimidating burger joint to be hanging out in at 3am with a group of 24 year old ladies (all wearing outfits that could only be described as "sparkly" or "glamorous"). 

I ordered a regular hamburger and small fries.  It took approximately 20-30 minutes before my order was up!  I could have easily run back to the hotel, ordered room service, eaten, and paid my bill by then.  Or I could have easily taken in part of a magic show.  The wait brought new meaning to the term fast food, and not in a good way.

 When the food was finally done, it was burned dry meat.  The fries were on par with McDonalds, but the place was so dirty I didn't even want to put anything near my mouth.

One side note: somebody was feeding their baby there!  What?!  At 3am at a dirty burger joint with scary biker dudes?  That baby had the biggest bags under her poor little eyes.  Good grief Charlie Brown!

I would never go back.

Good burgers for sure and by good I mean tasty, sloppy and juicy.  Just the way I like it.  The fries they serve are always piping hot and cooked perfectly.  

Our timing must have been good because we were seated quickly during a busy period and although our food took a little time it came out hot and delicious - both the fries and the burgers.  

We observed the manager and he was one busy guy, keeping everyone and everything in order, not to mention the big smile he had on his face when he greeted us.  

We were impressed by the whole experience.

The burger brigade conquers yet another burger baron foe (that soon after became a friend), that of new-ish Fatburger in Thornhill.

The location is in off of the Disera Drive faux neighbourhood complex they've built just across Centre Street from Promenade Mall (seriously, it looks like a tiny historic neighbourhood with lots of walking paths, street parking, street level shops - ingenious really for the burbs).

Now the menu is MASSIVE, every kind of burger (beef, double beef, double double beef, chicken, fish, turkey, etc, etc), chicken tenders, onion rings, soft drinks, lemonades, chilli, fresh made chips, every kind of french fries.... it goes on and on, something for everyone.

I went with the Fat Cheeseburger, which was 2 6oz patties on a bun with every topping standard (the standard for any of their burgers with the Fat-prefix), I added some double thick cut bacon and some special sauce. Our group split a lumber jack poutine, regular fries and their house made chips. Now the burger itself I would give maybe a 2.5 or a 3 star MAX. It was (in my opinion) overly seasoned with black pepper, and overly cooked. I like a little pink or a little juice. I found it a tad try and it needed the toppings to be complete.

The sides and service were top notch however, and staff were clearing our garbage away within seconds of being finished, I thought this was a nice touch for a fastfood joint. Big points for this guys well done.

They have Amsterdam 416 coming in on draught soon, so make sure you check them out. This was an OK spot that if you're nearby I'd suggest checking out, but not something really worth trekking across the burbs for. 

Eatcrest Out!

No thanks to Dollar car rental, we got to my friend's house in Vegas at 3 PM (after a 12:45 flight arrival) and by that time we were freakin' starving.  Fatburger to the rescue!

Got a standard cheeseburger and fries.  It was good, but I wish someone had told me the skinny fries are coated fries -- yech.  The burger was a wee bit overcooked and dry.  Maybe we should have eaten them there instead of taking them back to her house, but it wasn't THAT far away.

Had to go, though, 'cause I can go to In-n-Out any day but there's no Fatburger in my hometown...
Was good. Vegas strip  is so busy we got it to go. So by the time we got bk to the resort food was cold. I'd suggest to eat it at the location.
I really enjoyed the burger joint. The sandwich was great and to be honest leaves you wanting more. I enjoyed my experience.

In-n-out ??? Smashburger ? Fatburger

'nuff said
wow! had their XL burger with cheese & bacon.  A BIG, gooey, sweaty, double-fisted mound of awesomeness! Yes, I'm hooked!

Located in GVR, it's one of the options in their food court.  

I was with some friends and we wanted to grab a quick bite.  Service was good.  We sat at the counter in front of the cooks and they were all very friendly and chatty.  

It was my first experience eating a fatburger and probably my last.  I ordered the small burger and skinny fries.  The taste of the burger was too salty.  Good thing I had water to help it go down.  I was really disappointed with it.  The skinny fries were good.  Crispy and a good amount.  

Fortunately there are other good places to eat in GVR.  As far as Fatburger, thumbs down.

Gluttony at its finest. This account is from my first and final trip to Fat Burger on the LV strip.

The second night of the girls' 21st birthday trip to Vegas was supposed to be our night to party hardy. Fat Burger brought all that to an abrupt halt. We spent the day at the Mandalay Beach, sun bathing and sipping on Long Islands and planning our evening. We then ate at Raffles cafe, drank some more, went to the room and cleaned up, drank some more, then hit up the Vodka Vault at Red Square, Ghostbar, Moon and Playboy and drank at each of those along the way. What... we were thirsty?

Hungry and desperate, we decide to get a snack before heading to the next clubs we had planned on, Tryst and Drais. Fat Burger put a halt on those plans because Tryst was scratched altogether and only half of us even made it to Drais.

Mistake: two of the four BZs ordered burgers bigger than they could handle.

Result: instant food coma, cranky and bitchyness. The two wanted to go home an sleep, thus foiling our big late night plans (now that our taxi rides would cost double and the fact I had to give some creepy promoter my cell phone number, for the greater good of the group, to get free guestlist at Tryst).

The service was S L O W, albeit, a lot of drunk people were there just around 12 midnight and the cooks were probably backed up a little. We had eaten probably 6 hours earlier so we needed to refuel. We must've waited at least 20 minutes for our orders.

OK, not so bad right? Wrong. One of the girls had severe implications from the FAT burger for the remainder of the weekend into Tuesday.... savage diarrhea and constipation. Trust, though it wasn't ME, we all had to suffer because she was queasy and cranky and was blowing up our hotel room's toilet at all times we were in the room. And boy, that bathroom door was paper-thin because we could hear it all. But we wont go there.

Fat Burger, thanks for being there, but never again. I'll stick with what I know and go to In-n-Out.
Not great. Spend your money elsewhere. Super pricey not worth it. Won't be back. Service is great though lol

The customer service is crap. They are super slow at orders. I physically watched the guy making burgers taking his sweet time with a million people waiting. I'm unsure as to how these people have a job at all honestly. I was going to wait until I ate my food to review it but I'm so annoyed at this point the food can not be worth this long of a wait on top of rude employees.

Came in at 4am. My friends were pretty drunk but they handled us perfectly. Shay went above and beyond which is really so unnecessary at a fast food place in Vegas at that hour. The manager that was ringing  (I didn't see his name tag) was also super accommodating. I don't really eat fast food but they made my experience great. Really thank you guys! You were amazing!

So when we came the first time the service was great , today was horrible thanks to a slow rude Jackie. First she overlooked us for about 20 minutes then took our drink order and came back another 20 minutes later. Food another 30 later and of course NO FRIES. someone ran the fried out after we were done and waiting for the bill. She never checked back! I had enough time to site and take my time writing this review, and I'm still waiting for this Jerk.

Fat Burger is one of those places I always go to when I'm in town.  They have awesome burgers and fries that are made right in front of you, Subway-style.  Prices are about right for a whole meal, and since they're located near ASU, there's plenty ofcollege flavor to go around here.  Their menu is basic, but I would say that Fat Burger is comparable to Seattle's Dick's.  Yum!

The name goes with the menu. Fat burger has really fat burgers. It is one of my favorite burger spots. and I go here once every time I'm in Vegas. The outdoor seating area surrounding the bar is pretty cool. Grab a beer and watch a game on the screen while you enjoy their fat juicy burger. It's an experience I enjoy every visit and you should too.

fatburger serves a solid, no nonsense burger, that is customizable with condiments and toppings to your hearts content. the patty is relatively loose ground beef, and cooked to a slight crunch.
this used to be the only game in town for a good burger, but now with burger bar, BurGR, B&B, and others, this place is losing it's appeal. they've turned the outside into more of a bar area, but it seems like the quality might have gone down. my last couple burgers here do not seem as juicy as the fatburger's of memory. i would personally rather go to either burger bar or B&B over here, but if it's convenient, i still stop by from time to time.
Burger tasted pretty plain. Might have been better with bacon, but I definitely prefer Smash Burger.

I discover the FATBURGER while doing business in Sin City! Yuck, that city full of sin for sure!! But FATBURGER was so so tasty treat to me for lunch.  Turkey Burger and fry from FATBURGER (oh I love saying the name... make me so silly saying that!)  French fry is my second love food *faint* yes, french fry and the hot Calamaris are favorite! 

The worker there moves very very fast... down to a science in the operation.  People come from near and far to visit the FATBURGER and the line can be long! But do not be discouraged... STAY IN LINE! you will be served quickly!!!  Boodah has no idea what they put on the FATBURGER but it make me feel like little baby.  

Simple, 50's style decor that remind you of diner experience.  Lots of soul music figure on wall and playing on jukebox.  Marvin Gay? on when I went first time, enjoy very much.  I tell you... the Turkey FATBURGER like eating narcotic burger... you cannot get enough!  As you can see, there is plenty of auto-love for the FATBURGER!
Food is good but the crew is usually to lazy to make half of it. And I've never gone through the drive thru without them forgetting something from my order.

Ordered 5 sandwiches and fries. Got all the way home(5 miles) and missing a sandwich. My options were credit..pick it up or have my name put down for another time. So i am hungry and you screwed me over. So i drive the 10 mile round trip to pick up a cold fat burger and was handed a 10% coupon off my next visit. How nice of you too have us drive 20 miles for a place that smells like sewer..is far from clean and that 10% wow thats a little bit much for all you put my visting company from Michigan through?? I would expect this from McDonalds but not Fatburger.
It's BS that this joint is mentioned as a viable eatery option when in downtown Phoenix when unless there is a game going on - it's NOT an option !!!

It's a fast food inside a casino, what do you expect?  There wasn't anyone in front of me, yet it still took them like 10 minutes to cook my burger and fries.  They don't have any combo prices, everything is a la carte.  I think I will go somewhere to eat before I step into the casino.

This location is so sluggish. I've eaten here a few times but I feel like I've made more attempts to eat here that have failed. Sometimes the drive through line will simply not move five, ten, and even once, 15 minutes can go by without the car in front of you moving. Shame.

Thought we'd give it a try thinking we would get a bogo drink but when we got in they said it was for bar only...oh well we here now so let's try it I had a chicken sandwich 7.80 no fries hubby had a Double cheeseburger 14.10 fries 3.65 2 drinks 6.20.... yeah they're a bit expensive but it's VEGAS right.? However I must say it was very delicious and fresh and a very plentiful portion *burger patties are thicker than they appear

Just finished up a meal here with my husband. Neither of our burgers came with correct toppings and my husband didn't get the dipping sauce he asked for until he got up and asked for it at the counter. We were one of 4 tables seated in the restaurant and every single order that was brought out was incorrect. The burgers were decent, but again, not delivered how they were ordered. His sweet potato fries were fine, my onion rings left much to be desired. We won't be back. With so many options in the area, Fatburger needs to step it up (especially for the price- $33 for poor quality and attention to detail).

I've passed by this burger joint a number of times before actually going in one day. First impressions are: Once you walked in, it is super narrow, and there is bar- like seating to the right that looks like just about the only seating they have. However when you walk past the washroom there is a dining area that is acceptable. 

The menu consists of burgers and the misc items that normally go with burgers like fries, milkshakes, onion rings, poutine etc. They had some gourmet add-on's too like guac, etc. The burgers were a nice thickness, tasted homemade and more authentic then other fast food burger chains. The fries and onion rings were nothing to write home about. 

I went with two other people, and we ordered 2 beef burger combos and 1 turkey burger with a milk shake and the bill came to over $60. Fat burger? More like Fat wallet. 

I wouldn't come back here again unless someone twisted my arm and said I had to. 

Verdict: Save those McD coupons.

              You're better off at Five Guys or South Street.

My friend heard great reviews of this place, so we decided to eat here for lunch while on vacation. I ordered the medium cheeseburger and onion rings. My meal came up to $16 (I had lemonade too). The burger was underwhelming. The burger was tart and pickley. The onion rings were plain and nothing special. I had buyers remorse throughout the entire meal. Just get a double double from In & Out. Pretty sure I'm not coming here again. (There is a bar outside, so maybe if you drink enough the food will taste better?)

NEVER AGAIN. Walked in with my boyfriend and didn't even get a hello. We stood at the cash register waiting to order for about 10 mins. Note, there was NO ONE in front of us. Three customers in the lobby. One lady sitting with her child and 2 others waiting for food. They messed up the lady and child's order. They took 30 mins to give the other people their to go order. One lady asked for a refund because she waited 30 mins to get ONE burger. They gave her the refund. The other lady is STILL waiting. No sure how long she was there. Finally the manager Manny took our order. He actually rolled his eyes at US for our choices that we put on our burger. I got my receipt, and looked at it and it turns out my order was wrong. I told him I didn't order an egg on my burger (which cost $2.00 to add on btw) He didn't offer a refund or anything, nor an apology. Finally, the other lady who was STILL waiting got her food gets her order. And guess what?! HER food was wrong too! They messed up 3 orders back to back, so I requested a refund. I ended up waiting for almost 30 mins as well. The manager then says I am waiting because my "burger has an egg on it," which I already told him that was incorrect. The girl in the back named Brittany started laughing. I told her it's not funny that you all have messed up 4 peoples food back to back and my total was $26.00. I actually have called Fatburger Corp. and spoke to the VP of Operations regarding this. I encouraged him to look at this yelp page to see how his store is doing.

The amount of late night spots that I am starting to Yelp, makes me thing I should create a list. Fatburger deserves a place at that table!

Having lived in SoCal for a number of years, and now, once again, Sin City, Fatburger is a staple for late night grub. The location on the strip is open 24/7 and is the perfect choice when you are trying to nurse yourself into zombie mode. I say that because, sometimes, Vegas can be too much fun, and you are near a coma-tose point. 

Being a Zombie would take some sort of miracle. Fatburger, can be that miracle.

On my way home from the club the other night, I got hungry. There really isn't too much in the way of convenience at 5am near my place (I can't wait to move to the Strip). Thankfully, this Fatburger location popped up like an oasis in the desert.

Feeling "healthy", I decided to order the Turkey Burger. With Bacon. Clearly, I wasn't in the right frame of mind, but whatever. It was late.

Yeah, it was delicious, amazing, and the whole nine yards but the reason I give this place Four Stars is simple. Convenience, speedy service, and a clean restaurant.

Done and done.

Tried fatburger for the first time tonight. I couldn't believe how expensive and how slow it was. $20 for my husband and I and we probably waited a good ten minutes just in line to order with one person in front of us. Burger was good and much bigger than typical fast food (1/3lb). Fries were ok but I wasn't crazy about them. Overall I was impressed and wouldn't go again as there are many better burger options around.

Ready for some food this am. Gonna be a good burger. It was so good we went two days in a row for breakfast. Had hamburger and fries one day and eggs bacon and potatoes the next day. And it was reasonable prices. Would recommend this place.
Absolutely disgusting!! The meat was burnt, and it was horrible. Didn't taste good at all. Will never be back

A great, fast easy lunch option on strip.  Of course not as good as In N Out but it will do. Way better than the MGM and NYNY food court options. ( Nathan's, I;m talking to you, a mediocre $12 chicken sandwich is robbery....)

Come here for the burgers!  That's it!  Just come here for the burgers.  If you can get it to-go, then even better.  I've come to Fatburger many times in previous trips to Vegas and there are 3 things that are consistent:

1- The burgers are bomb!  I always get an XL Burger which is 8oz. with everything plus bacon.  If Im really starving then I add an egg which is $0.99.  Awesome burger!  Cooked fresh and juicy.  

2- This place is always dirty!  And when I say dirty, the tables are always dirty, the floors and especially the bathroom.  This time around the mensroom looked like someone threw up everywhere but in the toilet.  Gross!  

3-  The cooks are lively, but the other employees who walk around doing whatever job their doing always look upset and disgruntled.  

But other than that, great burgers!

Ordinarily I wouldn't come to an establishment that looks really seedy but it was across the street from the Mandarin Oriental where we were staying and we wanted something quick and cheap for lunch.
Outside it looks a bit creepy; inside they played Biggie Smalls and the the people working there were really into the music. It does have a somewhat fun atmosphere if you're into that workers being loud, but that's not my type of crowd. 

We got a XXXL Burger, fat fries and a Chili Cup and brought it back to the hotel. The burger was huge, but it was over $9. It was difficult to pick up so we basically just took it apart. My friend ate most of it, but from what I had it was a decent burger -- better than the typical fast food restaurants available to new yorkers at least. I have yet to try In-N-Out, so I can only compare it to places like McDonald's or Burger King. The chili was really salty, but we ate it with the fries. The fries were crispy and seasoned well. 

The food is better than your average fast food restaurant, i.e. Wendy's, McDonald's, etc but it's not as clean, so I'm not comfortable eating there and the clientele's too rowdy at night, but I'll gladly get it to go.

Discussed with their service!!!! They not only screwed out order. When we go home, the charges is for 4 cheese burgers and extra for cheese and only 1 person had cheese. We called and they acted like they could not understand what we were saying. They had the audacity to ask the person prepping the food of they forgot the cheese as if we were lying. Horrible establishment and will never go back!!!!!!!

After working a long shift at the hospital all i2 wanted was a good filling burger. Headed to the fatburger. The guys who was on the night shift around 6/26 1030p was amazing. The cashier who took my order was super friendly. And the cook made my burger perfect. We stepped away to gamble and the cook brought it right to our table. And I ate every bite. I watched them as I ate and their service was superb. I'll definitely be back to this location. Keep up the good work guys.

Ordered through ubereats at 8:08pm expected arrival time 8:27pm...well that was a fail! Reordered again , expected time 8:41pm and it was still a big fail!!!! Ordered a turkey burger, specifically marked what I want on my sandwich and still a fail!!! Crap! Never going to this pace anymore! Great driver but not the delivery time.

I've never written a review on Yelp, but this place compelled me to write my first one.

This place gave me a severe case of the stomach flu. 

I've never tried Fatburger in my life. So earlier today I was craving for a burger and passed by this one and saw it as a good opportunity to try one. Horrible experience. 

First, the food here was ridiculously overpriced. Call me cheap, but I consider paying close to $15 for a burger, a drink, and onion rings grossly overpriced. Secondly, the girl that took my order got my order wrong and didn't even give me the fries I ordered. Third, the girl that gave me my food first asked me if I wanted ketchup, to which I replied "yes please", and then proceeded to hand me a bag of food that I later found out contained no ketchup whatsoever. Fourth, the food itself was quite mediocre, at best. The burger was dry, and the onion rings were drenched in oil and tasted more like oily onions than onion rings. The only decent thing was the sweet green tea.

Lastly, and this is the major one, this place gave me gastroenteritis. For those who don't know what this is, it's the stomach flu. How do I know it was Fatburger's fault? because it was the first and only thing I ate today, and I didn't even have dinner last night. It started with some major diarrhea, led to severe stomach cramps, and ended with me in the ER at 3 in the morning. I can almost guarantee you that Fatburger either didn't cook or wash the meat thoroughly or some part of the food was contaminated. 

If you don't like expensive burgers, getting your orders wrong, dry burgers, oily onion rings, diarrhea, or stomach cramps via the stomach flu, then I HIGHLY suggest you stay away from this place like the plague.

Delicious burgers and fries. OMG.
My son and I stopped by here on our first night out on the Strip. I wasn't expecting much cuz it looked shady outside but what a pleasant surprise! Delicious and everyone was great.

This location was a fail for us.  The area isn't bad but the restaurant was pretty worn and smelled bad.  Customers were very rough.  We were called for our food and handed the waaayyyy wrong order.  We tried to tell the employee but they took off and ignored us for a while.  Finally got our correct order...Asked for no pickles and no onions.  Got onions and no relish but plenty of pickles.  I really like Fat Burger but this location may just need to be avoided.
I heard good things bout Fat Burger before, so we finally tried Fat Burger for the first time.  Food was A-OK.  Nothing special.  Unimpressed at all.  Won't go back.

Was super stoked vegas had a fatburger so that I could finally try it!

Eh it's not an LA location so I'm not gonna judge them completely off this one. The burgers here though just weren't that great. It was pretty expensive and didn't have much flavor and wasn't juicy at all. 

In n Out is sooooooo much better and a lot cheaper...at least compared to this location. Highly suggest that people go there instead if wanting something a bit more quick. 

If you do come here though they usually have a groupon so check!

We stopped in to have lunch here.  The location is fantastic; there's patio seating right on the strip and plenty of televisions playing the Sunday games.  The burgers, beer, and service were all really good.

Ordered 2 burgers and 2 fries w/2 sodas for $39.

That is a crazy price for 2 people, could have gone to Red Robin and had endless fries and service for that price but we were there and we knew the prices before hand.   

The sweet potato fries were unevenly cooked, some were underdone, some were done just right and some were way over cooked and hard...so that was not a good experience.

The burger I had was good, I liked it.  It wasnt worth $8 or whatever it cost, it was very expensive and mind you, I only got the medium.  My Uncle who was visiting in town for the weekend ordered a chicken sandwich, its small (Medium)  looked small to me, we could have gone to Mcdonalds.    

So...The burger was good but go to Red Robin.  Seriously, why pay $39 for 2 burgers?

I was in the area, so I decided to give it another shot.  This time I got the large combo and the patty was bigger and fatter, but still tasted pretty lackluster.

What a waste of 12 bucks.

Went to the late night window and there is one person working. There were two people in line for food. I waited ten minutes at the order menu and couldn't even get an order placed. Left and went to Taco Bell.
Quite possibly the biggest ripoff on the strip!  Very, very mediocre burger at an outrageous price.  Do yourself a favor and skip this one.

I was dying to try this place. My man and I made it our first food stop in Vegas, and I'd have to say it was just ok. It reminded me of Wendy's, but with a longer wait time and a seedier crowd. I didn't want to put my purse on the dirty floor for fear of theft, so I kept it in my lap. All this did was make me look like I was afraid, and you never want to show fear. I put it on the table.

Other posters have commented that the best bet is In-N-Out, but I also think their burgers taste like Wendy's. 

My man really wants to eat here again when we return to Vegas at the end of the month, but I'm going to drag him to BLT Burger.

A West coast original! Fat Burger is home of the biggest, juiciest, "slap your momma" (please don't slap your moma-she slaps back and your dad gets mad), burgers. 

One of the first minority owned chains, now around the world. From small to the massive XXXL( don't let your wife know you ordered one), the burgers are always fresh beef. Now, there is chicken and turkey, if you like vegetables. :)

Milk shakes are made from scooped ice cream! Yum.

So good! The outdoor bar is the best! You can order food while sitting, drinking, and enjoying the views of the strip. The staff and bartenders have always been super helpful everytime I've been. Great late night spot to get your drunken eating on.
Why don't you try Fat Burger from now on? You can get can get a cheese and fries for 2.95.....

Don't waste your time or money here at this location. Sincerely just order through Grubhub and it arrived with a driver who looked like he was high as a kite. So that is the first disappointment next beening the fact when I ate into my chicken sandwhich it was RAW! Upon calling the store itself I spoke with an unidentified worker claiming to be the manager. When I told her what had happened she said I could come in Yes drive to the place when I already ordered thru grubhub and tipped the driver, but you want me to drive 4 miles roundtrip for a chicken sandwhich? So NO! If my car wasn't dead I would have because I was intending on eating and being satisfied. Her suggestion was to then contact grubhub for a refund. The most frustrating aspect of it all is upon the conversation with the supposed manager she knew from my description of my burger which one it was but was only ready to remake it tonight at her convenience not the paying customers some management team you got! Anyways 86 that location Go To RedRock Casinos Fatburger waaaaaaaaaay better!
This is the worst fat burger in Las Vegas. I eat at fat burger 2-3 times a week, and the costumer service in this place is horrible. I don't know how this store stays open.
Love the burgers here.  So flavorful and juicy.  The one lb burgers is plenty to split between two people

I was hesitant to try this place after reading multiple reviews of diners getting food poisoning but the BBQ restaurant next door was closed midday. For some reason with no notice so I decided to give Fat Burger a try. Slightly torn on this review as my meal was decent but my wife's was extremely disappointing. Overall I do not think there is much value in this restaurant. Burgers are on the expensive starting around $10 and up. Nice decor with some history of the franchise on the walls, apparently a popular chain from California back in the old days but that must've been quite a long time ago. I ordered the mushroom Swiss burger with fries and drink (unlimited refills) and my wife ordered the turkey burger. The mushroom Swiss was moderately sized, nothing crazy about and to be honest I expected more size for the price but the burger was pretty standard similar in taste to Wendy's but much more expensive. My wife's meal was disappointing, the turkey burger patty was very very small and thin almost like a wafer and it was overcooked to a dark brown leaving it very dry and unpleasant. Her burger was 80% bun to be honest. We will not be going back and I don't think it is really worth the value or a try in my opinion. There are many better burgers in the city.

Solid burger joint. We came with a Groupon ($16 for 2 burgers and regulations fries) so it was fairly priced but if it wasn't for that I'd say it was expensive. I mean two burger meals go for $22 +tax. For a fast food joint I'd say that's a little too much. Personally if it wasn't for the Groupon (even though the service was excellent) , I wouldn't come here again (mainly due to price). 

Pros
Good fresh food
Yam fries are great 
Generous portions
Good service 

Cons
Much too expensive for a fast food joint 
Nacho fries aren't that good

Good burgers done on the flat top grill, resulting in crunchy edges and a nice sear. Get your burger or chicken sandwiches hot and fresh, made to order in a custom size with an adequate choice of toppings, sauces and garnishes, hot or chilled and fresh.

The ladies working the counter and grill are friendly and efficient. There is usually plenty of seating for solos, couples and small groups. It's not a new location, so don't expect glamour, but it's usually tidy. 

We order the meal deal, with a drink and fat steak fries (or skinny fries).  It's not cheap fast food--one medium burger meal and one large burger meal will cost more than $20. Expect a short wait since your burger is cooked to order, not premade and sitting under a heat lamp.
This place is awesome. Food is great. Service is great. Way better than the rest of the fast food chains. A must place to eat.

For starters i haven't had fat burger in a few years. I walked in the store and the pos system was down so they had to write my order down, I got the honey garlic crispy chicken and a side of onion rings the chicken was rubbery and I don't think it was cooked fully through because of the texture, way too much honey garlic sauce it made the chicken breading soggy or maybe that was because the meat wasn't cooked all they way either was it was a disgusting mess. The onion rings must have been cooked at a low temp in dirty oil because it was like an old nasty crunch and oily at the same time. I heard no sizzling coming from the fryers. I threw it all away and ate left over from the fridge. Thanks for a horrible experience. I used to love fat burger now I don't think I can ever eat there again. I'd give a half of a star if I could. Or none at all.

Placed order online so when I got there it would be ready to go since Fatburger is usually slow to get your food out. When I got there my food hadn't even been started yet. I had to do order over again. She asked me to pay and I told her I paid online. She said she didn't have a record of that and wanted me to pay again. I showed her my bank account on my phone so she could see the money was taken out. She still wanted me to pay again. I told her to cancel the order and I just went to the pizza place next door.

The burger was good although it took awhile for them to make it (one burger). Considering that it took awhile, we expected them to have the correct order. The burger had to be redone since they added all these ingredients that should have not been included in the first place. Again, it took awhile. Overall, our experience was average.

Okay place. Nothing extravagant. It is expensive  for burgers though. 2 medium burgers with cheese, skinny fries, and onion rings = $17.88. 

Come to try if you need a quick bite.  Cooked well, onion rings rocked, burgers were burgers.

Great alternative to In and Out Burger as well, and way less busy!

Better than McDonalds! The fat fries are enough to make you want to eat at this place. This burgers are always juicy and perfectly melts in your mouth. A bit pricey for a burger joint, but definitely worth it. 

Our friends make it a breakfast burger by adding an egg to it. Strange, but they make it look DELISH!
This is a very clean fatburger, and has bery polite service, I jabe been coming to ghis one for a number of years. My only issue is they dont always keep there lemonade filled

I had been interested in trying fatburger for a while. We came in at about 8 PM, the service was good, the guy working the register was cheerful. Overall a solid experience, although the burger should have been outstanding and it was not. Condiments were spot on, patty was not especially flavorful but still delicious. I can respect an establishment that doesn't freeze their meat. Bun was dry. I think if I had ordered some cheese it would have been better. 

Fries came out hot and were good, but not great. I figure if I can get a more satisfying burger and In N Out for half the price Fatburger as a franchise needs to try harder. 

Again, I thought the employees were friendly and knew what they were doing, just the food wasn't up to par.
Great Steak Fries and Exceptional Banana/Strawberry shake. I received Amazing! Customer Service from Kathy today, and they are lucky to have a quality employee like her!

I only went here because of that Beastie Boys lyric:  buy a Fatburger when when he's way out west. Never again. Cheese is extra, on the already expensive burgers. 26 bucks for 2 medium cheeseburger meals. And not better than say, Wendy's. And holy crap, I thought they would come out with cobwebs on them it took so long. This location also seems delapidated. Nope, sorry Beasties, you are wrong on this.
Excellent burgers and fries!!! Customer service is world class! Friendly cashiers and cooks!

Dang, where is the crackhead ghetto speaking midget counter guy as was described in another review?  I was hoping to take a picture of said employee because it was a hot day (102 degrees) and I was ready to unload some insults at someone.  Instead, we have a cool, nice, and efficient counter guy.  Did they have the nerve to fire above midget?  Or did he leave for a better paying gig? Aw dang, normal hard working people are so...boring.  So, anyway, I settle for a medium burger with the works but no egg or chili.  My brother had the same thing

I wasn't there when the previous yelpers had a bad experience.  But we clearly enjoyed ourselves. Based on those previous yelp reviews, I also didn't want to get food poisoning so I watched them make it from start to finish.  To my surprise they were actually very clean on a Saturdahy night at 7 PM.  In 10 minutes, the guy brings out our tray.  Now I am a clean table freak at time.  So of course, I had to wipe down the table we were sitting in even though the table looked clean.  I do this all the time. 

So I take a picture and take a first bite of the burger.  Very good...hot patty nicely grilled with a pile of letttuce, tomato, mayo, and mustard.  The bun was grilled, too which is important to me.  Who wants floppy buns?  

Then I take a taste of the crispy, greasy, sweet onion rings.  Its was a 3.5 burger but 4.5 onion rings this time.  Both were just cooked and just fine.  While people in the casino said words like "Da!! I lost my money" we said, "Yum, we're gaining calories with a Fatburger fat burger" and it was good. With a soda, it's over 12 dollars, a lot more pricey than In N Out, a 5 star place for me most of the time.  This was a 4 star trek for some decent burger and 0-rings, and hope my luck doesn't run our either with the good burgers and casino if I ever gamble.
It was very good and the store was clean I am puzzled by the bad reviews I eat a lot of burgers I will be back
Liked it a few years ago but the last time I went food was tasteless. More expensive than five guys and five guys blows fat burger away IMO

My family and I came in here thinking it was going to be a quick and cheap dinner... Wrong! We spent $90 and waited 50 mins for our food. We ordered 5 burgers, 4 fries, and 2 shakes. I would've got faster service and cheaper food if I would've drove 10 mins out of this area. Disappointed, dissatisfied, Never again.
Good, filling, decent variety. Service is simply fine. 3 stars because its chain/franchise diner with hefty prices.
Love this place. Great Food Great Service. Get a Groupon! It totally helps with the $$$

The fries and the onion rings are the bomb! Love my fat bacon burger! The best part this place is dog friendly! Yes, we brought our little dog to Vegas! They gave our little dog a little bowl of water! They were nice and caring service! My margarita was good!

Walk in n seat yourself and a server will bring menus. This is my fave casual spot to rest my feet n grab a bite of burger, hot dog, BBQ tossed wings. 

Food is generally mediocre and slush drinks n cocktails are weak (ordering beer is your best bet) but the location is prime. That's why Fatbar is set up by the sidewalk to catch foot traffic.

However, ongoing construction nearby disrupts people watching and kinda ruins the Vegas vibe.

Ate here twice the past week.  Ok, not great.  Cheeseburger was good.  Expect to wait for food which is fine, they cook to order so your burger is fresh. Thick fries were nothing special.  Staff here are great.  Extremely friendly and courteous.  Staff gets 5 stars!

Worst experience ever.. I ordered the "fat salad" and recevied shredded taco lettuce with an abused looking tomato on top. I thought it was a joke.  In addition, I FOUND A PICKLE IN MY SALAD!!! EWWWW! IM F@#KING ALLERGIC!.. I was sooo infuriated. i politely asked the employees did pickles come with the salad, they laughed and replied "no". i showed them what I found, and they laughed even more (i didnt find anything funny).  so I took a picture (please see uploaded post of salad w/pickle--if the following has not already been deleted by their request) for my own evidence, and the manager excuse was "it gets pretty busy, so our cooks can be clumsy"  im standing there puzzled like really?!?!!? did you just say that to a customer?!?!?!?! I recevied a refund, and will never return.

OK I get that if you eat too many Fatburgers, you will get fat. But at least, you'll be fat and happy.  I've recently re-discovered how good this burger can be. My relatives go to this Texas Station Casino now and then and try to beat the gambling odds and Gods. But after gambling if they have money left, they get something to eat and replenish all those calories expended cussing out the machines.  On this trip, they bought me a large Fatburger.  Yum, I hadn't had a fat juicy, delicious, warm Fatburger in awhile.  What a treat.

There was a little more mayo than I like, and the lettuce and tomato along with the onions and relish made for messy eating.  But the best part was the seared, fresh juicy hamburger patty. The bun was fresh and didn't fall apart. Overall this burger can hold its own against any burger joint in this town.

This is one of my favorite burger places while in Vegas. Living in NYC I can't get this burger on east coast. Being on the strip makes for a nice walk and then stop in for a great burger along the way. I will be in Vegas in two weeks and plan on enjoying a nice "Fatburger" during my stay...

Upon ordering our food, another patron was horrified at paying for a regular fat burger and getting a burger the same size as the baby fat she also ordered. The cashier agreed they were the same size and the cook disagreed. It turned into a yelling match between patron and cook. Wow what a horrific sight to see. The cook walked out to get security and the patron yelled for a manager (who never came).   The cashier tried to help the patron and ended up just refunding the money. The poor guy seemed so flustered and the cook was so angry and dismissing at the same time.  Needless to say, we were in the middle of our order when this fiasco took place , so the cashier was distracted trying to accommodate the upset patron. After refunding her money, he came back to us.  Finally after we get our order in...it was a pretty big one (to go). We waited until our food was ready and left to go home. I got home, took 2 bites of my large fat burger with grilled onions and the meat inside was pink. Undercooked to the edge of the patty. I almost threw up. I barely ate my burger. 2 bites. What a waste. I called the store several times. ..no answer.   So I came here, online, to the feedback section. And now since I wasted my money and have no burger to watch while I Netflix...I guess I have to settle for top ramen tonight. :(



I used to really enjoy Fatburger, but lately it doesn't taste the way I remember. Totally bland and badly prepared/cooked.
Was a typical burger fast food joint. Wasnt too impressed however it was early morning and it is located on the strip in Las Vegas!

My burger was still RAW from the inside after I ordered a second burger because they messed up my first order. I said NO onions, pickles, and cheese and they put all that and I complained and said they would make it again and guess what! I got the same exact burger and raw meat because they rushed it. Horrible service horrible everything they shouldn't even be in red rock.

I was expecting the same experience that I normally get from Fat Burger in Los Angeles. The onion rings were the only item that was as good as the ones I have had previously. The burger just wasn't the same. Gritty texture and under seasoned. The worst part was the bun which was stale. Kudos to the wait staff who were extra friendly. I would have complained but my order was to go and I was too far away to drive back when I discovered the substandard food.

There is just something about being able to get a nice greasy burger and sit down between 3 prostitutes and their pimp on one side of you, and a family of 4 on the other side, and have everyone just so happy with their burger that they don't care about what else is going on. This is Fatburger! 

If you like burgers, stop in and get you some!

On a 4 night trip to Red Rocks ate here twice!  Medium Burger with cheese and all the fixings and still could not finish it. Exceptional burger- freshly made. When you order they give you a number on a stick and bring out your order.  Cheese fries were tasty. Free refills on soda.  Come hungry- these burgers are ' fat'!  A little pricey but worth every penny!  A quick and fast meal between gambling, bingo sessions or before or after a movie.  Yum!

Absolutely terrible service, usually things are slow here but today was ridiculous.  I walked in, and the line was moving so slowly that I just left.  My friends who stayed told me that it took forever for them to get their food.  I don't understand how this place stays in business.   Do not come here if you value your time.

I've had the worst experience here. Feeling sick since I ate there. We waited quite awhile for our food (that's normal) and received our cold food. I ate the hamburger- I probably shouldn't ... and probably wouldn't recommend this to anyone. Ugh . But thank you for giving me some of my money back-appreciate it . Next time I'll just eat at home before the movie.

This place was actually pretty good. Although, I wish they had a condiment bar instead of just stuffing my burger with everything possible. Definitely better than any fast food places like McDonalds or Jack in the Box. But definitely nothing compared to mom and pop burger joints you can find around San Francisco. 

Fast and Friendly service. No complaints here. 

The place can be a little cleaner, but hey all places could usually be a little cleaner. 

Overall: I had a good experience here. Would recommend to others.

DON'T EAT HERE IF AN OLD INDIAN/MAYBE LATINA WOMAN IS WORKING THE CONDIMENTS!!!! 
I was making my second trip here during my Vegas vacation on a slow, Sunday afternoon. When I got my order it was wrong. No big deal, just needed a bun swap (I HATE MAYO!!!) and different condiments. I brought the burger back and asked to get a new top bun. THE LADY PROCEEDED TO WIPE OFF THE TOP OF THE BUN WITH A WET, DIRTY, RAG, AND WAS READY TO GIVE IT BACK TO ME! Who does that???  
When I confronted the lady and her manager, she flat out denied what I just saw in front of my face. On top of that she denied taking our receipt too! What a shame! On top of all of this, the f*%$ head manger gave me tons of attitude after I demanded a refund. I had so much love for this place before, but what did I ever expect from a fast food place on the Strip? Good luck eating here. I hope to revive my love affair for the Fatburger establishment one day, but not on Las Vegas Blvd.

I walk in, cashier girl who we will cal Betty because she has a Betty boop tattoo on her thigh, ignores me because she's busy flirting. Immediately annoyed but whatever, teens will be teens yea?
Go to sit after ordering my food, every table is dirty.
That is not a hyperbole, every table is too dirty for me to even feel comfortable eating at.
In addition, there are these napkins with little "I am the plug" drawings on every table. Perhaps it's my hatred for Drake, but I pointed them out to my server when he brought the food. He cleaned some up. Another dude, whom I though was a customer, walks into the back to do whatever. 
In case you were wondering how I know this girl had a thigh tattoo, easy, her and this boy were in normal clothing but walking in and out of the kitchen like it was their playground. It's awkward to order food from someone when you were convinced they worked there. In addition, Billy is the only dude actually working and kudos to him for dealing with those other two completely disregarding their duties.
I get it, they are teens. But just because you employee teenagers doesn't mean your restaurant needs to be ran like an unproductive teen club meeting.
Do something, train your people or hire people who appreciate work.

Conveniently located on the strip, Fat Burger makes for a convenient hangover cure. I have absolutely zero complaints about this place. For someone who just recently started eating burgers again I have no regrets. I thought this place was so good that I came here twice and wanted to go again before my flight home but overslept lol. It was one of the best burgers I've had honestly. The burger was seasoned to perfection and with all the toppings it was a mess of flavorful and deliciousness.

Worst service EVER! This was our first time trying here, we went through the drive thru. The man was rushing us and for no reason it took them 20 minutes to give us our two meals. I don't care if you work fast food or you're a CEO of a company professionalism is EVERYTHING. And the man who we dealt with was not!! If I could give 0 stars I would.

Yelp says they're open 24/7, and their sign & website says they're open until 4 am - but the guy working had the audacity to say they were closed and act like he was doing me a favor by firing up the grill at 3 am. Likely story, dude. Quit graveyard if you're too tired or lazy to do it. This was literally one of the only places open at 3 am that wasn't a bar and I'm not 21 so SORRY I'M HUNGRY DUDE. I'm sure fat burger wouldn't appreciate this guy acting like they're closed when they aren't. He had the lights turned off and was in the back hiding, an hour before they were supposed to close. He said they closed 45 mins ago, and I said they needed to update their hours in that case. Will not waste my time during late hours again.

I'm being generous with two stars that's just because they are opened late. When we got here it was packed! I ordered the XXl Burger and I asked the lady what's the best fries because they have different choices she told me the chili cheese fries. I asked her let me get those without chili and just make them cheese fries.. When I saw those fries after I ordered them I was very disappointed it was like they took American cheese and put it on top and let it melt. I was very confused on how you mess up cheese fries it's very easy. Anyways the burger was big but tasted like nothing if that makes any sense. The bun was like dry and not soft it was gross I needed a lot of coke to wash it down with. After I eat it my stomach wasn't happy for a while. This place is over priced and gross. I'd rather find another burger place that actually cares about your food.

BEST BURGERS IN TOWN !!! The customer service is great!  I ordered a large fat burger and I always go there once in a while and the cashier always happens to be rosie and let me tell you she is the best, makes my day and always helps me out with anything ! Today I went in around 4 pm and they were kinda busy but they still manage to keep up with my order there was 2 other guys there and they know how to make their customers happy!!!

It's just a burger(I had turkey)...made to order, which is a little different for fast-food. 

Either than that I see no difference from Nations, Mickey D's, Burger King etc.

Yea I'll suggest it, but it won't be my first choice.

This is for the Sunset Station location - Don't know what all the hype is about....but the burgers are just OK. This location has really bad customer service! I purposely sat at a table with a power outlet because I has to finish up some work on my laptop. So while waiting for my order, I took out my laptop and plugged it...The manager came by and said I couldn't use their outlet!!! Also, there were two guys sitting next to my table who were waiting for their friends to arrive, and the manager told them they can't sit there unless they order something!! RUDE!! Fatburger, how are you going to pay for overhead if you kick out your customers?!?! TWO THUMBS DOWN!

First time eating at any Fatburger. This place is great! I had a delicious turkey burger, which exceeded my expectations. The food is made to order, so you do have to wait. But you know the food has not been quietly growing stale and dry in an aluminum bin like in fast food restaurants. The cook actually brought the order out to the table, which was unexpected! My only criticism is that the restaurant did not have good air circulation and had a stuffy feeling.

A recent transplant from San Francisco, also latin and never been to one of these, took a chance on this place because I didn't want to deal w/ the in & out burger crowds. MMMM Good. Bigger, fresher burgers, fresh vegetables, quality meat. The two gentlemen there (one the cook, the other at the cash register) were both hard at work and very friendly.  I will definately return, in fact, my husband is on his way there b/c I have a craving for their non-greasy, saltless killer steak fries. Go figure. Forget the in & out. this is definately the place for cheap and good food.

I was really impressed with their Boca burger.  It's not every fast food hamburger joint that has a veggieburger.  I was really glad it was well done because I ordered everything on the burger.  It seemed like this place was always open; people were constantly lined up to try the Fatburger.

This is the Fatburger location inside the Green Valley Ranch casino. It serves up all the usual Fatburger offerings. And it's open extra late. So when leaving the casino after a late night of drinking, you can grab some delicious Fatburger to go. The staff were polite and efficient. Everything was quick and correct about our order.
