And the burgers are seriously delicious! The Baby Fat is just the right size for me. And their chili cheese fries are pretty darn tasty too. So in sum, this is the place to get a burger when at GVR.

Okay, I was impressed by Fatburger. I think they have a better burger than In-N-Out. I love the size options and the fact that they have a good veggie burger, and that you can add a fried egg to your burger. The fries were not that great; I wish I'd tried the tasty-looking onion rings. This is a nasty place with dirty bathrooms, but sometimes I like that in a burger joint! Like Dirty's in Austin. It's just part of the ambiance.

Awful.  Place smells like garbage and the service is poor.  I could get over the garbage smell since I didn't eat there, but the burger just was just not very good.  Place was empty and the employees seemed annoyed that I came and they actually had to do their jobs. 

Fat burger used to be a place to grab an above average burger in my opinion, but this location defiantly is not.

I found this place surprisingly good. The only other time I had eaten at a Fatburger my experience wasn't great, so I didn't know what to expect when I bought a meal here before a movie at Red Rock. The burger was very tasty and filling, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely eat here again.

The burgers here were really good.  Grilled and with crisp edges.  I would most certainly eat here again.  The place is a little rough around the edges but a good place for a burger and fries and to avoid the expensive places in the hotels.

DO NOT EAT HERE!! Waited near the order box in the drive through for a while before they finally acknowledged me. They still had me wait even longer though. I assumed he was the only guy working and had to take orders, payments, AND make the food, until I saw someone else there cooking. When he took my order, he didn't ask the usual questions such as fat or skinny fries, what I wanted on my burger, or what drink I wanted. I went ahead and gave him all that info anyway just in case he wasn't a mind reader. I got to the window and he just stood there. Didn't ask me for payment or anything. Now I'm thinking I must be the mind reader, because I handed him my card and sure enough he did want me to pay for my food! He handed my card back, again without saying anything. I waited maybe 15mins before I got my food. I know fatburger takes a long time, so the wait isn't a big deal. He asked me what I wanted to drink even though I told him already. He gives me my drink while I wait for the food. Once he gives me my food, I open it to make sure it is correct. No cheese! I paid 99¢ for cheese, I'm going to get my cheese! I honk to get their attention and hand him back the bag and told him I ordered with cheese. He takes it and comes back a short time later. I start to open it to check again while asking "what, did you just throw a slice on the one I have you?" And sure enough, that is what they did! Cold cheese on my burger! I told him to go ahead and take the whole order back and I would like my money back. I paid with my card and they gave me cash back. I guess go here if you just need some cash but all you have is your card. Otherwise, just go elsewhere. I came to In N Out right after and the guy who took my order was so great I wanted to hug him.

Since I hadn't been to Fatburger in a while, I decided to stop in to get a burger and fries. I pulled up to the menu board in the drive through - which was barely visible because most of the lights were burned out. An employee came on the speaker and said that she would "be with me in a minute". I waited. And waited. And waited. After ten minutes with no response, I left. As I pulled around the restaurant I saw one car at the pickup window and three people sitting in the dining area, so they weren't exactly overrun with business. I know why.

I discovered I love Fatburger more than In-N-Out. It's so good. I can't believe there is a Fatburger in the Bay Area and JC and it took me a visit to LV to finally try it out. I was missing out big time.

I ordered a turkey cheeseburger because I'm not a fan of red meat. But if no one told me it was turkey, I'd swear I was eating ground beef. It was super juicy and the burger had all the grease residuals from the stove. I got mine sans mustard, pickles, and relish because those are not my friends. Still with all the other toppings (lettuce, tomato, mayo, raw onions) my burger was pretty tall. It also came in a toasted wheat bun. Did I mention, the burger was as big as my face?

Fatburger also offers skinny fries and fat fries. You can get them with cheese or chili cheese. Everything on the menu looks super good but the burger was enough to fill me up. In regards to the price (not cheap), Fatburger is also better than Bistro Burger.

This, was probably my favorite burguer place... only at the Beverly Hills - LA. 
At the store in Las Vegas, was a poor experience. I bought a XXXL Burguer, with 3x 1/2 pound patties, only the burguer... no soda, no fries... and they charged full meal. When I received, the meat was well done, I asked for medium rare, with egg, everything was burned. At the cook place, a lot of people making jokes with each other's. 
I feels disrespected as a customer.
My order was $40 bucks and I think, I should eat better at McDonalds.

If you like frozen burgers from your grocer then this is the place for you. If your starving and you come across this place then your good to go. If your hungry and your planning a burger place to go to then choose one other then this place.

Seriously, with all of the amazing burger places in Vegas, why in the world would you go here? 

I took my son the burger lover to this place and wow, was he disappointed. I thought he could eat anything. I guess I was wrong. That makes two of us that didn't like it here.

First, the wait is atrocious. They say the burgers take 6-8 minutes to make. Okay, why did I wait over 15 minutes for mine in a place with zero customers but me and my son? Oh, that's right, because charred-to-hell burgers take longer; gotta make sure they're dead. They definitely handed me a dead burger.

My son asked for everything on his burger but tomato and onions. They ignored us and went ahead and put them on anyway. Thanks, now we had the added pleasure of picking things off that we didn't order. I also ordered a Diet Coke which they promptly forgot about. How hard is it to get a lone customer's order right? Pretty hard, apparently.

The burgers were so burnt and so tasteless, if the grease hadn't been dripping off we would have though we were chewing on blackened wood. I'm sure there's a place for that somewhere in Vegas, I just wasn't looking for it.

When my son ate his french fries I asked him what he thought. Being the straightforward kid he is, he promptly said 'they taste like Burger King fries.' I'm not a fan of Burger King fries, but I wanted to be able to say I tasted them. That would be a stretch to say that. I didn't taste anything. These skinny fries have to be the worst in the world. I think I'd rather eat BK's. Ugh.

The service sucks, the food sucks, just stay away.

I typically go to GVR for the movie theater and sometimes I swing by this Fatburger for a quick bite.  Admittedly, I was craving for a Fatburger since the last time I went to GVR early one morning only to find it CLOSED.  Yep - this Fatburger is not open 24/7 as advertised.

Unfortunately, it seems that the quality of the burgers cooked here vary from day to day.  Sometimes the burgers are juicy and flavorful and sometimes they are dry and bland.  

If only the burgers were more consistently yummy.

DON"T buy the $29.99 slushie package for two groupon. You will be wasting your money, instead go to 7-eleven and buy a couple of slurpies. There is no alcohol in these drinks. I read the reviews before I bought and didn't listen...I do regret. I even added extra vodka to mine and I never got a buzz. The place itself is in a great location and the servers were very friendly. Don't waste your time on a groupon.

What I want to know is who the hell puts sweet relish on a burger? Especially a burger that already has dill pickles.. I mean I love pickles as much as the next asshole, but I fn HATE sweet relish, so it pretty much ruined the whole thing. 

Aside from that, my curly fries were perfect, and they have Cherry Coke.. so here, have 2 stars.

The burgers were nasty!  It tasted like they got the patties at a discount from Walmart off the frozen section.

I have had Fatburger and I know they're good but not from this location, I threw half the burger in the garbage. I was with my brother and he looked like he was about to throw up.

The food and milkshake was good, but the manager was who really made the experience. He was cooking as well as making sure to talk to everyone that came in, and hand delivering each order with a smile. He really went out of his way to make sure everything was great which is rare in fast food chains. 

I just randomly stopped here as I live in another part of town, but I'm glad I did, and I'll make the drive to come back

Fatburger's been around Vegas for a while and had a reputation as the best burger in town for years. Recently they've been outclassed by SmashBurger and I can say there's not much reason to go back. The burgers are average and served with relish and lots of mayo which makes for an odd sweet taste. Fries taste about the same as those from the frozen section of the grocery store and are rather limp. 

This location had particularly bad service. Went in around 8 pm on a weeknight and there was only one staff member behind the counter, trying to fix a broken milkshake machine. Took about five minutes for other staff members to show up and even then they hung around the kitchen area. We had to wait for the first staff member to finish making milkshakes to help us and then he was incredibly unfriendly. On top of that there's no drive-thru.

If you're looking for a good burger in Vegas go to SmashBurger, or at the least In-N-Out. Avoid Fatburger.
This is the slowest fatburger ever! I order a shake it takes them 20 mins to make? Cmon! Really!

Ate here a couple of weeks ago.  I had the Med burger meal with skinny fries and the works minus cheese on my burger.

Awesome hamburger!  Awesome Lemonade!  Good service and clean tables& floors. A tad pricey but worth it.

Isn't everything suppose to taste better when you are faded?  Burgers here taste like cardboard.  I can't imagine how bad it tastes when I'm sober.  Their diet coke tastes pretty good though.

The location is right on the strip so its very convenient.  It's not that fast of a fast food place so expect to wait about 5 to 10 minutes... especially when there is a line.

This was my very first Fatburger visit and I must say I was very impressed.

I found Fatburger while looking for a quick place to grab some supper before a meeting.  My meal was a regular burger with cheese and a lemonade. Nothing too fancy but certainly one of the tastiest and least greasy hamburgers I've had in a while.

Looking forward to seeing more locations closer to where I live and normally hang out.
Excellent burgers, homemade onion rings, make sure to stop at the sports bar for amazing Alaskan beer on draft!
Terrible service!  No onion rings 20 minutes prior to closing!  This is not acceptable!  Fire the management!

A burger is a a burger is a burger is a burger. Two meals = $30 and the fries were cold.

No thanks.
Fat price!
Mediocre burgers - if you are in the area and want a fast food burger, Fatburger is  a better bet than Wendy's. But it is nothing to go out of your way for.

It is great that it is open 24hours but the food was not that great. I have been to better fatburgers in other states. The served taking my order clearly hated her job and was a bit rude.  The visit was at 4am but it was quite crowded.
Next time I would just go to the McDonald's next door because of the pricing.  My beef just did not compare with a sit down resteraunts typical hamburger and was a step down from in n out.
Waited at our table for 20 minutes, no service, said excuse me to one waitress and she ignored me. 3 groups that showed up after us got immediate service. Absolutely atrocious.

Wow. We opted to go to Fatburger on a Monday night INSTEAD of going to a strip club. This has to say something about the draw of their 'cuisine' here. Perhaps it's sprinkled with a ghetto-fabulous dust that has the same addictive qualities as coke (I believe this dust is sodium and lard-based).

For the two of us, we ordered about 60 dollars worth of food. The food isn't good, but if you feel the craving of a pregnant lady itching inside you for fried and greasy food that will probably dissipate the moment holy water ever touched it, this is your place. 

We went around 3am and it was still open, so yay for the hours.

I got some oreo shake concoction, and it was so thick that when I turned my cup upside-down, the shake was still in place; not one drop leaked out of the cup.

We ordered the chicken burger, 2 other burgers with assorted toppings, hotdog, chili fries, onion rings, beer (from outside), and the shake. After all, we had a checklist for things to do while in Vegas, and our list was basically a list of the 7 sins. Gluttony, check.

It was all very wrong, but felt so right.

Burgers was okay, fries done right and well, but the service I got when ordering was just not good.
And since it's really out of my area, I don't think I will try this place again.
Awesome burgers, onions rings and fat tire draft beer!  10% local discount and free fries with beer!

This location is not the best in the LV valley, but the burgers are juicy and made to order. My only complaint is that it is bit over price. Not sure I would ever order the XXXL burger. It might be too much burger if that is even possible.

I've been to other Fat Burger locations and i love it.  BUT this location is horrible.  Food is disgusting and my friend got sick off the chicken sandwich.  BEWARE.  i suggest just going next door to MCD and getting the $1 spicy chicken.

We were at Texas Station recently and went to eat here after about a minute after we ordered I got a call and we had to leave.  We asked for acredit back to our card and these two kids said they didn't know how to do a credit?seriously they are frying burgers and ringing up orders but they want us to believe they don't know how!  I've worked in places with registers and you are trained how to handle these matters. The little girl was smug and disrespectful grinning saying you'll  have to come back tomorrow when the manager is here. I said I work tomorrow but again she just grinned and said sorry you'll have to come back tomorrow cause we don't know how to do our job!  they can't do Credit!  I wonder if I starting eating and the burger was awful she is going to say I can't do acredit so you will have to come back..not hardly! So I come back "tomorrow" and this little burger flipper says I told you to call first the manager is only here at 7...we can't help you and she called me a liar.  She is the liar because my husband was with me when she said to come back tomorrow.  I waited about h15 mins because they were so busy ..watching here maul the burgers and picking at the meat in the center to see if it was done...so I have been defrauded so I will contact my bank.  She smugly said we are a franchise...but franchisees cannot defraud their customers.  Beware if this place.  I hope you are truly not so stupid you can operate your cash register. She has a long way to go to learn how to treat customers.  Long story shorter...we kept coming back and kept getting lied to...finally Saturday we came back to get the food we already paid for and they refused to fix it until they talked to mgr who is never there...we refused to leave and after much arguing they agreed to fix the food we paid for on Wednesday...then the burger flipper Emily told security she was afraid of me cause I told her to go to hell which I absolutely did after her telling me I was a liar...she is the liar, my husband was present when she told us to come back on Thursday...we were customers if this place...she has no people skills at all so she should just keep flipping burgers and stay away with any interaction with customers.  We are guest here for a week and I will take the security guards suggestion and speak to the casino management about this restaurant employees.

This place never disappoints if you want the best burger on the strip! The crunchiness is absolutely amazing! Be sure to add chili and cheese! We never hit Vegas without doing a FatBurger Run! Be sure to get the skinny fries and the Vegas Vacation drink!! Top notch cheap meal!

Another day, another burger! A pretty nice place to get a fast food burger if you're in the area! Provides you with a nice burger with all the bells and whistles, so to speak!

Came by for the Yelp Burger Binge Week, and was pretty happy with the burger. Quick and friendly staff took my order and made the burger in about 5 min. If you sit in, they will even bring you your meal to the table! 

A nice juicy burger with all the toppings you'd typically expect! Except this one included cheese and bacon, which are the best toppings in my opinion! If you want, there are options you can include on top or exclude if you are so inclined to do so! Easy personalization without much hassle and lineup. 

If you're looking for a fast food burger that's better than your typical joint, I'd give this chain a try!

Who's in charge here? Poor customer service over the phone. If you're busy say so. If you can't take an order over the phone, say so. Don't just hung up on people then not answer the phone. Way to lose clients.

I'm a total fan of Fatburger. IMHO, it is a superior burger to In-n-Out. Yeah, I said that. And their chilli cheese fries are pretty great too.

This location is on the Strip, near the Hawaiian Marketplace. You'll pretty need to park elsewhere and walk here. There's an inside area and an outside area. Since people-watching on the Strip is a fav pastime of my mine, we opted for outside.

The outside space is a circular bar with bar seating and then several high-tops. It's a seat yourself place. Unlike other Fatburger locations, this one has waitresses. So when you sit outside, a server will come and take your order, bring you your food, and bring you a check.

Also unlike other Fatburger locations, since this one has a bar, you can get beer and mixed drinks. There's also a slushie stand where you can purchase those crazy yard-long tourist concoctions.

The service isn't much, but that's kinda to be expected.

The food, though, is awesome. I thoroughly devoured my delicious burger and all the chilli cheese fries. If you're looking for a good, cheap-ish burger, and want to partake in some excellent people-watching, this is the spot for you.

I find this place a little expensive. . I wasn't really a big fan of this place. Food to me was just ok, nothing special. There is 3 different burger sizes and I don't think the medium burger size example was true in size. My burger was way bigger. I would get the small next time.

Les meilleurs Burgers de Las Vegas.
Bonne quantité servie. Ambiance sport ( foot us, baseball, bascket, etc...).
Si t'aime les Burgers t'es obligé de t'arrêter

Rude employees, place is dirty, food was alright, not the same as back then.

Went around 7ish to get a burger, when I went to order the guy sounded mad and annoyed, if you don't like your job go find an other job. Guy was rude when I was ordering, would cut me off and literally tossed my food and jerked it my way through the drive thru window.

Ahh Fatburger, how do I love thee?? Lucky for me, I was born on the west coast and have always had access to In--out and Fatburger. The raging debate goes on as to which is better. Well duh, they are different!! They both have fantastic things to offer. Fatburger is fantastic, because a. they cook your food when you order it, b. you can get a fried egg on top of your burger, and c. you can fax in your order. Fatburger tastes so great and you get your choice of skinny fries, fat fries, or onion rings. Also, you can get a turkey burger which is so good!! I crave Fatburger once in a while and I absolutely cannot satisfy the craving otherwise.
The food wasn't to bad. Fresh grilled burgers and the bomb drinks! On the south end of the strip,  good location.

I watched as a truck sat in the drive thru for 10 minuets if not more without being helped at all. It's not like you couldn't hear the vehicle sitting out there either, it was a diesel. As soon as the car pulled up that was behind them they were helped right away, to just to sit at the window for another 10 minuets waiting on their food.

Was it the best ever? Maybe not but we were hungry and everything was extremely hot and fresh. I could barely finish my burger. It was also nice to eat outside near the fountain at night and bring our dog out. So will definitely be back. Not too often though. It is fast food! They lost one star for service mainly because of lack of English knowledge by counter person. Not friendly either.
We were tired and walking around aimlessly after one of our tours and stopped in for burgers. They are pretty good and not overly expensive.

Since there's no Fatburger around from where I live, it was definitely one of the places I have to eat while I'm in Vegas. It was kinda hidden from the strip, but it's directly across from Monte Carlo and located in a small plaza next to Walgreens that was being renovated. To promote the new FOX TV show's Bob's burger, we were a bit confused at first thinking Fatburger is now Bob's burger, but it's only temporary. This is a good place if you want to grab a burger something quick besides McDonald's. It's a bit pricier than other fast food chains, but it was just fattening good. The burgers can get larger and larger, but the average size of their burger would be a medium since a small would like a tiny burger.

I went to the Fat Burger location off of Rancho and Craig Road in Las Vegas, Nevada at about 8:05p.m. -8:22p.m. This is not the first time I've been to this location, and this is not the first time I have had horrible service here. This was by far the worst of all the instances, though. I went through the drive-thru and a lady, Marisol (name on receipt), on the speaker asked if she could take my order. I had but a second to think when she rudely and quickly said, "Just let me know when you're ready to order." I said that I was ready to order & she did not respond. I said "hello, can you hear me?" Still no response. She finally came back on and said "let me know when you're you ready to order" I said yes, I have been  ready and started to place my order.  She cut-off me off and told me to hold numerous times while putting in my order. I get up to the window and ask if there was something wrong with the head set because it seemed like any time I started to talk I would get cut off. This lady immediately started to get aggressive with me and tell me, "Well I told you to let me know when you're ready. I'm too busy here for you to decide what you want." (Now mind you, as I drive up to the establishment I noticed that there was hardly anyone inside as I pulled up to the drive thru & only 2 cars ahead of me -One car was at the window& the other was waiting behind him to get his food. There was no one behind me). I asked her if there something was wrong with the headset because I tried numerous tine to get her attention at the intercom. She became very unpleasant,  hostile, & very unprofessional. She  said she was too busy. After arguing with her and telling her she was cutting me off even when I tried to order and her denying this I finally just paid and waited for my food. When I asked for a manager she claimed she was a manager. This surprised me because I cannot believe anybody in their right mind would allow this awful woman to be a manager of anything. She is absolutely horrible with people (again, this isn't my first time dealing with this lady). I asked for her name and her manager's number. She said her name was on the receipt. She would not provide me with a ph# to her manager.  This whole situation appalled me. I am baffled! Her behavior and customer service is unacceptable! Shame on the owner and shame on Fat Burger for keeping someone like that around!

Wow, what a rip off. I recently went here during my visit to Vegas. If you want to pay an outrageous price for a "Fatburger" then this is the place for you. I walked out of there with a bill of $50 for 3 cheeseburgers and a greasy hot dog. The lady at the register had an attitude and i think that those prices should provide better customer service. Will never go there again. It truly is nothing special and definitely NOT worth the price!

Dirty tables and floors. Cashier had no clue what she was doing. Dumb basically and tried to overcharge me $2 for a salad. No water cups at the cashier counter so she said she couldn't give me a cut for water. Her boss had to tell her to go in the back and get some. Had no clue about military discount either. The manager was very accomodating. Boy does she have her work cut out for her!

Horrible, horrible service!!! The employees are not nice and the food took forever. We placed an order at 3:03 PM.  We didn't get the order until 20 to 25 minutes later.  The order was wrong but we ate it anyway because we didn't want to wait an additional 20 minutes.  They didn't even get the drinks right.  I'm not sure how 'Mountain Dew' sounds anything like 'Root Beer'.  We also requested no tomatoes. Guess what?  We received tomatoes.  The employees really do act as though they don't give a crap.  
I will never eat at Fatburger again.  This was my first and ultimately LAST time.

First time betting Fatburger. The pictures looked so good. I order a grilled chicken sandwich with the chicken on the side (to ensure my sandwich didn't become soggy). However when I arrived home I saw that my sandwich was completely plain. Just chicken and bread. Cannot believe I paid $7.50 for this. I'm especially frustrated about this because I'm 7 months pregnant and I was craving the good in the picture. One good thing, the fries were very good.

Order from Grub hub - picked up at 7:37pm..arrived a FULL 30 minutes later cold.

Burgers are good...service and delivery is a joke.

This place is run by imbeciles. 

Ordered a LARGE fatburger - the cook ANGEL proceeds to plunk the think ball of meat on the grill and wander off for 2 minutes!

Then flips it and still leaves in without flattening it to cook properly

THEN FLATTENS IT LIKE A DAMN PANCAKE so it 8" wide !

So I'm watching him and knowing when he attempts to flip again - it will disintegrate - which is DOES...so this idiot proceeds to take the THIRD of the burger I just paid for and throw it down the waste hole on the grill!!  All while I'm watching this!  So I says " Hey - you just threw away a 1/3 of my burger - I watched you! and he just looks at me spaced out like  - I tell the kid on cash who is like - "I don't know!"  

How many times are they doing this to customers who are not watching??  I paid for a large and got less than a med burger - all because the grill guy is not paying ATTN and flattens the burger TOO DAMN MUCH!! 

I am relating this to head office and district supervisor as no one at THIS location gives a damn obviously - look at the pathetic score on this store and non reply for MGMT.....of course...IF there is any at all....

Fatburger is all hype. They're just overpriced burgers. I'm not saying it's not good, but it's nothing special. Cheese does not automatically come on the burgers, you have to pay an extra dollar for it. There are other add ons you can get for an extra charge as well. It also comes a la carte so sides are separate. Two burgers (one large and one medium) and a side of fries came out to almost 30 dollars.

One of my first stops every time I'm in Vegas.   It's one of my favorite burgers anywhere and the chain hasn't made it to my corner of the world yet.   Since my last visit - they have expanded to add the "Fat Bar" - which provides the same great food in a patio bar out front of the restaurant.  The only thing better than a Fat Burger is washing it down with a nice beer.   After a little taste testing - I've decided I like the skinny fries better than the fat (wedge) fries.  See you next time Fatburger!

I had their veggie burger. It was about $6 and I added cheese for $1. It was similar to Burger King's BK Veggie burger and about twice the size so I was OK with it being twice the price. Fat fries (AKA steak fries) were standard and I'm a fan of them so I liked them. My mom got a chocolate shake and that was pretty good too. 

All and all I would say it lived up to it's reputation to me and the others I ate with who had regular burgers. There is limited seating so if they are really busy and you are planning to eat there you might have a problem finding a place to sit if you are in a group.

I  will never visit this location again. The sweaty big guy,that took my order was rude. As I pulled up he opens the window to retrieve my money. As I roll my window down to hand him my card,he turns his head and starts taking another order. So,after sitting there for a good 7 minutes, he hands me my root beer float with sweat mixed with root beer, on the outside of the cup...Yuck! The burger was supposed to be a Xl...It looked more like a regular burger from a ran down whole in the wall,ass place. Even most of them have larger burgers than this....Then after he hands me my food,I asked for ketchup, he says, it's in there, as he proceeds to shut the window as I was still talking. ..$15.89...I don't think so. ...waisted money. When I got home I took three bites. No flavor, bread was hard on the top,and the bottom bun was soggy. I ended up giving the rest to my dog..

Hell to the no. This location sucks, and if you don't know, now you know. I waited over 20 minutes for a nasty overpriced chicken sandwich. I know they make everything fresh, but I was the only person there. I have eaten burgers from here before, and they were okay, but I thought I would try something different and go with a chicken sandwich. It was supposed to be a grilled teriyaki chicken, but it was teri-yucky haha. Super salty and not worth the price. I also ordered chili cheese fries, and was given regular fries. Luckily they didn't charge me for the chili fries so I didn't say anything. I don't mind waiting and paying for good food, but this was not good.

Finally got my son to try Fatburger with me and he loved it. We both got bacon cheeseburgers, he got his with a fried egg that's kind of his thing. This one's not in the best side of town but if you're over here it's clean and the food is very well prepared. We also recommend the fat fries they're really good steak fry style fries. Not the cheapest place to get a burger, but much better than most places you should definitely try it out at any location in town.

1st time eating here & must say that the staff is very professional, kind and courteous!!! The burgers were delicious along with the chilly cheese fries!!!! Nicole our waitress was very attentive and Francisco who runs the food was awesome making sure the orders were correct!!! Strongly recommend this world famous burger joint!!!!!

I got talked into the impossible burger, which was supposed to be the latest and greatest "veggie burger." It was dry and served on a dry bun that was too big for the "meat." To make matters worse, I was told it was healthier, all natural, and plant based. Out of curiosity, I looked it up afterward, to find that it is a processed food loaded with preservatives and has more sodium and saturated fat than a beef burger, not to mention that it is GENETICALLY MODIFIED AND INCLUDES AN INGREDIENT THAT HAS BEEN DEEMED UNSAFE FOR HUMAN CONSUMPTION by the FDA. I can't believe I ate this!! I CAN'T BELIEVE THEY'RE SELLING THIS!! The impossible burger is well named... it proves it is impossible to make a fake burger that's better than a real one. PLEASE STOP SERVING THIS!!
I just expected more. Idk. it was expensive and the burger was just ok. Fries were also just ok. I will have to give it another shot but was not overly impressed especially not with the price.

My Uber driver recommended Fat Burger. Walking inside smelled like moldy beach water or old mop water. There was a horrible smell coming from the back are. It made the whole joint stink. I couldn't even smell the food being freshly prepared. 

I ordered the turkey burger and mom ordered the chicken sandwich. We split a side of onion rings. Simple! 

The turkey burger was seasoned and cooked really well. Very juicy.
The chicken sandwich was good according to mom. However, after being told there was an extra charge for cheese, mom asked for NO cheese on her sandwich. she was charged for it anyway, and it was added. 
The onion rings were fried crispy but juicy! 

Would I visit again? Yes for the food, but only if I knew the smell wouldn't be a problem in the future.

Michael the cashier and George the server need to be fired! Michael does not know what the term "make it a meal means.  After I told George the server, that I was missing an order of fries he said oh well thats not my problem talk to the cashier!!! OMG I wanted to kill him at this point.  What type of service is this???

Are burgers supposed to be crunchy? I guess that's why it took 20 minutes to cook. 
Also, the whole place smells like ass.

Always wanted to try a Fatburger ever since Ice Cube told me that he ate one at two in the morning.

Well I had my eyes did at Lasik Plus about 2 years ago which is right next to the fatburger, so after my initial consult we moseyed on over to try it out.  The burgers were aight, Thanks alot O'shea! Foo, I'm just trickin'! No, but seriously they were good, and where else can you add an egg to your burger?.  The relish was a bit strong, so I recommend that you get it on the side, or not at all.  Hey, it was clean, and the staff wasn't all loungin' around when I went. Maybe the boss was there!

Someone onced dared to say this place was better than In-n-Out!

It's not, but it's on the strip and open.

If you can make it In-n-Out do, otherwise, go here....

Extremely disappointed!  Overpriced! 1 kids meal was 8 DOLLARS ! The hamburger it came with had nothing in it! Patty, bread and fries for 8 FRICKEN DOLLARS!!! No toy or apples included. I order a large Fatburger and asked for thousand island and never got it. The burger was dry as hell! The fries are nothing special. Overall I spent 45 DOLLARS for my entire family. 2 adults and 2 kids. NEVER AGAIN!
I love adding the bacon and fried egg, I guess it also makes for great hangover food. Dumb how we came one day and they ran out of burgers! -_-. I wonder how the XXXL Burger would be =D.

"I'm fly at Fat Burger when I'm way out west" - Beastie Boys

And this spot on the Strip is the best.  It has a huge outdoor patio with a bar and tv's.  No other Fatburger that I've been to does it like this.  Fatburger isn't my favorite, but it is pretty good.  There is an indoor part of this Fatburger, but what's the point of that?

But really, everything tastes better outside, with a beer, and watching a game.

The Skinny: decent burger but it isn't something I would come again and again for (3.25), service: reasonable timing of food and it's counter service (3), value: it's not like In-and-Out kind of good deal but it's still pretty reasonable.

Went here for a bite after watching "The Expendables" and came for a large burger and the skinny fries.

Personally, I think that there is a little too much bun for the size of the patty. But otherwise, the bun had a nice texture and flavour. The patty itself was well-seasoned however lacked thickness and wasn't as juicy as it should be. The iceberg was shredded and was a little too wet. It kind of messed up the textures in the burger. The sauces on top were rather uninteresting.

The fries are nice - crispy and well salted.

Overall, a good burger but not exceptional.
You don't know burgers til you've eaten fat burgers...they are up there with in-out burgers but even better in my opinion,,, definitely upscale in fast food...

Seriously this place needs to have more people working, took 20 min for them to complete my Postmates order after arriving and I waited 15 min after it was placed. One burger and one fat fries 35 minutes wtf.

It is ok, but not really special. I would love it if they had organic lettuce & tomatoes. If they had grass fed no HMO, no hormone no antibiotic high quality beef... It would be a much better experience.  It is ok but could be so much better! The cashier etc. We're all very friendly.

Best milkshakes ever!! I would definitely call ahead & order cause the wait is forever which I understand because everything is made to order. The burgers are great though & the milkshakes are made with ice cream!

Just had dinner at this location, the food was great as always, yet the manager need's to staff better, the girls were very sweet and overwhelmed being only 1 cashier/drive through orders and 1 cook. 3 of the 4 meals came right away and almost after the others were done eating the last meal came and 1/2 through that the last of the shakes came! It was not the employee's fault at all, being short staffed with a long line at the drive through they were over loaded. Sadly the manager needs to step up and make sure he/she is fully staffed during the rush hours from 3pm to 8pm! Raishaundra and the cook were super nice and did a great job considering there were only 2 of them to fill the order's! Give those ladies a raise!!!
I don't get the appeal of this chain.  What I had was just like any fast food burger but not as tasty.
The food was just okay. Over priced for the quality of food you get. The employees were great. Fat burger is only good for a late night meal

Went to this place for lunch with some friends, ordered the food to go.  Obviously they are in NO RUSH WHATSOEVER, even when you ask after 20 minutes where the food is.

There were maybe 2 or 3 orders ahead of us, and we all got basic burger combos.  We actually watched them make our hamburgers, and I'm pretty sure the cooks had never made one in their entire life -- or thought that if they stared at the patty long enough all of their problems would be answered.  THIS IS NOT GOURMET FOOD, THIS IS FAST FOOD.

Overall it took us half an hour from order to walking out the door.  No apologies even given.  Fries were done well before burgers, so they sat under a light IN FRONT OF US for most of the time.  Ridiculous.  Will NOT go back, and highly encourage the rest of you to NOT go.

This location is horrible. The staff are very very rude! If you have a special request such as something as simple as no pickles they still manage to screw it up. I recently visited the location on Sunset and Mountain Vista when I placed my order before I could finish the employee gave me my total. When I said I needed something else his reply was "hold on since you want to order something else."Once he added the items he then said "are you sure you don't want a drink? I mean really." This is the last time I will ever frequent this restaurant. The outside parking lot and menus are disgusting. The manager should be absolutely embarrassed as well as the company itself for such an awful representation of the Fatburger brand.

I just read Genevieve R's review below and have to say I didn't even know Fatburger had a vegetarian burger.

Who the hell goes to a place named "Fatburger" and eats veggies?  ;)

Me, I do the double meat (real meat, you know, beef), double cheese Fatburger. It's double the goodness. You can practically feel your arteries hardening with every drippy gooey delicious bite.

I don't know what it is about this place. But sometimes I just get this weird, "I need a Fatburger NOW" craving. And it doesn't stop until I gorge myself. Then I'm good for a couple of months.

It is a bit on the pricey side, but so far every visit has resulted in a tasty, juicy burger. Fries have ranged between so -so to really good. I have no idea why, but sometimes they just seem.... limp.

Killer shakes too!

This location has not provided good service in the three years we have been patrons. We consistently wait 25 to 30 minutes for a couple burgers and fries, and our food is always delivered with an apology and agree order of something because they were out of an ingredient or forgot to drop our onion rings. Tonight was epic and the last time we will eat here. It took 45 minutes to get our food and when it arrived it was poorly wrapped and thrown in the bag. Both burgers were ice cold and the food was delivered with another apology and after order of chili fries, because our onion rings were not ready. I told the "manager" that our burgers were cold and she said she could reheat them for me. And indicated she is sorry everything is taking so long but she can't get her employees to work. She offered to remake the burgers, and said they were still running behind. I asked for a refund and that's the end of that. This location will never get it together. So if you are up for an adventure, and a good story to share at the end of the night, stop by this fat burger. Just don't come hungry.

Fatburger's the kinda place you come for lunch or a late night meal like when you leave the bars after 1a. I like the interior of the Fatburger on mill with its retroness and it's multilevel set-up. Altho climbing those stairs when drunk is not that fun. It's slightly pricier than other joints namely Five Guys and way more than In-N-Out. Usually a burger just comes with the regular fixings, lettuce, tomato, onions and pickles, but everything else is an add-on... like cheese, bacon, chili and egg. I do admit, I like that they have a fried egg as an option coz that's yum. I also like that they have other things apart from a burger, and that is a Turkeyburger and a Bocaburger.

I usually get a Small Fat and if I'm really hungry a Medium Fat. Their onion rings are pretty good, and their skinny fries are better than their fat fries imho. Anyways... if you're looking for a good burger and willing to pay a little extra, Fatburger is not that bad... it's alright and reliable especially on Mill Ave. =)

In dying need of food after waiting in line for 3+ hours at a club that couldn't even get into, my stomach was starting to eat itself. Walking the strip and seeing fat burger was not busy ( 1am sat night ) decided to try this place out. Sitting outside in the patio area, watching drunk people pass by the waitress comes and asks "any drinks?" Umm yes just water for now, since I haven't looked at the menu yet.
(Please note, all employees that work here do not wear name tags...ODD)

Waitress comes back again and asks for my order, in which i tell her and brings me another water. Noticing others around me, there was a couple who arrived after me and got their food already. ( Already waiting 20 mins) So i figured my food should be arriving soon then. 40 mins later, food STILL hasn't shown up, now I'm furious. I flag down the waitress and ask her where the food is at and she leaves for another 5 mins, comes back and tells me something happened with my ticket order and the kitchen doesn't have it and she can't find it.....Really?? She then says " Oh I must of thrown it away, what's your order again??" uhh...So i asked for the manager on duty right away and told him what happened. He apologizes and gives me free drinks and a meal. Pshhh waiting an hour for a hamburger....ya no thanks...

Please avoid this place at all costs!

Stumbled into Fatburger while piss-drunk in Las Vegas at 3am. Showing zero will power or restraint - I ordered what has to be the worst item on their menu, or anyone elses for that matter...

I got the Bacon Cheesburger with a Fried Egg on top.  I destroyed it, and didn't go under cardiac arrest - so I must give it some love. 4-stars!!
A crispy chicken sandwich with cheese is 7.29 and tasted similar to McDonalds'.  It took 30 minutes to get at the drive through.  Not a bad burger by any means but way overpriced for what it is.

You're money baby, money!

So my boy D and I were rolling through Vegas for the weekend.  Finally a chance to enjoy Sin City for a few days that weren't work related!  So maybe the boys from Swingers wouldn't have made a stop at Fatburger, but what the hell..we were saving our money for the fun stuff, so tried to keep the midday meals to a minimum.

What can I say?  I haven't had a Fatburger since I was a kid, and wasn't sure what to expect.  I am a confirmed In-N-Out lover, so wasn't sure if I was going to be traumatized by trying something else out, but went for it on D's advice.

Hamburgers were great, fries good and the atmosphere...interesting.  It was a midday meal, so not really full of what I understand to be the partying drunk crowd that it usually gets late night.  But the music was blaring and there were plenty of people eating, so much people watching was available.

I enjoyed my visit.  Wasn't the best burger in the world, but it was good.  Wasn't the most relaxing of locals but it was fun.  Wasn't the most healthy of meals (hellloo!  FAT-burger, right?) but it was tasty!

Enjoy it in all its glutony and have a good time.  It IS Sin City after all.

This place rocks! The staff was really really nice and friendly and the food was so yummy! We sat outside by the side walk and people watched as we ate our great burger and fat fries and drank a beer! Perfect place for lunch and a great price too!

Abosulty never order from this store.  Manager was an asshole about giving my money back.  We ordered thru grub hub and got our food fast. But when it arrived it tasted old, flat soda, and the quality was horrible.  Called the manager back and he told me to complain to grubhub but we didn't have a issue with speed. But the quality was awful. The guy is spoke with had an attitude his name is Miguel Espinoza and basically told me to
Go fuck myself. Never go here never order from far burger here or anywhere.

Came here at 1 A.M. with my little brother, it's been a while since i'd been to a fat burger. I've been eating so much in n out i forgot what a fat burger taste like, so i got a large with everything in it including an egg! It was pretty darn good, the first thing i noticed about a fat burger thats different than a lot of the burgers that i've had is that a lot of the focus on flavor actually goes into the meat. Instead of everything that surrounds it. All in all a pretty good burger and a good A.M. snack!
This place is okay. I figure anyone could probably make this hamburger at home. Nothing really special about it. If all you like is a lot of meat on a burger this may be the place for you.

Staying at the Sunset Station, which by the way was much better than I had expected it to be.

Well Gus had some folks to meet for dinner and I was on my own. Figuring I would get something and take up to the room I walked around a couple of times and decided on Fatburger.

The young lady was quite personable with each who approached. She took my order of a burger with whatever it is they put on them and since the sign said the onion rings were the best you know one always believes signs I too had an order with a shake. And I wonder why I am a fat old man. 

It took very few minutes to get my order and off to the room I go. Well the burger was a mushy mess of no distinct tastes, I truly hated it and the onion rings were bland at best. The shake... ok.

It was mentioned that we should stop at a fatburger the other day and this memory popped up and I shuddered, never again...

Used to be the best burger joint on the strip pre Shake Shack. Great burgers and shakes. The outside patio/bar is great for people watching or just watching a game on one of the tvs. Good drink/food specials. Great service. Open 24 hours!

When I called the store I got someone on the phone and she said "Hold On."
She put the phone down and for 5 minutes all i heard was background noise and her voice taking orders from other customers.
My wife and I walked in about 15 minutes later and noted there were a total of 5 people on duty with one register open.

We got a number while we waited for our order.
A server walked around looking for number "39" She was announcing "Number Thirty Nine?" "39?"
We were # 40!

Three minutes later someone walked out with our order. It had the number 39 written on the bag!

We started to TRY to expedite our order by a phone call. 
Not the case!

I'm a big fan of fatburger and have been to 3 locations in Vegas and Henderson. Today was our first time at Green Valley Ranch location thanks to Groupon. What a let down this place is! The meat was completely dry, although still slightly pink inside, and very bland. If you've been to Fatburger before you know how juicy there burgers are! Not here.... and just to top it off the soda machine only dispensed flat soda.... Don't bother coming here, even with a Groupon.

Fat Burger is (greater than symbol) In-n-Out Burger

Being from Texas I am pretty snobby when it comes to burgers. I always compare other fast food chains with my beloved Whataburger. A couple of years back I tried In-n-Out and it didn't quite stack up. This time around I'd figure I try out Fat Burger and see how well it fares. i must admit, I can see why they call it Fat Burger. You can get an XXL burger which is 24 ounces of pure beef goodness. Even this Texan isn't stupid enough to get that! I only got the large (8oz) fat burger with bacon, cheese, and fried egg on top along with fat fries and a diet coke. haha ok I kid on the diet coke. I enjoyed every artery clogging morsel and dare I say it was better than Whataburger?!?!

Ordered the Impossible burger and paid 17$ for fries and the burger. 
Got it home to find out it was a bocca patty. WTH? 
I have bocca patties at home. I would pay that much for something I can make at ho e for a fraction of the cost. 
Oh and if you pay with credit card, the workers told us they don't get the tip if you write one in...only get to split the cash in the jar.
Food was absolutely delicious! Always heard of Fatburger but never had them..well they definitely did not disappoint.
Ate here on NYE. Ordered out and it took a while, which is normal for fat burger since they are made to order. The food was good and we were stuffed. We will be back. Thank you

Just paid $14 for a turkey burger fries and soda. Could have gone to McDonald's.  Used to love this place.   Won't be back. Just by tasting one fry I can tell they haven't changed their oil in a long long time.

The veggie burger is the best in town!! Everything else is a little shaky with attitude by the employees and the inability to get orders right at the drive thru. I suggest going inside to order. The prices are also crossed off on the drive thru board so sticker shock of 29 bucks for two shakes, fries, and one veggie one turkey burger. I'll just get the burger next time and make the rest at home.

They're open 24 hours for a reason: it's the best burger on the Strip morning, noon, and night. 

Fresh burger patties, fresh toppings, and great service. Every time I'm in Vegas, I make sure to get me a Fat Burger! :D
A really good burger and love the fat fries!!! They need to come to NY. what would a skinny burger be anyway?

When I went here it was a good expierence. The staff was nice and top of it. The place smells fresh and is clean. If you want a burger don't waste your time at fast food. This place has it all. Their Burgers are very good and very well cooked, it's very fresh and their shakes are good as well!  The burgers are big but worth the taste it is called Fat burger for a reason and I will consider coming back here!

I was just out here a month ago, and wow this Fatburger location is great. Ordered i believe a triple burger to go with everything on it. The fries are slamming big time yum. I decided to come over and grab some food to take home at 1:30am . This location also has a bar outside of it, nice outside bar. Had a few drinks talking and chatting with some of the locals. Fatburgers in L.A are not as good as they used to be, but there are great spots in Los Angeles for a good fatburger. Really recommend eating at this strip location.

We went in here tonight. We weren't really hungry so we were gunna split a burger. We ordered the baby burger and it was incredibly small. We had to go buy another. Its overpriced in my opinion. The fries were alright. I like crispy fries so I was disappointed. The burgers were good but they better have been for what we paid for them. My wallet is still angry with me.

Decent prices for being on the strip and fries are yummy (but if they added seasoning it could be sooo much better) and the burgers are pretty good too! Get a shake while you are there. You won't be disappointed!

Awesome little spot on the strip! 5 of my friends held up here to watch the Super Bowl they had the game on and weren't mad that we sat there for 4 hours with a pretty low tab we had been hung over from a heavy night of drinking. Bar tenders were awesome and super friendly the staff was awesome as well! The male bar tender took care of us and he knew we were hurting, took his time and didn't push food or drinks. 

Once we warmed up and got some water in our systems we had an awesome time chicken strips were amazing and the fries were light and crispy!

my first time trying fatburger and it was good but didn't quite live up to the hype. got a babyfat with cheese, eggs, bacon, and grilled onion. i love that you can add eggs to the burger and the price for all the add-ons isn`t bad. the burger patty had a good flavor to it but i think overall i was expected it to have more of a wow factor. maybe jucier or a special sauce? i don`t know

i like that this location is off the strip so probably not as busy. it was pretty empty when we came. but we were in a group of maybe 10-15 people and they messed up (or forgot?) about 4 of our orders. the people at the end of our group ended up waiting days for their orders, having to actually go up to the counter, show their receipts and wait even longer up there. i could see other customers getting their orders with confusion and it seemed like the cooks were getting their orders wrong too? another person in our group placed an order of just french fries and waited a pretty long amount of time for them, then when they finally came out, they were cold!

good burger, not the BEST service/experience. i`d def still eat here again though

The veggie burgers here are AMAZING! We ended up eating here a couple times late night & the guys that cook late are super nice, friendly, funny, awesome & the food tasted great!!

The boca burgers are really good & full of flavor, with all the veggies added & a side of fries, it's all I was craving at 2am!

Its nice to find a burger place that knows how to also make veggie burgers really well!!

Was braucht man in den USA - ja genau einen guten Burger!

Und wie der Name es schon sagt, die Burger hier sind - FAT!

Die Einrichtung ist wie in fast jedem Burger-Laden.  Es gibt verschiedene Größen an Burger - von M bis XXL. Nach der Bestellung bekommt man ein Nummern-SChild und muss warten, da die Burger frisch gemacht werden! Dafür sind sie super lecker, fast wie selbst gemacht! Aus die Soßen sind super.

Ich hatte einen XL Burger - und war mehr als satt!
I was very disappointed tonight. I ordered through the drive through. Not only was my order incorrect, my burger was cold. I waited 25 minutes in line. There were 5 other cars behind me!
Not much to say here. Good juicy burgers, will definitely stop by again when I'm in the area.

Please avoid this restaurant, always understaffed and food is not good.

First, when I ordered , lady rolled her eyes at me like I was messing up her day. Second, messed up and did not make my shakes. Also, they delivered the food in a tray when it was a to go order.

Once I tried the burgers, it was a real disappointment, sloppy and flavorless.

Definitely better burger joints in town.

Great burger chain, I just hate this one particular restaurant that's on the strip.

Dirty on the outside and horribly crowded on the inside. You'll see all sorts of people in the inside from the business professional to the dirty street hookers. What's important is that they're actually pretty well behaved since they've all walked off the alcohol I guess. This place is crowded as hell and it will take you a while to get your food.

I ordered the king burger and a peanut butter shake and ate it all. The food was great but the waitline was just way way too long. We should have just gone through the drive through and then sat inside or something. (This technique works well at crowded In-N-Outs.)

I have never been to Fatburger before and it's right outside the movie theatre I frequent, so we went early to stop for lunch.  Groupons are great!  Now I like hamburgers and fries, but my daughter LOVES them.  And Fatburger didn't disappoint either of us.  The burgers were juicy and cooked just right.  We also ordered bacon on them, and the bacon was cooked nice and crisp with thick slices, none of that see through crap you get at lots of burger joints.  Curly fries were nice and hot and fresh.  And when you have all you can drink diet coke, that's like a big fat cherry on top of a hot fudge sundae!  This place was great, a little expensive for a hamburger place, but really good nonetheless.  We will definitely stop back, especially since we walk right past it at least twice a month when we go to the movies.  Yum.

Fatburger just opened in the area not to long ago. I was surprised to see so many different burgers offered. I tried the original with the tumble weed chips. The chips taste better than Sputniks and the burger was juicy but also not greasy compared to the others. My favourite part is the fact that you could add an onion ring for free and the texture and taste is phenomenal!

The shakes are actually made with ice cream and my wife loves it. Would definitely come back with the entire family!

Showed up mid-week about 10pm so there were more workers than customers. Burger was better than some other spots. A bit pricy but that's what you get for eating on the strip. Our waitress was nice but the service was lacking when we needed stuff, we had to look around for someone to bring it. Got to watch the bartender to his best "cocktail" impersonation.

Ate here once and that will probably be enough. There wasn't necessarily anything wrong with the burger, but at this price, you are pushing into "gourmet" burger territory and gourmet this ain't.  Frankly this a step up in price from the Five Guys and In-N- Outs of the world and a noticeable step down in quality. As such, I can't say I really see a reason to eat here.

The rudest worst service ever. Not only was the guy at the counter rude and told my brother "no, it's too late" when he wanted to change his drink to a shake before the order was even sent in, he also got the order completely wrong and got nasty when we asked for it to be corrected. Unacceptable!

NOT 24 HOURS!!!! Several times in the las month have tried to go here late/middle of the night while at the casino and it's closed! Don't advertise that you're 24 hours if you are going to close in the middle of the night. Wish I could give ZERO stars!
The hamburger was dry and so was the bun. The cheese sticks were the frozen kind. The beer was $8 even though we had a Bogo coupon. I would not recommend this to anyone.

I hope the young adults working here honestly make $15 or more an hour because every time I come though the staff is attentive, and courteous. Never had a problem with my order. My Triple X is always seasoned properly, and cooked to perfection in a timely manner. There should be a tip jar in the drive thru, those cooks are working hard. The meat mixture they're using is flavorful, and has great texture. Fatburger on Flamingo is my go to grub spot.

I usually like this place and it's a regular for my moms lunch or snack spot. I got the small fat a good size when your not all too hungry but need a quick fix to your hunger pangs. The onions rings are ok just a tad bit greasy. My burger I had it better maybe at the green valley ranch location and perhaps I should have specified medium. My burger was a bit too hard on the edges the meat wasn't all to tasty as it use to be. I think I'll be sticking to eating garnished at green valley ranch instead

Wow. I've never been to such a slow fatburger. I ordered a burger and fries - no one in line, and 1 burger in process ahead of me, and it took more than 30 minutes. I don't think the cook was aware you can start another order while one was on the grill.
  The quality was standard Fatburger - it's a chain.
  Don't come unless you have lots of time.

They make one of my favorite burgers but good things only come to those who wait. Her, you will definitely wait.  They are slow. The place is run down and looks shady but the food is good. They messed up my drive through order today so you might have to check your food before leave.

Now I have eaten at several FatBurgers and this location has got to be the worst! My burger was the driest, thrown together burger I've ever had got home took 2 bites and was pissed!!! My fries were cold as ice! I will Never go back

Worst hamburger I've had in a long time, and I paid $22 for two SMALL burgers, two fries and a small shake. The bun was squished, meat over cooked and dry. We won't be back. Even Jack in the Box is better than this, and probably half the price.
The food was satisfactory, but definitely NOT worth the price. I had to wait forever, and it wasn't that busy at the time, either. The service could have been a lot better.

I still love their food every now and then for an indulgence and I'm not petty when it comes to bad service usually as everyone has a bad day. Today, I was craving Fatburger, one car ahead of me, sat at the order screen for 5 minutes before a shallow voice came over asking can I help you? Ordered my food, forgot to say everything on the burger but he never asked. I decided to just tell him instead of waiting. Pulled up. Car in front leaves, he's in the window. Opens it and ...........complete silence........ No read back, no hello, no total given. Just silence and looking at me. I hand him my money knowing the total from the order screen. He hands me my change, no words are spoken. This is really odd to me! Why would you have your drive up window person be someone who is socially rude? I don't get it. The name on my receipt read Break and below that initials DT. Management - please get someone else to work the window!!! This young man is not the type of person you want handling face to face contact with customers. My food came and he opened the window looked at me,  I must have been sitting there waiting for a word and he just hands the bag and closes the window. No thank you, have a good night, nothing!  I don't get it.  Maybe I'll just start going inside now when the dining room is still open. The drive in seems to hire those making their paycheck with little to no effort or enthusiasm. I'm not requesting cheerleading chants when I receive my change but a simple smile and thank you would be nice?! I've sat at that order screen twice before and was never helped. I drove away. Today was the third disappointing experience and my god if In and Out Burger had turkeyburgers, I'd be there instead. If Fuddeuckers opens up on this side of town, we'll have to part ways Fatburger.
I only ever go here when my boyfriend is craving a greasy, tasteless fatburger. I can't stand these things. Like another poster said, they just make me hungry for In-n-out.

This is a great spot for the Red Rock, probably the best place within the food court area.

Fatburger is a legendary So Cal burger staple, with Ice Cube rappin' about it ("...Two in the mornin' got the Fatburger") on his hit "It was a Good Day" 

I prefer it over In and Out, Five Guys, Johnny Rockets, The Counter, The Habit and most other over the counter non-fast food, cooked to order burger joints.

In LA, I usually get the Fatburger on the char grill and fat fries (as opposed to on the greasy grill with skinny fries)

In Vegas, I opted for another of my favorites, the Bacon and Egg sandwich.  It's really good, but tell 'em to skip the mayo and put on ketchup instead, it'll taste better.

I've not gone to LBS which is a sit-down burger restaurant in the Red Rock, so can't compare this to that.

With Fatburger... The prices are good, it stays open late, what more can you ask for?
24-Hours, Drive-Thru action... And d@yum good BLT w/Egg breakfast sandwiches :-D. My weekly weekend treat!

I LOVE Fatburger! This location is awesome no matter what time I visit and it's always a pleasure when Vladimir is my Server. Don't forget to get your discount if you go to the movies that day at Sunset.

I wish their was a zero star option. The person at the register said he could not even take my order for at least 10 minutes because he had people before me. Learn to multitask. All he had to do was take my order and throw a patty on the griddle.
Burger was ok. Needs a refresh/update. It's inside the casino so plan on a smoky atmosphere.

We stopped by for dinner after seeing the Blue Man Group. Since it was the 4th of July the Vegas Strip was crowded. Neither of us were in mood for a fancy sit-down place and most of the fast food places had long line. On the way to see the fireworks at Caesars Palace, we saw this place and there were plenty of places to sit outside so we decided to eat here. 

I had a veggie burger and my husband had a burger with a single patty. I thought it was fine as I expected to be. Since it was too hot to eat a lot of food, we didn't order anything to go with the burger. I thought the portion was just right.

Service was fine.

I'm from Texas and I have heard how Fatburger is amazing and all, so I came in with high expectations but it was okay. For my taste the hamburgers were too oily and the burgers didn't have any special flavor.

After eating here, I appreciated more living in TX where the mighty Whataburger is King! :-) Five Guys is even better than Fatburger. Although my burger was overloaded with pepper, it was good but nothing to rave about. I will give it another try. 

Eat Up!

My double Turkey Burger with sweet potato fries was everything especially after being in the pool for a few hours and we had the plain Buffalo wings those were great also.. Now for the drinks they were kinda light but affordable  wouldn't buy drinks from there again.
Good food! I always love the "cook2order" thing.. Fun and friendly but wish they still had the jukebox!

Fatburger is the African-American version of Johnny Rocket's.

In order to create a Fatburger, you take the Johnny Rocket's old school diner feel and replace the Elvis, Roy Orbison, and Jerry Lee Lewis with the Aretha Franklin, Al Green, and the Jackson 5. The music here has me "all shook up," but it has my, "r-e-s-p-e-c-t." I love it.

Fatburger also takes the complicated Johnny Rocket's menu, eliminates 75 percent of it, and makes you focus on how you want your burger and what kind of fries you want. Ordering is like, "A-B-C, easy as 1-2-3."

You first pick the size of your burger. By size, it means in terms of patty size (2.5, 5.3, 8, 16, and 24 ounces). I am not sure who can eat a 2 pound burger, but until I weigh 400 pounds or I am high on government grade grass, I'll stick to the 5.3 ounce patty. Plus, there's only so much meat I can fit in my mouth.

You then pick the toppings. The burgers come loaded with fresh lettuce, onions, tomatoes, and pickles (unless you say otherwise), but you get to add to your "Fatburger" experience with four extra toppings: cheese, bacon, chili, and/or an egg. Personally, I always roll with cheese and bacon. But under the influence of Las Vegas, I have added chili and an egg and it while it was different, it was still delicious. Yum. Burp. Fart.

If you want fries, you get two options: skinny fries or fat fries. The former is thin and crispy, and the latter are more like steak fries. Honestly, they are both really good. This is like having to choose between Betty and Veronica. And just like Archie, I can't truly commit to either option. 

So I pick one or the other on each visit, but never both at the same time. You have to keep your options open and never let them know you are savoring both. Now that's "true playa" status, right there. Ya feel me?

Also, the milk shakes shakes are wonderful. You have try one at least once. They have five different flavors: chocolate, vanilla, strawberry, Maui-Banana, and Oreo Cookies & Cream. You can't go wrong with either, but I suggest the vanilla, strawberry, and cookies & cream options. They are just so thick and creamy. That's what she said.

In addition to all of this, the service is stellar. But since it's set up is not a sit down restaurant, you don't need to tip. I guess Fatburger eliminated the tipping from Johnny Rocket's too. So you are left with great burgers, at a good price, in a cool environment.

Needles to say, I'm a fan of the African-American Johnny Rockets: Fatburger.

My absolute favorite burger joint ever. It might sound exaggerative but out of all places I've tried, Fat Burger rules supreme. The patty including the bun and everything else between is refreshingly... fresh! A juicy flavorful patty, the variety of ingredients and the french fries are great too. It's unfortunate we don't have one up here in AK but every trip I take to Las Vegas, it's my first and last place I eat there. Highly recommend and the service is great also.

Very friendly staff. The food amazing and the service is excellent. The cook, who's name I didn't get, was very nice and the cashier Jessie has nice sense of humor and gives excellent customer service. Very satisfied with my visit. Thank you.

It was 1AM and I'm walking back to Polo Towers after a hard evening of gambling in New York, New York, MGM and Monty Carlo.  I was hungry but didn't want a full-sized meal costing over $80 for one person on the strip.  Plus most places were closed ... even Hard Rock was closing.  There was Denny's but I wanted something more.

As I passed the local FatBurger I noted people were there eating, the bar was was open and there were heat lamps ... so I stopped for a visit.  Ordered a Med burger, steak fries and Onion Rings.

I like my fries crunchy/crispy and thats what I got.  Fabulous crispy fries and the onion rings were just as good.  Crunchy and the onions were soooo tasty.  I was in heaven.  The burger was med cooked and very juicy.  But it needed seasoning.  

Overall my visit to FatBurger was a hit!

I liked what I had ordered which was a Hawaiian which had bacon, pineapple, Swiss, teriyaki.  My burger wasn't crazy large but it was the size I wanted. We had a variety of sides which consisted of Cajun cut chips, fries, bacon poutine. 

This is the only Fat Burger in the GTA just north of Promenade mall in Thornhill. 

While I wouldn't necessarily drive all the way to Thornhill just for this place if I'm not too far I would come back to try some of the different burgers. 

For the price it is not bad since you can basically choose your size from small to super large over a pound and even more I'd you wanted. I give it an a-OK.

im a FAN. seriously. i love me some double doubles animal style... but cmon... the fatburger - king burger - is just as awesome.

LEAN beef... everything on it (except lettuce for me) and add cheese... i love it. i usually order my in n outs without sauce, ketchup and mustard only... so this KING burger is pretty much perfect.

BOCA or TURKEY burger for my wifey... god bless her sexy self... so if she can eat a burger where i eat a burger... we are both happy...

FAT FRIES. done son. smother in salt and ketchup. thats the shizzle. fo sho.

For convenience sake, we popped in here for our last meal in Vegas.  It's expensive.  It's dirty.  It's greasy.  It's messy.  It's scary.  It's Fatburger.  It's delicious!  
I got the "Fat Deal" combo for $10.  I love the "fat" fries (steak cut fries), and the fact that they put both relish AND pickles on the burgers.  We braved the Vegas clientele, and ate our food there.  When it's your last night in Sin City, and you haven't had any luck at the casinos, you might find yourself blending into the Fatburger crowd at midnight.

I feel completely humiliated. I was at your drive through and it took 10 min for someone to acknowledge my I was there. They said they would be right with me. 15 min went by And nothing... cars started honking and couldn't do anything because there was a car in front of me. The car in front of me left and STILL no one asked for my order. I went inside and told them I've been waiting and again no one in your staff said a word. They ignored me like I didn't exist. The car behind me was asking if the store was getting robbed, and they turned off the sound. It was unbelievable...

Came here with a Groupon. We got Cheddar Fatburger /w fries for 2. All I got to say is...there's nothing special about the burger or the fries. The only outstanding thing are their sky high prices. If I didn't have a Groupon, this deal (2 burgers + fries) would have cost me around $25 which is ridiculous. With the Groupon, the price is just "Ok". 

If you just think about how burgers are made, there really isn't a lot of culinary skill involved. Watching the staff put together my burger made me realized anyone with a pulse can do it. I don't like places that charge a premium for no reason other than being famous. 

Is it better than McDonald's? Yes but that's not a hard benchmark to beat. The burger tasted like any other mid-level chain's. Worth my money? No. Will not return.

I've been having a Vegas affair with Fatburger ever since I've been going out to the strip.  

Located just south of the center of the strip, this 24hr burger joint brings the flavor.  They offer burgers, chicken, turkey, and veggie burgers so they are sure to please any crowd (drunk or sober).  They have killer steak fries and their add-ons (egg, cheese, etc) make the possibilities endless.  Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating as well as full bar options just add on the awesomeness of this place.  

Long story short, when you're needing drunk munchies food on the strip, this place delivers.(not like actual delivery to your room/location, but more a metaphorical delivery).  Boosh.

Overpriced! You're better off going across the street to Five Guys  (you'll save quite a bit of money, too).  I'll admit that the shakes are good, but not good enough to pay almost twenty bucks for dinner for two!

Not impressive at all.

Stopped in as a tradition in Vegas to sit on the patio and yep, the 2 for 1 drink coupons at the front were going around. (pay for one and get the second one free) It was the most beautiful day ever so nothing beats being able to have a light lunch and have a small (ok, med is the smallest available) burger. 
We skipped the fries, onion rings - we just had burgers. You order inside, pay, grab your number on a stick and grab a table. Our server was spotty, saw her once only and then an Angel called Roberto took over to help us and he never missed a beat. LOVED HIM so much we called out a manager from his office to tell him what a great employee he had in him. It takes more effort to give a nasty complaint about someone than a good one, right? We will miss chatting with him, at least til the next time we come back!
We had the best afternoon watching the Vegas world go by.
The music was great and not too loud over the lunchtime.
Our burgers came out hot, fresh, good-salty and cooked to order. It was busy and the food is cooked in the order it comes in of course so relax while you wait with a drink and enjoy the sights, tunes and staff.
Next time I come here, screw it, I am cheating and getting the onion rings. They are to die for!
Good burger & this Vegan would eat there again if you lower your price, $14.99 + tax is too much for a fast food place. Other locations are $8, why not this one?
I heard the hype about this place so I checked it out.  My burger was really dry.  :(  I'd just go to In-n-Out instead next time.
Not as good as In-n-Out, but a solid late night choice.  The wait can be pretty long since everything is made to order, but it's worth the wait if you are comparing to the McDonald's next door!
Great location, hours, juicy burgers, great customer service. It's a simple burger spot, don't expect anything else. I got the XXXL burger "challenge" and it was tasty and filling.

Im not one to write bad reviews, I firmly believe if you don't have anything nice to say don't say anything at all. But this needs to be said. 

I'm sitting here watching a man with scruffy grey facial hair cook. He has thrown down raw patties, cracked some raw eggs on the grill, built all of the burgers he was cooking and wrapped them up. He then proceeded to clean the grill and his station. 
Unfortunately, he still hasn't changed his gloves. He's just wiping his dirty gloves on his dirty apron. 
A couple approached the woman at the counter and let her know what they saw, because I'm not the only one staring at these violations, and she said he was "supposed to do that". 
The kitchen is a mess, the floor is a mess, the restaurant is a mess. 
This is really pretty disgusting...I wouldn't eat here if I were you. I know I'm not going to.
YUM! I order my food on my lunch break, and it is ready when I get there. the staff is friendly. service is quick. and food is delicious - what more could I ask for?!
Generally I love Fatburger, HOWEVER, STAY AWAY from this location! Staff did not even ask me how I want my burger cooked, it came dry and tasteless! I will NOT be going to this Fatburger again.

Their burgers without a doubt are some of the best burgers in town. They have 5 different sizes of burgers to meet any man's appetite. They are juicy and flavorful and that's all I can really ask from a burger place.  But the burgers are so freaking expensive that I can't justify coming here without a groupon. The meal is not worth the price.

I will say the service is pretty poor though. Every time I come in, it doesn't matter who is working the register, but I always get such a despondent look from the people when I start giving my order. Ok, so I'm sorry I make your life a little bit more difficult because I don't want everything on it. But for goodness sake, it's really not that complicated. They literally sigh when I give my order. Buns extra toasted, mustard no mayo, tomatoes and lettuce. Maybe I'll drop off the Cheer Up album by Reel Big Fish the next time i'm here.

Moving on, the chicken sandwiches are pretty tasty  that it makes me forget for a little bit how much I hate their service. Doesn't matter if its grilled or crispy, they both come out well, but honestly this place is known for their hamburgers so I would say that if you are chicken sandwich connoisseur that's it not really worth your time or money. 
Their seasoned curly fries make an excellent combo with their choco milkshake. Perfectly seasoned fries with a really thick and creamy milkshake.
