P.S. No matter what you order and no matter if the place is completely empty, it will take on avg 10-15 minutes to get your order. I understand that everything is made when you order, but seriously a 15 minute wait in an empty restaurant is pretty ridiculous?
I would say stay away from this place unless someone else is buying or you have a coupon, the burgers are good, but the time and money expected at this place is not justified.  However,  if you only want a shake and seasoned curly fries, then definitely go here.

A friend of ours said we HAD to visit Fat burger's when we were in Vegas. He was completely right! Fat burger did not disappoint. The burger was delicious! The dressings they put on the burgers are unique and the sandwich was mouthwatering.

The sign on the building says OPEN 24 HOURS, but it is NOT. Then they have a separate sign taped to the door saying their hours. They really close at 10 PM every day. The food is good, but it is false advertising.

Fast food served slow!  Be ready to wait at least 20 min after ordering and be sure to double check your orders if taking togo. 

And, where's my hubby's bacon?  I still haven't heard the end of the $1 charge that never materialized.  Take it from us if you want your fries skinny, you have to ask because they're not going out of their way to clarify your desires.

We Went to see Nashville unplugged a country concert and then went to eat at Fatburger, the burger was okay, but we got fries that was cold and 2 drinks  the bill was over $30 for 2 burgers for what we got and the price was charged it is not worth it and we will not be back!

Yum, I love fatburger and I'm not surprised that this location in Vegas is no different. This is just your average fat burger place but with the extra spice of Vegas included at no extra charge! The burgers are delicious, the service is 24 hours so unlike everything else, it's when you want and what you want. You can order up a notch if you're really hungry. They have the best fries as well and everything from veggie to major meat head. 

I recommend walking here though, because if you drove there's more or less no parking!

Good burger, nice amount of toppings and great location.

They accommodate gluten free pretty well too!

I have been to many of their locations in LA and I always love it.
100% real beef burger is what you get.

Good location on the strip and open 24 hrs a day. Looks dirty from the outside, but inside while nothing to write home about, it is just fine. The line although long, moved rather quickly. I had a large Fatburger meal. My burger was very good and just the right size. The skinny fries were also quite good and similiar to the fries you would get at McDonald's. The prices are kind of high for fast food, but what can you expect for a place in the middle of the Vegas strip. If you are drunk and in need of late night eats, you would be well served going to Fatburger and getting the grease you need to fight tomorrow's inevitabe hangover.
Food was Delicious!! The cashier was very kind and patient, since I'd never been there I had a couple questions but she answered them all and I was very happy with our order.

Me:  "Fatburger?  Never heard of them!"
One of my friends suggested, "I hear they're pretty good."
We decided to try it.

Both my friends and I agreed.  This might be a good burger if you're drunk, but it was pretty bad while sober.  While my friends ordered their own combinations I went with the medium Fatburger deal omitting cheese and onions on my burger and choosing the fat fries over the skinny fries.

Although this place looks and operates very much like a fast food place it is not.  The burgers are cooked to order so definitely expect a wait for your food order to be called.  If you order a soft drink it's self serve.  That part I liked about Fatburger because I can control how little ice and how much soft drink actually goes into the cup.

However, back to the burger.  My number was called and a worker delivered the burger tray to me.  The first thing I noticed was how small the burger (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LtXy1VinKWfuLFslVarKRw?select=2v29rPxqQNAWVXQlLTyqPQ) was compared to how large the portion of steak fries were.  I love thick fries which is why I selected the Fat Fries over the skinny ones.  These were a huge disappointment even though they were nice and meaty and fried to a perfect golden yellow color.  The fault was in the oil which tasted old, and because of that the fries didn't taste fresh.  You'd be surprised how big a difference there is just by changing the oil in a fryer.

The burger was not good either.  The burger patty was so overcooked no moisture existed within the meat.  I might have been happy had there even been a glistening of grease within, but nope, chewing cardboard is probably the best comparison.  The shredded lettuce while crisp had the odd taste of being stored in a refrigeration unit badly in need of a box of baking soda.  I don't mind that they use pickle relish instead of pickle slices but even that tasted old.  It's kind of like when you go to Costco and stock up on too much of something and store it until the taste begins to waver.  The pickle relish did not have a fresh snappy taste to it.  The only ingredients which tasted fresh were the tomato slice, the bun and the mustard.

At the least the service was good and the workers are friendly.  I can honestly say I won't be back at a Fatburger restaurant anytime in the foreseeable future.

I recently cheated on my pescabacontarianism (veggies, fish and bacon) diet to enjoy a burger while at a recent outing to a baseball game. 

I was excited to see something other than your standard hot dogs and nachos while walking around trying to find something to eat.  The excitement quickly faded once I was told the price for two combo meals.  Thankfully I had recently sold one of my kidneys on the black market so I was able to scrape together just enough to pay for the meals.

Hunger is indeed the best spice, the burger and fries went down without much of a fight.  Sadly since I have only one remaining kidney the odds are I won't be able to eat here again, unless I win the power ball of course.

I had a craving for a good burger to take out so I found this place on Yelp due to the positive reviews. 
The burgers are expensive for a fast food burger joint. I had the Ultimate BBQ burger combo with tumbleweed chips for $15.27 plus tax.  With the combo there's a choice of thin cut fries, curly fries or tumbleweed chips. 

Pros: 
Service. The staff are friendly and attentive. 
Toppings and beef are very fresh. The beef has a good meaty texture.
Chips are crisp and nicely dusted with some type of seasonings. 

Cons:
The BBQ sauce is way too sweet to be on a burger. It was overwhelming the beef.
The bacon is very thin, similar to McDonalds. 

Overall, the burger I tried was just okay. I'll probably come again to try something else on the menu, but definitely without the BBQ sauce.

I haven't been to Fatburger in about 12 years.... I just went today and man was it good..... I got the XXL burger which is 16 ounces of ground beef and costs about $8.95 with cheese and no fries... It's a little bit of a wait if your going drive thru but it's worth it, the burger is definately one of my favorites and I'll be trying the XXXL burger next time I go which is 24 ounces of burger. Hopefully I can eat it completely.

2.5

I haven't had FB in years! All of them virtually closed up in the OC, I remember the one on Tustin Ave. and the one in Downtown Brea, back then the food was solid and I don't remember being as expensive as it is now! :/

Fast forward to a few weeks ago when my sister and her friends were in town, they treated me to dinner and majority of the time when I go out to eat I order off the kids meal because of my stomach issues. I ordered a kids cheeseburger meal and her friends shared one combo, somehow it came out to $22.00!! 

Are you kidding me? One kids meal and one combo (no frills, no double patties etc.) for $22.00?!! I can honestly say I feel ripped off! The burger was OK, nothing special, nothing like the Habit and even the Habit doesn't charge crazy prices like this! Did I mention we waited in the drive thru for almost 15 minutes?! We were the only ones in line and took ridiculously long!! I don't think I'd ever come back unless I was just downright begging for a FB!

-__-

Talk about some great drunken munchies after a night out on the strip. This place cranks out burgers in minutes and there really good. There not In-and-Out good but still really good. The place does get crowded and packed and you also have to deal with alot of drunken people but overall not a bad place to go.

It's really a 3.5.   Solid burger joint with many size options up to 1 1/2lbs!  I recommend adding a fried egg and bacon to the burger.  The chili dog is pretty good, too.

Kind of small inside, but clean and friendly service.

I pulled a muscle in my back lifting luggage on my first day in Vegas, and my doctor called in a prescription for a muscle relaxer to the CVS across the street. We had never tried Fatburger before, but they are everywhere, so we thought they may be on a par with Five Guys. Mistake! Honestly, we would have enjoyed the McDonald's next door more. The driest, most tasteless hamburgers were served by the unhappiest servers I've ever seen. Please, fellow Yelpers, take heed!

For a supposedly good burger chain, this place was not good.  First off, it was very overpriced for the quality.  The burger had no real flavor, and my bun was quite stale.  My wife and her friend got the regular sized burger, while my buddy and myself got the larger burger.  Both my wife and her friend got sick hours later, while my friend and I did not.  I had always wanted to try this place, and now know to skip it and go straight to in n out, or 5 guys.  I was very disappointed.  There are a ton of other great burger places around Vegas, so skip this one.

Stumbled in here drunk on my bachelor party the weekend of October 6th-9th. Drunkenly ordered, outstanding burger, and proceeded to leave my wallet upon leaving.

Retracing my drunken steps the following morning, I realized I left my wallet at Fatburger and immediately called. They said they did have my wallet and I proceeded there immediately. Thank the lord, my wallet was safe and sound. Thank you Fatburger. I will definitely be visiting on my next adventure to sin city.
Decent burger but not worth the money! Two of us had just burgers, sweet potato fries and drinks for $33! Outrageous! Will never eat here again!

I really like Fatburger for what it is and it's great to have one In the food court at GVR.  The burgers are consistently good and tasty and the shakes are great too.  Personally I like in n out better, but change is good every once in a while...not to mention egg, bacon and chili!
I just find it so obnoxious when fast food places put a tip option on their Interac. This one is forced tipping as well. So you have to choose between percent and dollar amount.

I love fatburger and will eat it any time I get a chance.  This is one of the pricier fast food joints as I paid $27 for 2 meals.  The fatburger needs no description!  You all know this tastes good.  I was definitely disappointed by the fat fries though. They tasted as if they had been frozen for a long time.  They definitely had a weird aftertaste.  I would suggest ordering the skinny fries as those were actually great!  The drive thru is open 24 hours but dining area has set hours.

I love this burger, but the bigger the order the messier it gets. I frankly don't give a damn because a Fatburger is about flavor, consistency and an overall quality product. It's not fancy. It's a burger stand, not one masked as a burger stand, and the food is made to order. The patty is formed right in front of you with some spice thrown on top. The fries are fresh cut and not frozen and you get the option of Fat fries or Skinny fries. Get the Fat fries. You decide what goes in your burger, but I get it all the way with both mustard and mayo. This time I went for the double. Dayum! It was huge and yes, it was messy but like I said it didn't bother me as I knew it was going to be one of the best burgers, EVER! The party was very juicy but not greasy. Whatever spice they throw in the party really brings out the flavor of the meat. The veggies are fresh and the fries are perfectly friend to a golden color. 

Every time I'm in LV Fatburger is my go-to place. If I visit Cali I make sure to find a Fatburger since there isn't one in Texas. Seriously give this place a try. I know it's not hyped up by Hollywood celebrities but remember they are probably paid to "endorse" that other California burger joint.

I never thought I would enjoy Fatburger, because I typically am not a fan of the type of hamburger that is taller than it is wide, where you bite into it and about a pound and a half of condiments dump into your lap.  That's why in the eternal war of In-n-Out vs. Fatburger, I would take In-n-Out.

But for whatever reason, I really do like this particular giganto-burger.  There is the kitsch of the classic hamburger stand, the chrome signs and lineage behind the thing.  Add to that a very simple menu with lots of choices for your made-to-order burger.  And the ingredients are generally very fresh.  Some combination of that makes a burger that is a great experience, instead of just a placeholder next to a mess of fries.

This particular Fatburger is very hit or miss as for service times.  You can go in at three or four in the afternoon, or very late at night, and get your food in no time and find many places to sit.  Or you can go right at noon and be monumentally screwed.  This place doesn't scale well, so you might have to give up and move on to something else if you hit a rush hour.

Oh, and Mr. Pibb!  I always love that stuff.
Great steak fries and delicious burgers. Makes a great late night meal. Grease and goodness.

This place is disgusting.  Horrible customer service and they are lucky I didnt go to higher people and complain. The manager was really rude and treated me like shit. She was mad when I asked for a new burger throwing my burger in th a trash and telling me I was a problem. Because it was morning and know one else was there she got away with it her terrible attitude. Dont go to this fatburger!
Chicken sandwich and crispy thin fries were good. Also tried the Oreo shake which was thick and creamy and jam packed with Oreos! A good spot for a burger and fries, but not the best I ever had.
The food is incredible- I had the strawberry shake,fat fries, and veggie burger. It's always packed! Definitely worth the wait.

Great Great Great...  So much so this was my Friday date night with the Wife...  And she was truly happy with the Burger...  She, Said it was the "BEST IN TOWN" and trust me we eat a lot of Burgers...  Wait time was about 7 minutes, as they cook everything fresh and boy were the fries hot... Trust me do the "combo specials" which will save you about $4 bucks...  Also this Fat Burger is not owned by the same group that owns the others in town... Have eaten at 4 of the others here in AZ plus ones in Calf. & NV...  THIS ISTHE BEST...  The only complaint (this is as a past fast-food owner)  they had 6 people behind the counter... Great for service, but must play heck with employee costs...

Great Food...  XXLDADE  (6"4' 270 and love to eat)

I orderer uber eats from this location. Took them about 30 mins to delivered to my place.
Anyways, their burger really fit with the name XXXL burger, pretty delicious. Only down thing is their buffalo wings, i order the mild type, which i expected to be atleast a little soft and spicy but it tasted a little to plain and the chicken was kinda hard. Over all it was a pretty good experience.:)

One of the best burgers I've ever eaten.  I must admit.. I was in Vegas and a bit under the influence!  I decided to take on the XXXL Challenge and demolished the burger.  I am now 'King of All Carnivores", or in other words The Burger King.

Grab yourself a FAT BURGER.

Good burgers. Juicy, nice size, well cooked. Not the best, but a good, solid burger nonetheless. Just remember when you ask for everything on it, that means EVERYTHING... including relish, which I can't say I've ever had on a burger before. It is a bit on the pricey side for fast food, but hey - it's Vegas. Part of the reason it gets bumped up to a four is because of the atmosphere. The jukebox plays pretty good hip-hop/R&B and workers are friendly. Be wary of the bathrooms though... Not the cleanest.... Just a heads-up.

Sitting at my desk in my office, I could see a steady flow of coworkers returning from their lunch breaks with Fatburger soda cups. This was enough to make me crave a big, fat, juicy, heart clogging, carb-filled burger and fries. So one day I decided to venture out and have my own Fatburger experience.

I selected their King Burger combo meal because I always order more than I should. The meal consisted of a 1/2 pound burger, fries and a drink. I got the burger with all the fixins' and selected the fat fries. The total for the meal was $9.19.

Arriving before the lunch rush, there was almost no line. The order taker was friendly and didn't try to "upsize me" or sell me anything other than what I wanted. I waited a bit longer than I wanted for my meal, but I guess that is because they cook everything when it's ordered. My only complaint is that there were no suitable containers in which to take out ketchup. They had those little paper cup things but there was no top to keep the contents from getting all over my car. There were also none of those ketchup packets to be found so I left their establishment ketcupless.

Back in my office I found that the burger and fries actually look like what is on their menu which is a surprise. The size of the meal was very good and filled me up quite nicely and then some, so I guess the food and drink was a good value for my money. My only issue was the actual taste of the food. I found it very bland and average at best. They either need to better season their meat/bun/something or start using some "secret sauce" to flavor up their burgers. I had the same issue with the fries. Thankfully, I was able to pile on salt and steal some leftover ketcup packets from the community fridge.

The worst fries I have ever had.  Understand, I never met a potato I didn't like, but these were undercooked and lukewarm.

I would have brought them back on principle, but there was a line.  They were supposed to be a treat for a project just finished.  Yuck.

10PM and all the mainstream restaurants are no longer serving.  You hate walking aimlessly through smoky casinos looking for food.
So, if you're me, you walk up the strip.  And walk, and walk.  
Your food choices include Denny's, McDonalds, Harley-Davidson Cafe.
A sign for a new Brazilian-type restaurant shown on the side of the Krave building had me hopeful, but I walked a block in the wrong direction only to find there was no such place.  Arg.  But, it's good to know that if I'm ever looking for boys dressed like girls, Krave is the place to find them...

I digress.  I kept on walking and walking, and ended up at Fatburger.  It was good but the service was crazy slow.

I ate my Kingburger and fries, slurped down my shake, and steeled myself for another long walk back down the strip.

I came here on the last day of Burger binge week. I ordered the Yelp burger, A big, juicy, 6 oz AAA Angus beef burger topped with Canadian Cheddar and customized to your taste with your choice of mustard, relish, onion, pickles, tomato, lettuce and mayo (and 8 other free toppings!). All for $5! 

If I had to describe their burger using one word, I would go with "Fresh". Everything about it is fresh, from the Juicy patty to the crispy lettuce to the perfectly toasted bun. It was a little salty though. To be fair I asked for all the free toppings. I suggest that you minimize your toppings, don't be greedy like me.

Great friendly service. Establishment is a little compact with the exception of their spacey, clean, fancy washroom. Surely worth checking out.

I had dinner here with some friends last Friday.

Fatburger with cheese and egg: 5/5 - I don't know how it could be any better. My friend saw my burger with an egg and said he got out-burgered.
Chocolate Shake: 5/5
Service: 3.5/5 - The staff was friendly, but very slow on my order. It wasn't that busy.
Ambience: 2/5 - It would be great if they had outdoor seating.

They took forever & messed up all our orders! 
Thanks guys you have terrible service.
Nothing too impressive. Burgers were pretty decent, but not out if this world. Onion rings were good. Price was expensive for what it was, in Vegas.

Dinner on Tuesday, 8/4/15

Yay! They're 24 hours but what isn't in Las Vegas, right? We walked in and there was no wait in line. Apparently if you're a police officer in uniform, you get to eat for free. The cashier was super friendly and took our order down quickly.

Drinks are self-serve to the right of the kitchen. There's also outdoor seating where you can order alcoholic drinks. There were plenty of tables available to seat ourselves. The food came out in a reasonable time. We enjoyed our medium-sized fatburger with skinny fries. I've visited other Fatburger locations and they all seem to be consistent in flavor.

When I'm Vegas, I'd definitely keep Fatburger as an option for late night meals. Walgreens is right next door so it's convenient to do our shopping after we're done eating.

I was recently in Vegas for a week for business, and found myself needing to do lunch on the first day there. I have a thing about hotel food (don't), so I yelped to see what was around.  And lo and behold....RIGHT across the street from the Aria shows a Fatburger!  Hadn't eaten at one of these since I moved from LA, so off I went.

Typical setup - stand in line to order, get a #, go sit and wait.  But....the ordering....ahh.....first, a REAL burger, cooked to your specs.  Choice of size.  Choice of REAL cheese.  Choice of bacon.  Choice after choice after choice.  You know...like a REAL burger place (kinda knocks In-N-Out out of the category). 

Ordered the basic burger w/swiss and bacon (I know, I know...that's so unlike me...(cough)), along with a small fries and a diet coke.

Received my meal about ten minutes later...and it was JUST like I remembered them...divine.  Definitely recommended!!

Ok.. when I first visited I was overwhelmed with the experience. Now I have a much more "meh" feeling towards this place. 

Compared to a lot of other places around town I find it slightly pricey. The burgers are better than any other fast food place.. but for the same price.. or a few bucks more you can enjoy gourmet burgers else where. 


I do recommend checking this out at least once to make up your own mind. This place also seems like a lot more fun during the summer --- more seating that's for sure.

We came in from Florida and I could not wait to get one of these! Love my burgers and this one was so amazing with the Friday egg and grilled onions and cheddar cheese! Going to have to have at least one more before we head back to Florida!

Really good! The place looks like a fast food place, but you get quality. Got the double cheese fat burger and it was perfection. Meat was fresh, toppings were plentiful!

This is a great place to get a no frills solid meal. Next time would opt for regular french fries than the fresh chip thingies.

Its not the cheapest, but again, you get quality. Will be going back again!

I went to Fatburger in Las Vegas late one night. I was expecting typical diner food. I did not feel like a beef burger, so I ordered the turkey burger.  I swear I heard trumpets and caught a glimpse of heaven when I bit into this burger. The burger was huge, however after the first bite it rapidly disappeared. 

The best turkey burger ever.

I'm happy to learn there is a Fatburger about an hour from me. I hope their turkey burger is good as the one in Vegas.

Located inside Red ROck Casino, there is ample parking, the hardest part is getting around the casino to find the food court. 
The ambiance is almost like a trashier version of johnny rockets with the red bar stools, simple American Food with burgers, shakes, fries, chili cheese dribbled onto everything. Although it seems they are making an attempt to be a little healthier with their new crispy chicken wrap (tortilla wrapped fried chicken with all the burger fixings on the inside). I mean the menu is by no means healthy. It is called FATburger- due to the quantity of food and the calories associated with that food. But as I watched them make our burger, I noticed they were not premade patties and they were using what seemed like "not previously frozen- but who knows" ground beef. Also it didn't seem like they were using binders (egg or breadcrumbs) 
As we ate our burger noticed the burger was kinda dry, probably due to the amount of add ons and very little mayo. Def had to ask for extra Mayo.
Large 1/2 pound 7.75$ 
Bacon: 1.25, cheese: American, cheddar, Swiss 1.00, chili 1.00, egg 1.00, guacamole 1.25, mushrooms 1.25
Sides: onion rings, fat fries, skinny fries, chili cheese fries 
Milkshakes: vanilla, chocolate, strawberry, cookies and cream/Oreo, Maui-banana (4.50)
Desserts include ice cream Sundays (2.10) and root beer floats (2.40)

Pretty pricey esp with a meal 
A) fat burger medium 1/3lb (12.25)
B) large 1/2lb 13.50
C) XXL 1lb 15.80
D) XXXL 1.5lbs 19.00

Idk, the price for the burger is quite steep. But it is in a casino. I just think there are better options for a better burger.

I think this place is the best burger place in the GTA. Everything is always fresh. Staff are excellent and easy parking which is much better than most of the downtown locations. Burgers are good size and not too greasy but still tasty.

I loves me some Fatburger!  Despite the name which, in my youth, conjured images of burgers with rivulets of grease streaming off of them, I loves me some Fatburger!

I might even like it better than that other burger joint.  Yeah, you know the one.

Their selection is the best for a fast food restaurant - regular burgers, turkey burgers, veggie burgers and chicken sandwiches all make an appearance on the menu.  You can get chili or bacon added on or, if you're feeling particularly British, a fried egg.  The option or fat or skinny fries rules and now it looks like they even have a wedge salad.  Whoa!

Now I know what I'm getting for lunch.
Got our order wrong and UberEATS driver had to wait for them to fix it. Then it turns out the order was still wrong. I didn't eat the item they messed up on so it was a waste of time and money.

I bought a groupon and decided to stop in after work for takeout.  Service is top notch.  Great staff and patient while I looked over the menu and talked to my son on the phone to get his order. 
Burger excellent, fries and sweet potato fries also excellent.  
Will definitely stop in again.

Pretty good burger, and there are lots of condiments to it.  The only thing was, I wanted to add cheese and an egg, but that would mean that I would have to spit out an extra $1.98... almost another babyfat burger.... I wish they could have made those additions a tad cheaper.

Fat fries are YUM :D

This place will not be around for long.  With the high level of GTA competition in the burger world these days, customers demand the best.

Fatburger fails in many areas, but let's focus on food failures.  The burger meat is dry and tough.  No love was put into forming these patties.  Whether it's overworked or low quality beef to start, doesn't matter because the end result is bad.  Fries are clearly frozen, the insides were freezer burnt.

We demand freshness and quality control and won't stand for American franchises like this that don't deliver.

I love fat burger and their prices are quite steep.  This location use to have the best staff ever.  Now the staff is horrible and the food taste like it was a pile of slop.  Everytime I order here they get my order wrong.  I am allergic to cheese and have you ever tried to peel cheese off your bread?  I order a burger NO cheese please, no relish please no mustard just mayo.
WOW I get home which is quite a distance from this fat burger and guess what?
My burger has CHEESE stuck to the bread couldn't get it off.  If I ate it I would end up in the hospital.  MUSTARD all over the thing dripping out , IHATE mustard.  And Relish on the burger that it was soggy by the time I got home.  I HATE relish.  
This is more then 1 occasion where I have had this horrible experience at this location.  Today was the last time . I will NEVER go back here.  The staff is rude and I don't know if there is a language barrier or they are just flat out stupid but even the management lacks what is needed in this place.  Now I understand why they are so slow.  Too bad for the owner of this business because im sure if it keeps going the way it is it wont be in business to much longer.  
FROM the DISGUSTED customer.

Yum!  I loved my veggie burger with cheese and skinny fries.  I will get that again.  Might even try the steak fries!!  Got the lemonade which was good but I wish they had fresh brewed iced tea instead.

If you love a good burger, not dry at all, with a soft bun and real juicy beef, then you will love fat burger, its a most eat if your a burger lover now if you think mc donalds is better then wendys then dont go to fat burger your taste in food is way off most people like Comercial burger spots but i scout a good burger wherever i go so to sum this one up,

 go during the day to avoid the night time drunks and make sure you grab a Guinness on tap and enjoy a DOUBLE 1POUND XL BURGER WITH CHEESE.

I have been to the other fatburger down at deerfoot, so I thought I would compare the 2 and also  comment on my latest visit. 
This location is significantly smalller than the one at Deerfoot, but for some reason I liked it better. I dunno, maybe it was the brightness of the location, there are lots of windows and it was a nice sunny day! 
However there were less booths here than at thier other location and I like booths. 
There is alot of more available parking here than at Deerfoot ( deerfoot gets nuts).

As is typical of Fatburger the food was hot, fresh and tasty. I had the veggie burger( I think its the best in town, if not the best  I have ever had)and onion rings. The onion rings were excellent, hot, crispy, with full rings under the crunchy batter. Drinks here are serve yourself and unlimiited and your order is always served with a large paper ramekin of Heinz ketchup. 
They have really nice seasoning salt on the table which I quite enjoy.
You have to wait a few minutes while they cook your order- to order. 
All in all, I have to say Fatburger is great, and so is this location.

Fail burger,  13 $ for a burger fries and coke?, a 15 min wait only to find out they gave my order a way . a half hearted apology from the frycook who is either high or drunk. The manager and staff seem like they rather be somewhere else
Fantastic casual meal with friends! Waitress was delightful!! Drinks and service very good.
If I could give it negative ten I would this location needs to close it's dirty people are rude and every one of the 6 burgers we ordered were wrong
Great place for all day breakfast. Supervised by the great service! Got the XL breakfast. It feed me and my 2 year old son. Fun music playing too.1

Ate here twice while in town and each time my burger was over cooked ,  it was tough. I only ordered a second time cuz the first fries were big and nice edible, good my second order not so much even the fries were over cooked. Not worth $35-$45 dollars for two people each time with and without drinks I'll pass, they were  crowded they rushed but gave awful food. Check your food before you leave each time was carry out. I'm used to fatburgers LA where there not only fat but juicy not dried out and hard.

2.5 stars

I wish the burger was better, granted I went at like 2am but still I was expecting more for my first FATBURGER experience. The bun seemed a bit dry and the burger was sliding around the bun a lot, huge turnoff. The fries were alright I was just hoping it was gonna be like an in and out with some beer to go with but not the case. I'd try it again in hopes it would be more like how it is in my dreams. Til next time Fatburger
Absolutely best fast food service in VEGAS.  Highly recommended. Every member of the staff was superb.

I'm not sure why I've tried these guys more than once.  The hamburger buns fall apart every time and for the price you would think you are getting a gourmet burger.  I'll stick to Five Guys or Smash Burger.  I have never been impressed with Fatburger.

Had to try Fatburger - wasn't disappointed. I got the 1/3 lb with the works and it's a wonder I didn't just drool everywhere. The fries were pretty average but I was very pleased with the burger. Giving 3 stars because the price seemed a bit steep.

OK. I'll admit that in the area that I live, Five Guys is considered the best burger in the area, so when I heard all the hype about this place, I had to give it a try. I'll have to admit that this burger was definitely tasty and unlike the Five Guys burgers, did not fall apart while you are trying to eat it. The fries are almost as good, and you can have a cold adult beverage with your burger. My only negative is the construction that is going on right in front, especially, if you decide to eat outside. The dust and noise is not good. I just wish we had one in North West Florida.

Passed by this place a zillion times without a thought of stopping since I'm a Carl's Jr fan. Finally tried it the other day because my husband wanted to go and I was pleasantly surprised! The burgers are made fresh to order and they are juicy and flavorful. The shakes are made with real ice cream, not the nasty powdered stuff most fast food places use. But they use vanilla ice cream to make a chocolate shake and it wasn't very "chocolatey". So the next time I went I asked for extra chocolate syrup and it was a perfect choc shake. The employees are nice and aim to please. Glad I tried Fatburger!
We stopped while walking the strip and found an average burger with mediocre choices for beers. They appear to have some specials, but we were never told about them.
Our server Mallory was super awesome!! Very attentive and a great personality. She made our stay worthwhile.
Can you say delicious!? Service was good. Food was amazing.  Loved the atmosphere ! Who doesn't ? It's Vegas!!!!!

The food is good but holy crap is it difficult to order! The lady barely speaks English and kept trying to give us a chocolate shake when we wanted pumpkin. Couldn't figure out how to do no tomato or mayo either. It took 11 minutes to get our food. We pulled over in the parking lot, ate our food, and drove away and the guy in line behind us still hasn't received his order!
Can you guys update your business hours? went by at 9:30 and it was closed this seems to happen more often then not, get your shit together

I have to say it is the average Fatburger experience. The staff is friendly and eager to please. This one is not so busy as the other locations around Las Vegas. It has plenty of easy parking. The lot is also easy to get in and out of.

Like other Fatburger locations if your in a hurry I find it better to call ahead or order on-line unless your with someone who's company you enjoy. They don't cook the burgers until they are ordered so the wait can be a monotonous if there is a line of people.

I like my Fatburgers cut in half and my fries well-done.

Good burgers with a nice list of add-ons. Although the price of each add-on is rather punitive. A $8 burger becomes a $12 burger with snap of a finger. Secondly, a previous review mentioned this and it's true-the buns fall apart way too easy!  If you're going put the kitchen sink on a burger then you better have buns to withstand the load.
Good burgers very filling for any appetite bit a little pricey. All in all very worth the meal

Fatburger has always been better than all the chains including In and Out.  The patties are tasty and ingredients fresh.  Their shakes are also made with real ice cream and taste great!

This location has plenty of parking, a drive-through and is open pretty late.
The best vegetarian burger with onion rings and added jalapeños I have ever tasted in my whole entire eating life!

Oh you're in Vegas. You will and need to go Fatburger. Regardless if you're a snotty rich person I would still recommend this place! The burgers and fries are great. The price is steep but it's Vegas!! The bar is good and cosy great service. However we stopped by the bar to get a quick drink. 3 vodka and lemonade $80? Oh well that was Nye. That's the only downside!

This burger was terrible. No one in my family actually liked it. The wings are barely even cooked and the  pootine was gross. Ya the milkshakes are amazing but for a outrageous price of 5$. I am never going back to this place.  
Ps the pice for 3 people that ordered one quarter pounder each and no drinks was over 40$!

I rarely eat fast food, but me and my dad came here before catching a screening of Rogue One at Sunset Station's theater. It was also my first time eating at Fatburger in literally forever. If you're looking for a good burger and fries to enjoy, I suggest trying this place!

AVOID this place, first time trying it ... to say the least SUBPAR. The cost of the food is way to much for how mediocre it is, figured be a good burger, but hell no. Customer service was bad, acted as though we were bugging them.

Will NOT do this one again, dont know if I will do ANY Fatburger again. Pricing is not reasonable for what they serve.

Pretty tasty stuff, especially their thick cut fries, yum!  Those are hard to find these days.  This location is in the food court at Green Valley Ranch, just go in the doors by the movie theater/arcade and take the escalator up.  It is a tad smoky for my taste, but it is to be expected since it is inside a casino.  I wish the food court wasn't open to the casino floor, but what can you do.  Weather permitting, I usually get my food to go and eat it outside at the district.  They are pretty pricey, and other several sizes of burgers depending on how hungry you are.

Oh lite night fix. How I love you fatburger, you are always reliable when others are closed. You provide greasy food to prevent my hangover from overtaking me in the morning. Thank goodness they have a veggie burger. Life saver. It's not my favorite veggie burger, that's why they only get 4 stars. But it does take care of the late night drunken cravings. :)

I love fat burger the burgers are probably the best you can get through a drive through. It's expensive and it takes a while, it totally worth it. If it was a little cheaper I would give them 5 Stars. The staffe needs some work but the quality of the burgers make up for it.

Great place. Burgers are always correct and delicious. The service isn't that good though. My friend brought in his service dog today and we were stared at the entire time and they all looked scared. It's a dog, not a lion. Calm down. Both times I've been here one specific girl always looked annoyed and like she didn't want to be there. Girl, there are so many people looking for jobs, don't take up space if you don't like it there.
The food was amazing like it always is but your host name Tanya with an employee number 86 has a horrible attitude and really upset my wife after having an amazing night at the red rock casino.

Had a really good experience at this particular Fatburger.  Great onion rings!  Yes, it takes 10-ish minutes for your made-to-order food and I paid $13 for everything, so you could say it takes twice as long and costs twice as much as McDonalds -- but its also twice as good IMO.

Love that this place is always open! Buy one get one drinks! Our drink server was really sweet. Has a perfect view of the Las Vegas strip. We went here both nights in vegas. Will definitely be back again.
Yea...we need to eat @ 4am...biotches.....bahhahhaa and now they have a bar....whhooo knew..with fatburger beer!! Whhhat what!!??

Haven't been to Fatburger in a while, and I remember coming here every now and then when I was younger, so we decided to have brunch here for old time's sake.

First of all, the guy at the drive-thru had no patience. Every time he asked if we wanted something with an order, within 2 seconds of asking his question, he'd rudely say "HELLO?" Secondly, I ordered a sweetened tea, but was given an unsweetened one which the lady gladly exchanged. But when I tasted the new sweetened tea, it literally tasted like sugar and water with no tea flavor whatsoever and barely any hint of color. And lastly, I found a few pieces of wilted lettuce in my chicken sandwich.

The burgers and sandwiches aren't anything special. The only good thing about the meal was the Fat Fries. So overall, the meals are not worth the price. Even my drink was terrible. And an entire additional $1 just to add a slice of cheese to your burger or sandwich? Come on.
Came to fat burger for lunch today and the food was ok not to bad but the price was not rite for the food I received!  Staff was great!
Heaven is a Baby Fat and an order of their awesome steak fries.

Fat burger is amazing! What isn't there to love about this place, big juicy hamburgers, fries. The location of this place is great it's on the strip and it's open all day long, do great for people getting out of the clubs and casinos. Lines can get a lil crazy it is VEGAS. Definitely a place to check out
Listen I just had a great burger and every time I go to fat burger it's a great burger so do yourself a favor go in there get the burger with an egg on it one of the best burgers in town

This place was busy! when we came in. Thats usually a good thing, and the line seemed to move pretty quickly. I was entertained with them yelling out the orders as well :) It doesn't take much to entertain me.  

We got our food and I have to say that my favorite part was the fries. They were excellent. The burger its self almost reminded me of a chicago style hot dog because of what was on it. Good, but not amazing.

It was fun to eat in here and just watch all the different people come and go.

This was the slowest place I've ever seen! 25 minutes and 2 people in line. I finally gave up and asked for my money back. The staff has no motivation. Never again! I hope a general manager does something about this slow ass place!

I think Fatburger has a really good burger. It's a hand-formed patty and it's cooked after you order it. It's hard to find that in fast-food nowadays.

The topping are always good and fresh. I really like that they put both sweet relish AND dill pickles on their burgers. It's unique and it tastes good.

The steak fries are also good. Hard to find at a fast food place nowadays. 

I always make sure to get Fatburger in at least once while I'm in Vegas.

Alright, fine, Fatburger gets a slight upgrade.

I never end up here on my own accord; I get dragged here by *boys* wanting a Fatburger at midnight. *They* don't have to worry about being accosted by dudes who think they're in a rap video (fyi: fake bling--not so cute.) *They* don't have to worry about their burger being too pink & not being able to eat it. Whine, whine, whine. My sincerest apologies.

I ordered a veggie burger topped with a fried egg & bacon--I've definitely had better, but at least it was edible, unlike my previous experiences here. Burger was overwhelmed by toppings (mustard, mayo, pickles, lettuce, tomatoes.) The steak fries (Fat Fries) were good. 

I'll eat here if I'm forced, but I'm not going to be happy about it *pouts & folds arms over chest*
Haven't been here in ages. What an awesome burger the bread really put this meal over the top. For a chain FATBURGER is definitely on point.

This place is beyond fucken ridiculous. I just paid $30 for two burgers one drink one fries and one Mille shake!!! Who in the fuck charges this muchZ this place is always dead. This is the first and last time I'm eating here! I can't believe this/ this place isn't even high quality or fancy. It's a fucken hamburger stand. Ridiculous! I hope corporate sees this and makes changes. You guys don't even offer ac in this damn restaurant. It's so hot and stale in here. You have workers who can't even explain their receipts! It's fucken pathetic. I will never ever eat here again. I feel like trashing this place for how expensive it wants to charge for two damn burgers!!!!!

This review is simple.

Positives: Burgers are very good. Has a lot of flavor. Cooked fresh made to order. Onion rings are very good. Not too much breading like other places. From what I have seen so far, all the Fatburgers that are in the casinos are 24 hours. Fatburger for breakfast? Sure, why not? Milkshakes are genuine. Very smooth and you can taste the ice cream.

Negatives: Pricey. Their smallest burger starts at around 5 dollars going up to 10 for an XXL burger. Their biggest, which is the XXXL burger, will have you forking up some serious coin. These prices are just for the burgers. Of couse you can get all these with fries and drink for an additional charge. You can get fat or sknny fries. So you see a combo meal can get pretty expensive especially if you are feeding a family of 4 or more. They also have turkey burgers. I have ordered it twice. The first time it was overcooked so it  was a bit dry and bland. The second time they didnt cook it thoroughly so it was a bit bloody still. Never again will I order the turkey burger. Those times were drive thru so I was too lazy to drive all the way back to complain and have it redone. 

Service is decent. Of course you gotta wait awhile especially if the place is packed. All their locations have a retro 50's, 60's, 70's rock and soul themes. Some locations even have a jukebox for your listening pleasure. 

So overall, it's a decent place to go to every so often. I just dont recommend the turkey burger.
The order was wrong and we asked for nacho cheese fries and got shredded cheese on our fries. We also waited a long time for our food.

I like fat burger, in fact I'll go as far as to say that for big burger diner experiences, I'd prefer this place than the nearby five guys 1 burger joint.

I believe that in the last 3-4 visits I've had over the years, I never had an issue with the quality of the burgers served. I particularly like their milkshakes and chicken sandwiches as well.

But in terms of the price, wanting something cheaper doesn't justify going to this place. Cheap, fast, burger fixes are best spent at Mickie D's. But Fat Burger is a great alternative if your willing to spend 10-15 dollars

The Last Great Hamburger Stand -- reads the facade of Fatburger. John Lee Hooker playing on the jukebox, cooks yelling order numbers at unsound decibels . . .  Yeah--I'll bite. 

I went with the Fat Deal (yes--that's what it's called) with onion rings. I was here for lunch and thought my order came out really quick. I was a little worried. My Fat Burger didn't look too fat, but it's all an illusion; it's actually quite a beast. I wasn't sure if I would be able to walk back to my conference when I was done. 

Fatburger is a cheap eat, nicely situated on this South part of the strip. I'm glad to have found it. The interior feels vintage and jukebox is pretty rockin'. I think the place is pretty top notch in terms of fast food. My burger was tasty and as I already mentioned--filling!

My son loves the vegan burgers here and now he has the option of the impossible burger or the Boca burger. He got the Boca burger but will be back to try the impossible burger. Only.thing is there is always a long wait here. Personally I don't really like the regular burgers here especially for the price so we only go for his vegan burgers when he gets a craving.

the burgers are alot better in the states than they are here, the name says it all, no calorie counting here, get the fat burger loaded with thick fries and a good ol' shake with whip cream to wash it all down, on the strip opened 24 hours, just watch the rowdys late at night or the drunks..every time i go to LV i go this joint, cooked on a flat grill and made to order... no microwaves here.....on a funny note my son is 3 and loves mc D's fries, so i went in the joint right next  door to Fat burger and all the eupopean tourists were in there, i guess they don't know any better....
My sister got e-coli from this place and so did a family friend on a separate occasion. Be warned. Hopefully they don't delete this comment like they did on Urban Spoon.

Maybe it was the time of night, or maybe we just caught a bad crew or maybe every one else is super drunk when they done here so it's delicious to them, not sure but our food wasn't good in the least bit. My burger was burnt and dried out and so were my two friends. But, if you check in on yelp and show the bartender, you'll get a free shot...which you'll need if your burger is prepared like mine was. Good luck!

Wow! Just woooow!! We decided to try this place out....Boy, do we regret it! We should of known better once we entered. The odor of sewer through out this place is ridiculous!! No freakin A/C during summer is INCREDIBLE! But anyways, we still ordered our food... I know it's called Fatburger for a reason but seriously, those burgers were greasy AF'! Over exaggerated greasy.  Not only were they greasy but does it really take 35 minutes to make our food? I mean I understand making it fresh and all but that's pretty ridiculous. Health Department needs to come down here and check this place out. I didn't even finish my burger and fries. I really tried to give y'all a chance...never again will I step a foot in this place. I was completely disgusted.

Craving it as I write. 

We decided to hit up a different burger joint since I was craving a nice, juicy burger! I was tired of In N Out, Red Robin, and the many over trekked joints. You know how it is when you're craving something and at the same time wanting to try something new - RISKY!

We walked in at first and was delighted at the simple menu. The food came out pretty quickly. The burger was as fresh and juicy as I'd craved. The first bite was insanely delightful with the juices melodiously circle in your mouth with the tomato, mustard, grilled onions, etc...and to add to it, the grilled bun added that extra crunch. SO good. 

Maybe we were hungry or maybe, it was just THAT good. We haven't stopped talking about going back. Oh, well, it's Saturday today. Maybe we'll have another Fat Burger snack today!

We finally decided to check out the famous fat burger! Oreo shake was good..........like really really good.... 

Burgers were pretty good, I tried mine with an egg added. Fries were good, we tried the thick cut fries. 

We didn't spend much time here since we were on a schedule zipping around Vegas! But we will be back to try the thousand island burger... mmmmm

Fatburger has delicious burgers (my personal favorite is the mushroom Swiss, and my boyfriend loves a XXL), but what makes this location stand out are the people. I love the food, so I'll go to the ones in Texas Station and Red Rock, but when I have the choice, I will always go to Rancho!

I ordered the smallest turkey burger on the menu add bacon and a fried egg, heavenly. I  couldn't finish my order of onion rings and was totally full. 
The server was very friendly and explained the menu very thoroughly to first time customers. They give Smash Burgers a run for their money.
The only negative would be the slightly high price.

Whenever I want to drop some some money on fast food & go in I drive out of my way to this location!!! The food is always on point there are2 other locations I could go to but I always go here! Keep up the good work  fat-burger team on N Rancho

Great burger but service was not as good as it had been last visit. I had a double burger and a shake and although tasty and filling. The girl working was more interested in flirting with her co workers than helping me. Slapping her coworker and saying "you so silly boy" made me wonder where the manager was. Anyway I would still go back its not like I was at Wolfgang pucks you know and it was like 2am in Vegas....

Fatburger gets hyped up a lot, so I decided to try it out for myself.  Fatburger is located in a nice and classy looking strip mall.  The servers were very friendly and greets you with big smiles and enthusiasm.  I'm not a burger fan, but based on all the hype surrounding fatburger, I had high hopes.  Well, to put it bluntly, those hopes were not met.  The burger was tasteless.  There wasn't even any ketchup on the burger.  Nothing separates this burger from any other burger, in fact, it was quite bland.  At least the big mac has the big mac sauce, hero burger has the hero sauce, Wendy's has the baconator and Harvey's has a grilled taste.  Well, this burger offered nothing to keep it in my memory.  Even the accompaniments weren't memorable, I can't even say that the onions or tomato were super fresh, which, I can actually say for a burger I once had at Burger King!  Anyway, my review of fatburger may be harsh, but this review is based on a comparison of other burgers I've tasted.  I must say though, fatburger has awesome shakes and poutine!!!  This definitely saves them and I would go back for the shakes and poutine.  The three stars is an average score and is based on the amalgamated review of the great shakes and poutine and the non-memorable and overpriced burger.

This fed the kid but I am not a fan I don't eat meat and had no interest in a turkey one. I notice the burgers got smaller. The kid mostly ate the fries. This place gets crowed and the workers are very speedy.

It's impossible to end a night (or morning) in Vegas without stopping by Fatburger! 

You can order burgers with veggie, turkey, beef, size S to XXXL.  I've seen my friends devour the XXXL and it's doable, but not recommended.  I swear they almost had heart attacks from all that meat.  

Whatever you do, follow these tips:

1) Order your burger with an egg!  
2) Order the skinny fries
3) Order the chili
4) Dip the skinny fries in the chili
5) Watch the drunk, cracked out patrons make fools of themselves while they dance to the jukebox music or attempt to eat their food.  Best Las Vegas entertainment outside of Cirque du Soleil or the strip clubs.  Trust.

I like a good old fashion burger.  You can either use their website to submit your order or call ahead if you are short on time.  They actually make the WHOLE burger AFTER you order it.  THEY DON"T keep a a little bin full of precooked patties, steaming over boiling hot water all day to drop inside your burger like some other places.  I bounce between the Med & LG burgers and hold the relish.  Pickles & relish together is just too much for me.   But they always make the burger the way you want.  extra cheese is a little high (.69).   But if you've come this far sometimes you gotta go for the gold with a shake and onion rings and fries.   Make sure you bring a friend or a date to help finish everything.  And don't forget to tip.  They always yell "Fat Tip!"

So I love Fatburger every now and then. Decided to get some today. I tried to get one at the Fort Apache and Flamingo location but their computer was down and the AC was out. So I figured ok the Flamingo and Rainbow location is not too far. Well oddly enough their AC was out too. When I had mentioned that they had the same issue as the other store, I was told both locations are the same owner. So that tells me that the AC is not working on because the owner is trying to save money. Really????.

The Fries of all shapes and sizes here are on the money. I parked behind this place for like $5 or something; some sketch guy is like:
"give me five bucks, and you can leave it here all day!"
"Is it safe back here in this rando' parking lot?"
"Yeah, dude. Here, put this raffle ticket in your window. You'll be good all day."
I left about $4k worth of personal items in the truck, and then stumbled into this Fatburger on the strip. 

First time I've ever had it, and I could eat this every day if necessary. Not world-class food, or life changing by no means. But me and my fiancé split an original burger and fries, and it was enough to get us up and down the strip for the afternoon for around $8. I suggest splitting it, because it's a lot of food - hence, Fatburger. And honestly, you're in Vegas; if you don't understand that great food is easily found everywhere, you're missing a huge part of what makes that place even bearable. Honestly, eat the Fatburger for fuel, in order to get you to some true greatness down the street.

The place seemed clean, and honestly, we had lunch there for two days. I don't mind it, but on the cheap, it can be had quick. Try a shake too, if that's your thing, because they looked great. Avoid it a little after hours though, cause it can get gamey with the drunkards and sorted riff raff.

Decided to grab some grub before checking out a movie. There's a few selections here that fall into the fast food category. We chose fatburger because their line was the longest so we figured that was a good sign. ( ha guy logic)

After our order was taken we waited a bit to receive our meal. By a bit I'm talking 20 minutes. That's long for fast food standards but I must admit the presentation was worth the wait. A mountain of food was shoved in front of us...minus my chili cheese fries.

My only real complaint is the inflated prices. I know these places inside of casinos have to survive but man they jack the prices up something fierce.

Headline: They have 4 burger sizes. Mine, the "XL," was a half-pound wonder that pales in comparison to its bigger brothers--the XXL and XXXL. 

Tasty seared burgers with crisp edges. Extra-wide buns. Topped to your liking. 

WARNING: Don't go here thinking that you'll save some money on your Vegas dining budget by "just grabbing a burger" for dinner. A half-pound cheeseburger, fries, and soft drink totaled $19 BEFORE tip.

Look at my photos, my burger was so dry, overlooked and gross, one of the worst burgers I have ever had. 
The sweet potato and curly fries was good.

Most locations are fairly good. 
This one screwed up 2 out of 3 orders .
Food was slipped together without any care or attention. Customer service was pathetic. 
I like Fatburger , but I'll never come to this location again.

This location is inside the Red Rock Casino food court, near the movie theater. The staff was friendly and they made your burger to order. They cam pretty close on the beef.

You can get a very large burger with lots of toppings on it. My favorite is the fried egg, although my egg was bit undercooked which made it runny, resulting in quite a messy burger. I can't imagine trying to eat one of these burgers with chili on it as well. The seasoning on the burger was bit unusual but I really liked it. I think other locations of Fatburger do a better job. This one is just a food court version. 

A vegetarian "burger," a chicken sandwich and a turkey burger are also available if you want something a little lighter. The skinny fries are pretty tasty as well. Good eatin.

If you are staying at the hotel you cannot charge your food to your room which is a little annoying.

I have been here a few times now and just get blown away at the great service we seem to get every time.  The burgers are amazing and the fact that their grilled makes them perfect in my book.  The fries are great as well.  This place Is a restaurant I would recommend to anyone including kids.
Some good grease when your wacked!!!  Always good and late nite is the best time to chow!!!

I finally made it out to Fatburger after years of listening to Ice T - "it was a good day" and its reference (possible endorsement).  I took my 4 year old son with me.  I got a Fatburger, fries and diet coke (I wanted to cut some calories - ha ha ha!).  My son got a kids meal that came with a small burger, small fries and small drink.  The food was really tasty, but too filling.  The two of us rolled out of the place.  I am not a light weight either.  

It is decent fast food, a cut or two above McD's, BK, Arby's, etc.

No ambiance, but good eatin'

The food is greasy and has enough calories to last you for the day.

I fun place to eat with the real feel an LA fast food joint.

Don't miss.

It's a good burger. I decided I wanted the fried egg on it after I'd already ordered and it was too late to add it. They were nice about (charging me for and) making me an egg all by itself so I could put it on the burger myself.

Yes, I am eating that burger in my picture, whoa!

People seem to hate on Fatburger especially when in comparison to In-N-Out.  I love both !!  I know that Fatbuger is a bit more pricey, but I'm a fan.

February 2, 2011

Intended on playing Bingo.  I arrived late and ended up eating Fatburger and gambling.  

Ordered:
Skinny Fries (Well-Done)
Fat Burger (no onions and relish)

PROS:
* convenient location located inside casino near movie theaters
* clean eating area
* they got my order right!  
* Unsweetened Green Tea and Black Tea!
*Chili fries and you can add an egg to your burger!

CONS:
* Wouldn't accept my BOGO coupon. Cashier didn't know how to enter it.

TIPS:
* Skinny fries taste incredible Well Done and extra Crispy !

This place would have gotten a 4 star if my coupon was accepted.  The only reason he didn't accept it was because he didn't know how to enter into the system.  I figured call a manager and off I go, but I guess that didn't cross his mind.  It's all good.  I still have the coupon and will use it next time I go to a Fatburger.  This is your typical Fast Food burger joint.  Just a bit more pricey.  Super Good though. I recommend you try Fatburger if you haven't already done so.
Just average I would say, a bit pricey drinks are nothing special. The burger was big and portions sizes fine.

Good place to go to after a night of partying.  Fast, yummy and perfect to eat when you don't want to feel like shit the next morning.  It's just a good and cheap alternative to the other places that vegas has.
It is the place I go for burgers.  Fatburgers.  The shakes and fries simply tidy the meal up in my opinion.  :)

I gave a bad feed back because the dinning are and tables are always dirty. Salt and pepper shaker and discusting all covered with black gums till the new management took over. Guess what not a thing changed and didn't take long same disgusting place to eat. The cooking are you can see over the counter is dirty as it can get. You will run out of you see it. Just walk up to cooking area and see it through glass....Never again..!!! Move along to better and cleaner place to eat. In & out is your better choice and not too far.

Good, overpriced burger joint on Nellis and Vegas Valley. This is not a $ IMHO; it should be $$ since you are paying near $10/burger. It's not a good neighborhood so get your burger to go. Get you drinks at the McDonald's across the street since they're going for $1 these days...

My bottom line? If taste means that much and you cannot possibly go 1 extra  mile north up Nellis to get to an equally flavorful contender at In-N-Out, then knock yourself out spending that discretionary gas money on a Fatburger special. Otherwise, move on down the road in either direction (In-N-Out to the north, Original Tommy's to the south) and get a competitive burger with gas money in tact. The true rating for me on this is actually 2.4 stars for demerits re: location, price and not compensating for surrounding competition...
The food's great, I like it here. My only concern is that they're really really expensive.
Food is not bad but don't try to go into the restrooms and wash ur hands it's absolutely disgusting! Other than that everything thing else is average.

The food quality is decent and consistent.   The restaurant is always clean and the staff polite and quick.

I appreciate the choice of opting out of the garnishes and have never left the restaurant hungry.

But the I really miss the enthusiastic echoing of shouting out the orders of the other location and the first few months this location was open.

The staff are competent and quiet.  What attracted me to Fatburger originally was the enthusiasm of the staff for their food prep and customers.

This is my husband's favourite burger joint, so we go there a lot.  And he compares everywhere else to Fat Burger.

If Hubby was a Yelpin' fella, he'd give it a solid four stars.   And since we like to keep him happy, we go to Fatburger but make him expand his horizons by trying new Yelp-bits  a couple of times a month.

24 hour burgers on the strip.  This was my first Fatburger experience and I got to say that they have a good thing going.  I would put them above most fast food spots, but I don't think they top in n out.  I love the fact that you can get steak fries (the best choice), but the regular fries are better than average as well.  Generally you have to decide how much meat you want and that will determine the cost and size of your burger (they also have some other meat choices as well).  They have other toppings too, which actually makes their burgers somewhat customizable.  I seem to remember even getting asked what type of cheese I wanted?!?!? Bring on the cheese choice revolution.
I found the prices reasonable for LV strip, and the wait (at 1:00p on a weekday) was about 25 minutes.  Don't expect a seat though, as the dining area was pretty crowded the whole time I was there and it almost certainly is worse at night.
I didn't find the staff to be *fun* like other reviewers did, but they were certainly doing their job and that is all I really ask of anybody.
I imagine if you show up at night you need to be prepared for a totally different scene that is less focused on the food and more on finding something to soak up all that margarita by the yard or random neon colored alcohol beverage.  I may visit at night just to see what the spectacle looks (and also 24 hours, relatively quick is better than almost every other option out there)

Came here last night and I must say that i was really impressed.  I got  a large burger, and it didn't disappoint.  Good size and tasty.  They need to put one in San Jose instead of all that crappy in n out.

One of the best, down home, non-fancy burgers I've had in the U.S.!  The only one I can think of which beats FB's burger is The Shack Stack at Shake Shack (NYC).

But FB is a must stop place if you're akin to we folk who can look past the super grody conditions of the "dining" area and dig into this fatty, greasy, unhealthy, heart-stopping piece of perfection which is otherwise known as the Heaven-sent accompaniment to the twelve drinks you just slammed over the past two hours ;-)

This Fatburger is great. The staff has a heart of gold, a spine of steel. My date and I arrived 20 mins before close on a Thursday (today). There were 2 gentlemen closing and they were taking the order of a large, violent, belligerently drunk group of people.  The people were rude and disrespectful and started cussing at the employees simply because they were too inebriated to communicate. The employees handled it very calmly with complete professionalism, and made my date and I feel very welcome despite the fact that that big group of people started getting violent towards me and my date. The two employees handled themselves very well! They deserve a raise! Thank you BK and Your collegue for excellent service despite anything.
Very amazing service and excellent customer service!! I got along with all the workers right off the bat! Will come back here over any other place

When I want fast food in Las Vegas, that actually tastes good, I go to Fat Burger. DUH! 

Vege burger, fat fries and a milkshake.

This isn't the best Fat Burger I've been too, but its the only one I know of in this crazy dirty town. 

Its affordable and worth it.

Gets kinda busy, so better to take it back to your hotel room, or find a nice bench to either people watch or city light watch.

Such a great location on the strip, smack dab in the middle of the "Strip."
I bookmarked this to review, but honestly can't remember the experience too well, so it was 'A-OK'. I think the burger was good, and the fries, but I've had better!

The food is not good. The cleanliness and friendliness of the staff is also very not good. On top of it all, it is very expensive. Two burgers and two fries were almost $30. Will NOT be back and don't recommend unless staff isn't so rude and food is served with quality ingredients!
Relieved the food wasn't as bad as our service. Repeated the order twice and twice they confirmed and they still got the order wrong with everything that was ordered.

Fuller stocked bar! Oh, and there is a groupon available for this location!! Yeah, this is our first stop in Vegas EVERY TIME! This Fat Burger has yummy food and a gorgeous outside seating area, plus the staff is super friendly and welcoming. As long as there is a groupon, you'll see us there!

We were in Las Vegas last week and went to Fatburger 2 separate times.  On the 1st visit we had a burger and fries. While both were good, they really were nothing special. If anything the meat was slightly on the dry side.
On our last morning is Vegas we went for breakfast. I had eggs potatoes and toast.  The eggs were very much undercooked, barely enough to not turn them back in.
Potatoes were very good.
Great food, service and classic music. I come here ask the time when visiting my mom!

The service by the blonde guy is amazing as he is always so nice and always remember what I order.  As for the burgers they suck.!!! They have changed something in the last couple months with the meat and buns.  Not fresh!!!  As for the owner!!!  Also, I am not a fan of the owner.  He stands over his workers and micro manages them which I can't stand.  I know longer go there as a guy like that doesn't deserve to manage people.

I love this place. You know why???  Because I love burgers.  You know why else???  Because you can throw in a fried egg in your burger.  People often think it's weird, but you can't knock it till you try it.  So try it.

The menu here is very simple with 6 burgers to choose from.  You got the 1/2 pound Kingburger to the Veggie Burger and 4 other options in between.  After choosing the burger of choice, you have your add-ons.  This includes bacon, an egg, chili, and cheese.  I like to add-on bacon, egg, and cheese.  I leave the chili for a different style of burger, where I'd add on chili and cheese.  As for the sides, I prefer skinny fries as opposed to fat fries (more crunchy and less starchy).  For the shakes, they have 3.  The basic chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry.  Choose whatever you feel like for that day... that's pretty much what I do.  Same goes for the soda.  

But yeah, focus on the burger and enjoy.

Food?  Top notch. Service? A lot to be desired.  I came here around 8pm on a Tuesday night and there was nary a soul to be found except for the two guys working behind the counter.  Like really, not a single customer in the entire restaurant.  
The guy taking our order seemed like we were putting him out and acted annoyed that egads!  actual customers had walked into the restaurant and shocking! wanted to eat.  He was so incredibly non-friendly that it was uncomfortable.  My husband (bless his heart *eyeroll*) has a knack for taking a long time to order.  This guy was not having it.  As my husband was checking out the menu, this dude had the nerve to ask not once, but twice, "Are you ready?"  I mean - I could understand if they were busy and other people were waiting but like I said, we were the ONLY customers there.  Obviously if we're still looking over the menu, we aint ready, Poindexter.
If you can overlook Mr. Personality behind the counter and just come for the food, you're in luck.  The cheeseburgers are classically good.  Quality meat cooked perfectly, tasty cheese, fresh buns and ALL the condiments you might want.  (In fact, while we're on the condiments, if you're not a pickle lover, beware that they put pickles AND relish on their burgers so it might be overkill).  The steak fries might be my favorite part of Fatburger.  They're fat and golden and hot and perfect.  The onion rings are my second favorite thing.  The breading is just the right amount and so you get a good onion flavor plus they're not overly greasy.  
The place was clean (as it should be with no customers in sight) and other than the less than enthusiastic employees there (I mean - I yelled "Thank you!" to them as we were walking out and didn't hear a peep back.  WTH?), Fatburger is on my radar for good.  It's one of the last real hamburger joints.

Let me start out by saying, DANNNNGGGG.  Woohoo! As good as it gets says it all.  I consider myself a foodie.  Professional buffet basher if you will.  This place blew me away.  If you have ever been to steak n shake its like that but 10 times better.  They are huge juicy burgers with a crispyness on the outside cause they smash em.  Its hard to say without a doubt best burger ever with the amount of burgers Ive eatn, but when someone asks me it will always be mentioned.  Atmosphere is cool, fries are great, I even thought the pop was extra tasteful.  They serve booze but I dont like drinkn when Im eatn for those who do that.  Every time I go to vegas I will most definatly be going there atleast once

Fatburger is the best.  I'm sorry.  I would choose Fatburger over In 'n' Out any day.  I've read your reviews.  And yeah, it's expensive.  But this is Vegas, nothing comes cheap in Sin City.  If they had an In 'n' Out here, it would be pricier.  Either way, the burgers here are simply gorge-yourself-delicious.  Yes, you can kill yourself with the Fatburger with a fried egg on it.  And bacon!  But that's the beauty, yeah!  Order that with the chili cheese steak fries!

Look, the place is called FATburger.  You're not coming here for  your health.  You're coming here for the Fat.  And on he side, you get a mean ass burger.

Can't say too much about the burgers... a bit over priced, I've def. had better burgers. The grease was, literally, dripping from the burger. The fries were tasteless, the buns were a bit stale. I'd rather go across the street to In-n-Out, drive 7 miles to Joe's Farm Grill or even better, drive to Four Peaks Brewery in Tempe.

UGHHHHHHHH!  Why did I come here when I could have gone to in-n-out?  NEVER AGAIN!

We ordered 6 burgers and everybody added extra things such as eggs, cheese, bacon etc (all for 99 cents each!) on their burger.  We waited for what seem like ages.  Walked our drunk butts back to the hotel ready to get our grub on...

Guess what?  We all didn't have any of the extras included in our burgers.  Not only that meat was dry with no sort of flavor at all.  Even though I was starving I only managed a couple bites before giving up.  What a waste!! The price of my burger was $4.99, for that much I could have gotten a #2 animal style at in-n-out.

Definitely a delicious stop on the way back to our hotel from gambling at MGM. Nice greasy burger and onion rings. Perfect when you're drunk. Stop here if you're in the area. It's nice that they have cooling sprinkler things too
Burgers are delicious but the waitresses are horrible! They put on sun glasses and so jerk !!!

Compared to other burgers this place falls way short, sadly i was disappointed! It's just a greasy pile of mess. If you want a burger that has great flavor and the toppings feel fresh then try on the other choices on Mill. The fries had very little seasoning and were just not appetizing compared to other joints. Honestly i wanted to give the place 1 star but felt that was too low and i like to reserve those for places with really bad food and really bad service. The service was good here they greeted you as you walked in and left.

Very small burger joint, but ample parking and great customer service. I had a groupon and ordered a chicken burger with fries and lemonade, and my boyfriend ordered a regular burger in a lettuce wrap with fries and lemonade as well. While it wasn't the most delicious food I've ever had, the portions were generous for the price (especially with a groupon too) and the employees were friendly.
I'd love to give them a great review but their website said they're open until 1:30 a.m. I went at 1:15 a.m. & they were closed. They probably should update their website.
Great burgers! I absolutely loved 'em....I would say the best burger in town....totally recommended

Nice lady working there waiting for a person arrival that needs to start her shift so she can leave had a swell chat. Now lets taste this late night second dinner it was great the bun and the beef were cooked to perfection for the quality of a late night dinner would come back
It was an ok burger. The restaurant was not very clean.  Went there with 3 other people and they got 2 of our orders wrong. I'm giving it 3 stars because it was ok food and they got my order correct

After a wild drink filled night at MGM we decided to ditch the super high bs inside the hotel and hit the strip in search of some low cost, tasty grub. We stumbled into fat burgers around 330 in the morning wobbling from painful stilettos and laughing signing BIGs famous fat burger line " If I wanna sport her take her to fat burger" While there I order the turkey burger melt with cheddar cheese w/ fat fries, mixed my drink with lemonade & fruit punch!!! Complete BURGER BLISS... End of story
This is the best place for burgers and chicken sandwich. Chili cheese fries were good also nice and crispy. Service was great they were nice and full of energy. Will be back.

I'm a former employee here, I quit to work at the District Attorney's office so there's no hurt feelings & my review is as honest as it gets. It's disgusting especially if Marisol makes your burger. She under cooks it the patty & never wears gloves. She touches everything with her bare hands & she never washes her hands. She will blow her nose & put the toppings on your burger directly after with her bare hands. Her customer service skills are non existent. She has A LOT of complaints with corporate, complaints with the owner (Peter), & to the main shift leader Ashley. Why does she still works there is beyond me. She has made many customers loose their appetite & walk out. She also take chunks of meat off of your burger & will eat it, & I mean shove the whole thing in her mouth & chew with her mouth open & stuff just falls out of it. She has worked there for 13-14 years & still is horrible at what she does. She is constantly touching her hair, boobs, face, nose & mouth. The burger might look & taste fine but trust me. It's gross. Jose & Raul are great. They will make your burger like they are making it for themselves. & their customer service skills are phenomenal. They clean as much as they possibly can between taking orders, cooking orders, & bringing customers their food. Ashley the shift manager is the best, she trained me & taught me everything I needed to know. She's great with customers, cleaning, & cooking. Everything is pretty sanitary except for the cockroaches that make it in because Peter is cheap & doesn't want to pay to get the premises sprayed. So basically, if Marisol isn't there you're in the clear. If she is?? I'd recommend coming at a different time.
