Completely overpriced and so disappointing!!

I tried their veggie burger for the first and last time yesterday. I would definitely not go here again. I paid $8.50 (with tax)  just for the veggie burger alone. Pretty astronomical price for a fast food joint, especially considering other better tasting veggie burgers (e.g. Hero Burger) are $2 less. The bun was fresh but doughy and the biggest part of the burger. The patty was salty and extremely thin (think of an iPhone and then halve it). The toppings very ho-hum (your basic lettuce, tomato, onion, mayo, pickles, relish, ketchup and mustard). Really disappointed that for this price that they don't offer anything beyond these very standard toppings.    

I  didn't like the fact that they don't put the toppings on in front of you so that you can personalize it (e.g. more/less of some toppings).  When you order, there is a list of about 7 very standard toppings on a  card beside the cash and you let them know  if you want all or some of the toppings. Then you can't see as they're making it and they hand the finished product to you. My burger had way too much lettuce (a huge thick piece) and almost no ketchup or mustard. 

Without a doubt one of the worst and most overpriced veggie burgers I've ever had. They seem to have spent all their money on making the place look flashy rather than the food. No surprise that I was initially the only one in there. Save your money and head to Hero Burger.

Should be one and a half stars . Very dry burger not so good and our skinny frys were stale tasted old. People who work here can't understand English.asked if it was process cheese or cheddar she couldn't understand then the lady who brought our food we asked for some type of sauce any sauce or burger was so dry she brought us salt asked her again never seen her again. We won't be back in an out is 100 times better and a quarter of the price. I will say it was clean

The last time I went to this Fat Burger was not a favorable experience. I decided to give them another shot which was a HUGE mistake. First the place smelled really bad when I went inside... I should have walked out then!! Never did get my order as I waited 10 minutes which is normally not a big deal. However, when I went to inquiry the person at the register was incredibly rude and said they did not know when my order would be ready. At that point I walked out.. would rather lose out on my $14 than put up with that behavior.
Oh did I mention it was a little after 1:00 pm and there was one other couple in the entire dining area. I think that says something. Never again!!!

Place seems new and chique...  But burgers were dry and tasteless.  Nothing special.

Interesting toppings and the service is good, but I just don't see the difference between this place and other burger places....   Perhaps my burger was overdone.

Blah!!! For $12 for a cheese burger, fries and drink I better get some yum! Especially when the buffet was $14.99. First and last visit to fat burger. No bueno! Go to panda express next door or the GVR cafe for a better value.
Great service. There was a big party ahead of us during a slow time. They worked extra quick to get it out and offered an apology. The food was great, as always.

Here's my disclaimer: I won an Instagram contest that paid for the majority of my food. I paid for upgrades to my prize; upgrades that cost me just over $12. 

Between the three of us, we split an original fatburger (1/3 lb burger), a mushroom swiss burger, a lumberjack poutine with gravy, cheese curds, maple bacon, and grilled onions, a New Yorker poutine with gravy, cheese curds, and pastrami (I think that's about it, although I may be wrong), and two Canada Dry's. While I was not completely full at the end of my meal, the food was sitting fairly heavily in my stomach, so I didn't actually need more food.

What I greatly appreciate is that on any of their burgers, I can add grilled onions AND onion rings (like the breaded ones) on for free! I can't think of any other burger places that do that. I also really liked that the special sauce actually had a kick. I can't even begin to count how many places say they have a spicy sauce that isn't spicy. The mushroom Swiss burger had a fairly good amount of mushrooms on it, so they have that going for them, and both the burgers were quite juicy. Given that they use fresh, never frozen Alberta Angus beef, I'd say that makes sense. Quality-wise, they're pretty good burgers. Here's the thing though. They're tall burgers, but they're really not that big. I wish they were a little bigger circumference-wise and a little less tall. They'd be a lot easier to eat.

On to the poutines. They have these trays they put their burgers and fries on. With a name like Fatburger and with the prices on those poutines, I was expecting a much larger portion of poutine. I have no idea whether this is because my meal was served like a combo and so the poutines were smaller, or whether the poutines are always this small. I'd say there were perhaps a little more fries in the poutine than a typical McDonald's small fries. Lots of gravy and loads of cheese curds though. Super generous with the curds. I prefered the New Yorker cuz pastrami. The pieces of meat could have been cut smaller though. That way, I can have a piece with each bite, instead of eating all the meat off the top before I can reach my fries. Curds weren't squeaky, which I liked, and they were melty enough to give me lots of stringy cheese action. The lumberjack could have done with a little more maple emphasis. Both poutines were on the salty side, especially at the end. Still, POUTINE!

Service was very impressive, especially as this is a fast-food kinda deal. They gave us a number after we ordered at the counter, and delivered our food to us. We were sitting in their table area at the back of the restaurant. It was wonderfully private. The only other table who had been there left soon after we began taking pictures. Before we had finished taking pictures, someone was already there to check and see how we were doing. When we were a few bites in, someone else came and asked if we wanted free drink refills. When we were about to leave, someone was there to help us dispose of our garbage, when we were fully prepared to do so ourselves. Great stuff and thank you!

All in all, because I didn't have to pay for most of my meal, it was quite nice. However, I'm giving this a three-star rating because if I had paid the full price for my meal, I'd be disappointed in what I got in terms of food:value ratio.

This place was okay. Never been to a Fatburger before, but we were looking for a quick, cheap dinner our first night in Vegas and this was right by the hotel.  Food is basic, simple (burgers, fries, milkshakes or cocktails) and did the trick. Service was okay. Waitresses in skimpy outfits that looked kinda bored (can't blame them, 7:30pm on a Thursday) but they were at least friendly. Seating outside was the highlight; people watching was the best--right on the strip!

I have nothing but really good things to say about this establishment. 

Walked in today after leaving Trader Joe's. Ordered me and my cousin the small meal deal with a Cheeseburger with everything including a fried egg and I got skinny fries while my cuzzo got the fat ones. 

Everything was cooked up fresh and fast and came to our table pronto, piping hot! 

I grew up in L.A. frequenting the Original Fatburgers. I remember the late night street races from Midnight til O'dark thirty in the morning. This place brought back some really nice memories. 

Thumbs Up! 

Only the best get a second visit so I will definitely be back!

This damn place is overpriced for the greasy ass ....hard ass burger they give. I ordered a large burger with bacon and cheese. I had to pay a dollar extra for bacon and a dollar extra for cheese. That brought the burger to 13 dollars. I told them to hold the relish and mustard. They put a whole lot of other stuff on that issh. Relish, onions , tomatoes, lettuce, mayo, pickles etc. When I bit into the burger all the "stuff" rolled in out. The burger was very crunchy shuck I'm not really a fan of crunch burgers. Overall the burger was flavorful but overpriced. Soda 3.19, all that damn money I didn't get fries. Can't wait to get my ass home to go to Wendy's and get a delicious 4for $4

My friend and I had practically zero sleep and decided to grab breakfast. Since I was visiting the area, I got to choose, and I chose Fatburger. This place is SO ghetto, which is funny as all hell since it's next door to the MGM Grand. In classic Vegas style, this location has a nifty neon sign, and is open 24 hours.

When we walked in, I couldn't help but snap shots of the interior. A gaggle of transvestites were carrying on and one noticed me, thinking I was trying to photograph them. I assured her/him I was really taking photos of the establishment.

I shared a turkey burger ($5) with my friend which wasn't bad, to start. I took a bite, chewed thoughtfully, took a few notes, then proceeded to douse mine in Tabasco. It's no In-N-Out, but it'll feed you. (I heard that I should get one of their specials, and top it off with a fried egg... next time!)

Never again would I dine at this location.  Employee that waited on us was so hyper, he could not focus.  Gave us the completely incorrect change, no doubt his drawer will be short.  Food took too long, 1 burger had so much salt, it was hard to eat!  Order of onion rings arrived 10 minutes after food, and were under cooked.  Noticed several exchanges of items (drugs?) from employee and a questionable customer. Customer even went behind counter to leave something.  This place was just weird and creepy.  Wrong condiments on burgers. Steer clear of this location, owner should be more aware of what is happening!

Nom nom nom!  I really enjoyed my first Fatburger experience over the weekend - I'll be back for more!  For dine-in, the service is fast and not overly hectic with screaming kids a la McDonald's.

I highly recommend the Turkey Burger - with cranberry sauce, it's like Thanksgiving without needing a long nap afterwards!

Went to eat there Thursday night and had a miss communication about our bill. We ate 5 burgers and were charged for ten. They claimed one of us went up to the bar and ordered 5 more burgers and fries (it was actually another table who went to the bar and threw 5 more burgers on our tab) I've worked in the restaurant business my entire life and have never seen anyone pay twice the amount that they ate. I would have never payed this bill obviously but the security and bartenders bullied me into paying the entire 166 dollar bill. They threatened me to the point I had to pay the bill or I was gonna get beaten up. I feared for my own well being which is insane to me because all we wanted to do was get some food before bed. These are all facts I would never advise ANYONE to eat at this establishment

Well I guess I should have read all the reviews before choosing this place. Took forever for the cashier to take my order and even after repeating it several times the order was still not correct. When I went to get it corrected the new person behind the register assured me it would be corrected. When I picked it up it was wrong.  When I asked for it to be corrected they argued with me.... I don't care how good the hamburgers are the service absolutely sucks!

Took a while for the server to get to us.  Seemed a little unorganized.  The medium burger 1/3 lb is quite small. Go the next size up 1/2 pound.  Burger was good I had to try since ice cube rapped about it in 1994. I think in and out is a lot better but it is definitely worth trying so you can say 3am and just got to fat burger. . Good burger.

I love groupons and deal vouchers. It's a great way of trying a place out and not feeling bad about having wasted your money if you don't like the food. Using a groupon I got two cheddar fatburgers and two small fries for $13. You get to pick from your choice of lettuce, tomato, mustard, relish, onion, pickles, and mayo for your toppings.
As chains go, this is one of the better ones for hamburgers. At first glance it was hard to tell there was a burger in there because of the way the burger is served. They make sort of an open envelope around the burger so that you can just pick it up and eat. The burger is nice and juicy and the bun was fresh. I also enjoyed the fries. They are some of the best fries among the fast food chains. The fries were crisp on the outside. There is no salt added but there is seasoning and hot sauces at the table. They have bottles of Frank's Hot sauce and Chipotle Tabasco Sauce
The service the night before was incredible, very friendly and fast, this morning the supervisor on duty was rude and disrespectful never going to this location again.

Way over rated. The beef was salty. The chili cheese fries are 90% fries 5% cheese & 5% chili.  I think for what these cost the chili should be more generous portions. 
Won't go back. Been to another location in Buena Park & it was a bit better.

Very very very slow. Did I mention it was slow?

No one in line and it took about 15 minutes to get a burger that was so so.

Good burgers and good chili fries, albeit everything at Fatburger is quite on the expensive side for fast food.

This Fatburger is located in the food court area inside of Wild Horse Pass Hotel & Casino, so it's convenient if you're staying in the hotel and need to satisfy a late night burger craving.

Service was okay but the employees could have been friendlier.

Not busy at all but still took forever to take our order. Dirty but instead of cleaning they were painting the floors right under the customers feet. Also the water fountain doesn't work. All around bad experience and that's coming from someone who loved Fat Burger.

Not my first visit but perhaps my memories fail me!  Not impressed but not terrible either.  They are no match for Lobby's and Giant Hamburger, but I'd give them 3rd place.  Had a crispy chicken sandwich, pretty tasty, a medium burger with cheese and bacon, curly fries, OK and great onion rings.  I requested no mustard on my burger but it was there anyway.  The fixins tended to overpower the burger.  I doubt I'll return with those other two places available.

I live close by, but don't dine here nearly as often as I would like.

What I truly love about this place, is their fantastic French Fries, because they are the huge STEAK FRIES that you never find in conventional "fast food" establishments.  That sets them apart from others in the restaurant industry, for sure.

Whenever I have a craving for terrific thick and juicy fries, this is where I go, to load up on several orders.

The employees are friendly, and make you feel very welcome!

This was a fun outing our first night out in Vegas.  Great prices on beers and burgers.  A great place for a fun night with friends.  Service was friendly and the ambiance is fun and relaxed.  Highly recommended for an informal night out!

Burgers taste good but not great. For a $10 burger it definitely does not compare to other expensive burger places out there. I used the groupon deal though so that brought the price to a reasonable amount. I dont know how much fountain drinks were but I remember I ordered 2 with my order and it added on $7-8, I never really thought about it till after I paid. 
One thing I did like about this place is that they bring your order to your table.

This is a fast food burger joint.  Not as fast as McDonald's.  On the other hand, they are so much better it's not even a contest.  For what it is, this place is probably the best I've had.  This is NOT the Cordon Bleu, and I'm writing this opinion with that in mind!

Their burgers are prepared fresh (no heat lamps!), and they taste fresh.  Even if you get a McD burger hot off the griddle it tastes like something that wouldn't spoil if you let it sit out for a year.  Fatburger's burgers are hot, tasty, and seem very fresh.  Made with real ground beef (it even crumbles a bit as ground beef is prone to doing...don't ever remember McD's doing that).

The curly fries are really nice.  A light crunch, very tasty.  Also fresh and hot.  And the shakes are pretty good too.  Not the best shakes, but pretty good.

The ambiance is supposed to be sort of 50's diner.  Complete with a juke box (that looks like it's from the 70s...ooops).  As they were established in 1952, according to their signs, I guess they are trying to stay in touch with that...at least a little.

If I have a craving for a burger and fries, this would be my first or second choice of places to go.  A tad pricey, perhaps, but you can order various size burgers from 5 oz up to 24oz.  Did I mention they're really tasty?

It took 10 minutes for me to receive the food through the drive through. The cost was $15 for a combo, which is a bit pricey in my opinion. Honestly, all the locations are costly and a bit of a wait but the Flamingo location is always slow!

I tried the 1/3 or 1/4 lb Fatburger and I must say that I was impressed! The burger was fresh and tasty! I've never had relish on a burger so I was ready to dig in, the relish complemented the sandwich perfectly! I would recommend for people to give this joint a try if you are in the Las Vegas area!

Went here yesterday to meet up with friends at the food court. I had limited options for food since I'm allergic to Wheat, Corn, Soy, Sesame seeds... & much more.  

Literally my only option, what a miserable cashier.  She gave me attitude when I asked for protein style. There was a language problem, so I couldn't ask her portions sizes because she wouldn't understand me anyhow. The other cashier standing next to her overheard my order & told her what to do in Spanish. It's "fast" food I guess I expected too much. Burger was a small but it was shaped like a Pacman "C". It was black on the bottom.


$5 for a burger wasn't even worth it . I mean I ordered a small just to get an idea of the size of their small patty but still would be nice if it resembled a burger! 


Next time I'll go up a size. Great FIRST experience & service (sarcasm). Maybe I'll give this place a try in a few years again. Probably not!

Went thru drive-thru, had to wait over 2 minutes before someone came to take my order. Had to wait 10 minutes for my order. The place is all falling apart...windows dirty, security camera hanging from the wall, signage broken, and many other items. This place is a POS!!! Do not go here!

I wanted to eat a burger here since there isn't one where I live. Kinda pricey $17 for a burger drink and fries. The food was alright. I've tasted a better burger, fries including a drink at a little food stand in the downtown area where I work, for only $6

I can't vouch for their tagline of "The Last Great Hamburger Stand," though I like to visit several restaurants in a franchise before making an overall judgment. This particular Fatburger did not make a great first impression on me. I did enjoy the casual atmosphere and the outdoor dining, albeit really loud. At places like these, I like to order my burger with basic toppings like lettuce and tomato and no sauces or cheese so I can see how the burger itself tastes. Mine was overcooked, the edges fell off from being poorly made, and it was too salty. If you're here with a larger group, remember what you ordered. When the food comes out, the server will have all the burgers on one tray and all the sides on another, as opposed to serving each person what they ordered individually. Sodas at $3.50 and bottled water at $4 was a bit pricey. 

There's a much longer line for a burger at Shake Shack across the street, and maybe that's a tell.

I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews.  My experience was a good one.  The food was good and the staff was friendly.  The onion rings were cooked to perfection.  Yes, the burgers are a little pricy, but it's entirely your choice on whether you're willing to pay them.  I live down the street and will be returning.

Fatburger is definitely not the first place that comes to mind when I want to run and grab a quick burger. I have had the selections of burgers in the past and it's always just left me with that "meh" experience. I do though think that the chili cheese fries that they make here are beyond delicious! I thought I would treat myself this past weekend to this 1 million calorie side item since I've been doing so good on eating healthy. This location was in the area I was in so I thought why not drive on thru...or wait there is no drive thru? Awkward. I hate getting out of my car sometimes but I thought why not create a calorie deficit and walk from the parking lot to the door.. Kidding. I walked in and a god awful smell of maybe like an old mop and dirty water/the sewer system failed smell. Yikes. At this point I questioned whether or not I should even proceed with my order. I looked around and everything appeared clean so whatever ordered them good ole chili cheese fries with the steak fries as the fry choice. Total wait time was approximately 10 minutes which was fine because after all I did request that everything be made fresh! At this time it appeared only 2 employees were working, 1 who was full time just in the kitchen on the grill and the other who took orders and helped also in the kitchen. Everything overall was okay and my fries were BOMB I just need that smell, whatever it was to not like ever happen again! Thanks :-)

I'm so surprised at how low the rating is for this location. I've always had great experiences here and the staff is very friendly! The restaurant is clean and the atmosphere is fun. I admit the burgers are pretty pricey (my husband and I can easily spend $25 for both of our meals), but the food is delicious!

During Christmas break I tried Fatburger for the first time.  It was simply amazing.  The burger was moist and one of the best I have ever consumed.  I was kind of reluctant about eating in a food court at 10:00 p.m. But was not disappointed.  I had the original with fries.  Next time I'm in Vegas I will return.  Much better than a Shake Shack, In and Out and Five Guys.

Horrible customer service. I went to the counter and waited 5 mins. The cook or cashier saw me standing there and never acknowledge me. He could have said "I'll be right with you" but said nothing.  I continued to stand there and was never helped. I just left. Seriously needs better staff. Unacceptable

My friend recommended this burger place for a late night dinner option so we decided to go so I can try it out. Fat Burger is an LA based burger chain with a location in Thornhill that specializes in tasty big burgers. At the restaurant, I ordered the original fat burger combo with fries and drinks. The food didn't too long to get. There is limited seating at the restaurant so we dined in. First bite into the burger and I fell in love with the burger. It was juicy, meat was good and the toppings were great especially when there's bacon too! Fries were good. Overall, a pretty decent burger joint to go to in Thornhill. The price point is higher than other burger joints but you are paying for the quality of the burger! Definitely check it out!!

Skip, the bun, order by the patty only for a better deal.  

Your other options are over priced and not great (sushi) or lame suburban chains (Yard House).  I opted for a lot of these burgers instead.

My last experience at a fat burger was very vague, so to say less I wasn't really on the first train Smokin' to get here. Bowling with friends and drinking like a sailor led me to do it! It had to be close to midnight and I was shocked to see the sign still lit at the end of the dark food court. We sat at the bar and read the menu to the best of our abilities! 

Deceived by my beer goggles I felt the xxl would provide me just enough beef to feel like it wasn't quite a fast food burger.. to the burger I added bacon, cheese, and yess an egg! I also opted for a side of chili cheese fat fries and a Maui banana shake! 

To the facts. The burger was divine, well seasoned, and cooked fresh before our eyes! Oh yea that mofo was Humongous! The fries were huge and loaded with so much cheese and chili, they even provided me with Tabasco sauce to top them! Last and least favorite was the Maui banana shake. It was cool but I wanted more real bananas and I think I seen him use a concentrate which was not bueno!
This place is good.  My friends and I went there a lot during our trip to Vegas.  They're 24 hours and taste a lot better than In N Out.  I wish they had a Fatburger near me. =(

Let me start by saying ive been to other fatburger locations that had great food and service. That being said, We were really disappointed about the food and the service, we went through drive-thru and ordered for three people. We ordered three burgers two with cheese one without. we all so ordered onion rings skinny fries and drinks. got home and realized we were missing one of the burgers, we drove 4 miles back to the location to be told by the workers that they didnt hear the third burger and so it was our fault. That if we wanted to replace it we needed to pay for it, even though we had repeated the order three or four time when we were first there.I returned inside to try to talk to them and both employees acted as if i wasnt there even tho eye contact was made. We then went back through the drive thru so we could talk to them since going inside went no ware. Once they realized it was us they insisted we come inside if we were to be helped, even tho we were behind 3 cars. After we finally got inside they handed us the burger and then apologized for the misunderstanding,  We drove home nearly half hour after the rest of the burgers had been made, just to find out that the other two burgers had been made wrong, and the rest of the food was cold. Most places would have offered to replace the order to start with. I most definitely will not be returning based mostly on the service not the product of the food.

Let me start out by saying that I Freaking Love Fat Burger! seriously they make my favorite burger in Las Vegas I used to come here at least 4-5 times a month. I get a large with cheddar cheese and bacon. there sweet potato fries are great as well and who can complain about Haagen-Dazs ice cream milk shake? not me.
I am just sad that the last few times i have come in I have had to eat outside because the whole inside smells like a bad sewer. Im not just talking about, oh someone made a big stinky a while ago i mean my burger might have some sort of a poop smell. It was so bad the other day that I had to leave before I even ordered. I really hope they can fix this problem being that I love this place and it is the closest to my house. maybe a suggestion would be to have someone put some soap and water down some of the drain hatches weekly. That works at my business building. just a thought.. until then I will have to go to another location.

A great place to grab a good burger and fries at 2 in the morning. One time my husband picked out some songs to play on the jukebox but he didn't  put the right numbers in.  So Michael Bolton was blasted through the restauraunt at 2 am.  I don't understand why anyone would have Michael Bolton in the jukebox anyway????

Unlike in places like Southern California where Fatburger has abandoned the crowded high-end fast food market and opted for urban stores in working class neighborhood serving primarily the minority communities, the Toronto version is aiming for the hip and trendy crowd that pays up to $20 for a "combo" and expects top of the line service and product. 

That's exactly where Fatburger fails however for that it delivers neither with a service protocol that is mundane at best (does anybody ever smile in here?) and food that is better than McDonald's but far from the quality available greatly elsewhere in Toronto. 

Points for cleanliness and pleasant decor, not much for everything else.

We stopped in here today for lunch. Definitely not the best dining experience we've ever had.

First of all the young girl taking our order seemed very bored with her job. No enthusiasm at all.

We both ordered a burger and fries with a drink. I assumed they'd give us our drink cups at the counter. When they didn't I assumed our drink cups would be brought to us at the table. They weren't. We went back up to the counter to get our cups.

There was some smell emanating from the restroom that smelled like spoiled air freshener if there is such a thing. My girlfriend said it was almost overpowering in the restroom. It was a really sickly sweet smell. I'm not sure what it was but it didn't make the burgers taste any better.

Here it is several hours later and I'm a little bit queasy. Not sure if it was the burger, but I haven't eaten anything else today. 

If it comes back up I'll change my review to a 1 for now I'll stick with my 2 star review.

It's average. Acceptable. Passable. Not great. Not terrible. It's just there.

The big draw is the size of the burgers, hence the name. You can get something as small as 2.5 oz. to as big as 16-24 oz. (2 or 3 of their eight ounce patties) If you have a big appetite and money to spare you won't leave here hungry. The meat itself tasted bland, though, and lacked flavor. I wanted to like it, but there was just something missing.

Even the fries were OK at best. There is something cool about them, though - you can get them in three different styles - skinny (shoestring), fat (almost steak-fry like) and in a sweet potato variety. So there's something for everyone here.

A word of warning - at this Las Vegas strip establishment, the prices are jacked up compared to regular Fatburger restaurants. It's the price you pay for eating near the action.

First off, I didn't love the food here.. but.... 

We were visited at 3 am and when we walked in they started blaring Biggie Smalls so loud. Everyone in line started dancing and singing. Even the fry cook was raising the roof. My friend was dancing like crazy. For the whole time we were there they only played Biggie and Tupac. So awesome/strange. 

Also at Fat Burger, some guy who said he was from the south side of Chicago gave me his CD. He said his friend was from WI and I said I was too. When he asked where I told him and he shouted out to 920, our area code up there.

The whole end of that night was super bizarro. There is video that exists somewhere and I must find it!

It's The Strip. Everything is served with alcohol, overpriced, and over-the-top. Can't say that this place is an exception to this unwritten rule.

First off, it's a Fatburger with a bar -- an outdoor bar. I would have never guessed you could get fat AND drunk here.

Secondly, the burgers here are massive and come in four sizes: L, XL, XXL, and XXXL. I had the XXL, which was $11 without a drink and fries -- if you want a small combo, you'll have to pay an additional $6 for that. I guess rent here is that ridiculous. They even have a food challenge here. I can't remember the deets, but the XXL was large enough for me. I couldn't take on the XXXXL (or whatever it was) Challenge.

The meat was nice and juicy and flavorful, something we don't see much in Ohio with burger chains. As I suggested earlier, everything is MASSIVE. One burger and a cup for tap water should be enough, but if you insist on the fries keep in mind that your wallet is going to feel much lighter after you eat. With many burgers this size, I think to myself "do I have to finish this?", but not here.

While I have a beef to pick with the prices here, I will be coming back my next trip to Vegas.
Came here for those awesome fries and a coke zero. They have ranch and mustard for dippin on request

I came here for a quick afternoon bite during my Vegas rendezvous this past weekend. A Fatburger with an outside bar???!!! I was hooked immediately! The ambience there was quite loud, considering there was a football game on. The TV's that they had outside made the place look like a very chill atmosphere. I grabbed a grilled chicken burger with skinny fries and I must say, it did not disappoint. I'm from L.A. and I try to eat here as much as I can! Yeah, it was more than I usually pay for that meal($11.85 to be exact!!) but hey, im not complaining. Its Vegas folks! Expect to spend a little while here. I will definitely come back next time I hit up the Strip.

It may sound odd to you...but Rex has had many disappointments in life. Losing ones I loved. Being rejected by Starr Jones. Falling in love with a woman with no vagina. Being forced to give up my Faberge egg collection. Having 3 livers give out on me.  Losing my Elite status on Yelp. These were traumatic. Some I have never recovered from...but I am strong. I am fierce. I am not one who needs to live in the past...I move forward. Onward and mostly downward...damn law against buying organs. Oh well.

I have had another bitter disappointment.  Fatburger. I want to say that my love of burgers is almost as strong as my love for the three things that mean the most to me...Emma Stone's panties I bought on Ebay, my Real Doll (minus head), and the picture of me mugging James Lipton in Central Park. So when I heard the Beastie Boys sing about Fatburger, when I heard my friends talk about FatBurger I got excited. As excited as when my Mongolian nursemaid used to change me when I was a freshman in high school.  

Well, this is not a story of long lost love. This is not a story of a guilty pleasure. This is the story of tears, screaming, two ambulances and 11 cop cars.

I will first start by saying that Rex does well in life. He wants for very little. So after I got done my panhandling shift on The Strip I decided to take my limousine...some call it a bus...to a Fatburger far away from that god forsaken place of broken dreams, Chlamydia, and overpriced drinks.  This is not my first Fatburger experience...but three hours of gas fumes, and a trip after 2 weeks in county lockup is not a good way to prepare for an eating experience.  

The first thing that happens to Fatburger is sticker shock...it is so damn expensive I honestly couldn't believe my eyes. I thought that years of sucking on bottles of a watered down bleach/ammonia mixture I call "Blind Happiness" had finally done permanent damage. The prices are outrageous for any "fast food" burger joint.  They charge 50 cents for CHEESE...REGULAR CHEESE!!!  How the hell can anyone justify asking 50 cents for cheese on a 9 dollar burger?  They have some gall. I haven't seen that kind of gall since the time I watched a guy take someone's kidneys while he was sleeping. It was amazing what you can do with two sleeping pills and a hacksaw.

Rex can live with high prices...IF...IF things are good. Here is the best part. The burgers suck. They are dry. They are over cooked. The cheese is bland. The toppings are flavorless. They need a special sauce or something to make their burgers worth ten bucks.  Two of us ate burgers, fries and drinks...for 25 bucks!! 25 bucks!! Here is what is the biggest crime...Burger King is better. Mcdonalds is better. Wendy's is better. Forget the really good places like In and Out or Smashburger...oh they are off the charts better. This is just a dry burger on a pedestrian roll with bland toppings.  Fatburger is living off  a name. Here is a name I have...RipOffBurger. This is awful. There is absolutely nothing special about this no matter how hard you try to find something...like Amanda Peet.

The shakes are bad and overpriced, the onion rings taste like they have been frozen previously, the fries were soggy and not crispy. There wasn't one good thing on the menu, and I say that with no exaggeration. EVEN THE SODA WAS WATERED DOWN TASTING! The mixture of the soda machine is desperately off. 

To add insult to our already crappy experience.  When I stood on the table, screamed that these robber barons should at least use a gun of they were going to rip us off...I was the one that the cops led out in handcuffs and leg shackles.  It is truly a world gone mad.  I think it was when I jumped over the counter and shoved their flavorless meat patties in the cooks mouth and screamed "now you know how your mom feels when I go to your house."  The truth hurts too badly I guess.

Rex fights for you even though he hates you.
Only two people working. I was never greeted, I waited twenty minutes before I decided to leave. I will never come back to this establishment.

Fatburger is better than In-N-Out. There...i said it.

There's a lot more variety on the menu, and I'm down for any place that lets you put fried egg AND bacon on a hamburger. Plus they have onion rings. And it's right on The Strip, so it's easy to get to when you're walking around.
Mary was awesome! She was so nice and she just made my day! Very personable and kind. She deserves a raise! I will definitely be back! Thank you so much for just being exceptional!

This is a bit of a hipster style Fatburger, it has an outdoor bar with WAY Overpriced Drinks and Beer, and Fatburgers average fare. The burgers are what they are, but they too are way overpriced as are the Fries! A Burger, Fries, and a Beer is probably gonna run you about $21.00 for mediocre fast food.
The music is blaring, and it's in a crappy strip mall in a dingy part of the strip, so you're not even paying for atmosphere. Overall if you're drunk and hungry a burger here isn't a horrible choice, but be prepared to pay top dollar!

I wish I could give this more props but... I really wasn't all that impressed. The hamburger was dry.

But... I love the name of the place. Love the jukebox.... and love the late night hours.

After a long day at work drove thru to order food. Waited 5 mins before the lady could take my order. Once she took my order it was a medium meal, xl meal with a shake and a kids meal. She told me the total $40 I was so surprised! I get to the window wait 10 mins before she collected payment. Then she told me after waiting 15 more minutes to pull to the front and they would bring my food out! I waited 10 more mins then I had to go in and get my food cause nobody came out!!!!! I just can't believe that I waited that long and paid $40 for something that I had to go in and get myself............ And all I got was a sorry. Waiting that long after a long day at work was the last thing I wanted to do. Won't be returning to fat burger ever again. Over priced and horrible wait time. Never fails but this has just topped it off from every visit prior.

This was an OK burger. This was my first time there and it was just that. I find that the only thing that separates these burger places are just how they build their burgers. I personally like 5 Guys better. I wasn't too impressed with the fries. It was a decent burger.

Absolutely, the ghetto-iest burger joint on the strip.  However, also muy deliciouso.

Be prepared to fight your way through drunken bachelorette's, greasy junkies, stoned ticket flickers, & priaptic midgets.

One of the best fast food(ish) burgers around...and they have Coke Zero at the fountain machine!

As much as I plan to have a nice steak dinner or something of that sort when I visit Las Vegas, just being real, there is no time! I'd rather spend my days at the pool or shopping and nights at any hip hop night club dancing til the morning hours. With that being said I do not want to put my party dress on and sit down for a large dinner before I go out all night. I went to Vegas for six days and ate here 3 times. The last time was before I headed to the airport so I can have one last taste. There's no better way to drink heavily other than to eat here. The skinny fries are great as well as the onion rings. The burgers are by far the best. Fresh, tasty meat with great toppings. I wish there was one close to me! Love this spot

Found hair in my burger.  While that is not completely horrible, I was put off by another thing I saw in the restaurant.  They had red buckets of Sanitizer sitting on the food preparation counter.  While I like to see a clean restaurant, I don't think keeping a bucket full of cleaners within a couple inches of the food preparation area is wise.  Also the staff was spraying window cleaner on fixtures they were removed for cleaning. This again is a nice thing to see, but not when the overspray was going straight into the food.

Maybe a one time bad experience, but it just looked like some serious lack of supervision of the staff.

I love the bay area, but it's missing my favorite burger stand, maybe the last great hamburger stand,  Fatburger.   I love fatbuger the way ed m loves arby's.  When lovie yancy opened the first fatburger she wanted to share the gift of a double king burger topped with cheddar cheese, bacon, grilled onions and a fried egg with all of los angeles.  Thanks to the beauty of expansion that dream extends as far afield as vegas baby...vegas.  I gotta say there is no better hangover deal on the strip than the aforementioned double king paired with fries insouciantly smothered in chili cheese and onions.  

My one gripe about this place is that they don't make the shakes fresh so they tend to be a little more solid than I'd like, but hey at least they're real icecream

Big, fat, and juicy!
Nothing can ever go wrong with a Fatburger after a long day 'n night in the casino playing your favorite game. The juiciness of the meat is just mind blowing. 
You won't get any better burger on The Strip!
It's fast food, but still a little bit pricey (but hey, it's Vegas!)
They'll shout out your name loud (mostly during rush hour), so watch out!

Do not go here. We had a groupon and they deleted it off of our phone and said it wasn't there. They also only had two workers working and were making the sandwiches without gloves on and the person taking our orders had dirty finger nails so I could only imagine what the other guys hands looked like. So we ended up not eating any of the food and just left. They're so disgusting don't go here. I would have left a 0 star review but that's not possible. Also they didn't even say anything to us till about 15 minutes worth of standing there.

Don't come here ever!
Margarita are weak they don't put any liquor on them...and they charge you $11 !!!!
Staff is extremely rudeeeeeeeee
Just an update to this review:  FATBURGER   "NEVER"  replied to my email I sent to them about our experience!!!   Some customer service huh??????

This place is awesome! Loved the MEDIUM size burger with the fries. Believe me the medium is big enough... My friend got the XL burger & she was waaaay overwhelmed it was waaaay too big. The medium is perfect, about the size of a whopper junior at BK. it was really good. And the lemonade is bomb. Cool motown music blasting 4:00am on the strip, this is a cool place:)

My favorite burger place by far. I think Fatburger has the best tasting hamburgers (get the works on it!)! And i love their fat fries! You can choose your hamburger size from small to XXXL. Service is always friendly  and your burger is always put on the grill when you order it, so it's fresh and not sitting around in a wrapper already cooked.

A regular cheeseburger, regular fries, and regular soda for $12.50?!

First, I have to acknowledge the cashier, Shanae.  She was excellent.  Helpful and outgoing to everybody in the restaurant.  I was so impressed with her service that I looked on my receipt for her name.  

The cheeseburger is good.  The fries were decent but not worth $2.99.

So I ordered a burger and a drink yesterday. Yes, ONE burger and ONE drink. The server thought it would be a good idea to include some ketchup, ok great! I could maybe squirt a sachet on my burger. I arrived home, looked in the bag, and the bottom of the bag was literally a TORRENT of ketchup packets. 25 packets. TWENTY FIVE packets of ketchup for ONE burger. 

You might give a middle finger to the environment, a middle finger to business profit (yes you should at least care about this one) and a middle finger to me (because there is no way you can give me 25 ketchup packets and expect me to do nothing). 

You wasteful people. When your grandkids are living on a garbage dump with seagulls as pets, you'll look back at this review and think, oh gee, maybe that '25 packet ketchup guy' had a point! 

My last visit! Well done. Clap clap clap
Worst customer service. No one at bar and,the bartender doesn't ask if we need anything. Ok if this was my business  I would fire them!

Wow two burgers in order of fries and one drink for $40... I'd say that's deep! The burger was actually really good the wait time was not too long. This was my first trip to fat burger this location was very clean, it was very hot inside, and fulfilling.

Fatburger is the perfect place to drunkenly eat burgers at 4 am. I think this will be one of my fondest memories during my Vegas weekend -- drunkenly chatting with you friends over greasy food... I particularly am thankful for my drunken munchies here because it prevented a terrible hangover (cue angel choir singing). 

This place isn't exactly the yummiest but it is when you're hungry at 4 am.
Great break from everything big on the strip.  Pretty interesting crowd but staff seemed to be on the ball.

If you mention you're a local and show your ID, they'll give you a 10% discount.

The prices here are a bit higher than normal.  The food is to be expected.  The staff was very nice.  

If you dine outside by the bar, the service staff will take your order there for you.  If you dine inside, you'll have to place your order at the window.

They played old school hip hop the night we went, so the throwback music was fun.

Ok...after you lose thousands of dollars at the casino, you can always run to Fatburger for cheap eats.  It's just too bad that it doesn't do a good job of cleaning the loser taste out of your mouth.

The junior fat doesn't nothing for an appetite and the steak fries are...well, just fries.  Nothing spectacular about this place.  Avoid it if you can.

Fatburger is good but this location is not. Had an encounter with a RUDE lady there. I went in to order a plain cheeseburger to go. I said cheese only--nothing else on the burger please. Not hard right? Burger comes overloaded with cheese and all other ingredients. Disgusting! I go back in and tell the lady. Of course she's right and I'm wrong right? According to her that's how she saw it. She claimed I didn't order a plain cheeseburger but rather I ordered it with everything. Right. No apology or anything. I patiently waited for my remade burger with no apology. I called corporate on this location and never heard back from them. Like I said earlier Fatburger is good but avoid this location. Disgusting rude people working here who don't care about customer service.

I've been frequenting this location for sometime now and I've never experienced anything but great service and food here. Staff is quick here and food is ready in a reasonable amount of time. In my opinion these burgers beat smash burger and in n out by far.

I had no choice but to eat here... we were meeting friends. I will never eat here willingly again.

I paid $12 for a double burger (no extras), a drink, and fries.
... What a freakn' rip off.

The burger was OK. It was juicy and had some flavor it was only because they use very fatty meat and salt the hell out of it... yes, I can tell, I'm a very good cook. hey burgers are cooked well done - no surprise here for a low-quality burger joint.

I got the thick cut fries, thinking they'd be good... WRONG. Welcome to FatBurger where we serve fries that are exactly like you can get at the grocery store freezer section.  They sucked - period.

one word sums this place up... AVOID!

So I've never been here before and it was conveniently right next to my hotel. I decided to stop here for a burger and see what the fuss was about and wowee it was a nice experience :) Our waitress, Lexi greeted us and was super friendly as if she was our friend for years! I ordered the crispy chicken burger, it was so crispy and moist! It wasn't a plain ol soggy burger from Mickey D's so it was a nice change. Lexi, our waitress would come by frequently to make sure everything was going well with the food and everything. All in all I would love to come back to Las Vegas and eat here again. There's no possible way to compare it with the Harley Davidson Cafe (which was mediocre at best)  down the street.. ::shudders:: 
Go FatBurger you ROCK ;)

Greasy, disgusting, enormous, ohhhh my goooodddddd.

You know what you want when you get food here. Don't come expecting gourmet shit, it is what it is. Huge burgers with bacon, egg, and the regular fixins.

I love me some fat burger.

I didn't think it was possible to find a Fatburger that wasn't amazing like the rest, but I somehow found one (hopefully the only one) here at the Red Rock Casino.  What a shame too, because the Red Rock has so many great places to choose from that it is ironic to have a bad place in Fatburger.

I love Fatburger in general and while I think the prices are a rip at times, usually the taste of the burgers make up for it.  Not here, the burgers have been dry and salty (?) during my experiences and even smaller on occasion.  The folks behind the counter have been slow to prepare our meals and weren't the least bit friendly.  I guess I'll have to save my appetite for the crosstown version which is infinitely better.

Fat-ass-burger is among the best burger chains I've ever had and certainly will be the death of me if I continue to devour these wonderful sandwiches.  Each burger will pollute your arteries with endless clots and empty your wallet in a hurry.  The actual establishment is nothing to rave about, but the array of burger combinations are to die for.   There is no bare bones about it, its the most successful yet simple concept there is to be:  Its a burger.  Its big.  And its fat.  Its delicious as a result!

I heavily endorse the KingFatBurger (i.e. Royal Fatty) and with the Ultimate Big Fat Deal.  Its disgusting when you think about it but oh-so-good when you put it in your mouth.  The greasy texture is completely ignored as the gorge temptation gets the best of you.  Vegas is the city of sin and fun, might as well have fun with your sins and eat it too.  Yeah, I'm still talking about the burger.

boy, did I ever have 1 of the worst fast food garbage, customer experiences ever in my 57 years on this earth. and I owe it all to a crummy $5.00 burger with fixings that turned into a $10.00 + tip...im at sunset station so I'm taking my burger to go. i'd rather eat out at the slots...besides the fact that 9 times out of 10 the tables are always dirty in fast food places...while waiting I go up to the counter to get some napkins...I always need xtra napkins...I always make a mess and I have a condition where I constantly squeeze and wipe my face ..I only use a napkin 2 times ..im not wasting it...its just a nervous thing...and I shouldn't have to explain myself to anyone...I guess I was taking too many because the fry cook asked me why I was taking too many napkins...I told him I wasn't taking too many, but what I needed...he said he only put 4 in customers bags..and I'm saying how does he know what I need and who is he the "napkin police?"  I told him I only had about 7 and he said I had a whole lot more than that...well, I started to count them and guess what? that piss-ant was right...OMG!!! I had about 13. I was wrong and let my temper get the beast of me ...I told him he could have his stinking napkins and I brushed them off the counter...I asked for his name..couldn't see it of course. he was 15 feet away. he told 1 of the other employees to call security because we're gonna get rid of IT!  I asked who the MOD was? quess who? it was him....next thing I know security is escorting me out and I'm not allowed back for 24 hrs. I was embarrassed and humiliated.....oh, and after "IT" got her walker, her sunset cherry pie, her greasy-fatburger, cashed out her winnings, wrapped herself up, left sunset station as fast as my little prosthetic leg could get me to the bus stop....caught bus, walked another 20 min home..well at least I had a burger right?  well...needless to say it was cold...somebody made sure that bun was squished down real good...majority of the mushrooms weren't even on the burger,just squashed outside the bun....thank you for a lovely experience .oh my dogs loved the $10.00 burger..........oh and guess what? there were no napkins in the bag..........god doesn't like ugly..............god bless you , "spanky".

I took the advise of a couple coming out of McDonalds that we should check out Fatburger that was right next door. This was the biggest mistake of my trip. It took no less than 30 minutes to get our food (two cheeseburgers and two fries) and it was completely burnt. The place looks like it belongs in a back alley with the floor and tables being torn up, but trust me, this doesn't have any of that hole-in-the-wall charm, its just sick.

It was cool....expensive because it was on the strip...I was still on from the bottle service we had that night (we went to fatburger at 3am) so my review isn't 100% clear hahahaha. But anyway, it was cool food, got the smallest burger and it was literally small lol! 

I'll be back, when I'm sober :)

If your looking for a satisfying meal with a tasty burger, then this is the place to go. The staff are very kind and the service is fast. Order a burger from this place with everything on it, and your craving for hamburgers will be satisfied. I also recommend trying some of the buffalo wings with honey garlic. Overall, this place is where you would want to go for a good burger fix, and I definitely recommend coming  here if you want fast, quality service.

My BF loved it and thought it was amazing... He had a big beef burger with everything on it super juicy he thought. I had the turkey burger, I was not impressed, it was just maybe ok. Good service at a fair price for the area.
The burgers are fresh and the selection is good. Price is kinda in the high side but you get some good quality meat and  large portions top and the people are friendly..

Spent $80 to take out food for the family. What a waste of money. Burgers were dry and overcooked. The buns were hard and fell apart. My burgers were broken and she put them on the bun anyway. Paid extra for bacon which was overcooked. They forgot to put cheese on burgers. The way they threw the burgers together  was like slop. I tried FB because I heard good thinks about them, never again. The only redeeming quality were that my onion rings and shake were the best part of the meal.

Just had my first Fat Burger last night and I was impressed. I was starving so I got the size above the Fat Burger with bacon and cheese with the Fat fries. It was amazing. The patties were fresh and everything about it was prefect. I don't think that I have had a better burger. The atmosphere is great for being a fast burger joint. Another plus is that they have shallow ketchup cups. I'll never understand why the rest of the world doesn't catch on.

Customer service or lack of I should say. Went to drive-thru. Employee over the intercom took my order. Drove up, looked at me, no hello, no smile, no "your total is..." I handed payment, gave me change without a single word being spoken during the transaction. It was a young kid on a Sunday night, looked like he didn't wan to be there let alone give a rats ass. Service is HORRIBLE! Management should better train and educate staff on customer service. Would not return to this restaurant.
Placed order. Waited for about 20 minutes and my burger was made wrong. Wife's fries are cold.   Chose one star because I could not put anything less

It's a good greasy burger.  This location is a bit dingy compared to others.  The chili cheese fries are great, and the burger is what a burger should be; it's fatty and flavorful.  It's not the best, but it's a good place to go if you're hungover or just craving something you know isn't good for you.

You're honestly better off going to mcdonald's. The food is way overpriced, but that's just a corporate issue. The issue with this location is that the restaurant was messy, the drink station looked like it hadn't been wiped down all day. The whole place is kinda dingy and gross. The food was also kinda sloppy. I asked the cashier to ADD grilled onions and yellow peppers to my burger, so naturally i got a burger with nothing but grilled onions and peppers. At this price level, you'd expect a gourmet burger, but it's actually worse than mcdonald's.

I gave it a shot because I use to love fat burger. It was the only place I could get a child burger in Vegas years ago. I was starving so, here I am. They don't take the on line coupons here. Its $30 for me and my kid. The food is not the Fat Burger I've had in the past. The burger is super greasy and the fat fries are hot but, soggy almost as if they were microwaved. 

I'm eating and all I smell it a dirty bathroom. How can I eat when I smell sewer. I'm disgusted. I'm not eating I'm leaving. 

I'm never coming here again. The smell is overwhelming!!!!

I'll go to Tommy's and get a real Cali style chili burger and not smell shit!! Never coming here again

Oh my gosh I can't believe how expansive this average burgers were.  I totally had better burgers and fries from greasy diners and at IN-N-OUT.  We also had chicken sandwich and it was nothing special.  I can't believe our bill was over 45 dollars for 3 boca burgers, 1 chicken sandwich, 2 small fries, and 2 medium sodas.  We will never go there again.

Welcome to the most ghetto and dangerous place in Vegas.  You walk in and all the extras that played roles in "boys in the hood" and "menace to society" are just hanging out.   I don't get how this place stays open when the white people that walk in are visibly fearing for their lives.  

Oh and the place has roaches that are visibly just crawling around.  

just don't do it

If you have the drunk munchies, then this is the place for a late night nom nom session!

Open 24/7, and located on the strip. Everything made to order. The burger is so big I had leftovers for breakfast; no reheat needed! The sign of a finely crafted hamburger.

Well worth the jaywalk from the Aria.

Stopped in for a late night burger after hearing so many great things about Fat burger. I gotta say the first thing I noticed was how fast they move to service the Vegas crowds. We were greeted right away and placing our order.  

I ordered the Original Fat Burger which was a solid burger but didn't Live up to all the hype. The patty itself was very Juicy and well seasoned but that is really all that stands out. All and all I would go back for a late night burger but prob wouldn't go out of my way for it.  

The chocolate chip cookie by the way was delicious.

Overall good place to eat. In the middle of all the action and a very popular place for drunk ppl to eat at. Burgers contain alot of greece, so I recommend eating this if you want to sober up after a long night of drinking and clubbing. BTW fries are extremely HOT, so eat with caution. Fat Burger is open 24/7 so you have no excuse not to go.
Absolutely love Fatburger!!  They never disappoint!  Fell in love with them when we lived in Cali and we we're so glad they had one in Arizona!  Burgers and fat fries are always on point!

Seriously I could have killed a cow and cooked my own burger faster than my one order came up...

I have to say the burger was good tho, when I actually got it... all the stuff seemed very fresh.

If you're in a hurry... don't bother... got time to burn, give it a whirl :)

The burgers have great flavor! 
We ordered burgers that were quite modified and everything came out exactly like we ordered it. We didn't have to wait too long for the food :) 

The customer service here was good. They were friendly.
Huge burger!  Nice size portions.  The Chili on fries and the cheeseburger were extremely bland!!!

On our last night in Vegas we decided to opt for a burger joint. We opted to eat outside and even though there were other customers smoking it was not a problem at all (we are both ex smokers). Ordered our food and shakes without any problems. When the shakes arrived they were thick and creamy just like they should be and the taste was really nice. The burgers arrived and they were thick tasty and juicy and cooked to perfection. We had ordered one portion of the thick fries and one of the thin fries. The thin fries were a little cold but this cannot be helped. The food tasted great and we both left feeling full and not over stuffed. If we visit Vegas again we will deffo use this burger joint again.
Meh. Okay burger, but way overpriced. Wouldn't go back unless it was 20-30% cheaper. You can get a better burger for less elsewhere.

A long overdue review

Love the 50-60's retro decor of the restaurant as it happens to be  one my favourite era.  There's also a nice big screen tv in the sitting area.  

Didn't know what to order so I ended up getting the FB original menu  However, I ended up liking more the pork pulled burger, a special limited promotional item that FB had.  Hope Faburger brings it back cuz it was so good~!!! to die for.  The fries and the poutine as a side were well made too. 

Pricewise, a little bit more expensive than most usual burger joints, However the quality is there and the ingredients are fresh..That is why I don't mind paying a little bit more for a great burger!    

Service wise, the staff is quite friendly and I like how they bring you the food to your table.

Washrooms are big, spacious and so clean! 

Definitely a great place to hang out after shopping at Vaughan Mills.

Even if not in the mood for a burger, this place has one of the best milkshake in the GTA.   Great hangout place to chit chat and relax on a lazy afternoon or right after work.

I love this place!  Great "after the club" eats.  The place is open 24 hours.  I ate there two nights in a row.  First night I had the turkeyburger.  Very  juicy, the best turkeyburger I've ever had.  I had to wait a little bit, but it was so worth it.  The second night, I had the baby fat burger with fat fries (steak fries). So good!  
Because it's open 24 hours and most people do go there after the clubs you do get some sloppy loud drunks in there.  If you get irritated by those folks, just get it to go!

Yummy, the burgers are good, the fries are good, the soda is good...

The employees are nice and you won't pay the price of a $20 room service burger, that's for sure.

Affordable and tasty...also, the location is pretty much tops.

Had to check out what all the hype was about, and I  must say the burger and fries were really good. Got the medium burger, well done with seasoned  steak fries. The waitress was very friendly and attentive. We sat at the outside patio area that was nice and clean. Will definitely visit again.

By far the absolute WORST fast food place we've ever been to. A homeless man sleeping on the chairs outside the door greeted us. We walked into the absolute worst smell EVER. Trust me I've been around meat my entire life and can "tolerate" the dead flesh smell but this was RANCID! Floors, tables, everything looked nasty I didn't even want to sit down let alone EAT here. We would've thought the place was abandoned but there was an older couple eating there when we arrived. Absolutely no emloyees in site. I wanted to leave immediately (which is rare for me) but my bf really wanted to eat so we proceeded to wait almost TEN MINUTES for a young girl to come to the register. We ordered one combo and one burger. $23!!!!At that point I'm like "AW HE-- NO". We went to olive garden & spent under $20 for all you can eat salad, soup & breadsticks AND you get a free wine sample. LOL Fat burger is more like a FAT FAILURE.

When I heard the name Fat Burger I was wondering if it was just a name. Ssure enough when I looked at the menu and saw an XXXL Burger any skeptical preconceptions on whether this was a serious burger joint were answered. 

"NUMBER 8" screamed the portly Hispanic cook from behind the counter over an Eminem song playing from the Internet radio juke box, signaling me to pick my order up. I ordered some fat fries and a large burger with the works. The burger was cooked just right, retaining the juices and the vegetables tasted fresh which is a plus in my book. The fat fries were piping hot from the oil bath. 

Not entirely sure if the other Fat Burgers are like this, but the Vegas ambiance and tasty burger made me a happy customer. Simply put this place shouldn't be compared to McDonald's or Wendy's. That being said  they can serve the burger to me through a hole for all I care as long as it's good and  I don't get food poisoning.

Happy Vegas fooding!

A different sort of fast food restaurant.... they make everything fresh when you order it. The resultant burgers, fries and rings are pretty good for fast food. 

This is a good place to grab a quick, casual lunch while on The Strip.

I went to Fat Burger because I was craving something delicious... I ordered the medium burger, protein style or without bun. Unfortunately, I had to order it without cheese, but I added egg and I'm glad that I did. It was pretty tasty. I also ordered the fat fries (my favorite) Even without the bread it's a pretty filling meal. 

I had originally ordered it to go, but by the time it was ready I decided to sit at the counter and eat it right then. 

I'm glad that I did, this place is ran very well. Jovani (Spelling?) has worked at this location for as long as I can remember. He is excellent. Friendly, but professional. He helps to keep the other workers on track, but does his own job efficiently.

Priscilla was mostly working the cash register and taking orders. I also felt that she does a great job of multi-tasking. She's pleasant and quick. At one point the shake machine was giving another worker trouble and she was trying to help him with it. She explained to one of the customers that the shake machine was having trouble. I think it was too cold or something... I'm not sure, but the lady was so rude. She made some comment about how dumb do you have to be to make a shake. I thought Priscilla handled it very nicely.

This location is the best . Anthony is absolutely awesome  . I have a fat burger by my house on sunset road and it's very depressing how horrible the staff is there . The food is good but for some reason they always get my order wrong and are rude .  Not to mention ignore all my phone calls every time I try to place a delivery! If you live in this area go to sunset station for fat burger ! Way better customer service ! Thank you Anthony

This place is sooo good!
Don't order a baby fat burger if you want a burger smaller than a McDonald's burger.. yikes..
Their onion rings are delish too! Not too greasy.

4 stars for a fried burger... not a bad rating from this burger snob. 

I prefer a flame grilled 1/2lb burger not a flat fried 1/3lb... but quality makes up for this. 

While it is very close to a 5 guys burger, i like that my burger was not well done. It is def better then all the fast food joints, less greasy then Johnny Rockets, but not as good as Fudds. 

The staff was nice, the place was a little dirty around the edges and can use a good scrub. Prices seemed good for what you get. 

I could be back sooner then later.

I really like to give locally owned businesses the thumbs up, but I cant here.  This family had their kids working here - none older than 9 or 10.  I'm glad they are letting them help and teaching them work ethic, but my burger looked and tasted like a kid put it together.  The place was dirty and poorly kept.  BUT!!!  There is potential here - All it needs is a little adult supervision.

Horrible.... sticky floors.... greasy dirty monitors...only one person to wait the front and drive thru and cook... the other person walked out while person 1 was on break leaving her alone.... ordered burger meals for 4 of us (nothing fancy) and the total was $50... I said you must be kidding... ... nope... walked out!!!

5 stars for a burger joint. That's right. The burgers are good. What really sets this place apart is the courteous and great customer service. I've never been to another fast food restaurant that came to your table to ask about your "how is everything" and offer refills. Great service good food equals great experience that's worth repeat visits

My boyfriend and I stopped into this place for a drink and a side of fries.  I had a free drink coupon, so the bill was only a little over $10.  When I handed the bartender a $20, he assumed the change was his tip.  I was planning on leaving his $7 or $8 anyway since the bill was so cheap and he poured a stiff drink, so I didn't confront him about it.  The service was good and the drinks were strong, but I think the bartender should have allowed me to decide how much of a tip to leave for his service.

Ive been here twice... in the same week.(guilty....) 

the first time i walked in and it smelt heavenly!! i could smell the grills smoking away :) 

i love the retro interior... the silver and white tables and walls... i guess us blondes just like shiny things... who knows... 

i ordered a regular burger and a drink... the service was quick and orderly... i liked that there was a lot of room for people to wait and for those of us already seated don't have to have butts in our faces while we try to eat... that's a perk for sure... 

the location isn't to bad either... and like i said its huge for being a burger joint on such a busy street.... 

the Second time i went i had the turkey burger.... it was AMAZING!!!!!!! 
it didn't make me feel like i wished i hadn't .... it tasted in some ways better... and my favorite part of these delicious burgers is that they put RELISH on them as well and PICKLES!!!!! yum!!!! 

if i could... i would so eat here everyday.... mmmmmmmmmmmmm 

::drooling::

I think their food is great, especially because I am a vegetarian and their veggie burger is insanely good. I give 2 stars because of the staffs attitude. When ordering I ALWAYS feel rushed, like they just want me to shut the f**ck up. After every sentence they just say "Is that all?" in a rude ass voice. One time I pulled up to the speaker and started ordering and I had alot to order for a lot of people and the girl must have thought her mic was off but we heard her say "OH MY GOD..." like we we're annoying her because she has to do her job? So I said "You know what, f**ck you, you stupid ass b*tch!" I drove around to see the b*tches face and I flipped her off and went to burger king.
***UPDATE****
AGAIN WITH THAT SALTY ASS ATTITUDE!!!
F*ck this place! My boyfriend and his friend went here last week and right when they pulled up to the drive through speaker, and this lady says "how can I help you", with out even giving him half a f*cking milli-second to respond, this b*tch yells "HELLOOO!!??" So my bf literally repeated exactly what I did when it happened to us the first time.
Here's a tip for the two stupid b*tch employees of this Fatburger: IF YOU DISLIKE YOUR JOB THIS MUCH, GO BE A DEGENERATE SOMEWHERE ELSE, PLEASE.

Immediately when I land in Vegas, my mouth begins to water for a fatburger. When you only come once a year, your's would water too.. or not.

I love that they have 3 different sizes to match your appetite. Small, Medium, or Large. You can choose whatever toppings and they'll get right to making it. The Strawberry shakes are absolutely delicious. I wish there were 2 different sizes for the onion rings though and I wish they were a little smaller. Other than that, see you next year!

BEST burgers, FANTASTIC atmosphere, PHENOMENAL shakes and fries. We went three times, morning, afternoon, and middle of the night, and we were impressed every time. So much better than In-N-Out that the two cannot be compared. This food is one of the things I miss most about Las Vegas.

I absolutely love Fatburger. I hadn't been a customer in going on 5 years, when I chanced upon this Fatburger on Rancho,,,,

I ordered the xxl cheeseburger, chili cheese fries,  and a coke. I think the tab came to around $15, give or take a few.  Yep, it's a tad spendy,  but in my opinion you do generally have to pay for quality,  and for fair wages for the grill staff. I don't  mind, my understanding is  (  and maybe I'm  wrong,  but I don't think so ) they pay the workers better than most Fast Food burger stands.

Anyway,  the burger and chili fries were AMAZING. I'll  be honest,  the sheer size and majesty of that xxl cheeseburger scared me a little  ( that doesn't happen often ) I wondered if id be able to "kill the beast " !   Huge. Juicy. Flavorful. Unique. A classic monster built burger. Did I mention Flavor ?  Abundantly flavorful.

The chili cheese fries are also amazing - because they are prescisely  what chili cheese fries are supposed to be, in my opinion. Thick tasty fries, smothered in flavorful chili with cheese. No beans. No fake cheese. No greasy limp fries. They were wonderful.

Like I mentioned at the top,  I hadn't  been a customer for years. The last Fatburger I ate at was in Redondo Beach,  So Cal.  Then moved to Idaho,  then here to beautiful Vegas !   So happy to see Fatburger has a presence here  :-)  

For the "chain " burger stands
1)  SmashBurger
2) Fatburger
3) Tommy's 
4) In N Out


Not necessarily in that order,  depending on my state of mind.

As a local my wife and I love coming here especially to see our favorite bartender deebo. He Always goes above and beyond to take care of us the half pound fatburger and the crispy chicken always fresh and the drinks buy 1 get 1 come on it's the strip can go out have the best hamburger and enjoy drinks listening to some good music without going broke!

We stopped in Fat Bar in Vegas  for dinner. The burgers were fresh and perfect. The oo9 ion rings are to die for. Fat fries, crispy outside and soft inside. Just the wasy I love them. Bobby our waiter/bartender was awesome so we had to stop in a second time for Patron sits to finish the evening. Great first night in Vegas for our mini vacation.

This place is great!  My friends and I went to Vegas last year and were looking for some food after our flight. We wandered the strip and came across fat burger. It was great. I can't remember exactly what we ordered but I do remember the milk shake was fantastic and I was sad we didn't get a chance to go back again before we left. I was also sad to learn there are no fat burgers by me. If you are in Vegas and looking for a good burger, go here.
its onle 2 stars because i ate breakfast.... lunch would have been better

Last minute search for something to eat. It was late, it was cold and Fatburger is a few minutes from our hotel so this is where my husband ended up.  He brought back burgers, fries & a milkshake for the teenager.  My burger was surprisingly good.  I loved all the little bits of onion throughout my burger and it was tasty.  I was told that they were greasy burgers but I didn't think so at all.  And the fries are yum too.

Ok so if you haven't figured it out I have become yelp happy lol. Tonight's Fatburger I must say was quite tasty. A double Medium with cheese, pickles and mustard really hit the spot. It's all about the pickle juice they put in the mustard, I even use it on my fat fries. Y'all know that I just had 5 guys but I had to come back to ol faithful. This location is always a hit an miss, but the new crew did Fatburger justice... I must say though when it comes to price and the extras for your burger there's this place with 5 guys that may now have my heart. What will be my next yelp be, any suggestions?

Fatburger provides a solid quick-service style burger open 24 hours on the Strip right across the street from the Monte Carlo. 

When I went there you could choose from small through XXXL for the burger size. I heard from a friend that their used to be only 3 sizes. I think that kind of simplicity would have be nice since I was quite baffled about which size to order. The burgers are all cooked to order which is nice but may cause a little bit of a wait. Cheese, chili, bacon, and egg are all chargable upgrades for the burger while other condiments are available for no additional charge. 

I was talked into the medium size burger. I added cheese, bacon, and a fried egg. It was too big. I got to the awkward point in my meal where I was satisfied to be done eating but only had a little bit of burger to go. I decided to avoid feeling the gut bomb and just tossed it. Along with my burger I ordered the skinny fries which turned out were not really all that skinny. I mean, they were pretty much standard size fries. I think I would have been better off if I topped them with chili or ordered the fat fries or onion rings instead. Lesson learned.

All in all, it is a decent option for late night eats. Especially if you want to avoid the more notorious fast food burgers, and of course, you have at least $10 to burn on a quick bite.
Really nice food and great service. Cool environment and not that pricey at all.
This burger tops all other fast food burgers hands down. Love this place. I recommend this place to anybody who wants a good burger.

One of the few fast food chains that offers a veggie burger option. They use the Boca patty which is not my favorite. 

Pros
-Staff is friendly
-Offer a veggie burger, turkey burger
-Skinny Fries (not diet food but they are cut thinner than steak fries)

Cons
-Burgers don't taste that good. My veggie burger was very very lackluster and my friend's beef patty was apparently not a home run either
- Price : 11 dollars for a fast food  meal (burger, fries, coke)
- Not really fast food if it takes 10 min to get the food

It's going to be a long time before I go to FatBurger again. Not impressive but edible.

Came to give this place another try after a few years and I must say it wasn't as bad as the first time but still didn't taste like much. Ordered the small burger with bacon and cheese and a small order of chili cheese fries. The chili cheese fries were basic. I think this may be the finally chance for here for me.
If u want a shoe leather burger this is your place.  Burger was beyond well done, no juices and patty crumbled.  Would expect more for $12.17

For rich people with no appetite. Paid $6 for a burger the size of a slider, what a rip off. This chain won't last long as they are overpriced, limited selection and no value. You feel more like you got robbed or fleeced after leaving here then full in the belly.

The staff was pleasant and the place was clean. The only issue was charging soo much for so very little. You spend about 60% less at the McD's, Wendy's and Burger Kings of the world and if you want a bit more flavor head over to five guys where you'll get a lot more bang for your buck. Otherwise, pay through the nose to get a thimble sized burger.
This is the place to go for a VERY indulgent and greasy burger with egg and cheese. (groan) I can STILL feel it. :P But it's totally wicked after a good nite of clubbing and drinking. fer sure!!

Employees are not knowledgeable about allergens and aren't even willing to make an effort to look. They need to learn the law before someone  that isn't as kind as me wants to make an example out of them. Shame on you!!

Honestly was looking forward to having a good burger, but after a 35 minutes wait I had to go check what the problem was.
