I have no problem with the prices at Fatburger because every time I have eaten there, I can tell that the food is of higher quality then the places where you can get a burger for a buck.... As with many things in life, when it comes to burgers usually you get what you pay for. 

Burger patties are cooked to order, so there will be a wait if you don't call ahead. I was at the mall, across the street from Sunset Station (where this Fatburger is located) when I called in my order. By the time I drove across the street, parked and made my way through the casino my order was just being finished...

The employee that helped me looked like he wasn't a day over 12, but he was friendly and he didn't forget the ketchup so I can't complain about the service! Overall this Fatburger is a-ok.

I am a fan of Fatburger, I've eaten at a few of the different locations around town. This review won't include any whining about prices, it is what it is and you get what you pay for... Frankly if the price is too steep for some people they should just turn around and head down the street to Micky D's or something else they feel is worth the cost...

The issue I have with this location is the service. Yes, Fatburger can be considered fast food so it's foolish to expect much in the way of service. Employees should still be cheery and helpful, and the one that brought our food out was not. She just slapped a pile of trays with all 4 orders on the top one down on the edge of the table and walked away. I'd be more understanding if the place was busy but it was not. I also do not understand why each person's order was not on it's own tray. 

The same employee was less-then-helpful when I informed her that their tea dispenser was out of tea. She told me it was not and that I needed to push the button... which I had done, and nothing but water came out. She then told her coworker that they should check the tea, and walked out the door for her break... 

Like I said, I am not going to bitch about the higher-then-your-typical-fast-food-joint prices, but I will say that if you are going to charge those higher prices your should make sure the people you have taking the money and delivering the product are at least somewhat pleasent to deal with.

Ordered a small burger for the kiddos and noticed it was a little too pink for their taste. 

If you are a well done burger eater make sure to order it well done.

I've been to Fatburger twice.  My first experience was no good.  My husband made me get the XL (with two patties, i think) and I wanted to throw up.  I was pregnant and the look of it made me sick.

BUT...I went to Fatburger again last weekend and it was really good!  It really hit the spot after a day of shopping with the girls.  I'm a burger and fries kinda girl!  Skinney fries were delish!

Good but not as good as the ones in California. So a good burger with descent service. The check out guy even recommend trying out In and Out. I know in and out so thanks but I wanted a great Fat Burger and Fat Fries. So just okay.

Went tonight after going to this location tons of times. Always consistant. Tonight they were poorly staffed with only three people working and two of them on their first day. The woman who took our order was missing at least two teeth. It was disgusting. I cant believe they would have her greet people. She did not look sanitary at all. My husband got the XXL which he always gets. It was off. They loaded it with mayo. They never do that. He heard them ask what the order of condiments was supposed to be when she was making the burger. She also complained loudly that it was too hot! Just make our burger and quit bitching loudly. it was really off tonight.
Place is understaffed and overpriced. Tasty burgers though. They should trim the menu down and focus on execution of their namesake.
What a joke. The smallest $10 burger I ever had in my life .   It's embarrassing.   Wtf.   Stay away and save your $

Checking out the reviews I have to disagree with the bad reviews I have been a burger eater since I was a kid there are 3 top burgers in 
As Vegas and here they are NO.1 bachi burger. NO2 fat burger. NO3. In & out burger. And for the record the staff at fat burger is very friendly I have been a customer there for over 15 years never once have I had a problem with the service or staff great crews all of them

Worst of worst fatburger
Poor services dirty restaurant
I was looking for clean tables for few minuts
No kachup no toilet paper 
It took 20 min to cooked two buger and fries
Also my fries was cold and tast like deepfried twice 
Bad managment looks owner dont take care restaurant 
Employees are too lazy to work

I love Fatburger and this location is one of the best in town. Yes, it is located in the Green Valley Ranch casino food court but it is open 24 hours. I'll grab a quick meal here before or after a movie or a late night snack after bowling. 

The guys at this Fatburger know how to cook! I usually get an XXL (double cheeseburger) with grilled onions, pickles and all-beef chili. I'm a low carber so I'll get it served in a dish with no bun. I love the beef here and I love how it is cooked in all of its own delicious burger grease. Sit at the counter and talk to the cooks while they prepare your dinner, and order a soda that you can keep refilling yourself at the self-service soda bar (wish they would add Coke Zero since I'm not a Diet Coke fan).

I love Fatburger's handmade milkshakes too (and their skinny and fat fries) but I've had to give those up due to all the carbs. But if you can, try their skinny chili cheese fries, they are the best. They melt shredded cheddar on them which is the key to good cheese fries. There are also a long list of possible toppings you can get on your Fatburger from relish to fried eggs to bacon and grilled onions. They also make grilled chicken and veggie burgers too, and both are good. You can also get your burger on a whole wheat bun or wrapped in lettuce.

Everything is cooked to order here so once you order you are given a number. They'll deliver the food to your table. Plan on spending about $25 for 2 people; it's not exactly cheap but it's convenient and the food is always fresh, hot, and served with a smile. And if you are a gambler at Station Casinos, you can even redeem your comp dollars here and eat for free.

I love Fatburger and this location is one of the better and bigger ones in town. The dining area is really big so there are always comfy tables or booths. And the rocking jukebox is FREE so play some tunes while you eat. 

I usually get an XXL (double cheeseburger) with grilled onions, pickles and all-beef chili. I'm a low carber so I'll get it served in a dish with no bun. I love the beef here and I love how it is cooked in all of its own delicious burger grease. Sit at the counter and talk to the cooks while they prepare your dinner, and order a soda that you can keep refilling yourself at the self-service soda bar (this location has Coke Zero and Gold Peak brewed tea, both make my tummy happy). 

I love Fatburger's handmade milkshakes too (and their skinny and fat fries) but I've had to give those up due to all the carbs. But if you can, try their skinny chili cheese fries, they are the best. They melt shredded cheddar on them which is the key to good cheese fries. There are also a long list of possible toppings you can get on your Fatburger from relish to fried eggs to bacon and grilled onions. They also make grilled chicken and veggie burgers too, and both are good. You can also get your burger on a whole wheat bun or wrapped in lettuce.

Everything is cooked to order here so once you order you are given a number. They'll deliver the food to your table. Plan on spending about $25 for 2 people; it's not exactly cheap but it's convenient and the food is always fresh, hot, and served with a smile. The bathrooms are usually pretty clean here too, and they have FREE wi-fi so you can work through lunch.

I like Fatburger. Their ingredients are of a higher quality than most quick service burger joints, they have Coke Zero on tap at their all you can drink soda fountain, they are open 24 hours and I like my meat well done. It's a win-win situation for me. This location is inside the Sunset Station casino, making it a great place for a late night snack or a quick dinner before catching a movie. The prices are higher than other spots (it's in a casino with a captive audience, people!) but I think the value is still there. What other burger places do you know that have Grey Poupon mustard, swiss cheese, chili, fried egg and relish as toppings? You'll pay extra for the premium add-ons but it's worth it (bonus tip: order a side BOWL of chili for a few extra bucks; you'll get 10 times the amount you'd get if you just order a scoop on top of your burger). Plenty of seating and always open.

We went through the drive through the Lady handed me the bag,
First she forgot my sodas
Second I asked for two large and two mediums and she gave me all mediums.
Third when I got home I was missing my fries.
That's why I hate drive through
It took 30min to get my damn burger!!!  And when i got it, the burger was cold and the bun was hard and stale. WTF??!!!

Though a bit pricey with not a lot of options, their burgers are juicy and delicious. It's a higher quality, thicker patty on a well made (though not in-house) bun. I get mine with just lettuce, mayo and cheese but you can get it loaded with toppings for the same price. I also got skinny fries but there are also a lot of fry/side options including steak fries, onion rings, or a salad. 
If you got a little extra to spend but still want a fast burger, Fatburger is the place to go.

A decent burger place.
If in the area I'd probably go back for another shot.

The burger was a good size and well prepared, no complaints there.  Might even have rated another 1/2 star for that.  But the fries... some of them were uncooked.  They had zero colour to them at all.  You gotta cook the fries.

Also, the cashier started things off with a pet peeve of mine.  Interrupting me mid order to ask if I wanted a combo.  Just listen until I finish and at that point if I haven't ordered fries and a drink you can ask if I want a combo... But that is a small thing, so I did not deduct anything for what is a personal gripe.
Waited 20 minutes for a burger...on a Tuesday at 3pm...no one in line. Enough said.

This one is inside the Red Rock Casino Food Court. Very nice staff who asked me if I was seeing a movie and gave me a 10% discount because of that.   So if you're coming here, grab your ticket first and then order to save yourself some dough. 

The burger came out promptly and was great too - as usual. I like mine with everything on it but you have a choice to pick and choose what you want on yours. 

A value for your money!

The food is good, always. The main reason for this 5 star review is for the two gentleman who were working on 7/15 (they both had tattoos I believe, one had an eyebrow piercing). Their attitudes were so good, they were super sweet too. The A/C wasn't working and were talking to them about it just kind of joking around, they were so humble. I wish I could compliment them more but I really just had short interactions with them. They were amazing!

This location may be too busy to get some real service.  The last couple of times I've gone my orders have been messed up.  They have two kinds of fries, but even if you ask for fat ones your getting skinny.  Don't bother asking for condiments when ordering because they are not going to be there when you get your food.  Maybe it's just too busy for them to get it right.

Good but overpriced. I spent $30 on myself and 2 kids meals. I can say that now I know the kids meals with chicken strips could be split between them instead of shelling out $8 bucks each. For what I paid it was just enough. Nothing spectacular.

More than 30 minutes later and they still had not gotten our order out. We asked about it and all hell broke loose.  The cook thought he had been making it over and over again.  Apparently the order had kept going out the drive through window.  So we never got our food and lots of other customers were getting the wrong food.  Will never be coming back to this one.

This was a great burger I will come back soon. It's been a long time since I been to fat burger but I am now a fan again. They are slow but nothing good comes fast. If your looking for fast have a slice of pizza if your looking for a great burger this is the place

Not very well maintained.  No soap or paper towels in the restroom, there was not even a soap dispenser.  But... there was a sign saying employees must wash hands before returning to work.  I'm not sure how they will manage to do that. Also, literally ever napkin holder every table was empty.  If these obvious things are over looked, it makes me wonder what corners are cut behind the scenes. Go to another location if you can help it.

Amazing burgers with great service. Even tho Fat Burger is a fast food restaurant, they bring the food to your table and ask you how the food is with a smile. I've been to this location a handful of times, tho consistency isn't it's strong suit, I've always left extremely full and satisfied. I have to admit that the last time I went, the service was great but the burgers didn't quite taste as good.

I love it when they top your burger with an onion ring for added texture and they do it here for free yayyyy! The meat is perfectly grilled to be crispy and ohhhhh that perfectly melted cheese.. droool. I would go lighter on the sauce tho that is a personal preference. Buns are just ok, nothing special. The milk shake is quite good - so thick and creamy. You shouldn't come here counting calories but sometimes I order the lettuce wrap to feel less guilty. They give you way too much lettuce compared to the proportion of the meat though, so I end up peeling back some lettuce to eat after I'm done with the burger as a salad lol

Avoid this location!

30 minutes to mess up an order of 1 burger and fries, nothing else. Worst Fatburger location this side of town. The employees are slow. The food is always cold. Avoid this location and make the trek to Red Rock Casino for a $1 extra for everything if you really need to have Fatburger. Done with this place. I would be firing the whole staff if I was in charge of this loss leader.

I wanted to try a different burger joint from In N Out. I ordered 3 Fatburgers (1 small & 2 medium), 2 fries and 1 onion rings. It cost me about $30 ( TOO EXPENSIVE! ). The small Fatburger was very small similar to a slider burger size. The medium sized burger was a good size but not for $6. The burger had onions, mustard, mayonaisse, relish, pickles, etc. I tasted most of the pickles due to its saltiness. I didn't like their fries at all, it was very bland. But the batter on their onion rings was delicious.

I would choose In N Out than FatBurger next time.

Avoid this location. Just go to the one on sunset. Friendlier staff and they are not drunk on shift.
Short Mexican with a mustache always drunk on shift at this location. 

Just save your money and go somewhere else.
it was Ok, the meat lack some salt or some magic spice (like other places). The place looks kinda crappy but attention is ok. Still I think I'll stick to my carl's...more juicy and tasty

This place is amazing! The customer service is outstanding. Shout out to Carlos! I asked if it was possible to use coke instead of milk to make a blended coke float and when I found out they don't usually do this I said it was ok I'd just take a soda. But Carlos said "No let's give it a try". And yes...it came out great! He also realized I was ordering a hamburger patty for my fur baby and remembered to leave off the salt when I had forgotten to request no salt. I wish I knew the name of the young lady that actually made the shake and the cook that came out to bring me my food. He showed me a picture of his pet ( a snake...eek...lol ) when I showed him a picture of my fur daughter, Luna. Of course the food was great also, even Lulu said so . This was a wonderful experience and I will definitely be back. Y'all give them a try!

First off they have super friendly and fast service. Second they now serve the impossible burger here!!! So if you're vegan in the green valley arena get your butt over here! Fresh and made to order it's the best thing I've had all week.

Mmm... That is a tasty burger. Skip In-N-Out (overrated), come here. And any place that allows you to put a fried egg on your burger is obviously going to be good.

Aside from being the cheapest burger on The Strip (or even the cheapest food), it is just darn fun and good. You hear the workers yelling out orders, it is a small diner-like atmosphere, and the burgers just taste good. Skip the lettuce and tomato and such and opt for egg, onions, bacon, and all the stuff that will slowly kill you as you walk back to your hotel.

And for the little ones -- like my wife who doesn't eat a ton -- they have small burgers that are perfect for little appetites.

3.5 STARS

On my getaway day from Las Vegas on 7/23, in advance of my red eye flight that evening, I could not resist some more sessions of video poker at Santa Fe Station. To get me back to the machines quickly I opted for a quick lunch at Fatburger, located in the casino's food court.

A pleasant young woman with a screeching cartoonish voice took my order. She advised me to sit at one of the food court tables and wait eight minutes for a freshly cooked burger. Eight minutes later I heard her scream........my burger was ready. It was a tasty, fresh burger on a typical burger roll. I could not distinguish it from any other fast food burger, although I do give this franchise credit for making fresh burgers to order. The burger did the job and sated my hunger. I did think it was a little overpriced, however.

The most surprising aspect of my visit to Fatburger was the Vanilla Milk Shake I ordered with Whipped Cream. It was outstanding.  It was delicious, with a beautiful consistency. I look forward to enjoying it again!

Thus.....I've added a half star to my review to praise this remarkable shake.

A. Conveniently located, i.e., once you've drank enough floaters at Studio 54, you can walk to this spot
B. Patrons are scary, i.e., bikers, gang-bangers, doped-up homeless dudes
C. Food was made quickly, lots of yelling by Jose and Hector on the deep fryers
D. Burger was like stacked and greasy as hell...the visuals of the girls biting into them while grease was dripping down the side of their mouths was stupendous
E. This place was dirty as hell (it was 4 am so I'm not mad at 'em)

I will hit again.

So when you first walk in, the arrangement is a little weird but once you make your way through the hallway, past the washrooms, you'll see a cheerful all smiley staff waiting to take your order. I, of course, didn't know what to get only having fatburger once before, so after a quick look at the menu, I opted for the fried cod sandwich.

The total came to fifteen dollars! I dished out the sum, but instantly regretted ordering such an expensive sandwich. Although, I must say that fatburger has higher prices than your typical fast food joint. 

The food was good, but not great, especially for fifteen bucks! The cod sandwich was definitely the star of the show. Soft and succulent deep fried fish mmm whats not to love. The sandwich did get a little soggy because of the excess sauce placed on it but its cool, I can live with that. Don't even waste your time on the french fries or the yam fries because they were not salted and couldn't measure up to mcdonalds fries. The coleslaw on the side was tasty, but what I appreciated the most about this joint was that it was meticulously clean (although its a new establishment) and that each table was stocked with burger essentials: napkins, various seasonings, and my favourite, tabasco sauce! They do it right at fatburger! Noticed the exceptional customer service by the way...we were greeted when we walked in and when we left as well as asked how our meal was twice by two different staff members. Great training by the management here! 

Will be back again to sample their other burgers. You can tell this place will soon be a local hotspot...good food, even better service!
I go to this location about once a week (don't judge me), and I've only had great service every time. The employees are always genuinely friendly and the food is good.

Not clean , floors sticky and the tables are not clean. Smells like sulfur when you walk in. 

Half the lights on the building are out, this store is rundown and needs some TLC. 

FATBURGER used to be worth the $9 burger. Not anymore.

Wow what a great burger.  The place was dirty but it's on the strip in a rundown strip mall surrounded by drunk street urchins and strip-club card-slapping Mexicanos - what do you expect??

If it's 3am and you've been drinking on the strip all night and want to get amazing service, a J Crew-clad crowd, a sparkling clean facility, AND get a great burger at a great price for the strip, GO BACK TO YOUR HOTEL AND GO TO BED b/c you're an idiot.

Oh yeah the food.  Great burgers!  Got a few of the small burgers with cheese each time we went (thrice in three days).  The meat was juicy and not over-cooked, the tomato and onions and lettuce were all fresh and hadn't been sitting out.  Better than IN-N-Out in my opinion and way better than Wendys and way way way way better than McD's.

There are some strong points when it comes to Fatburger. The music, for one, stands out in my mind. They always have good music playing. I like that you can watch your burger being made. It is like the ultimate in quality assurance watching everything the cook does. I like that the burgers are made fresh. There is a certain quality that you can taste in the freshness.  They do make a good burger. I admit that. My main issue with Fatburger is the price. In what world does it make sense to charge $10.99 for a burger, fries and a Coke at a fast food chain restaurant. I can get more food for the same price at a place like Red Robbin. A crazy price like $10.99 steered me away from the combo so I ended up with just a burger for over $6.00.   I guess I shouldn't complain too much though. It forced me to stick with my diet a little bit.

Eh. This is my second time I have eaten at Fat Burger in the 10 years I've lived in Vegas. Nothing special about this place. It's pricey for what you get. I do like that they have the skinny and fat fries since I like one and my husband likes the other. The service at this location was good and the cashier was really nice. Food is ok. I'd take In n Out over Fat Burger.
We have a split house on this one.  Husband loves this place since we had one locally.  He loves the burgers and fries.  I thought it was ok, nothing to write home about....just another burger place.

A little expensive for burgers that are similar to In and Out. Add ins are a buck more so if you add cheese and bacon onto your burger, you already have a burger that is about $10. Their is really nothing special about these burgers other than the name. With all the different flavors and foods that they serve in Las Vegas, Save your money and try something exotic.

You're walking along the strip and you see an attractive woman in a skimpy red bikini on top of a bar, you take notice.  This is in front of the Fat Bar which is the patio portion of Fat Burger.  I'm not reviewing this as part of Fat Bar, because the sign says verbatim "Welcome to Fatburger's Las Vegas Slushie Bar."  I always loved Fat Burger.  It's a big fat burger with fat fries.  Before they came to Reno, I always hit the Fat Burger here like a tradition.  Now, let's get back to what's important.  There are one or two hot women in bikini's in the front hawking over-sized margarita-flavored alcohol slushies.  The Las Vegas strip is super expensive as far as drinking.  I paid $20 for a drink to get into the Haze Night Club (it's free to get in so long as you buy a $20 drink coupon).  That got me a watered down vodka and Coke.  Yuck.  Then I paid $10 for a Sierra NV 12 oz beer.  After $30, I wasn't even close to feeling buzzed.  For $25 (using a $5 coupon) I got 55 oz of slushi strawberry margarita-flavored booze.  I expected it to be watered down a lot, but to my surprise, BANG!  It was LOADED with tequila!  I got drunk immediately.  So be careful.  I later blacked out.  I got the small guitar.  I know, it's totally touristy, but when in Vegas, be a lame tourist and live it up.  Trust me, the guitar gets you attention.  I had women taking photos of me with them and then they'd wear the guitar and get more photos.  Can you say chick magnet?  Too bad I was toasted by then and barely remember the whole ordeal.  None-the-less, the bikini beach bartenders were super friendly, and I'm telling you, there's nothing like drinking 55 oz of booze from a plastic guitar on a public street.  Unfortunately, it was the worst tasting margarita or dacquiri or whatever the hell they want to call it.  It was like pure corn syrup after the ice all melted.  It was hard to drink, but basically it was just a vehicle to help get the tequila down so don't expect craft, natural ingredient juice here.  Just swallow it down and get drunk.  I'm a craft cocktail snob, but this place isn't about craft cocktail numb nuts.  It's about the bikini bartenders, the guitar, and getting wasted on a public street in Vegas, and then blacking out.

Wow.... where do I start?

I've come to this location many times throughout the years, but this was seriously the worst service all the way around and management needs to know about this ASAP!

My husband and I came here for a bite and as soon as we walked in we were met with the most unfriendliest, unprofessional hostile cashier ever. The cashier was visibly annoyed and being rude to the customer at the drive thru and then she rang us up with her personality of a door knob self.

She was loud and disrupting the other workers on the grill, which makes sense why my food tasted like crap. I've always received great service at all the Fat-burgers I've been too but this was a disaster. I'd like to know who in the heck hired this crazy person.

The food was sloppy, warm and lacked in taste. It looks like the cook forgot to add salt to the patties. All together this was by far the very worst I've come across at FB and I don't ever want t o come here again. Yikes!!!

Its a fun gimmick but, why would I go back here? Its not like there's a paucity of good burger places around. I realized I could stop when I saw that they just had the same place everywhere, and I mean everywhere. Its kind of depressing, especially after you get all clogged with Fatburger. Seriously, give it up. This place isn't that good, just familiar if you are from the west.

This beast is a Triple Kingburger:

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LtXy1VinKWfuLFslVarKRw?select=gC1lIlUt2iGUj_JBghjgeA

I could not finish this damn thing.  It's actually bigger than it looks in the pic, you can't see the depth there.  And you have to chip away at an angle since it won't fit in your mouth.  The cook came out to check on my progress after 20 minutes and just laughed that I wasn't close to done.  

I felt like John Candy in The Great Outdoors at the steakhouse when they tell him he has to eat the fat and gristle too.  Oh and for all you Gen "Z"ers or "Millenials" with your "internets" and "imacpods" and "myfriendspaces", who are gonna try to make me feel old for referencing John Candy instead of Chris Farley or the fat kid from Superbad, take a lookee here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c3Z4OfTr8ww&feature=related

It's a very good thing, but damn, that's a lot of meat.

Fatburger is great because they're open 24/7 and they're right there just north of the MGM on the Strip.  So at 1 am when you and all your drunk buddies are realizing how many empty calories are in half a bottle of vodka, and that all the good restaurants in Vegas close at 10 or 11, you know where to go.  Sure it gets messy in there but you're too drunk or hungry to care right?  

And you don't really want McDonald's do ya?  No.  No, you don't.

Oh yeah and props to Eli G for the burger inspiration, this guy lives and breathes the carnivore lifestyle:

http://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=4ZfcCa4m5RWvO4EFzfYm1A

I found everything to be mediocre. I ordered a large bacoj cheeseburger with fat fries and a soda. Came to $20 even.

The burger was just OK. Cooked in a lot of butter or lard or something to make it crispy. The fries tasted fried from frozen and highly processed.  Overall, you can do better at Shake Shack for a greasy burger fill.

Service is very slow, I received my milkshake in the drive-through and my milkshake is almost gone before I've even receive my food. Also everything is WAY overpriced, tastes good but I might as well have gone to a sit down restaurant for what this was worth. Paid $17 for a 1/3lb burger meal smdh

I personally enjoyed In and Out much more than Fatburger. Fatburger is your more greasy, down to earth, bar food type of burger. Nothing too special about it, although they do offer ginormous portions, and give you an option to add a fried egg.  I was not very fond of the wedge fries, got to sample the shoe strings and onion rings, both which taste better. The location is great if you are staying around the strip, about a 5 min walk from planet hollywood.

Fresh burger cooked to order. It cost a little more but if you like more meat, it's worth it.. The meat is fresh and bigger than the bun. You get to choose which condiments you want on your burger when ordering. The best burger I had around in Vegas
24 hours! Yes, please! I love going here everytime I am in Vegas. I love the fat steak fries that come with your burger!  SO GOOD!

Nice surprise. We needed breakfast, and it was 10:30 so no luck at McD's. Stopped here and were so happy we did. 

Margarita greeted us, took our order and then cooked our food to order. We ordered sausage, egg and cheese sandwich. You get two giant sausage patties which are super hot since they come right off the grill. 

Will definitely go back again.

Eat here every time I'm in Vegas and love it.  Service has always been great and so has the food.  Expect to pay twice as much as In and Out.  Love the new renovations with the bar outside, it worked perfect for my son (17) and I so we could people watch on the strip and I could have a beer without the hassle of his age.  I love In and Out and Fuddruckers also but this is a different type of burger joint.  Can't wait til the next trip!

This place is a great choice to nurse hangovers lol! I like to treat my hangovers with a burger that contains mushrooms, bacon, and cheese, and this burger, along with the fries and a locally brewed IPA, satisfied my every need! I definitely stop by here for a beer or a few when I'm on the Strip!
Sign says open 24/7, not true!! Went there at 2:30 am and it was closed!! We were pretty annoyed at this.

Alex R. and another gentleman working with her during the 2:30am shift yesterday were very kind and provided my girlfriend and I with great customer service. There was an issue with our order ticket when the food was ready, but Alex jumped right in to make sure this problem was handled properly. Five Stars!!!

Upon my arrival at this fat burger location I noticed the "Open" sign was on but was greeted in the drive thru with a very unpleasant experience.  The voice I hear is a woman but didn't catch the name. Almost a half hour before closing I am told there is no more orders to be taken because someone right in front of me had placed an order of approximately $200 and they wouldn't have time to make my order.  All I had tried to order was fat fries. Never have I ever been told that I couldn't place an order because someone before me purchased a high volume of items on the menu, especially at a fast food place.  She wasn't kind speaking through the speaker, quick to dismiss  and definitely wasn't very accommodating. My recommendation would be to get staff more qualified to take a high volume of orders or shouldn't have an "Open" sign on if they can not serve food a half hour before closing. I love that this place has a drive thru but safe to say I won't be returning.

Went here once for your curiosity and once because I was dragged here. Fat burger is mediocre at best. Its overpriced and takes wayyyy too long to get your food. In N out kills this place and is almost have the price. I would rather go to burger king or carls jr and those places are shit.

Yum.
Munch.
Crunch.
Burp.

Not your trypical burger joynt.

Located on the Vegas Strip, this place is the perfect kill you Vegas hunger at 4am after a long night/morning of lounge hopping in those over-price Vegas nightclubs.

Be brave. Order the XXXL burger and bust a gut!
Also, don't be scared of the locals that hangout there. 

They're there for your protection. lol
Both my neighbor and I stopped by last night ordered from the Drive-thru. Both are sick at the stomach. Just called and will be contacting the store manager Etc... Not cool at all.

My first mission with the GTA Burger Brigade and I think that I completed the objectives of filling up my belly with burger-y goodness!  Located in Thornhill, across from the Promenade Mall in the newer complex of business, Fatburger is located on the corner of the building facing the west.  Lots of ample parking.  The restaurant has a small footprint, but is more long than wide.  About a 25 seat eating area, ample enough for a small group.  The menu is quite extensive..not just beef burgers..but chicken, turkery,vegetarian options also salads as well.  They also have a variety of different french fry options, ranging from different topped french fries, yam fries and the Large Bag O' Fries (which I have not tried, but it is on the list).  Not like your regular burger joint, when they take your order..you tell them all the toppings you want and you are given a number and they will deliver your burger to you wherever you are sitting in the restaurant.  This way it keeps the line up at the cash moving, so that there isn't a line up of people waiting for food.  A great idea!! The service was fast and friendly and the staff was always helpful to explain all the options.  I sat in the dining area and they brought my meal in about 8-10 min.   I ordered the Double Kingburger..which consisted of 2 8oz patties with Cheddar (extra) Bacon (extra) lettuce, tomato, spicy ketchup, mayonnaise and to top it off...Chili (extra).  From what I have been told..you can keep adding patties to the burgers for $2.50 a patty.  The current record is 7, I think I can beat it..The burger was cooked perfectly and it had a very distinctive black pepper taste.  I personally love pepper so it was quite a delight, but if this isn't your thing, just ask to hold off.  The drinks by the way are bottomless, which is good when you have a 16oz burger you need to wash down.  Fatburger will be a licensed restaurant and it looks like they will be stocking some fine local Amsterdam Brewery products (on tap!!) .  All in all it was an excellent sojurn to the northern part of the GTA to experience a well known US chain that has been cooking Burger-y goodness since 1952..head on down to Fatburger in Thornhill

Used to be ok but now is just rotten! 3 employees totally ignored us for over 2 minutes without even a hello or a can I help you when I walked out the door. Won't come back here and neither should you. I suggest management, if there is any, look into their employees practices because they frickin suck.
Is the goal hockey puck quality? If so, bravo. My burger was super well done. Those fries tho. If u want a beer and a tasteless piece of meat and hot fries... this is your spot.

This was the last stop we went to eat before leaving Vegas and it wasn't too impressed. The burger was very greasy and nothing too special. I really like the location and we ate outside because it wasn't too hot and it was nice to view the strip. I wouldn't jump back in to Fat Burger to have my burger craving but this was on the way out...

Thought my tip would suffice but seeing some bad reviews of the place I just need to put mine in. 

The first time I ever tried Fat Burger was maybe three years ago. I never had any reason not to go to In N Out for a good and fast diner burger. But one drunken night we were in some casino (Red Rock?) where there was conveniently located, a Fat Burger. I can't deny a good old fashioned burger drunk or sober so it was on. 

I'm not dumb or close minded so I wasn't gonna compare them to In N Out or any other burger. Not every burger wants to be an In N Out burger, some burgers just wanna be themselves damnit. I really like this fat guy! He's more than doable for me and I was an instant fan.  

Plain hamburger all day every day. I'm old school. I'd eat it between sandwich bread. The patty is hand formed and made to order and while the flavor is not out of this world it is close to out of the ballpark for me. Not bad at all. I've returned many times to this location. 

Speaking of which, you'd think it's my favorite Fat Burger since there's a full bar outside. Nope. It's actually my least favorite and specifically because of the bar. The service out there sucks big baseballs. Doesn't matter if it's winter or summer, they be freezing. I've never seen so many man bitches. Soo rude and grumpy and not taking any pride in the place like the other workers inside and at their other locations. That's what confuses me. The workers inside at the counter where you order your food are excellent just like the guys at the casino. The manager here was professional and even the cooks were upbeat. I felt extremely welcomed inside and then entirely snubbed outside. 

But unless I'm feeling sensitive, it's the food that I really care about. I'd eat a decent burger from a Yankee fan I would. This here will be my drunk burger. 

I've had the garden burger which I liked fine, but I love frozen garden burgers, so. I tried the turkey burger and it was also fine so I stick to beef since we're all so fine. I prefer In N Outs protein burger because I like the full lettuce wrap as opposed to a salad set up they have here. I'll add bacon and cheese to my burgers if it's one of those nights but if I'm really trying to party I'll add an onion ring to a plain or cheeseburger. Hell yes. The onion rings are what keep me comin. Home run baby. My fave onion ring I've found in burger land.

Fatburger and breakfast? I never really saw myself eating here on a lazy Sunday morning, but a quick and casual breakfast craving brought me here. Plus, seeing that breakfast is served all-day, I can see a breakfast fanatic (me) frequenting this place on more than one occasion.

Don't come here expecting extravagance. You get your typical breakfast sandwich: a bun packed with a sausage patty, cheese, and a fried egg on the bottom. The fried egg was a nice touch, which gave it more a homemade taste that you don't get in most major fast food joints. It's not a gigantic sandwich, but it's a good enough size to get my fill. Although it doesn't specify in the menu, the sandwich comes with a side of tater tots too.. score!

I'd skip out on ordering the OJ. Turns out, it's the bottled concentrated Tropicana stuff. Does not taste fresh squeezed, nor does it taste fresh. Reminds me of the sour OJ sipping sessions during depressing hospital visits. Definitely gonna roll with a coffee on the next visit.

Prices more than reasonable for the breakfast menu. I got my sandwich, tater tots, and OJ all for under $5. I end up spending almost twice that much getting something off the regular menu.

P.S. - Free Wi-Fi is offered here!

Going to Mezza Notte Trattoria last Friday, I saw across the street, a burger joint "Now Open" for business.  I thought I would try it one day in the future.  Fast forward just 5 days, lo and behold... the future has arrived!  Hahaha!!!

I was around the Promenade Mall area today and decided, let's hit up that new burger joint.  I had no idea what to expect because I hadn't read any reviews or heard of this franchise yet.  From Discera Drive, I popped in and immediately, there was a seating area with all tables of peeps chowing down on burgers!  I walked into the place, old school pictures from 1950s America everywhere and... the corridor was kind of narrow before the ordering area.  You'll know what I'm talking about when you enter.  Surprise!  The staff, registers and menus overhead!  

Totally new to this place, all the staff greet, smile and asked if I needed to be served.  I asked the cashier, "What's your recommendation on your most popular burger?"  He let me know that it's the ORIGINAL FATBURGER which I have to try first before any other burger.  Good 'ole American burger.  Saw the picture to the side and fell in love!  Salivating, succulent meat.  For $6.99, that's the one I had to get.  I asked the cashier when they opened up and if there were any others in the country and he said, "Last Friday and many in BC & Alberta"!  It was the first one in Ontario.  So when I saw "Now Open" across the street last week, it was their opening day!  Wow!  Great timing and good location.

On my Original Fatburger, it came with all the toppings listed on the side menu.  Also, you can add 2 FREE toppings to the burger itself.  Excited to add, I got Jalapeño Peppers and Onion Rings to the burger.  Wonderful!

We took a number to our seat and the food was served to us in a couple o' minutes.  Burger looked scrumptous (look at my picture below).  I bit into it and the taste was preeeetty happening.  Condiments were absolutely fresh and crunchy.  The bun was plump and intact.  The beef patty was soft and delicious, although, not as juicy as I would have liked it but there was this nice, distinct taste about the entire burger.  I was happy with it.  By the time I had finished by burger, it became busy and there was a huge line-up.  I guess a lot of people in the Thornhill area needed a new burger fix.  I am most definitely coming back to order again and either get it with cheese and slam a poutine at the same time.  The pictures around the place does it justice.  Give it a try!  It's not a Goody's Burger, Priest Burger or Holy Chuck Burger but it's a close 2nd.  No harminit!

I ordered at 11 and didn't receive my food until 11:30 and there wasn't really that many people there to warrant that long wait time.

Food was good as well as service sans the wait time.

Came here in February and didn't wait nearly as long with 4x as many people there

My second time at a Fat Burger, the first one was in Vegas. This location was great! So much food for the price. They were very friendly and helpful staff. If you want a great HUGE burger. This is your place. They also have the best salad menu ever... check the pic to see what I mean haha :)
Not at all what I remembered, the restaurant and service was great, but the food not so much.   There are other places worth visiting.

The only reason I'm giving one star is because I can't give zero stars. Service was slow. The bartenders are full of testosterone and like to use it to bully their customers. Never have I felt more disrespected as a customer/consumer. At this location the customer definitely does not come first.

Are you KIDDING me? $14 for a combo. Then I waited in the drive through line 15 minutes behind ONE person, gave up, left, never got my food. You losers need to give up and throw in the towel. You are incapable of running a drive through restaurant. You can't even afford to change the numbers on your menu, just taping paper numbers up there. Just give up and go out of business already.

I was so looking forward to eating one of my favorite burgers. First time at this location and my favorite burger was 100% ruined. Ordered 5 burgers and boy were they spicy and salty! I couldn't even taste the meat! Even my kids refused to have their burgers! Horrible! The worst ever! Will never come back to this location again!

I had purchased a Groupon awhile back and never had the chance to use it so it had expired. Recently I read the terms and conditions and it noted that I can speak to the vendor directly and that the money I paid for the Groupon never expires (suh-weeet). We head over to FatBurger and are told to speak to the bar staff. The man behind the counter quickly verified that the voucher was never redeemed and gave us two alcoholic slushies in souvenir cups, featuring up to 50 ounces of drink with 1.25 ounces of alcohol per 10 ounces of slushie ($30 value each) One large order of Fat Fries ($3.20 value). Fries came out quick, fresh, and crispy!

I went to Vegas hell-bent on trying different burger places.  I got to the strip at about 2am and FatBurger was right there so I had to try it.  I had found memories of it from 8-years ago so I had to go and re-live it again.

First Impressions:

I have to say the Late night service kind blows. Took 15 mins to get my order. Food came out in about 5 though. I guess this is how I remembered it.  The cashier took a long time doodling with the register, guest who had already been helped were coming back and trying to add things on or make changes.  It was a cluster F.

It took me 20 mins to get 2-small burger meals with drinks.  That irritated me but I was hungry.

On Second Look:

In my humble opinion, a good burger isn't defined by its gimmick or cult following - but rather it's patty.  This burger's patty was delicious and it complimented the rest of the crap on there.  The mayo and juices were flowing and got me to forget about the sub-par service I got while waiting for it.  I think it's whack that you have to pay extra for cheese, but hey this is America.  

The burger is better than the service.  Go there if you're hungry and want to grub out, but don't plan a trip around it.  They also have an outside bar now which is kind of lame.

Ok... Nothing special. Burgers were way overlooked. Charged me for a shake, didn't bring it, charged me again, found my original receipt, asked for money back, was told it would be easier to just give me another one. Thankfully someone in our group wanted one!  Nice staff. Good chili cheese fries.

I love fat burgers but last time my families order was not right and ever time it gets dirtier and dirtier.  It is so unclean that I stopped going.  For example, go to a smash burger on Sahara and compare the inside and the cleanliness.  I like the taste of FB better but I don't want to eat some place that is dirty.  Imaging what the kitchen, that we don't see, is like.

Wow, terrible costumer service. Called to place an order for pick up. Young lady answers, tells me to hold on. So, I stay on the phone for 5 minutes while I hear chatter in the background that had nothing to do with being busy. Then I heard someone finally pick up the phone and hang it up without even checking to see if someone was on the line. So, I went across the street to 5 guys instead and will from now.

The staff there are so disrespectful and rude. I went in there to order but wasn't even acknowledged and when I finally tried to order, the staff said they werent making the meal in a very disrespectful way

One of our party ordered a burger with no bun, only cheese, bacon, and a fried egg along with an order of sweet potato fries.

It was delivered smothered in sauces, tomatoes, peppers, lettuce.

They forgot the sweet potato fries, too. 

It took nearly 30 mins for them to redo the burger, so everyone else ate while our companion waited.
The food here is greasy and not worth it! The fries also weren't seasoned. 3 stars for the nice cashier.
$13 for a disgusting veggie patty, fries that were stale and beyond greasy, and an iced tea.  PUHLEASE.  So, so, sooooo bad.

Fat Burger. I had my first Fat Burger in Vegas on my burger run. I have to say the burger is a good burger. It's not in the class of a Bachi's or Gordon Ramsey's burger, but it is a good burger. I would certainly buy it again when I'm in Vegas. 3.5 stars.
Hey... soon as I get there... I ordered.... and got my food in 5-7 min... really fast... and great tasting.... thank you guys for amazing burger..my with delicious fat fries......
This burger used to be sooo good. but has suffered over the years. So sad to see the quality go. Thank God The Habit is in town now.

4 stars

First experience - took a cab here from the club before getting dropped off....this experience was between 2-2 1/2 stars. service was ok, fat fries were good, but my medium fat burger w/ chz was really salty on one side. 
Next night I decided to give them another chance.....hiked all the way over here from Wynn at 4am.....I wanted to sober up, so that long walk did the trick. 
This time it was a little different....they had music playing, all the employees were having a great time and the service reflected that....
customers were coming in and dancing or singing along to the music (rap from early 2000 mostly)...and even choppin it up w/ each other while waiting for the food. 
I got a mini fatburger w/ cheese, fat fries, and skinny fries (for my gf). Said bye to my new friends.....grabbed a cab (I was almost sober, so no point in walking back) and headed back. 
Got back quick enough to still have warm food......shook my gf awake and ate.....mmmmmmmmmm mmmmmmm!!!!!!
second night definitely made up for the first night.

If I could have given this place less than one star, I would have.  This place is a total disaster.   

Our sad tale begins by being greeted by our waitress, a woman that would make a skank look classy.  She took our order for a couple of beers and for our food.  She returned 10 minutes later with our beers, but that was the last that we saw her.  I guess that on some level, I should have been thankful. Any prolonged contact with our server would have ensured an incurable case of syphillis at the very least.   Did I mention that she was dirty??

After 45 minutes of waiting for the food, our beers long dry, we sought out our server to find out what was going on.  Upon finding her, the skank threw us a lot shade, and even had the nerve to state that it was my fault that we had been waiting so long.  Yup...skanks truly are dumb. 

At that point, I decided to minimize my contact with my server without having the benefit of a hazmat suit and found the manger.  Of course, he offered to get us our food right away, but we were pushing up on an hour at this point.  While this was all going on, my herpes scarred waitress was screaming that she had done nothing wrong....except be a waste of human life that is.  The manager saw what was going on and offered to comp us our entire check.  That being said, we thanked him, but told him tht he could keep his crap food because my guest and I just wanted to get the hell out of there.

This dump really needs to get a handle on its staff.  Avoid this one at all costs people.  

You've been warned!!

Order started out with the person taking my order asking me how to spell my name. My name is H O L L Y. 
Burger was just ok...
Fries were worth one star 
Pricey. I spent 17.00 on a okay burger, good fries and okay onion rings with a med drink. 
Took them a long time to complete my simple burger order. 

I probably won't go back.
Incredibly slow service. Waited over 30 minutes for 2 burgers, fries and onion rings. Not worth it.

The burgers are decent they are way better in Inglewood though and they racist and rude as hell. I had to ask 5 different people to take a piss, white dude walk right in and he took right to it. Who has a bar with a locked washroom in Vegas of all places.
I love this place because I'm always drunk when I'm here, the chili cheese dogs are da bomb and gin n tonics are 2 for 1! Yeah Vegas!
Shared triple burger with my wife and had perfect people watching over the strip!  Great experience!
Great burger and fat fries! I shod of got that instead of the turkey burger. The turkey was good but when I tasted my hubby's burger, it made me want to get ine.

3.5/5

I'm by no means a burger expert, but I can tell if a burger is good in the sense of juiciness. This place wasn't bad, however I prefer In-N-Out over Fatburger if I were to live in the western US. If only the In-N-Out in Las Vegas was actually on The Strip proper...but I did plan to explore more next time I'm in Vegas.

I had two medium Fatburgers with onion rings for one of them. Believe it or not, the onion rings here are much better than the burgers. I love o-rings that are huge in size, and the fact the onions were also large in size (it's not just batter). This place has both aimed spot on! As for the burgers...I like the fact there are different sizes for the burgers, cause there's no way I'm eating a XL. I also like the fact the burgers are lean beef, so it's less unhealthy for you, although that might have contributed to why I find the burgers not as juicy as In-N-Out.

Again if I had to choose between Fatburger and In-N-Out, it's In-N-Out all the way. However Fatburger is also a great choice for those Vegas folks who don't wanna leave The Strip and want something that's not a buffet or splurge restaurant for a change.

Would have gave it a 3 star for a typical world burger chain restaurant, if it was not for the horrible service. We were walking down the main strip of Las Vegas Blvd. My friend Steve wanted to eat at Denny's, I said Hell no. Let go somewhere it's happening. Well we came up to Fat Burgers, right off the main drag. It was not to busy. I was not to hungry, but I ordered anyway. 

Here what I ordered, a large chocolate shake with whip cream on top, which it was really good. My sister ordered to Fry's, which it tasted like Burger King Fry's. It was not to bad. She also ordered the strawberry shake. She liked it. I drank the rest of it. My friend Steve ordered the chili, he said it was ok. 

Now to the service. We were #62, 63,64,65,66 and 67 were all waited on before we got our food. I sat and watch and stared at this guy making our shake. He took his sweet Ass time. I never in my life seen a human being take so long to make 2 simple shakes. Our waiter was horrid. I think litteredly  think he was stone. I had to ask him where is our food? He said"ah i don't know". We finally got our food 45 minutes later. Remember this is a popular burger joint, the burgers and food are prepped. They suppose to cook the burgers quickly. 

BAD BAD BAD SERVICE for a renowned burger joint, we should have gone to DENNY's, at least we would have got better service. Hope to God the CEO of FAT BURGERS reads this YELP!

I've been to several Fatburger's and they were just ok but I love the Sunset Station location!! The staff is always nice but nothing special. The place is clean but nothing special. But what IS special is what counts, the food! Its fresh, greasy, delicious, perfect!  The burgers are good every time. And not just good but like one of the best burgers I've ever had! I recommend a Double Fatburger with an over medium Fried Egg (cooked whites, runny yolk) and Cheese. Yum! It's SO good!! It's rarely crowded so we order and get served quick! We go often and we'll go again! Recommend this location!!

What burger eater doesn't enjoy a big messy Fatburger?!?

The burgers are cooked to order and offered in a bunch of different sizes with different topping options too.  Probably one of my favorite drunk food choices on the strip.  (kinda hard to get to tho, if I can remember right). 
This spot is open 24 hours and every time I've been, it's been filled with a bunch of drunk customers and funny burger flippers.

Throw a fried egg on my XXL burger with a side of Fat Fries and I wont need to eat for the rest of the day!

Fatburger is the latest in gourmet burger joints that have opened up. The store is at a plaza across from the Promenade mall in Vaughan, it looks like one of those new style urban-like plazas in a suburban environment, definitely unique, despite the setup, there's ample parking at the back so there is no problem.

The place has a 1950s or 60s kind of feel, it's old school, and the staff are friendly, there are a few big screen TVs hanging around too, and it wasn't too loud.

I just got the "baby" Fatburger which seemed bigger than a Quarter Pounder at McDonald's, the patty tasted fresh and had great texture, there's a good selection of toppings. There's a lot of stuff on the menu so you can be a bit overwhelmed.

The milkshakes taste amazing, price is a little steep, and it would be nicer if they had a smaller size for that.

I cannot believe the customer service here. I came through the drive through and had the woman taking me order LITERALLY yell at me. I found out that she was the manager! Such a shame that Fatburger would allow Marisol to be a manager when she doesn't even care about the customers.

Not even worth it. There's an In-N-Out right around the corner and if you really want Fatburger, go to the one inside the Santa Fe.

I love this place - the turkey burger, fries, and shakes are delicious. It's nicely decorated and homey with fun trivia and riddles on the numbered cards they give you to indicate your order. I've never been disappointed here.
Had the XXXL with cheese and bacon. It was amazing! Haley was a superb server! Came by and checked on us constantly.
To be honest I expected better. The burger was sloppy and the food was over-priced. I paid $22 for one combo and one with just a burger and drink. Not cool fatburger!
First off, the food is always great. It's so good. But what made this experience wonderful is JAMIE. She was very nice and professional. Made our dinner well worth it
Not that great of a burger spot, maybe it was because I'm sober and most drunk ppl would say it's all that but the burger is really dry and I honestly would have just went to In and Out instead

Never in my life have I been to a Fatburger- in fact I've never heard of it. Strolled by and saw they have awesome cheap breakfast and even better... strong breakfast drinks! Our server was awesome (beautiful black gal) and the people watching is stellar! Drinks were $10 but strong and food was great. Had a $4 breakfast sandwich and we were set after a few screwdrivers. Patio had nice heaters as well. I dig it!

Cheers to the Saturday late late night cook! The chili I like to order is mild for me so I asked him for the Tabasco since it was put away. He knew what I really wanted and went back to get me diced jalapenos! Best chili there ever! *smile*

Ordered 4 med burgers with cheese, fat fries, onion rings and 4 drinks.  Priced was about $40 which was not bad for a burger joint that is made to ordered. 
we figured it would be a long wait but didn't realize it would be 20 plus minutes.  However after reading all the reviews we knew it was worth the wait.  Burger came out and it was dry, nothing like the other reviews where others said it was juicy.  Huge disappointment!

2 stars since the onion rings and fat fries we decent.

Fatburger. So good. After a long day of golf in 118 degree weather @ Angel Park, this place hit the spot.  Gotta get the fatburger with cheese, add bacon and egg. Man that egg makes the sandwich.  Pair it with a side of fries and wash all that grease down with a thick, ice cold milkshake.

Yes!  For all you hamburger connoisseurs out there. This Fat Burger was amazing and...wait for it...gluten-free buns. Yep! I was pleasantly surprised. I haven't had a bun, strike that, a good bun on a fat burger in years. Thank you! 
Oh, I was daydreaming about the burger. The service was great! The gentleman was nice, knowledgeable and courteous.

I've been to other Fatburger's in the valley and this one is by far the worst. 

Came in here at 5:50pm to order two burgers to go, one medium and one large, with cheese and no tomatoes, and some fries. The cashier was very nice, however don't be fooled, a nice face does not mean a sense of urgency. My order was punched in at 5:59, and since I know the burgers are make to order, I expected the food to be out in about ten minutes.

Wrong. The female cashier and the male cook had absolutely no teamwork whatsoever. They were all over the place and were literally falling apart, with only 4-5 orders on the screen. There was food just sitting under the heat lamp for a good ten minutes before she decided to grab it and hand it off. At the 20 minute mark, I was getting impatient, because an elderly woman got her order (two burgers) before me, and she ordered after me. I politely asked where my food was, and the cook said it was coming right up, and that if I had a complaint, it wasn't their fault because they were short handed. 

That's a load of BS in my opinion. I manage a high volume restaurant and any competent staff can handle multiple orders, ESPECIALLY when the whole menu is essentially burgers and fries. Even with two people, with proper teamwork, sense of urgency, and a sense of priority, they should be able to handle a work load, especially since it is what they are trained to do. 

6:34 comes around and I finally get my food, along with one other woman that was waiting for her orders to come out, which had a long ticket time as well. The cashier went up to me and said if I came in next time and said they botched my food, I would get a replacement. I don't want a replacement. I want to go into a food establishment, and get my order within a reasonable time period. 30 minutes is not acceptable ticket time for two burgers that weren't even made properly. 

Other locations are good, just this one needs some serious improvement.

One of the slowest "fast food" experiences I have seen.  The staff couldn't try any harder not to look more uninterested in serving the customers either.  The food however is pretty tasty for a burger joint, and the prices are what you would expect from a casino.  You can do better, but if a burger and fries are what you crave.  This is as good as it gets.

Very poor in sanitization, employees are very rude to customers. Once saw a employee yell at a newer employee calling him some very rude names. Don't listen at all to what's going on the burger. I've gone 6 times to this location And only once have they even gotten close to making my order right... also once again sanitization is very poor needs to be greatly improved(found mold in my soda about 3 times)... only good things I've had I can say are amazing are the Fries and the milkshakes.. I prefer the one on the strip may not get my food on a timely manner but is way cleaner and more friendlier than here.

This place is pretty cool because it is open 24/7 and has quality burgers better than your fast food joints like Carls Jr, McDonalds, Burger King...etc 

The price point isn't too bad. It sort of has a diner feel? My girls and I came here because we were starving, and this place didn't seem too bad. I had the Grilled Chicken Burger and it was pretty plain, but the meat had flavor to it. The fries were whatever. My gfs burger was yummy with melted cheese on it. 

They obviously don't have the best burgers, but they do have basic stuff to satisfy your hunger!

Fatburger used to be good but those days are long gone!  I went to the sunset station one a few months ago and that experience was disappointing as well.  

When you pull up to the drive thru you get to look at the ghetto sign with paper taped over the old prices as you are waiting..and you will definitely wait here!  The food was expensive.. for two burgers, fries and drinks it came to over $30!  The food was okay and I got some crazy stomach pains and diarrhea later that night!  Save yourself some money and from food poisoning and stay far away from this nasty place!  

This was the last time we will visit a fatburger!

Paid $36+ for two burgets, fries, onion rings, and two drinks and waited 25 minutes for our food.  We ended up getting our food to go because it took so long.  When we got to the car the onion rings were cold.  We will not be returning to this location.

Jack, was very awesome! 
He was funny and had quality customer service! He made me and my mother laugh as we were ordering! There should be more people like him working in any customer service industry! He had a very pleasant personality. He truly made our experience in Vegas amazing! He would be the reason we would eat at Fat Burger as we only came to order fries. He deserves a promotion!!!!

Open 24 hours does not make this place good.  We stumbled in here as the sun was rising for a nice burger and a breakfast sandwich, and I have never been so disappointed by a place in my life.

The food took forever, with about only 3-4 people ahead of us.  Also while waiting we witnessed a fight between two guys waiting in line, rolling on the ground with light slapping back and forth.

Then I made the mistake of going to the bathroom.  I have never, ever seen a bathroom as bad as this one.  The Caution Wet Floor sign was up, implying that they mopped, but that bathroom has not seen a mop or cleaning materials in a long time and smelled horrible.

Our food eventually came out and was really mediocre, between all of us there, most said they wished we went to McDonalds instead and the rest said they wished they had not ordered anything at all.

I would never go back.

My first time here and all I can day is Bomb.com! 
Everything was great from the food to customer service.   The burgers were made to petfection and the burgers were delicious. I will definitely make this a stop every time I come to Vegas! The service was an absolute 10...

I showed up here after work to get a burger and fries on Saturday night at 410am. The posted hours on the door read open until 5. The employees inside locked the door, then proceeded to laugh and ignore me. Unprofessional, and infuriating.

now this is the "best" hamburger around. huge, thick & juicy really flavorful. the relish & pickles just kill. the onion rings were super-fresh hot & crispy
this place is great-it doesn't matter where it's located in a food court or a stand-alone shop. they are always consistent. 

every thing is made to order. and the burgers always leave you wanting more. 

I lived across the street from in & out burger for 3 years-they are good but-fatburger is #1. 

always good service, fast & friendly staff, place is always clean & the decor is traditional burger stand. we love it!!!

Get yourself a baby fat meal with fat fries & a shake you won't regret it. Voted Best Fast-Food Burger!
Great late night place for burger and beer. In the middle of the strip so easy to walk to.  If you are low carb like me you can order without a bun... Yummy :-)

How can you not love this place. Open late, right on the strip, not too overpriced, great food, all the good stuff.
So its 3am and we've been walking the strip and most like several beers in. I'm in town for a convention and havent had a really good meal since i arrived. The co-worker i'm with says "We gotta go to Fat Burger". Being from the East Coast i had never heard of it, so I decided to give it a shot. Place looks nice enough, will have to go without beer for a half hour. I get in line, look at the menu, and decide the burger is where its at. I get up front and see a sign "Free fries with purchase of beer". What? They serve beer here too?  Hence the 4 up to 5 stars. So the burger was fantastic, and really hits the spot at that time in the evening/morning. The fat fries were just regular steak fries, but man those burgers hit the spot.
Looking forward to going back my next time out west.

I ordered a small Fatburger, while by boyfriend ordered a large Fatburger.  The burger was really greasy, which was a major turn off.  You could see the grease dripping off the paper.  Service was good and the vegetables were fresh.  I guess next time I'm eating at Fatburger, I'll order a grilled chicken sandwich, turkey burger, or veggie burger.  The grease ruined my appetite.

Ambience. B
Service. A
Food. A
Price. A

Open 24/7!

The Mgr recognized even after my 2nd time after two. Days. Nice friendly Service taking orders and patient in options and getting what you want!
 
They are constantly cleaning.  It's hard to clean up after a drunkenly Vegas strip and they strive to get it done.  Even to the bathrooms.  Stop making a mess people!

I ordered my burger with everything with extra pickles and lettuce.  Gives a nice sourly crunch with each bite.  The fat fries were nice and hot and fluffy inside. Mayo with my fries please!

Total. Under $11!  Glad they were open. As it was hard to find good food around this part at this early morning hour. 

I'm a fan early this morning a 4 am!  Burp!

I love fatburger...i prefer it over in-n-out because the fries are spectacular and the burgers actually have meat in them. Now, I might be starting a war on this subject but if White Castle was in AZ, I would take that over both.  Fat burgers are good, juicy, and quick....and STEAK FRIES I LOVE STEAK FRIES.  Also, I agree with Stephanie L...if you don't like drunk college kids...then choose another location.  I like the bacchanus atmosphere myself.

The kingburger supreme is still one of the best burgers around, but they don't have the potato chip like fries anymore. They were fantastic, too bad because the normal fries are typical frozen crap.

I guess it will save me money getting burgers only

3.5 stars, IMO ... The burger was over salted, but had nice crispy edges... The drinks were WEAK...I would've sworn that my first cocktail was all coke and no rum.

Service was spotty, but that's to be expected at an outdoor patio spot...

It was a great outdoor spot to perch up and people watch. The people factor in Vegas never disappoints! 

I'm an in N out girl....

Don't bother with this place...  Worst experience ever.

The choice was McDonald's or Fat Burger,  My wife and I decided to try this place more so because McDonald's was crowded and we also wanted to sit down and enjoy a drink or two :)

We walked in bar area and were told by one of the guys cleaning the tables that we could sit at any of the table and order our food and drink there.  Well we waited and waited and we waited a bit more... The lady servers kept ignoring us and a few other people sitting at the other tables... We waited around  30 minutes or more

In the end our patience ran out and we walked out... As we left two young ladies were handing out coupons to people passing by to get them to go in.... Really why... You could not take care of customers who were actually there...  

The good news is we did not waste our money on this dive and found a place that served just what we wanted.. sadly no drinks... but awesome customer service... Check out my review on that place and give this dump a miss.

Every time I feel like and old fashion greasy burger, this location seems to fill that urge! The XXL with thick cut fries never seem to disappoint. Probably one of the best and more consistent burgers with so much flavor you can't go wrong except for the price ($18) for the combo. Groupon had one of the best groupons for this location, but they were probably losing money with it. Hands down best shake in the near area and always consistent with Haagen Daz ice cream!

Wish the wait wasn't so long BUT it's so worth it. Can't be compared to any other burger because it's so different. 
BTW make sure you get yourself a side of "Chipotle Tobasco Sauce" and pour it all over the inside of your burger and you will never regret it!!!

I get to review the bar service, food, and table service. Why, bar and table, read on...

Bar-2:30pm only 6 people spread out around a circular bar. Cut a pie in fourths and I took the last remaining section. The bartender waited/stood in one section and didn't move out of that area for 15min (not exaggerating) except to make drinks in service bar or talk to couple near service bar or check her phone (3x), never once looking at or acknowledging other customers. Granted it gave me PLENTY of time to study the menu and decide what I wanted, AND search my phone for other options. But, I wanted a burger.

Table- So, I switched to a table top, since they looked like they were getting waited on.  Again, not many people and service was slow but at least some one showed up to take an order. Service was-take order, run, drop, run, ask if u need anything as she's almost to next table, drop check. Sigh

Food- I sat across from a sign saying "voted best burger in Las Vegas."
WOW, WoW, wow, the standard for burgers must be REALLY low for Las Vegas. My niece and I have made it our mission to search the DFW area for  the best burger, so I have some idea.
The pattie reminded me of a bulk stack of patties I once and last time bought from Walmart.
The rest of the burger, reminded me of Burger King. 
Note to self- got to Burger King, faster, better!

Last Friday, my family and I went to the Texas to bowl and while there we decided to eat at the Fat Burgers. When our meals were ready, in which took them a long time to prepare, the buns were toasted to hard and overall the burgers, and the chicken sandwich was disgusting, even the strawberry shake was awful. Plus, it was too expensive to taste that lousy. That being the case, I will never, ever eat there again nor will I recommend it to my many circles of friends.
Ate there last weekend. Cashier was really nice! Great service. Just a warning though the burgers are huge lol. I didn't even finish half.

My husband and I had the original Fat burger with the fat fries and a coke. It was all delicious. The food was almost $30 for the 2 of us, which was pricey, but it seems like everything is Vegas is expensive. The service was fast and friendly. The food was good, but it's a little overrated.

This is convenient because it's on the strip and not buried in the depths of a hotel. There's ample indoor and outdoor seating. 

It's a typical Fatburger which means juicy burgers, and the fat fries (nice steak cut fries) are a must. This location is a bit pricey; now this just could be that I haven't been to a Fatburger since I moved away from LA, or their prices are just higher since it's on the strip. I'd go with the latter.

The wait is kinda ridiculous here. There was no one in front of me, and all I ordered was a cheeseburger and fries, and I waited like 30 minutes for my to-go order. Also, my burger came to me way before my fries, even though I was taking it to go, so I was pretty concerned my food was going to get cold. It's weird because loads of others got their fries before me, and I had to ask about my fries after my burger came, so I think they just kinda forgot part of my order.

Ultimately, this was an ok meal. I was in town because my boyfriend was at a convention, so I just wanted to grab something quick and take it back to the room since I was solo at the time. I just really wanted some fat fries though.

In Vegas, there's so many places that are better than this, and probably quicker (and maybe cheaper) that I'd prefer to spend my money elsewhere. 

This location is convenient enough to the Tropicana Hotel and MGM though if you need a snack.

Really? You are charging this much for a burger & drink?

Okay, they are open 24 hours...that is cool.  Okay, you do have a nice bar set up outside...this is cool also, even for a person that does not drink such as myself.  Yet, your prices are crack head crazy!

I must admit, the burger is not already made, already pressed meat filler substance that most chain restaurants serves you.  You had real beef on your metal tray, and you can taste the difference.  The strawberry banana shake, and the chocolate banana shake was both awesome.  Fresh ingredients in those most definitely, which you verified by not having all the banana completely shaken in your shake.  Yet, you charge for everything.  You want both buns, another 50 cents. Cheese is $1, straw for your shake is $1, use the restroom is $1, and looking in the direction of the bathroom is 50 cents.  

They made sure to have some of the decorum in a retro style diner set up, which was nice for nostalgia sake.

All in all, I think you should try this place at least once just to form your own opinions, but I know that my wallet will rarely make my way to this place, ESPECIALLY CONSIDERING that there are buffets that cost about the same price as a cheeseburger combo with the works!

Came for the impossible burger. Yet another place with no vegan bun and the lettuce here is shredded so a wrap won't happen. It was tasty but still annoyed that when you say vegan they don't know what that is. The wife got a real meat burger and it looked good.

Fatburger is one of my favorite fast food places to go to. Unfortunately, this time they failed. 

Over $50 in food for three people, we ended up taking home the following:
Overcooked burgers with little to no juice, which is something I appreciate Fatburger for... a good juicy burger. 
Horribly made milkshakes, Oreo was like drinking a cookie and the chocolate was so runny that it was like drinking chocolate milk. 
Vile onion rings and poorly made French fries. 

But it all started in the place when our food was ready way before our shakes, which the young man who was on the shake station forgot to make the two chocolate ones. So instead of being home in the 10-15 minute timeframe before the fries get too cold, etc.; we ended up going over that timeframe by about 20 minutes. 

Very disappointing and frustrating experience. Definitely will NOT be visiting this location ever again.

So after a little time spent in the pool, we went up to our room, showered and had to decide what we wanted to eat. I have Subway all the time and was in the mood for something else. My girlfriend, her cousin and I went with Fatburger. They both got burgers, I was feeling chicken so I got myself a spicy chicken sandwich and got some fat fries for a side.

After having my chicken sandwich, I was wishing I had the burger. It was your standard chicken sandwich. Not spicy, more peppery. The only heat it had was in it's temperature. The chicken was steamy inside the outside crispy layer. Took a little bit of time before I could eat it without burning my mouth.  It was a tasty chicken sandwich, but the burgers looked so much better.

I have had Fatburger in the past, but it's at least 8 years since my last one. Maybe I'll grab one on another night. I'll be staying in the Fiesta for the next week.

It was midnight when we arrived in Las Vegas and 3am technically for us since we came from NYC. My friend and I were starving right out from the airport as we were about to check in on our hotel we drove around to grab something quick to eat.

We ended up here in Fat Burgers and just randomly went in. I've got the fat burger medium meal as my friend tried out the turkey burger. You had a choice to add a topping for 1 dollar each however you want it. I chose cheese and a fried egg which was nice. I have to say the burgers were really juicy though not the healthiest late night meal, we were satisfied and once we got back to the hotel we were knocked out and slept well.

Great late night food!

Came here for drinks but ended up ordering burgers too. A fast food joint with alcohol?! COME ON! The chicken burger didn't even taste like fast food, it was sooo goooood! Almost gourmet.. maybe ? I enjoyed the fat fries also. 
We got two large drinks and a fat fry for $42 on Groupon-- well worth it. I'd highly recommend the strawberry margarita.
