The waitress recommended strawberry and Miami vice, I honestly didn't like this at all. I felt as though she was rushing to take our order and didn't seem genuinely interested in giving suggestions. 
Also, we asked for the bill but stayed for a few mins after it was brought to us. Right away the amount of the bill and 20% tip was placed into the bill holder.  About 20 mins after getting the bill, we gathered our stuff to leave. The waitress passed by and saw us near the exit and said "did you ladies leave the bill?" ... clearly we asked for it --- why wouldn't we leave it?  I might be overthinking but that was just weird since a group of females sitting at the bar got up.. left and weren't asked if they paid. Actually, our waitress never even asked if we were doing okay during our time there.

Walking around the strip late at night, and drinking made the hubby and I hungry. So, we stumbled into Fatburger.

They had a drink special; buy one drink, get the other drink free, so that was a special that we monopolized on. We were greeted fairly quickly after seating ourselves by a waitress that never seemed to hear me. I ordered a turkey burger (add an egg) and the hubby ordered a traditional beef burger and fries. 

There was literally nothing special about our food.  Did someone order "extra ordinary for two"? That is what we got.  The fries were pretty good, however, everything else was average! 

We will skip this burger spot next time.
Just sat in the drive thru from 12:38pm-1:06pm and our order was not complete, nor was it correct!! Very disappointing!!!!!!!

Overall good place to eat. I been to this location about 5 times now and it's good to decent. That restaurant itself isn't the cleanest. The bathroom is very old, the restaurant is kinda old now that I think about it. 

Fatburger gets very expensive well. Two people getting a 5 oz burger cost around 20-25 bucks! (Adding fries & a drink). Too much in my opinion. 

However, the food is good, and the shakes are very good. That is the main reason in why I like Fatburger. The customer service is good as well. This place is a three star overall I can't see it being more than that.

Waiting for a flight around midnight and never had Fatburger ever so we went in to try it out. We ordered 3 meals which totalled  $60... food was definitely overpriced for what we got. Everything was crappy and I know I'm never going back. Glad we tried it cause now we know.

We went here because my boyfriend thought it was so good and I had to try it.  Anytime I go to a new burger joint I always try the burgers exactly as offered in the menu.  So I ordered a fatburger with fries.  The server asked what kind of cheese I wanted and I said cheddar.  When she rang it up my jaw just dropped...$24 for two fast food meals?  When we sat down we figured out that cheese was an add on for 99 cents and they upsized the drinks and fries with out asking or even mentioning it.  
When we got our burger it was dry and over cooked. My boyfriend says they usually aren't like that though.  
A note to the owner:  I understand your employees were trained to do that and they did get an extra few bucks out of me this time but you won't get another dime from me.  Over cooked was forgivable but sneaky business practices are not.

Pros 
- Open super late
- Friendly cashier offered me a complimentary taste/small serving of the "famous frozen custard"
- Good, flavorful burgers (especially when you get them hot off the grill...see below) 

Cons
- Long, unnecessary wait was very frustrating!

I waited patiently for my burger to find out that it had been ready for 15+  minutes and the server had the wrong number for some reason. She was standing right next to me, and I even asked her if it was my order a few times. Lame! Would have been great if she offered to make a hot, fresh one. 

It was nice to try the custard, but I didn't think it was extraordinary...who considers it famous anyway?

I haven't had a fatburger in ages so decided to order a freaking large fatburger with fat fries and a drink.  Omg them fries were awesome and the burger, Jesus Christ it was delicious, had a hard time devouring it all :D

I Love Fatburger, but I was very disappointed with this location. My husband and I not only ordered the same burger and was overcharged in one of them, but they also got my order wrong. The manager didn't want to give us back the money extra nor did they offer to remake my burger how I ordered it. Bottom line, lack of customer service, especially for paying $35!! Never again.

Great casual burger joints with a little more class than a drive through. 
They customize your burger just the way you want in front of you and the huge fries are really yummy too. I don't eat a lot of fast food, but I would trust Fat Burger more than most places for a great burger! 
Also try a great milkshake!
For the fact it's says 24 hours and closed at 1:16am on a Friday night. Drove over for nothing. Update your info please-

Aye, if you're looking for a good burger with authentic topics and flavor right on the strip, this is your spot. Legitimate burger. A medium will fill you up just fine and it's pretty expensive to add to it aside from the basics. But totally worth it if you do! I got a medium with chili and cheese. Real chili and not some weird Texas Pete out the can type ish. This is good stuff. Stop by for a quick bite!

I remember years ago going to Fatburger and having a juicy fabulous burger that made you dream later of the wonderfulness you had just experienced!

NOT this time! Just not what I remember..... It wasn't the worst burger I have had.... but not memorable either.

I really wanted to give them 2 stars for the lacking of taste and quality... I tasted more relish than burger! 
I gave them 3 stars because of the fond memories of good burgers in the past!

These burgers are A-OK, I like that you can get a small, medium, large, x-large, and super large sized burgers.  I ordered a medium and it was a little juicy (not bad for a fast food burger) but I would still say that 5 guys or Smashburger is a little better.  Still these guys don't make a bad burger at all and I would stop in again and recommend it if you are a burger connoisseur that needs to taste every burger.  I like that this location is close to my office and I was headed to Culver's before I came here but that place smelled so bad inside I had to walk out.  I also like the atmosphere here, it is a nice clean casual looking place and comfortable to enjoy a quick lunch.

The food is ok, good, nothing out of the extraordinary! If you've never been there I do recommend you go at lest once, it's one of those type of restaurants. I sat out side in the FATBAR, but I wasn't ordering alcoholic beverages so the lazy waitress said to go order inside cause the out door sitting area of the restaurant is a whole different owner or some non-sense like that.

Pros:
Well made burgers

Cons:
Size of sides lacking
Burgers can get really expensive

The family was feeling burgers so we decided to try out a new place.  We usually see this place when we're going to the T and T nearby.  As soon as you walk in, it looks like one of those diners from the 80s.  I liked the theme of the place.  It gave off a nice vibrant feel.

We ordered an angus burger and bacon cheeseburger combo as well as a kids meal.  You order at the front and the servers bring it to your seat when the food is ready.  It doesn't take too long when it'snot busy.  When we were finishing up it was a little busy and the wait times were about 10-15 minutes after ordering.

The burgers here are very well made.  It's a very good overall burger.  Everything is made to order so you know your burger is fresh as can be.  Burgers here range from about $8-$12.  If you add some extras like an egg, bacon, etc. your burger easily becomes a $15 dollar burger.  You still don't have any sides yet.  Getting a combo will set you back an extra $4.

Look, a $10 burger won't bother me if it's well made.  Fatburger makes a really good burger so that's fine.  It's the sides here that bother me.  The size you get here is pathetic.  I got an onion rings for my combo and my wife got the fries.  I think I had about 8 onion rings in total.  My wife had about 20 fries at best.  When you're charging $4 for a side and a drink, that's way too little to give.  You're going to be spending about $15-20 on a combo, you should be full after.

Fatburger makes a good burger, there's no doubt about that.  I just wished they would give you more value for on the sides.  If they change the portion size on those, this easily becomes a go to for me in the future.

My husband and I think Fat burger is the best tasting burger we ever get. When we try new places we always compare the burger to fat burgers and fat burger always wins. A  place may have better fries but will not have have a better home cooked burger

i like the burgers there dont get me wrong but they are so pricey,i dont go that often but my daughters like them so i went,i got to save my money to go to a fast food joint,pricey................................

Really good burgers for a fast food place in a casino. Burgers are prepared fresh when you order them. Fries are either thick cut or skinny. Could have used some kind of seasoning, salt or something. But otherwise the burger really was good!

It was a good burger. The food was plentiful as the name of the restaurant implies. Rihht now they are doing a limited time offer for a orange Creamsicle milkshake that was out of this world!! I honestly wish the serving was bigger. It was thick and creamy and delicious.

A typical burger place with the obligatory vegetarian burger option. This one is located in the Red Rocks Casino food court.

The veggie patty was a much thicker version of a Boca Burger (I actually had to pick at the burger before eating it because I thought for a moment they gave me a meat patty). 

The burger was tasty and very hearty, although there was too much relish on it which made the bun a little soggy on top. The fries that accompanied the burger were good - freshly made, hot and crisp.

One of my favorite guilty pleasure spots in Vegas. It's one of those places you truly love after you've had a few (dozen) drinks.

Honestly it's a typical burger place but the burger and fries are A+. In my opinion they are better than in-and- out burger and I know people would kill me for saying that.

The portions are huge. And unfortunately the service is slow. What do you expect though?

They offer skinny fries and fat fries. Always fat fries- always and I have to add cheese, bacon and egg to my burger. Oh yeah, and a Diet Coke because I'm watching what I'm eating. ;)

The best part about this place is that it's open 24/7 so you can get your fat on any time you want!

This was my first time eating here and the experience was alright. The employees were nice and prompt to take my order. I ordered it to go and was disappointed when I got back to work and noticed they had put everything on my Chicken Sandwich when I had asked for it plain. It wasn't a big deal scrapping off the lettuce but it's always annoying having to fix your food before you eat it. They had 50's music playing and the decorations were in the same vein although it didn't really have the overall 50's diner feel I think they were going for. All in all, I still enjoyed my food and will probably go back to this place in the future.

While looking for a place to eat in the middle of the night after had just arrived from the airport, we ended up here.  How bad can it be? Its a burger joint.  I opted for a small burger, perfect size for me and cooked the way I wanted.  Service was fast which we were happy about since we were so hungry.  Not bad for a quick meal, fast and affordable.

Love me some Fatburger, but disappointed this evening by the shops dirty appearance, along with the fact they were out of root beer, and when asked to substitute a turkey patty for a hamburger patty on a mushroom burger, it just proved too difficult for the counter staff to comprehend.

I enjoy coming to this location, but when you arrive and there is only one other customer in the shop you would expect for the shop to be spotless or at least the staff working towards that goal.

The restrooms are a completely separate conversation as they are filthy, and I wonder how they pass health inspections? Once you go in, you wonder how you are going to exit the space without catching something.  Urinal has been covered for weeks.  What does it take to clean a window or door??

Took forever for the food. Very hot inside restaurant. Turkey burger was tasteless and disgusting, I didn't finish it. Kids burger wasn't much better,my child didn't eat it all either. Onion rings were gross also. Very pricey for the food we got. Not going back yuck.

What better way to satiate your drunken munchies in Vegas than to go to Fatburger.  I had the King burger with egg.  To tell you the truth I was too faded to even remember how it tasted.  2 important things:  1) I was able to eat it, 2) I didn't puke.  I'd say that's a good sign that It's at least worth three stars.

It was 2:30 in the afternoon, not a busy time at all. We pull up to the drive thru and they said they need a minute because of a shift change. We didn't know what we wanted so we said that was ok. After discussing what we wanted for 5 minutes, we told them we were ready. The lady then told us we needed to wait another 10 minutes because they were busy inside??? We pulled around and saw a total of 6 customers inside, which most of them already had food. Horrible service, horrible priced food which we didn't even get to try, and terrible workers. I'd advise everyone to stay away from this place

Burger is pretty good. But they charged for ranch witch is on the free menu also charged $1 to cut my burger in half. Wtf a dollar to cut the burger and didn't even tell you it cost a dollar. $2 dollars for cheese and In the pics it has cheese on it. But will definitely say the burger is good. Customer service a little lousy though.

The famous Fatburger! We stopped here around 12:30 a.m. on our first night in town after a long day of flying into Vegas at 6 a.m. and then perusing the strip. We all got a Fatburger and fries, and they had some deal going where you got your fries free if you got a draft beer. Definitely a good deal with the high prices of Vegas. The burgers were good, but in my opinion just your basic quick burger. Not the best burger I've ever had, but I'm glad I checked it out. The outdoor/patio bar is great too on a nice summer night!
Excellent service as usual from Duwan tonight!! Nice clean place.. the food and service is great!

Fatburger in Red Rock is one of my consistent sanctuaries in Las Vegas. 
Usually I am here babysitting my grandmother during the weekly drawings on the weekends. The wonders an order of fat fries with cheddar and a chocolate shake can do for your soul is wonderous. ^_^

Okay. What do you do when you're starved for a Fatburger when last time you were in Vegas, you were rushed off with no time to get one? Come back two weeks later and find the Fatburger closest to the Airport!

This one is usually crowded but I got lucky during 11pm arrival. What makes me give them an extra star above the normal three is that the cook suggested a new way to a favorite Fatburger staples: cheddar Fat Fries. Most awesome ever. How so? The cook melted cheddar at three different levels of my fries, not creating a cap, but actually soaking my fries in the greatness that which is cheddar. 

Plain medium fatburger with cheddar was perfect and my shake was great. Service was greatly appreciated.
Great when you're out and about at 3am and weaving in between the hookers that roam the streets late at night.

we just left fatburger downtown Vegas. Very bad service. Didn't even ask how we were doing or checked on how was our food or drink. I was almost choking on my burger cus I didn't have anything to drink.  Negative 5 stars

after a few days of dining in the casinos (buffets, restaurants, etc etc), it was a big sigh of relief to order a burger and fries. what can you expect from a fast food burger joint? it does do "made to order" style burgers...and it did get a bit backed up. me and my cousin had 2 orders and it took over 10 minutes, which was fine. 

mixed crowd inside, and it was in a shady part of the stripe. lol. we did take out and walked back to our hotel while eating. pretty tasty!! i would say its better than In-and-Out burger down the road!

I've not always received the friendliest service at this (or any really) location.  However I found Yaz here to be the nicest, most customer-focused person I've encountered in any "fast food" atmosphere.  Her beaming smile and genuine helpfulness was awesome.

The hands down, absolute best fast food burgers anywhere. I don't want to hear about In & Out either. They are good, but nothing is better than Fat Burger.

Fatburger offers you different size burgers. The XXL is way more than I should eat, but I eat it anyways. The toppings, the meat, and the fries are all much better than any other fast food place out there.

The staff is very friendly at this location and they are open late. Nothing compares to a Fatburger!!

Veggie Burger in Vegas! For vegetarians on the Vegas strip, this is a good pick! Being an Ovo-Lacto veg head I had the veggie burger with cheese and a fried egg. Messy as hell and good as shit! (that's a compliment) My friends liked the regular burgers, the only "meh" to be heard was for the chicken strips. The staff was excellent. We had a group of about fifteen and the service was great. Outdoor seating with misting to keep it cool. Wish we had them in Atlanta!

It's a tradition to sit out on the out door patio of Fatburger located right on the Las Vegas strip, dead center of all the craziness. At night they have bartenders who flare and  play good music like Kaskade (and similar artist) that makes you want to get your food and fuel for the next party. During the day it's just a nice shaded spot  which I can personally hang out at for hours until the sun goes down. The food is excellent but do not expect any healthy alternatives if you are watching your weight but who can stay on a diet while on vacation in Vegas, what is the point? The inside of Fatburger is for the families with childern to help shield them from the drunks and exposed bodies that walk the strip. I have only walked through to use the restroom :)...which is a disaster but you win some you lose some.
Good but a little overpriced, all the burgers are good, I've only tried the regular fryes not bad but they have lots of othere options.

Gave 1 star because the guy on staff that took our order was nice, polite and smiled a lot ..Cost $30 for 2 of the smallest cheeseburger meals. Floors were sticky all over the store. Tables not. Leaned. Bathroom was in terrible Gross shape. Soda machine was out of syrup. Napkin dispensers were empty... the 7 employees I saw were all hanging out in the back by the cook. Not once did any of them come out to the lobby to clean up or do anything that resembled work. Got our food and the buns were so old I literally checked for mold... all on a slow Sunday afternoon. No leadership. Can't imagine how dirty the kitchen is since the soda machine looks like it hasn't been cleaned in over a year.. just bad.. could have spent literally half the amount somewhere else and not had to worry if I was going to get e-coli poisoning.. #nevergoback

I love the decor of the Fat Burger with its counter seating and old timey feel. The prob is that a meal is just about $10 for a burger, fries, and drink. That's outrageous for fast food in my opinion. 

They are currently running an interesting promotion where you buy a meal, and they give you a second burger for free. I guess if you have a hungry friend along who can cope with sharing your fries and drinking water, this would be a great cheap date place! ;-)

Best thing I ate here were the fries, Picked the skinny ones, as opposed to the steak fries. Very crispy outer shell and only slightly salty. A very clean natural flavor. 

The burger patty was tasteless as seems to be the M.O. for fast food joints these days with their overcooked meat. Nothing at all special about the burger.

Overall, I'd rate In N Out higher than the Fat Burger, since there is no equal to In N Out's Animal Style topping combo.
Always get the XXL with no bun for a delicious low carb meal. Pricey compared to most hamburger spots but in my opinion very tasty meal. Always made fresh to order. Friendly staff.
Very pricey but in my opinion a very good burger. I prefer it low carb style(no bun) & using a knife and fork. Friendly staff. Great people watching if sitting outside.

Compared to other FatBurgers I've been to, this one is lackluster.  Despite being a chain, the burgers here are not as tasty for some reason, maybe due to cooking technique?  The shakes are more watery than thick, and employees are generally disinterested and indifferent.

Oh baby! Fatburger was too good.

I visited this burger joint for the first time last night with a Yelp coupon. A $5 6oz AAA angus beef burger with Canadian cheddar cheese and free customized toppings. I dressed mine with grilled onions, an onion ring, pickles, lettuce, tomato and mayo. It paired nicely with a $4 pint of Amsterdam. The burger melted in my mouth! It was fresh and bundled up tightly in it's blanket/wrapper.

The staff were super pleasant too. The guy on cash was efficient and finished my sentences. 

me: "what toppings can i..."
him: "right here on this list"

me: "what's the secr.."
him: "it's like a spicy ketchup"

He and another lady came by twice to check on us.

Great customer service, amazing taste and quality. I'll be back for sure!

We love Fat Burger.  The food is miles better than In-N-Out, and usually this is a really fun chain to eat at, but we have completely given up on this location for one reason and one reason only...

The employees need customer service training.

One occasion, we showed up 15 minutes before the sign said they closed, and they rushed to the door & told us they were closed.

Next trip, we walked in and the girl behind the counter who takes orders was sitting on the counter (no customers in store at the time), chatting with the cook and took her sweet ass time getting over to the cash wrap to take our order despite looking right at us when we walked in...and when she finally saunter over, she said not a WORD.  Just stood there glaring at us, waiting for us to say something.

Normally this location (unless really busy) brings your food to your table when its ready.  On the last several trips, despite being the only folks in the place, the cook waves his spatula at you & says "ready!" while same lazy cashier girl sits on her ass.

It's no wonder this location never has any customers any more.  We take the extra time & effort to go to the Desert Ridge location instead now.

I wonder why the management of this location hasn't wised up yet.  Clearly his/her business is suffering & its all due to the shitty attitude of the employees!
Amazing how they transform a burger!!!  Pretty sure the best I've ever had!!!!  Definitely going to recommend it to others!!!!

First place I've ever been where an employee needs to unlock the door for you to the restroom!!! It was very strange. I just assumed that you would go up to the counter, get the key and do your thing. But nope, the guy walked back w/ me, unlocked the door and off he went. The thing that was also weird was that it was a multi person bathroom.

We walked in, we had never been here before, and it was a straight shot to the cash register. The way this place is set up is awkward and if there would have only been 3-4 people ahead it would have put almost back to the door. I could see how during busy times it would suck cause you would be stuck outside while standing in line.

We got up to the register and looked for a menu, there was none. All they had was a little laminated sheet that told you what the burger toppings were. They have a digital menu, but it is not helpful. In my opinion the screen moves waaaaaay too fast, you see something that looks good but then the screen changes. It a pain cause while you are trying to figure out what you want, you also dont want to hold up the line either.

We finally decided on our order and purchased 3 cheeseburgers, and order of fries, 1 soda and 1 strawberry shake and it cost around $45!!!

The burgers were VERY good though. The buns were butter grilled, the burger was very juicy and had a good flavor. I especially loved the crispy char on the ring of the burger. The fries were cooked to perfection. They give you the option of steak cut fries or thin...we opted for the thin ones. My strawberry shake was creamy and had chunks of strawberry in it. I am not sure what I was expecting in regards to the shakes. A lot of places I have ordered strawberry shakes from have just used the flavoring, so I was thinking it was going to be something along the lines of that. I am glad that I was wrong...these shakes were REAL ice cream and REAL strawberries. The shake took a little while to make, but it was totally worth it.

I would consider coming back here. The service was great as was the food. The price was just a little much for no more than what we ordered. If this was a sit down type of place and included a side and/or drink it would have been different. They were also running a Groupon deal, but it wasnt valid for this location.

Not a fan of this location, I do think it's great they have Boca Burgers though.  I generally thing FatBurgers are great, and employees are nice but this one the employees are always so unpleasant.  And the food is simply not as good as the other locations.  This one is simply a disappointment.

Very lousy hamburgers and service was awful. I had heard this place was good for years but was disappointed. I had a movie ticket and they refused to give me my 10% discount. Employees speak little or no English and have poor customer service skills.

every time i come here when I'm in Vegas it is awesome. the one in SA sucked and closed, so I'm not sure what makes these so different but the only thing that's sad here is the price. the burgers are pricey and not all that big. but they are certainly Delicious. (get the fat fries, they are wayy better than the reg fries)

Updating my review,

The only time I feel a restaurant deserves a 1 star review is of I got sick eating their food...

I got sick and got runs that night.. Not to mention in my review after the meal, I mentioned the meat with very pink..

Went there breakfast/ lunch, first meal of the day, went to play badminton after work and started getting the runs.. Couldn't sleep all night..

~~~~~~~~


In my opinion, a little less then 3 stars. Was going for a burger lunch and it would have been Fat Burger or Bone Yard which is right beside, but they weren't open.. Even tho it was supposed to be open.

Place was run by 2 Asian kids..

6oz original fat burger is $6.99

My XL Burger (Double Fat Cheese) was 12oz $11.99.

Burger was cooked from fresh, it was somewhat hand pressed.. They advertise Angus Beef, but the patty seemed not enough for some reason...

The fat juices were just dripping right out when she plated it on the bun.. She had to hold the burger up sideways just to let the juices go.. It looked sooooo delicious!!! I'm a huge fan of fat unhealthy juicy beef burgers..

The bun was lightly toasted.. Not enough, 3 stars on the bun..

The patty didn't seem 100% cooked.. Maybe 75, 80%.. It was very pink, but no blood dripping..

For my reviews, 3 stars means I would go back but wouldn't recommend, 4 being I would recommend it to others to try..

Reason for being a little less then 3 stars, Bone Yard is right beside, you really have to step up your burger game if you have competition right next door.  I've been to BoneYard before and remember it being a slightly better experience.. It was probably a year ago but I will go back again in the next couple days to see what they have for a burger..

Good thing about this place, they lots of different exotic burgers you can try. So they take the original 6oz fat burger and make a Texas burger which ranch sauce or Mexican burger with gauch and the list goes on forever..

I had a turkey burger which I could have liked but it was too salty.  I was surprised that the burger was actually seasoned.  I will try it again! We came early in the day and there wasn't a line, I heard this place usually has a ridiculous line.  Did I say I will try it again!  Hopefully next time the burger won't be salty and give me high blood pressure.

The staff was very pleasant!

If you're looking for a cheap place to eat that's not the typical fast food joint you'd find across the nation, eat here!!! The burgers are actually quite tasty. I ordered (my very first) fatburger, with cheese and egg. The burger was well flavored and juicy, a good amount of pickles and mustard to finish off the hamburger. I think I only tasted one bite of onion though. If it weren't for In-N-Out, I'd say this place definitely outranks any franchised burger joint. But, a true fan stays loyal. In-N-Out forever. However, Ice Cube, I do know what you mean. I too, would want a fatburger 2 in the morning...only in Vegas.

Fries were hot and fresh cooked.  The burger was warm and dry not cooked fresh. It had a pile of pickles on it when I ordered it without.  This was my second time eating here but I won't come again unless it's for the fries.

I had it two times and the first time it was good.  This time the fries were great but the burger was cold and dry. Told them no pickles came with them piled on it.  I didn't see them cook it on the grill fresh it was slapped together and passed out the drive through in less then three minutes.  Last time it took about ten min but was hot and fresh.  This makes me realize how important Hot and Fresh all the time is. Never coming back after this bad burger:(

I guess I should not be surprised. It looks like the easiest things to make are nowadays the easiest things to ruin. I mean, how difficult is it to make a decent hamburger? Why cannot they get it right? They certainly don't want to get it right at Fatburger. It is probably because they are trying to hoodwink you.
After paying $10 for a cheeseburger I was left with the feeling that some people have no guts and must give everything no matter how bad or average a five star rating. The burger patty was dry and shriveled. I guess they use low quality meat and perhaps salt it too much and let it stay. Not only that it is was small. Imagine a drier McDonalds patty. So, the race for the most expensive and disappointing hamburger in town continues.
Fatburger sure know how to make up for the size of their patty though. Almost half the head of a lettuce sits on the burger. Let's call it Lettuce Burger with a dry and sad patty underneath.
If you go add extra ketchup/mayonnaise/whatever to insert some life into your burger.
At my end I have boycotted Burger's Priest for the owner's disgusting beliefs, cannot afford to pay $25 for a burger at Drake and of course usually have more sense than to enter a Burger King. I will continue to make my own, visit Harvey's if I am in the mood when walking around the city or keep searching for a decent hamburger I don't have to empty my bag's content for.
It just dawned on me. Their burger is similar to Wendy's. I want to be careful writing it because I have not been to Wendy's in a long time, but from what I remember Fatburger may be getting its burgers from the same source as Wendy's..

Service is extremely slow, but since I love their burgers it's decided it would be worth the extra wait. I had ordered a large burger and after waiting for over 30 minutes at the drive through window, I lost my patience and left. In a fast food world this is definitely not acceptable. The whole idea of a fast food joint is to get your food in under 10 min. Not going to be visiting this place. I am sure they need to look at new management.

YOOOOO. Ordered a burger meal with a drink from Uber eats. Took these mofos 54 minutes to FINALLY send the guy on his way. He arrives without a drink and both the fires and burger are cold af , the bun was stale and I'll be surprised if I don't sh*t myself tomorrow. ::Finger crossed::Never again

Most of you out there, don't know that I am married now & that my wife is 100% Finnish. I don't know if this is strange, but my wife's favorite American food is Burgers. Having said that, we have been going out of our way, to try every Burger joint on the west-side. I have to say after trying: Farmer Boys(very good), Smash Burger(over rated), 5 Guys Burgers(worst burger, but insanely good Fries), Montana Meat Packing Co.(very good), In-N-Out(best service & wife's favorite), Red Robin(great, but pricey), Chilli's(so-so for the price), as well as the Real National Fast Foods: Burger King(best of the Nationals), Wendy's(love the Red Head in the commercials, burgers lack flavor), Carl's Jr(not bad, but also not great), McDonald's(a familiar friend, but never the first choice), Jack In The Box(hate the burgers, love everything else), & Sonic(way over-priced). We have not tried: Any Asian Burger joint, Gordon Ramsey's Burgr, Applebee's, Heart Attack Grill & White Castle.

After everything is said & done, Fatburger is still my favorite all-around Burger joint. Keep this in mind, I love a thick, juicy burger cooked Medium Rare to Medium, any more than that & I consider the burger to be burnt. I also love Fat/Steak fries or Potato Wedges. Fatburger has everything I look for in a Burger Joint.

The bad things people say about Fatburger: They take forever to make your food- yeah, this is true, but everything is made to order & I get the Fattest Burger, with Fat Fries & this gives me the perfect time to have a pre-meal smoke. Service is bad- Not True. I have been to almost all of the West-Side Fatburgers & have always had better service than a McDonald's or Burger King. Fatburger is pricey- yeah, this one is true, but if you eat as much as I do, I normally spend just as much at McDonald's or Burger King...... I just need 1 FatBurger, instead of ordering 4 normal fast food sandwiches/burgers.

The Skinny on Fatburger: If you love your burger, thick & juicy burgers & the option of  steak fries, Fatburger is the best California Chain Burger Joint.

Best Burger in town!
They are a must while staying on the strip in Las Vegas. Everything is made to order. You can add what ever toppings you want. They have a small sitting area outside and in. You can enjoy a burger and people watch! What better to do in Las Vegas.

Always satisfied coming here, whenever the girlfriend and I have a craving for a juicy burger, this is our go to place.  The fries are excellent, and the burgers....ohh the burgers are amazing, we have not had a bad experience.  Definitly Recommend,
Fast and friendly service!  Food was amazing!!!!!!! Definitely the place to be for indoor or outdoor casual atmosphere. Staff was friendly and happy to see you!

My first time getting a fat burger, and I wasn't impressed at all. Fries were stale and room temperature and the cheese burger was nothing special and they put way too much mayo and lettuce on top which made the bun soggy and gross. I don't eat fast food that often but I'd rather have had mCdonalds than this place.

A good burger, but still not enough to defeat the venerable In-N-Out in value and taste.

I use to eat at Fatburgers ages ago because it was by my college campus, so convenience factor was there. But got converted once I discovered In-N-Out despite having to drive out to get it. Never looked back since. 

Funny thing happened, I was going to try LBS Burger so I asked the Fatburger employee where its at. Yup, I really did ask Fatburgers where I can find their competitor burger place is at. They didn't know.

Was at Red Rock waiting for the movie to start so just grabbed a bite here. For around $11 I got a really big burger and fries. I got a pretty good value based on the size of the burger and the fries, but flavor just didn't impress me. Much better than Fuddruckers. Fries were very good though with the clean and crispy flavor. 

Good place to get burger if you're in Red Rock. You probably won't be disappointed, but if you have the option to go with In-N-Out, do yourself a favor and go there instead.

We had high hopes for this place. We saw an episode of Undercover Boss and thought after that episode that this place would be top drawer as a result. Sadly, not the case. We had two cheeseburgers and a side of fries and one soft drink. It was almost $25. The burgers were decent, but not spectacular. The real downfall was the building and overall general appearance. The ceiling was disgusting with dirt, grime and severe water stains. There was grease and grime all over the salt and pepper shakers, and the whole place was generally grimy. The place was pretty slow, and even taking into consideration that everything is cooked to order, it took 15 minutes to get our order. To top it all off, a message to corporate was totally ignored. Guess the show was simple "entertainment".

Ever thought about having a heart attack at a young age? Well this place can help you out with that! Kind of a cutty little burger joint along the strip. 

A cheap place to eat, but definitely unhealthy for ya. I ordered a large burger combo with egg and the sandwich gave me mixed feelings. The burger was good, but it was a bit too oily for me. The oild drenched the wrapping paper and onto the table and slowly made it to the edge of the table to drip on my pant. The egg was not my expectation. It could be my fault, I was expecting sunny side-up, but it was not. I guess I wanted the egg yolk to drip all over the place but that didn't happen.

If there was a Fatburger where I live, I would definitely give it another try. Probably the next time I go to Vegas, I'll stop by for a visit.
Ordered through Postmates. Delivered on time. 2 out of 3 orders came out wrong. One of them just completely messed up. There was no special instructions. Nothing fancy just some simple burgers.

Fat Burger has been my favorite hamburger place since I first was introduced to it in high school.  My school was only a few minutes away, and when we could, my friends and I would sneak over to Fat Burger for a delicious escape.  Now that I'm at ASU, it's closer than ever!  Better than In n' Out, better than Sonic, Fat Burger is your ticket to hamburger heaven.
Good burger yet a bit over priced. Then again its Vegas and most is. Burger was very tasty, fries were good and Strawberry shake was good too. Overall, just what it needed to be.

Decent burger but way overpriced.  $12 for regular burger and fries.  In N Out $6 for double double and fries and in n out is better quality.  Had Fatburger in Barstow and it was pretty good.  This one wasn't up to par.  If you're gonna charge it, you have back it up and they didnt.  Won't return here.

Nice stiff specialty drink ( pop the cherry ), and a good burger. I still think In and Out is better. Cool scene at the burger bar outside, but hey this is Vegas, cool scenes are a dime a dozen if you don't come here often.

Amazing workers. My wife and I sat in and were treated with courtesy and smiles. The three guys there were huslting and getting those orders out as quick as they could. Good burgers as always but the owner seriously needs to help these guys out with one more person. Thank you, we wiil be back for more.

The employees are nice and the food is great. How do you not love Fatburger? 

This location is nice because it is in Red Rock and there is plenty of seating and always clean.

Juicy, made to order, and tasty burgers. It might take a while for your order to be ready, but that's because they make it as you order. You can taste the difference in freshness though. I really like the classic Fatburger with cheese without onions though. The chili cheese fries are worth trying too. You have the option of "fat" fries or "skinny" fries. The "fat" fries are steak cut fries, so much thicker and wider. The "skinny" fries are like thin cut, shoestring style goes. I like the chili cheese fries with the skinny fries. The sauce gets to get in the nook and crannies. They have a grilled chicken sandwich option as well, but I think I'll stick to the burgers since I think they are better at beef than chicken. Also, if you save your movie ticket stub for that day, you get 10% off. Not bad, but make sure you give them the movie stub as they ring you up. So, if you haven't tried Fatburger before, I say go for it!

The burgers are good. The chili cheese fries are even better. Getting your food takes a while since everything is made to order. The staff is friendly and I think they do their best to try to get your order out as soon as possible. I usually get a Fatburger with mayo, onions, and cheese. The meat is well seasoned and juicy. If you do get the chili cheese fries, you have the option with going for fat fries ( thicker cut fries ) or skinny fries ( thinner cut fries ). I personally like it with the skinny fries because more chilli cheese goodness gets in between the nook and crannies. Not giving it four stars because sometimes the food takes a long time to be ready, so it doesn't make it a good quick lunch/dinner spot if you are short on time. Still recommend for the food though.

Fat burger has gone Hollywood! I never thought that I would see the day that the restaurant would look better than the burger. $7 for a 1/3lb burger that looks more like a slider. I'm good of the Vegas Fatburger. I hope the one on Crenshaw didn't change up on the original Fatburger patrons!

I stopped eating red meat for a while.  Decided to get a burger because I was starving and it sounded good at the time (cause I was drunk!).  Lo and behold, Fatburger carry's Trukey Burgers!  YEAH!  Had 3 over a three day period.  Loved it!!!!

Some friends and I decided to give this place a try after enjoying a night on the strip. 

Lots of pros here: 
1. Open 24 hours, which is perfect after a night of walking the strip and partying. 

2. Lots of menu options. Whether you like turkey burgers, veggie burgers, a paleo burger, or shake, this is your stop. 

3. Friendly staff. The service is great. 

4. The food is really good. Especially the onion rings and the shake. 

Cons:

1. restroom is kind of nasty. 

2. Because the food is so good...the line is long. 

3. Even though I enjoyed my food, I felt it was a bit overpriced. I paid $18.00 for my burger, onion rings, and shake.

I stop in about 1/month. The last 2 times I've been here, I'm starting to doubt how this place is run. The cooks are the only people doing work with good service. Each cashier I've encountered does not greet you or tell you thank you for coming in. They drag their feet over to the register and start putting in orders. No "Hi, what can I get for you" or any acknowledgement.  I feel like I'm standing there waiting for a sloth to come take an order. A big downfall- they don't serve their lemonade here. I would have only given 1 star, but the food is still good and the cook does a good job. Maybe they should replace the sloppy cashiers to better business here.

This burger joint operates in the Green Valley Ranch Casino and is a Fatburger franchise.  Now Fatburger is renowned in California for their juicy delicious burgers.  However their reputation does NOT translate to the Green Valley Ranch Casino location.  I went there about a month ago and asked for a medium large fatburger, hold the relish and mayo.  The mayo and relish were held however the burger came as a salty grossly overcooked piece of meat, more tasteless than the inexpensive major burger chains and cost $11.45.  I was shocked.  I recently returned and placed the same order for a large fatburger medium rare.  The waitress said fine.  Again to my surprise I received an overcooked burger loaded with salt. A piece of shoe leather would have been more appetizing!!  Again I paid $11.45.  Two times is enough for me.  This place is the WORST and does not come close to living up to the Fatburger standards. This franchise needs to be closed. You would do better and cheaper eating at any other burger joint in Las Vegas and there are many.

Love the service here !! This is my first time my boyfriend said he loves it so I'm like omg whatever ! Let's just try it and you get to pick what you want on your burger and that's what I like . Lol . I already know the burger tastes good just by looking at it .

OK, I like this place for my selection (as follows):

XL, cheese, grilled onions, egg, and hot sauce (tabasco)

These are salty and fatty...thats why they taste so good to me.

I recently learned about the "Impossible Burger. It's a plant based burger for non-meat eaters like me. I am always looking for new vegan / vegetarian things to try so I made my way over to Fatburger. 

I browsed the menu but I didn't see the burger listed, so I asked if they had it, which they did. 

We ordered two impossible burgers, one order of onion rings, one order of fat fries, and one drink. The total was $45.00. I thought I heard the cashier wrong, it was rather noisy, dinner for two at Fatburger can't be that much? I gave him my card and got my receipt. Confirmed, the total was 45.00! 

The impossible burger was 15.00 each!!

The food came out soon after ordering. Moment of truth, to try this hyped up, $15.00, Impossible Burger. The Impossible Burger was amazing. Being completely honest, this was the closest thing to real meat that I have tried. The texture and flavor was just like a burger. Topped with lettuce, tomato, pickles, mustard, relish and everything else, it passed as the real thing. 

I was super excited that the Impossible Burger was amazing. I have tried so many vegan or vegetarian dishes at different restaurants and have been disappointed at times. Just because it's vegan or vegetarian doesn't mean that it should lack flavor or that wow factor. 

This review is 4 stars because the price. 15.00 is a bit pricey in my opinion.
Inside the Santa Fe casino. They're friendly and a lot faster than a stand alone franchise. I personally like it better than the other one not too far from here because it feels safer .

RUDE. Dirty. It takes 30+ mins to get a burger. The people behind the counter fight with each other.. Like the whole time I was there..Raise voices & curse. The people before us got a refund..because of grossness and attitudes they were receiving. 
The big white chic who makes food and takes orders is the most unpleasant person to order food from. Aside from her attitude her body rubs up against the food as its being made.. Puts a glove on one hand.... Yet touches the burgers with the other. I'm starving.. I wish that would have been a good experience.

Stopped here  for lunch with a friend on our way to the pool. They have the best little burgers & fries!! I say little cuz i get the small one..its just enough for this girl!
The fries were really good and salted to perfection.
I love me some Fatburger!!
Terrible service. Hard potatoes and a English muffin that was micro waved  thI waited over 12 min for

Customer service was excellent. They greeting every customer that came and left the location. Very friendly staff the food was not good. The fries were fresh, but the burgers were dry. I don't know if it was because it was Turkey burger, but I was very dissatisfied. I only tried  this place because it was next to my mechanic. Maybe next time I will try something  different just because of the great customer service.

Although the burger wasn't the best, it was good. I got a medium size and that itself was pretty filling. I was able to stuff it with lots of extras including bacon, grilled jalapeños, and grilled onions. Inside was nice and clean and worked rather quickly. I went at a busy time, so I waited the most 10 minutes. 
I also had an Oreo shake. Now that was good :)

My kids love Fatburgers!  After sitting in crappy traffic on the Strip, enjoying a sightsee of all the pretty lights, I was able to do a U-turn and hit this place.  The parking was a breeze even if you do have to shoo people out of the way from crossing the driveway, which is nonstop.  Sorry, move the F out of the way, I'm coming in because I'm hungry enough to jump out and start chewing on one of you people.

We got in and there was no crowd.  I have to warn you here, FB is pricey, but we knew that already.  I just ordered for the one daughter, but my other one decided she wanted McDonald's; me too.  Woo-hoo, McDeath's is just next door!!!!  Sweet!

So got one kid situated outside at the open air seating, complete with open bar and misters.  Please, if you're a slow eater, sit away from the misters because they spray every other second and it does get annoying after a bit.  We went to the McD's next door and luckily avoided a big gang of folks who herded in.  

It was very nice sitting there people-watching out on the strip.  A nice calm evening with my teenagers, watching guys hand out X-rated flyers to passers-by.  

Leaving is the same hassle as coming in because I had to darn near run over folks to leave because they don't care if you've been sitting there a while waiting to LEAVE!  Fortunately, I'm from back East and have a A-card on guerrilla driving.  MOVE!  So just be prepared to be a little proactive in that department.

oh Fatburger, how i missed thee.  how long has it been since i last pay you a visit?  ahh that's right, it was back when i was dating this chick who gives me a guilt trip for not being religious.  i guess that's why she is history and Fatburger isn't.

succulent burgers, golden brown fries, cavity-forming root beer float..., need i say more?  i could hardly contain myself when i was in line and almost plowed into the people in front of me.  ya so i was hungry, forgive me (i'm being religious here).  i broke down and ordered me a chili-cheese fries, a cheese burger, and washed it down with a big-ass root beer float (sinful).  i can't say that  i'll stay afloat after having all that food (i'm going down straight to hell)..., but i sure felt an orgasmic (heavenly) experience.

so next time you spot a Fatburger, go in and have yourself a religious experience.  i'm sure my ex would have been proud of me!

I've tried Fatburger several times, on Denman in Vancouver and at the first location in Calgary at Deerfoot Meadows. I've always been happy with what I've had there but not consistently at Bankers Hall. One time I got a burger with bacon I'd absolutely not requested on it. Another time I tried the turkey burger which has bizarre sage seasoning and just comes across as turkey sausage in burger form on an unfortunate whole wheat bun (which NEVER belongs anywhere near a burger). Then I fell in love with their baguette sandwiches but they took them off the menu.

Why, given this spotty history, am I giving this location five stars?

Because I saw burger heaven today. I finally ordered the King. Two 4-oz patties, delightfully messy, perfectly cooked beef  on the softest, most UNCTUOUS bun. The whole experience was transcendent. I had the best burger of my life at P&L in Toronto in May and this is the single best burger I've had since then. I'm instantaneously obsessed now- plotting ways to get downtown even though I work at U of C. I just can't say enough. It was amazing.

Fries were superb as always- Fatburger has the best fast-food fries in town.

Rude staff, slow service, poor quality food and MUCH MUCH MUCH too expensive. This place is a huge difference from the one in Bellevue WA that my boyfriend and I used to eat regularly at. 

The food here is much more dry and tasteless than the WA stores. The prices are almost twice as much, even for the off strip locations, and when asked about them at this location, I was directed to go to the one in Summerlin which is cheaper... After an almost 30 minute drive, we get there to find... exactly the same prices. Good thing we've got a fuel efficient car.

Locations that are not right on the strip have no right gouging locals for the same prices that tourists get slapped with on the strip. Would not return...

This place is expensive as hell! But it is Vegas and on the strip so technically this should be considered as "average" price. Came here at 1:30am Sunday morning and ate outside on the patio area. Music was playing, nice cool breeze outside, so I say this was a perfect night to eat outside. When we got our food, the burgers were fresh and hot and freaken good! I would say this cannot beat in n out but it does come in 2nd in my book!

When I do not care about breaking my diet this is the burger I want. It is nice to have a burger that is dripping with flavor. It may not be the healthiest but it is a great burger. I also love the fat fries that you can get here. It is a little tiny inside with not many seats but there are seats outside if the weather is accommodating. So, I recommend that you indulge yourself once in a while. Try a Fatburger and you will not be disappointed.

Today's burger adventure took me out to FatBurger, which is the closet burger joint to where I live. I figured it was time to review them here on my site. So I got in my car and drove the very short distance to get there.

I went in and for a late afternoon lunch and it was actually quiet busy, busier than I have seen it since it first opened. I walked up to the counter and took my order after a few questions and reading over the menu. The menu consists of chicken fingers, wings, chicken sandwiches and of course burgers. They have, like so many places these days, specialty burgers and regular burgers. Their regular burgers come in three sizes; BabyFat (4 oz), Fat (6 oz), and King (8 oz).

I ordered a double BabyFat (so 8 oz) with fries and a coke. On the burger I had the usual; mustard, ketchup, onion, tomato, pickle, lettuce. Once I ordered, they gave me a number and my drink and it was my turn to wait for the burger and fries. It took about five to seven minutes and while I waited I looked over at the semi-hidden grill area to see how they were cooked. The burger came out of a drawer, not frozen, fresh and red but already flattened. It's cooked on a griddle and covered with a metal skillet at times, it looked good as it cooked.

When I got my burger I dug into the fries first. They looked like generic frozen fries; they tasted like generic frozen fries. Not great but not terrible and nowhere near the best or okayest fries I have ever had (their curly fries are better but they are also generic frozen ones). I don't get why burger places open and pride themselves in their burgers that are fresh fresh fresh and then they just open a frozen bag of fries and serve those?

Let's move onto the burger, after all that's why we are here right? So I looked over the burger. The patties were nicely shaped and fit the white spongy bun perfectly. The lettuce was chopped and loaded on the burgers. The onions were diced and there was an ample amount. The pickles were small and few and far between and there was one rather large slice of tomato which seemed like the perfect amount.

Biting into the burger a slew of thoughts flooded into my head. let's talk the topping thoughts first. The lettuce was very crisp and juicy and maybe the best iceberg lettuce (shape, texture, freshness and juiciness factors) I have had on a burger ever. The pickles were tasty but like I said not enough, the onions were white onions and very flavourful and the tomato was juicy, not stringy and like I said, just the right amount. The toppings were gold.

The bun itself was a good bun. It was starchy, bouncy and held together well throughout the whole burger eating experience. It's not so gourmet but it's also no run of the mill burger bun you can buy at any grocer's. Bun plus toppings were A-okay.

Then there are the patties themselves, potentially the most important part of the whole burger. These patties tasted good but are they the best patties I have ever had? No, no they are not. They taste fresh but they also taste like day old fresh. Sure, they haven't been frozen but they don't taste like they were made to order, something other places do a very good job of. They taste like they were preformed and were sitting in the drawer for many an hour. Still not a bad taste and very similar to Johnny Rocket's. Their texture was a little on the tough side when you chewed; they could be ground a little finer. They stayed juicy and dripping the whole time I ate them; always a good thing.

So how was the overall experience? It was very satisfying and I would return to this place again. In fact, I have returned numerous times. It's not the best burger in the city but it's very decent. It is very similar to Johnny Rocket's (better and fresher toppings here), and the price point is virtually identical. This burger ran me fifteen and change and that's just a single (or double baby). Burger wise, these places are very very similar and for that Fat Burger gets the same rating. I'll be back here soon but it's no Five Guys, who does what they do but better.

Out of 7 FatBurger scores 5

Bad service at this location.
Preface: went in mid-afternoon, there was no line and only 3 people eating in the dining room, so no reason to have provided us with better service.

My friend and I went in and were discussing what each one of us would order right in front of the cashier. Not that she needed to eavesdrop, but she should have been aware or attentive enough to realize that we were each ordering something.

My friend ordered first. Right after the cashier took their order, she left to start making it. we tried to call her back, but she just carried on at the grill. We literally stood at the register for at least 5 minutes, I saw her glancing up a couple of times - didn't think to wonder why we were still standing there, staring at her? Good customer service would have been to ask if we needed anything else, but this did not happen. We were fed up, and my friend just wanted a refund for the meal instead... not that any team members or manager were coming over to help us.

Finally, a different team member noticed us waiting and came over. We told him about how I was never able to place my order and that my friend just wanted a refund. He tried to tell me he could make it right then and there, but we just wanted to leave. He gave my friend a PARTIAL refund, which my friend noticed after we left.. and I have not returned since. I believe my friend made a comment on the actual website of Fatburger, but not sure what occurred after (if anything even occurred). Buuut as for me, I won't be returning to this location.

I really like coming here. The food is always good and consistant. Its made right in front of you while you wait. It takes a few minutes, but is worth it. The staff is always friendly as well. We had more than exceptional service this evening from Natalie and will be back!
I like the concept... quality burgers with several ingredient options. Good decore, friendly staff, cooking seemed to go well, but ingredients seemed a bit stale.

The portions they deliver are little smaller then what I thought it is good and they are efficient 
They remembered everything as well all in all a great delivery

It seems like not so long ago, The Fatburger brand was blowing up, and expansion seemed endless... 10 years later, and Fatburger almost seems like a relic of the past, and isn't the first place people think of when it's.. BURGERTIME. Thanks to a few fantastic Groupons, I've returned to Fatburger, a few times recently. Really impressed! I admit to being a glutton, and enjoying *EVERYTHING* in excess, so The XXL Burger, Chili Cheese Fries, and Lemonade totez hit the spot.. GIANT TASTY MEAL... Even without a Groupon, the price isn't too horrible, and with one, it's an absolute steal! The staff is fab, and friendly, and while the interior decor is modern retro, it's.. now.. really outdated modern retro, and needs to be remodern retrofied. :) 
Give Fatburger another whirl! I'm glad I did.
The best burger place in my opinion I didn't think it was gonna be as good as it was. Skinny fries and burger all day everyday.

Went to Fatburger with our family tonight and will not return. 

Average food. The burgers were average. The lettuce was wilted, the tomato was green, and nothing outstanding about the flavor. I'd say better options nearby are Joe's farm grill, In-n-out, or Culvers. 

Cleanliness was average. The floor was a little sticky and the beverage area was kept very neat. The kitchen appeared clean. 

Service was below average/horrible. The cashier was very unpleasant. We all ordered at the same time and the first half of the food came out about 15 minutes prior to the 2nd part. It was pretty slow. By the time we got the fries they were cold. The staff literally acted like they were a bunch of highschoolers who were annoyed that there were any customers who interrupted their hangout. 

I know this sounds harsh...it is. My experience was absolutely horrible. We will not be back and I don't recommend that you should either.

Wow this burger is flavourless and overpriced.  If i didnt throw away my receipt in disgust, I would of posted it.  For $10.15, all I got was a single burger with cheese and bacon. Even the bacon had no flavour... Wow... Honestly a double quarter pounder from McDonalds is far better then this burger.  The only thing going for this place was the excellent customer service, but that doesnt change the price or taste, so 1 star for you Fatburger.  Then again I was the only person there, so customer service better be on point. Save your money please... This is a BS burger.
Only come here if you want cold food with nowhere to sit. 45 minute wait for a freaking milkshake

Food/quality:
Great juicy burgers with tiny fries. It is fast food, but definitely a great deal especially late at night in Vegas after having some drinks during the evening. 

Service:
Service here is what I had a problem with. When I ordered for my boyfriend and myself, I had to repeat the order several times to the man at the register. He seemed to have trouble understanding our orders. For example, when stating that I wanted everything except tomatoes on my hamburger, he placed the order with tomatoes only. After continuously trying to have our order input correctly, I still had to walk up to the people preparing the food to have the order changed to what we wanted.

Atmosphere:
Interesting crowd. I remember there being a drunk girl falling all over the place in line. The bathroom here was not worth using, so I waited until heading back to our hotel.

Value:
Inexpensive quick meal, especially after you have already had a huge dinner elsewhere earlier in the evening followed by drinks.

I thought I would really like this place, but I just don't find anything really special. 

The burgers and fries are just so-so. Pretty pricey for a burger joint even for Vegas standards!

Good that it's open 24 hours.

Had this during my last day in Vegas.  It was the best hungover meal ever! I had the medium burger and the onion rings.  The bad part about this place, the wait is kinda long and the workers yell really loud.  Not really cool when you've partied too hard the night before and you just want to enjoy your meal in peace. haha
The place was clean.  The staff was nice.  I wasn't paying $12 for a burger combo.  Got a small burger ala cart for $5.  It was four bites.  See ya never.  Plenty of other burger joints everywhere.

Tasty burger ... I ordered the small burger with everything, added cheese and bacon with their skinny cut fries. Burger was very enjoyable, juicy and seemed to have some flavor ... although I wonder if I am really tasting the burger with all those condiments. The bacon definitely had good flavor. Their fries were nice and crispy too, could have used a smidge more salt. I will say the small burger is pretty small for the price, $12 when all said and done. All in all good but nothing about it makes me wish we had a Fatburger in Chicago. To be honest I think the last burger I had at Five Guys was a lot better.

Went to Vegas last year, and I'm still thinking about the burgers here!

The place was right across the street from my hotel - so convenient!  I passed by this place a few times, with no intentions of going inside.  At around 3AM on a Wednesday, after a great time on the strip, was heading back to the hotel, and I was hungry.  It was practically empty inside.

I'm so happy I went here!!  I had the Small (Baby Fat) Fatburger with cheese, bacon and an egg. DELICIOUS!!  I'm drooling right now...  The skinny fries were great too.

I even made a trip to In-N-Out sometime the next day - my first time there actually.  Although it was good, I preferred Fatburger, and made more trips here instead!

The location was convenient, and the people that worked there were really nice, funny actually.  People have said that they have encountered shady customers.  However, I went there a few times between 1-4AM, and all I saw were tourists, like myself. Maybe I was just lucky.

I miss you Fat Burger!

Hahaha, good times here! 

Ordered our food, got a seat by the front windows, and promptly fell asleep for a short little nap.

When I came to, my burger was still sitting there in tact on my tray, but my sister was still nowhere to be found. Turns out she was still in the bathroom, out of it, and having vomited. 

Gross! 

when she recovered, we managed to eat our food slowly, and oddly enough, in peace in our seats by the entrance. 

No one bothered us. We didn't have anyone rowdy being obnoxious. 

Food was solid -- for a burger and fries. Can't go wrong. Service was fast. Guess we came at a time when there wasn't any line.
worse place to get fast food they take tgere sweet ass time.  they litterally don't have nothing ready for u till 30 mins..  never will i go back..

FAT BURGER CORPORATE ALERT: BRAND BEING TARNISHED! Ive loved Fat Burger since the first day I enjoyed their turkey burger with egg and Mr Pibb. This is the only Fat Burger I've seen look this bad.Do not think this is how all Fat Burgers are operated. Everyone I've been to was nearly perfect.  What happened to corporate quality control? Neon sign broke, dirt building up from neglect, no one greeted me and manager rushed order, TV broke playing nonsense. Trays of old food sitting out, chairs, straw wrappers, and other stuff all over while employees walking by with no care to clean it up. Only the manager and lady working not sure but looks like they are trying to save money but its going to end up costing them customers. Food was good but more care could have been put into stalking the burger so it was even.  It's sad they don't care anymore...

Poor service.  Botched our order after we were waiting over 30 minutes and wanted us to pay again.  There was literally no one here when we ordered and they still managed to mess it up. This is probably my third and last time going to this place.  Previous times had lackluster service but at the very least the burger was what I was expecting. I get that this place isn't meant to be great service but considering at the time the place was vacant the least they could have done is make an order right.

Delicious hamburgers!
Stayed at the MGM and walked over here to get a good hamburger for a good price. I got the skinny fries & medium burger and it was simple and delicious. The BF got the chili cheese fries and said they were really good. Chili isn't my thing so I didn't try em. The service was good and fast and honestly I'm from California.. The Bay Area & I think this place is better then our In N Out.

Burger was HUGE, tasty, inexpensive, open 24 hour, service was friendly, a definite go to spot after a crazy night on the strip.  I love how there is a veggie burger option.  The veggie burger tasted so good.  This burger joint is special compared to in and out.  You can add an egg on the burger for $1.  yay more protein!!!

first burger during the day was a little on the dry side, but still tasty.  next burgers were at 5am, and ordered the "baby fat" this time.  basically a smaller burger.  these were very tasty and good.  the steak fries are also a nice addition to any burger meal.  btw, this location is open 24/7.

The burgers here are decent. Meat is tender and there are a decent selections of toppings. I got the fat fries and didn't really care for them, they didn't seem crispy enough. The prices here are pretty high for what it is, if it came down to spending 10 bucks on a burger and fries I'd go to five guys first, in-n-out second, smashburger 3rd and fatburger fourth. Overall, I do like that they have shakes, like any good burger shack should, but I don't factor that in because to me, when a place has the word burger in the title that's all that matters. I might stop by again if I feel the need for a 1000 calorie burger near my house, otherwise, I'll be driving past this overpriced burger stand more often than not.

For the most part the food here is wonderful...pretty pricey but worth it for the most part. I'm not crazy on the wings, especially the hot, they are not hit at all! I would highly recommend this place despite my opinion of the wings.
For strip fast food, it was actually really really good. Thank god for the 32oz beer option as well.

Horrible!!! Disgusting!!! Not clean!!! We arrived expecting to have an amazing burger, however our visit took a different turn. This place is dirty!! Nothing was clean, soda lids were missing, no napkins in dispenser, ketchup was old and bubbly. I will complain directly to the company. Did not enjoy the meal
I've tried giving this place a few chances but they screw up orders everytime never  have got my order right since the first time I went I actually used to like fat burger

Don't expect anything remotely good from this place. They're the most absolutely disgusting, dry, overlooked crappy patties EVER made!  It's like eating sand, sawdust and meal worms all rolled into one. This is the most sorry pathetic, atrocious excuse for what was written on the menu as a burger.  Voted best burger, MY ASS! That review was from 8 years ago! Definitely don't waste your time or money!!  You'll find something better to eat, I promise.

I ordered a chicken burger, onion rings, and a drink. Talking about freakin good.! Probably one of the best burgers I've ever had. I loved that it wasn't oily or greasy. The onion rings batter is thin and flakey but trust me it's good.!! Highly recommend

Red meat is not my thing so it's very rare I am open to eating burgers but this time it was so worth the risk! If only there was one in my town I would have a huge problem. The fries were good as well. Filling meal that may require a nap afterwards lol.

Fat Burger is good, but not better than In N Out. I like the fact that they're open 24 hours. The burgers here are not as great as other burger joints I have been to. The prices were pretty high too. If I'm in Las Vegas and it is late at night and I'm craving a hamburger I'll go here. I had the triple king which was humongous, i couldn't even finish it!  =O

The food here is awesome!  This Location is convenient off of US 60. I eat here often when seeing a movie next door at AMC Mesa Grand 24.  I wanted to give this location 5 stars, but could not because I have not always had good service.  The service quality depends on when you eat at this location.  Usually the service is fast & friendly, but if you come here when the high school kids are working, service usually is ok at best, if even that good.  Overall very good except for a couple of times of rude service from the teenagers.  I reported the rude teenagers to the manager on another visit and he said he would look into the situation.  Service lately has been excellent.

I've been to plenty of fatburgers always hits the spot. I had to review them at 3 stars on this trip due to tables being dirty, foul smell, and ladies bathroom overflowing while there are less than a handful of customers. Food was however up to par with the rest of locations. I would drive through next time.

3am, and a night filled with way too many drinks, way too many bets, and great times with friends and family.  Where to get a greasy fix?  Fatburger.    This one is located within the Red Rock Casino Resort, and is open to fill your needs 24/7.  The Big Fat Deal with Cheese and Fried Egg was heavenly, especially considering the state of mind I was in.  Nice!

It's the best burger in Vegas but I say that because it's the only burger I have and ever will eat in Vegas (I am from Chicago). Last summer I was visiting and I made my friends walk from the Belaggio to Fatburger listening to them whine and complain about the distance the whole way. To me its no big deal to walk that far...its not even that far. But after we ate they agreed it was worth it. I wish I knew what spcies they use in the burgers....

I'll start with the only plus - the fries are great. Tried both the curly fries and the fat fries. The curly fries were very crisp on the outside - warm on the inside. The fat fries are a basic steak-fry - but cooked to perfection. No complaints on the fries

Service - The kids running the place were pleasant and nice; but they were just going through the motions. This store has the cooks calling out the orders - a la Startbucks - but there was no real enthusiasm in their voices. It really seemed that they were mouthing the words because they were getting paid minimum wage to do so.

Burgers - The burgers are cooked fresh; but, they are, for the most part, tasteless. I'd cut them some slack if they were dishing out burgers for $2; but at $7 to $10, I expect a lot more. All burgers are cook to well done and the toppings were bland. I tried the mushroom / swiss burger. The mushrooms tasted steamed and no sauted as I'd expect. They were over cooked and mushy - not firm and juicy. The buns were slightly stale and broke apart while eating the burger. This just isn't a $7 burger

Lot's of room for improvement her

Register was slow. The dining room was nasty. There was garbage all over tables where messy. I had to clean my own table. Outside area was mess the garbage was full. 4 workers and no one is cleaning or washing hands.
Great late night fast place to eat. People usually go there for the burgers, but the hot dogs are surprisingly good! Give them a try!!

I Wanted to try something new so I headed to this fat burger location. The place was empty but I like how they played oldies in the restaurant! The burger was good except they jammed my patty with a lot of pickles! I can stand 1 or 2 pickles but not a whole avalanche of them in my patty. Their regular fries tasted ok except some tasted like cardboard....
This place is great!  The outside bar is fun and right on the strip so entertainment all day and night.  Bartenders are amazingly cool.  Ask for Meg she is great!

I am not sure that this place can compete.  I am all about hamburgers, 20.00 hamburgers and 1.00 hamburgers.  I have had them all.  This place is home of the 6.00 hamburger and for 9.99 deal here is the deal:

a. Menu - So easy.  Pick from just the basic Fatburger from Small to XXL which has like 4 patties....  They also have chicken, turkey, veggie burgers, hot dogs, chicken strips and salad too. 

I had a medium fat burger.  It was about 6.19 and by time I had the combo with drink and fries. 

b.  The taste - Uneventful Very edible, just not a journey, not orgasmic and nothing special... It was just very edible.  This is my problem.  For this price, I would rather have an In and Out Burger. Way tastier, so juicy, and the fries are amazing.  Here at Fatburger, everything was just okay.

So, while it was pretty decent, here is  how I would rank things.  If you want an awesome adventure and wonderful burger, go to Bachi Burger or to Capital Grille.  For 20.00 you get the best and you know it by the taste and juicy mess factor.  If you want best value, go to In and Out.  If you are in the middle and want a generic experience, then there are plenty of places like Five guys, Fat Burger, Smash Burger and all the same.

GK says, not bad, but I won't be a regular customer.

PS - Service at this place is really great!

This was my first expeience with Fatburger. I had always wanted to try it (most because of IceCube. . ) anyway i ordered mine without the sauce and tomatoes. The meat was really good, great flavor, cooked well. On the greasy side but hey! you knew what you were getting into when you ordered at "FAT burger" lets be honest.

I loved it. But I know this is an occasional type place. This location is inside the casino so it was either here or Subway. If you havnet had it. try it. and get the sauce on the side so you can try it but you arent stuck with it. i wasnt a fan myself but you might be. .

Had high hopes for this place... First time I visited it was not so great, so I decided to give it a second chance. However, I ended up waiting for my order for 30 minutes in the drive thru, when I finally got home, my order was wrong and they forgot to add the extra mushrooms that I requested and PAID for! Ugh, get it together Fat Burger!

Another successful yelp event! Thank you Kris for organizing. Fatburger is worth checking out if you are in the thornhill area. And there is plenty of parking in the back. I ordered the "baby" burger which is exactly the same AAA angus beef used for the regular burgers except smaller sized. It was the perfect amount in my opinion and "only" about 591 calories (excluding cheese) according to the nutritional info :) 

You order your food at the counter and they give you a number, tell you to have a seat and bring your food to you. Nice! 

You can add a variety of sides (e.g. chili, guacamole, egg, etc.) but the best value is 2 for $1.99 so I opted for the fried egg and the Canadian cheddar. I was disappointed that they were out of the pepper jack cheese and also the free onion rings but didn't let it get me down! 

The burger was tasty and flavourful. I was pleased :) 

Fries, poutine and Cajun chips were a nice addition that we all shared. Standard fare in my opinion. The poutine was nice and hot and tasty.

The baby burger with the 2 sides came to about 9 bucks without drink or sides. 

Worth it if you are in the area.
Best snack pack for our cravings:  kid combos with Nathan hotdog, yam fries, strawberry milkshake, and 5 mini donuts. They are really tasty and crispy.

It's 1138, and I was just told this establishment was closed because the cook already cleaned the grill.. Shout out to the owner, your employees should be held accountable for not following procedures. Close early if you're unwilling to serve customers past 1130 when your CLOSING TIME is 12pm. #drunkandfrustrated.  The date in question is  Wednesday November 15th,2017 if anyone is interested in further research.

personally i would prefer In-and-Out Burgers but the line at the In-and-Out's drive-thru was terrible so I stopped by Fatburger to get my burger fix.  Sadly, I had to wait 20 minutes for just one (1) chicken burger and some Fat Fries to be made, while the restaurant was widely empty!  I didnt understand what took the kitchen so long to assemble a burger, but service was just super slow. period.
