Would I go back?  Nope! The Hawaiian chicken burger was just alright and the Fat Fries were meh.....meaning that both were soooooo not worth the wait!!!  Price was not cheap; total 14 bucks. GRRRRRRRRRR i felt furious.

I've always loved fat burger every time i come to las vegas, but this time they gotten my order wrong. As i ordered my burger i told the cashier no bun and ended up with a bun anyways, and i didn't want to send it back because i don't know what the cooks will do to my food if i send my food back. I good thing about it was my oreo cookie shake was soooooo delicious, don't know what type of ice cream they use for they shakes, but it was very good. Just might return for a shake next time.

My girlfriend is a fan of Fatburger, so I decided to go to this location to surprise her with some food. I quickly discovered, however, that Fatburger, this location in particular, is a very mixed bag.

First and foremost, the biggest flaw: NO DRIVE-THRU WINDOW. In this day and age, I didn't think they were still making fast food restaurants that required you to get out of your car. It doesn't take a rocket scientist to know that this is a big mistake.

Secondly, the service is very hit and miss. One time I asked for the thin/skinny fries, and they put the larger steak fries in my bag anyway (which if you ask me, aren't as good.) One time they tried taking my order when they weren't even standing at the register, and needless to say I wound up repeating it several times. 

Another thing that is really weird about this location is their jukebox. It brags about free music, yet the LCD appears to be covered up. On top of that, it even has money/credit card slots. Seriously? Having access to free music would be a great way to kill time while waiting for my order, but it looks to me like this damn thing doesn't even work.

And another big flaw.... the PRICES. For a medium burger and a small  order of fries, its TEN DOLLARS. And this is WITHOUT A DRINK! The food at Fatburger is excellent, and I believe they would be justified in asking slightly more for their items.... but this is ridiculous.

If you MUST eat at a Fatburger, go to one with a drive-through - and be prepared to pay more than you might want to. This is a place that has the potential to be great, but this one needs a drive-thru, improved service, and lowered prices before I give them anything above 2/5.

I don't know how else to put this but I picked up a burger here after a little gambling at the casino and when I got home and unwrapped it............

There was a very long black hair in between the bottom bun and meat. Thank goodness I add extra mayo. So gross. Love the franchise but could never eat at this location again.

This place was a MESS. Walked in and waited 15 minutes for my order to be taken (there was only 2 people ahead of me). Apparently they were having system issues and their computers were down so they were writing down orders and telling  the customers the bill would be brought to the tables. I ordered the original burger and a side of skinny and a side of fat fries. The food was brought to my table pretty fast. The burger was okay the fries were also okay. After the check was brought over to my table I got up and went to the register to pay and the manager standing there tells me to wait for the cashier because she's in the bathroom. So I wait. 10 minutes pass and I'm still waiting and he's still standing there trying to reboot the computers. 15 minutes pass and I'm still standing there without acknowledgement as 3 more employees are trying to reboot the computers. At 25 minutes the manager says: "so are you paying cash?" And I say "YES" and he says "Ohhhh" . So you're telling me I waited 25 long minutes standing up waiting for your system to work when allll along I could have payed cash? The least the manager could of done was apologized for wasting 25 minutes of my time but that wasn't done nor any sort of discount was applied. Talk about horrible business. Fat Burger is a Never Burger for me!

This is a tricky review to write as I do enjoy Fatburger products but the service is inconsistent. Often times they forget to add the extras that you order for your burger. On several occasions I have ordered bacon on my burger and have gotten home to discover no bacon was ever added. About half of the time something is wrong. The staff is friendly and helpful but many of them are not properly trained. Often the credit/debit machine is out of order. Compared with In-N-Out Burger the wait time is very long. Sometimes I have had to wait 20 to 30 minutes for one burger, not to mention that the store wasn't even crowded! I would hate to see what would happen if a lunch crowd came in. 2 Stars.

Has to be the best burger. Add a fried egg to make it even better. Love the fat fries and onion rings too. But its the burgers you have to try. Everything tastes so fresh. Their is a size for everyone. If you think you can try the XXXL challenge. My brother did in April (a little disappointed that is picture isn't up as promised with the challenge). They have shakes and an outdoor bar as well. The best fat burger we've been too!

Came here last week with my lovely girlfriend in early July 2015. I chose this place because I have been looking for a nice burger wrapped in lettuce!

As soon as we walked in we thought that everything looked good in terms of food and we only saw the promotional stuff. We walked deeper into the restaurant and looked at the menu. This menu was a bit overwhelming and I was entirely sure where to begin to look. The burgers are also missing descriptions of what's in them from what I recall. I just winged it and ordered the burger that sounded the biggest and it appears that I made a good decisions. Our total was around $30 because we both ordered a combo. After paying, we were given an order number.

My girl ordered the baby fatburger and I ordered the double king supreme burger in a lettuce wrap. She is extremely picky but enjoyed this burger. It came with a multitude of free toppings. My burger, on the other hand, came with two huge patties and all of the free toppings offered!

We proceeded to the seating area and our food arrived after 10 to 15 minutes. Even though this was a fast food joint, there was a waitress that delivered the food to us and took care of cleaning the seating area. She asked how the food was after we finished, which was more customer service than we expected at such a place.

Overall, the service was great, the place was clean, and the food was amazing! We will definitely be coming back here again.

Food: tasty Experience: ghetto (the bad kind)

My wife loves the Turkey Burger (TURKEY FAT!) and I, the Boca (BOCA!). I think most people eat burgers for the condiments and Fat Burger is evidence to support -- try a fried egg on yours, mmmm!

Their shakes are tasty too and my kids won't shut up about them. 

Here's the ghetto part:

Stuff breaks and they don't fix it; to the point where I think they take pride in how long they can go without having to fix things. We've been going to this location for 3-4 years and the juke box is completely unplayable more often than not (don't get me started on never-once-working jukebox and forever-broken-covered-with-a-traffic-cone-barstool at the Desert Ridge Fat Burger). 

I wish they'd bring back the real lemonade, too. Minute Maid is not lemonade.

We thought the store was closed not really well lit but saw the open sign. Burgers were fantastic onion rings excellent. A little but of time to get food but worth the wait. Ordered both without cheese both came with cheese due to long travel day we ate them.  Good burgers!

This was my first time visiting a Fatburger (we do not have them in TX) and I must say I was very pleased with this place. The burgers were really good. I had the turkey burger on wheat and the burger held it's own. The onion rings here are the bomb digity. They were so flaky and damn near melted in my mouth. The guy at the register was very polite and helpful. There was also a young lady working there that helped us decide on what to order. The restroom was really clean and I would recommend this place to grab a quick bite, especially for the price. 

FYI - They play great music, old school R&B.
Amazing customer service!!!! The people are so nice!!! And the burgers are a great way to fill your tummy!

Talk about bombay late night grub in the city that never sleeps, well if you go to Fat Burger then you came to the right place. I love it because its just a down right good greasy fast food burger. I prefer it over Five Guys and In and Out. Love the face that you can get cheese bacon and a fried egg on the burger. Its a tradition to hit up this place every time I am in vegas.

Always a repeat offender in the land of Lost Wages!!!

Maybe It was the fact that I was starving and it was 3 in the morning, but that was one of the best burgers I ever had!

Unfortunately, the dining area is disgusting (I was afraid to look at the kitchen), the staff look like they all just got out of prison and don't seem too concerned with customer satisfaction. But despite this, I would totally go back.

I hope there was something less than a 1 star rating.

WASTE OF MONEY, STAY OUT OF IT......!!!!

we spend $70 dlls. on hamburgers (5 people), $70 dollars for food for 5 is nothing, specially at Vegas, but when you just throw your money down the drain, to me that's a fortune,

even the $1 cheap Mcdonald's burgers are way better that those served at this location, DRY and COLD buns, flavor-less patty's, COLD onion rings, lousy service, orders taken  wrongly after a 40 mins waiting, no soda refills offered, it took another 20 mins.at the end just to get the tab.............

MY TIP:............$ .000000 of a penny

the place wasn't even full, so that is not an excuse, it is on a great location on the strip,
tables and bar to eat ouside but not even that saves the experience.

AGAIN, STAY OUT OF IT.......................

This is the dirtiest Fat burger I've been to.   We walked in 40 mins after opening and all the tables were dirty.   Walking up to order the person working was chewing food and the two homeless guys in the booth when walking in....didn't help this review.   We had to clean our own table!!!   Food was normal

Excellent burgers, love the fries, but the deal maker for me? The shakes. OMG Amazing. Service was fast, food was good. Tables could have been wiped down more often, but all in all, so worth the stop. Open 24 hours. Nice casual place to stop in and grab a bite on the strip.

This is my second time here. Our first experience we didn't know that we can make your own burger. We just pick the one from the menu. 

My boyfriend order XL burger and he added so much stuff and different sauces. Great idea in added whatever. 

I'm glad they had a fatburger at the hotel. We stayed at hotel for couple nights and it was a great place to get a late grub.

This is around the corner from a Five Guys, but we went here because they have Maui Banana shakes.  Don't ask me what's in it, we tried to figure it out (Sure we could have asked, but yana.....).  Definitely banana, and some other kind of "exotic" flavoring like a hint of coconut or mango or something.  I was hoping for something along the lines of a Sonic pineappple milkshake (BOMB, btw), but it wasn't.

You get your choice of skinny or steak fries.  I got the skinny, and noticed they have an extra coating of crustiness, like Burger King or McD's.  I like them better than In 'N Out fries, although I worry about what makes up that extra coating.

I asked them if they could do a 'protein style' burger without the bun, and they were happy to do so.  They basically put the patty on top of all the fixin's, and put the whole thing in a cardboard container (like the fry containers at In 'N Out).  

I like that they have different Tabasco sauces for you to choose from too, and saw a bottle of A-1 Steak Sauce on the counter too.

This place wasn't busy, maybe because of Five Guys.  But fine with me, I'll go back to this place.

Oh, and they have free wifi.
I did not try the burgers. I only had their oreo shake and it was delicious! If you are looking for something sweet late at night, do not hesitate and go to fat burger for a shake.

The burger is made with mediocre blend of meat. No significant char on the patty. The condiments were unmemorable.

Go to the InNOut on the Strip if you want a good burger. Fatburger was decidedly mediocre and overpriced.

The wait can be a little lengthy once the throngs of tourists all get a mean buzz working, but every time I've been in here, the food has been some real good stuff. The burger is fine in its own right, and anywhere you can add egg to a burger wins points in my book. The staff is pretty cool too, they always seem to be having a good time despite wage slavery in servitude of a bunch of cheap drunks. One of the older Mexican dudes that brings people their food challenged us gringos to a pepper-eating contest (he won). It was fun at the time, but later on, burning sensations led me to realize I should not have eaten such a large quantity of spicy peppers. Please learn from my mistake if he challenges you too.

Pretty mellow spot. I like sitting outside in the bar area. I like coming here to have a few drinks before I do anything else. The staff are real cool here. If you're lucky, you might run into their happy hour vouchers . I'm always there and you should too!

A little girl sits happily for a picture with cheeks puffed up filled with food. It's fat fries and sticking out of her face. 

Fast forward 16 years and I'm sitting with the BF late night at a fatburger and there was no happy grinning girl here.

He ordered a medium burger, no veggie toppings, add cheese, add egg, add chili. 

I got a medium with everything and added egg and cheese.

We shared fat fries.

What we ended up getting was two medium burgers with everything topping, one with egg.

No chili, no cheese, no other egg. Well, I look at the receipt later and we never ordered the extra egg or cheese on mine, but we did get charged for chili cheese for the BFs burger so it was the right order for him (for the most part). I guess the extra egg part didn't get heard for his. Still, the chili cheese was he was mainly after. 

Two very different burgers and was the only order on the pas....really, it wasn't hard to make them correct. I think it's a lack of attention to detail since the order wasn't made right (it was dry, overcooked) and then  the burger wasn't made even to what the ticket said. Sure we can have went back to get a refire, but to go back to the restaurant and then wait again for new burgers- we didn't have the time. Went for fast food since we needed fast food. 

The BF was sick. When he's sick he can drive me nuts about food and when food isn't right and he is hungry and sick he gets so pissed and then makes him feel worse. 

What an awful dinner this was.

I have been a loyal fatburger fan since I was a kid. It actually was my reward for a good spelling test in elementary since I loved it so much. As an adult, I prefer grabbing a turkey burger with egg over any other fast food burger. Most of the LV casino locations really don't care. This is not the first time I felt it was less than stellar (usually overcooked) but this was the worse service so far.

 After tonight, I think I am done being a fan. Goodbye Fatburger. Hello In-N-Out, thanks for being consistent.

Satisfying fresh drive thru food. 

Nuff said. 

I know a lot of people like In N Out, but I'm going to say it that I have a special spot for Fatburger as the late night choice. I mean a double double animal style is good, but sometimes I just want other options and I like the fries a lot more here. My favorite is the turkey burger  with all toppings or try it with some egg. A plus that burgers come in sizes, sometimes that late I just want a baby burger. 

I didn't know there was even one near me until I drove to Big Dog Draft House. Yay! Looks like we have another late night dinner pick up in the NW, we have very few options past 11pm when we have our night owl schedule.

I never knew they had crispy chicken sandwiches but they are really good and cooked fresh.  I have heard the orders have gotten mixed up and the service can be slow from time to time, especially due to the noise from the casino, but the atmosphere is fun and it's a fun way to get away for a qwik meal

I always make it a point to get Fatburger at least once when I'm in Vegas. Just ate there and as always the food was great. The fat fries are the best anywhere. Got my usual burger with everything but pickles and it was perfect.  My only complaint is the prices and the long wait, which was strange considering hardly anybody was there at the time.

I went to Fatburger twice on my recent trip to Las Vegas. I was seriously tired of the buffets and loved the burger here. Got a king burger, with onion rings and a banana shake (which was to die for).  I will be back here on my next visit to this location on the strip.

Good God what's not to love about this place?

December and it's cool outside but they've got the warming torches lit outside and it keeps the outdoor area nice and warm.  TV is on with football and they have a full bar!

Burgers are straight up off da hook yo.  Like a homemade burger patty all misshapen but hot, cooked to perfection and delicious.  Fat Fries are pure nosh-a-licious!  Dip 'em in the chili.  Do it now!

Beer + Burger = Dinner for me last night... and lunch for me in about an hour today :-).

Beer = $7.  Burger = $7.  $14 worth of pure delicious goodness.  Better than either In&Out or 5 Guys in my opinion.

Go, eat, chillax, and people-watch.

Ok first off the crew at this location is hard working and cool, my food came out in less then 10m, place is clean. Food was hot and tasty. Plus fat burger is now offering gluten free buns that's great!

We got a Groupon to try this place out. $16 for two cheese burgers and two fries. We also got an order of chicken strips which were $10.50 for 6 pieces. 

The restaurant is modern meets classic diner, the menu is large and has a lot of choices. There are several posters around the restaurant sporting claims that fatburger ingredients, flavours, freshness, etc.. are better than other burger chains in Canada but I'm not sure I'm convinced! 

The burger itself probably gets the lowest score, the patty was a bit dry, unfortunately and the toppings and bun weren't particularly amazing, although they do offer a nice selection of free toppings, including onion rings. The fries were ok, despite the claim that they're hand-cut, skin on, they actually kind of tasted like from-the-freezer fries. They weren't terrible, they just didn't have that rustic fresh fry taste like you'd get from a chip truck. The saving grace were really the chicken strips, a bit costly at $10.50 for 6 pieces, they are hand breaded right in front of your eyes and fried to a golden crisp. They were flavourful and crunchy on the outside and the chicken was moist on the inside. We tried the honey mustard and honey garlic sauces and both were above average, the honey garlic was particularly delicious. If we were to go back I'd go for those. 

The service was a bit strange, I'm not sure if the girl at the front desk was new or had an English language barrier but she had to keep asking another associate for help whenever we asked for anything which slowed the process a bit. It wasn't bad but wasn't particularly engaging

I don't think I'd be back to be honest, definitely worth a try if you're in the area and are able to get the Groupon deal, otherwise I'd stick with five guys.

I'm not really a fan of fast food places but i must say i really like Fatburger..

I ordered the Turkey burger with everything but the pickles and skinny fries.. all for $11+ kinda pricey but it is worth it. They have many toppings for your burgers such as eggs and bacon.. i skipped on that part since im on a diet.. 

Overall, If i wasnt on a diet would love to try the real beef burgers instead of the turkey burger even thou the turkey burger was really good!

The location of this Fatburger was inside Green Valley Ranch Casino, kinda loud environment and i didnt like how the tables was next to a trash can and how they allowed smoking .. oh wells what do you expect your inside a casino

overall experience was great and rated it a 4 star..

Paid $15 for a combo meal that was not good at all. They got my order wrong, even though I said something at the window to correct the mistake. Barely got any fries at all, and the shake I order was basically water. Not worth the time, and way too overpriced. I'll stick with In-n-Out or Five Guys.

I am usually a fan of Fatburger, but the location on Fort Apache is absolutely the worst. On a Sunday afternoon with no one in the restaurant it took us half an hour to get our cheeseburgers and fries. The staff was incompetent and is a negative reflection on the company as a whole.

Good news! FatBurger has veggie burgers now! Who knew?? My boyfriend kept asking if they did, and I always told him no.  Then today we went in just to check and much to my surprise, they do! Woo hoo!  They're $4.29 and it's a Boca burger, but it's just fun to actually have that option when you want fast food.  Most fast food places don't offer veggie burgers unfortunately.  

The veggie burger was really good and the best part is you get to choose if you want skinny fries, steak fries, curly fries or onion rings with it. Yum. Not the healthiest meal you could have, but it was damn good. I'll be back!

After playing poker for hours, I visited Fat Burger looking for one BIG burger, and I definitely got it. I'm curious how would I feel after eating their XXXL Burger, but the one I ate was very tasty and big, plus the onion rings were awesome. Big recommendation for Fat burger!

Giving this a 5 because Fat Burger now sells the impossible burger and it was out of this world delicious!!! the gentlemen working the counter was extremely nice and we were served in about 15 min or less.

Last night in Vegas and I wanted to eat something that I could enjoy. This place was a little pricey, but the burger was great. It was huge and made fresh, as well as the fries. The burger could of used some kind of flavoring or some seasoning, it had that flavor of being cooked at home on the stove taste to it. But other than that it was pretty good.

Hey Hey Hey!

It's Fatburger!

Naa, naa, naa, gonna have a Fatburger!

Naa, naa, naa, gonna have a Fatburger!

Hey kids!  When you have a taste for a burger don't mess around with that In n' Out, McDonalds, Wendy's or Burger King stuff!  

Fatburger will definitely satisfy the need for a delicious gooky burger.  I personally recommend the Baby Fat with bacon, cheese & grilled onions.  With a side of Fat Fries of course.

Fatburger really can't be lumped into the Fast Food burger class.  First of all, it's not fast.  Secondly, this is more of a good diner or hamburger grill burger you're getting.  Just a notch above the fast food places for just a bit more money.
Their turkey burger is one of the better ones I've had. The bun was nicely toasted and was a great alternative to a beef burger.

We decided to give this a try because it's location and time (it was early morning)  The service sucked and the food did as well. The burger was dry and the fries were soggy. We ordered 3 burgers, a side of fries, chili fries and 2 drinks that totaled to be about $43. I wish I could have just saved my money and went to McDonald's.

Many people tell me they prefer In-N-Out over Fat Burger (or any other burger for that matter). To them I say, to each his own. Me? I prefer big juicy, greasy burgers, not small "clean" burgers. When I'm eating a burger, it's not supposed to be healthy or good for me. That's why a FATBURGER wins in terms of taste, size, and overall satisfaction. With a order of Fat Fries and a Large Coke. Yeah, now that's heaven. You can keep your overated, non-burger tasting in-n-out "burgers". Now, someone needs to bring a franchise to San Francisco.

Fatburger is legendary! Open 24 hours on the Las Vegas strip, get the fat fries and a double king Fatburger with the works, what else could you possibly ask for in life?

The jukebox inside is great, the workers yell out in harmony to thank you if you leave a tip.

Fatburger is heaven in the desert!

I don't get the Fatburger love.

Last night, after a looooong flight, my fiancé and I were desperate for something - ANYTHING - to eat.  We passed this Fatburger on the way home and decided to stop by.  We both got turkey burgers and cups of chili.  The chili had a strange, gritty texture.  The spices were incredibly strong... not in terms of being spicy, but more like it had LOTS of paprika or something in it.  One thing I can say about the chili was that it was served piping hot.  I hate lukewarm chili - it grosses me out.  So I guess that's something. 

When we got our burgers home, we found that neither one was cooked all the way through.  It wasn't just that they were pink like turkey burgers tend to be.  They oozed blood all over the paper and stained our buns a putrid pink color.  If it wasn't two in the morning, we would have taken them back and complained.  However, in our fatigued stupors, we downed the gritty chili and called it a night.

One thing I can say for certain is that we won't be back.  We can't afford to waste money on undercooked meat.

I haven't eaten at Fatburger in about 12 years. Since I now live near the Green Valley Ranch and it was on Groupon I gave it a shot. BAD MOVE. Really bad. I can see why the Burger war has hurt this franchise. I ordered a half pound cheeseburger, Fat fries and a vanilla shake. I asked to PLEASE cook my burger medium which they said they would. The fries and shake were OK, nothing great but edible. The burger was well done and dry and looked like a quarter pound burger at best. I asked them to make me another and even the second burger was well done and dry. At this point I wasn't going to send it back again. I figured I would eat cause I was hungry and swallow my losses. BTW that order came to $16. I hardly call that fast food prices. Definitely my last time to any Fatburger with so many other excellent fast food burger places around such as Freddy's, In and Out, Habit Burger and Shake Shack. I apologize but my review was for the Fatburger in the Green Valley Ranch

Extremely dissapointed ..... me and my fiance went for lunch. And ordered 2 xxl with specific items and extras and we pay for everything which was over 40 dollars.. which was fine cause we ordered extra things on it... but to pay for burgers and still have them not be what we ask for is ridiculous seriously whats the point in ordering something a specific way and they dont do it.Mind you they confirmed my order before I  paid and they still disregurded everything .And charged for things that they didn't do...will never come back to this location again...

i'm pretty sure that this a chain, and i usually try to avoid fast food joints when i can, especially while on vacation. however, at 2:00 AM in the morning, anything open is fair game.

i was hurting for something greasy to calm my inebriated self. i had eaten merely hours before, and i even told myself not to eat too much else i would be hurting tomorrow. 

one medium size burger with chili [and a lot of stolen fries] later, i felt goooood. the burger reminded me of in-&-out. what probably gives it an interesting touch is the relish. not bad i guess.

this place even had live entertainment - drunk people causing commotion.

It's my first time at Fatburger. Months ago, I bought a Groupon and realized that it was going to expire in a day!

So, I visited the place after work. It's in a part of Thornhill that I hadn't been to. I was pleased to find a lot of parking. The restaurant is situated next to a Starbucks. Nice!

I went in and was promptly greeted. My order consisted of two Fatburgers with cheese and two orders of skinny fries. I also ordered a side of gravy. 

The burger was amazing. The ingredients were so fresh and the beef was seasoned nicely. I am frankly bored of fries, but the skinny fries are the perfect size for me. The gravy was tasty and accompanied the fries nicely. 

The menu is extensive. I will definitely go back to try more options, including the turkey and veggie burgers. I also love yam fries, so I will need to sample those. 

The service was fantastic. I sat there waiting for my order for perhaps six or eight minutes. My order was brought right to me and the nice woman even pushed my chair in after I had grabbed my order. I'd definitely recommend going there for a decent burger.

My first Fatburger experience! Check that one off my cheeseburgers list.

I was properly warned that it takes quite awhile to get the food, and man were my advisors correct. We pulled up to the drive-thru at around 4 pm and didn't get our food until about 4:27. But that's because they make it fresh, to-order so you're not getting burgers or fries that have been sitting under a heat lamp for God knows how long. And yes, you can taste the freshness in the product. 

Burger was good, fries were even better but the star of the meal had to be the strawberry shake. Cold, creamy and full of berry goodness... it hit the spot on a hot, Vegas afternoon. Normally I don't drink the entire thing, no matter how good, 'cause that's a lot of dairy in one sitting. This time, I absolutely drank it all. 

Fatburger would likely be in my Top 10 all-time burger experiences. It's good and a special treat since we don't have them in the Bay Area. But my heart still stays true to Krekel's Custard in Central IL.

- Clean restaurant on the strip in Las Vegas. Ton of foot traffic and bright lights of Las Vegas in view while you eat. Atmosphere isn't a problem, the actual food however is another thing all together. The bacon burger I had didn't have greasy goodness, the oreo shake I had lacked any real taste. In this age of "healthy organic foods" there's no sin in eating real food in Sin City. When you eat food that isn't great for you however and it doesn't even taste good....well that is a deadly sin!
nice staff, place is clean, and burgers are good. hits the spot when you need a good fresh burger
"2 in tha mornin, got the fat burger" ain't nothing like a juicy double king cheeseburger with a fried egg and an order of fries at 7am to soak up all that hennessy!!! Awwww it was a good day

Come here once in a blue moon, decent burger & frys. Unfortunately every time I come here I order a chocolate shake, and it doesn't arrive until after my burger has been devoured.... I think your order should come out all at once shouldn't have to get your drink five minutes later after you finish your meal....I think they need help as well 2 people just don't cut it for this business....

This isn't the best Fatburger in the world... I've been here a handful of times and it usually takes a bit too long to get your order. The burgers are a bit too salty for my taste too. On the other hand they have FANTASTIC real milkshakes and are open til like 3 AM. If I'm looking for a better burger I'll either grill it myself or drive down the street to Fuddruckers.
I love this place with my whole heart; 24 hour service and very friendly staff and bartenders... you can't lose!

I'm a huge Fat Burger fan.  I've never gone inside this location on sunset but I frequent it after work on the way home at night. They routinely deliver the same excellent service and food every single time I come. I love their hamburgers.  I'm not a big fan of In N Out. It may take a little longer than most people prefer as they cook it fresh, but it is worth the wait. Those burgers are juicy, flavorful and delicious. 
My only complaint is they have a dark parking lot and some lights out.  It has an unsafe feel to it.  I don't see a lot of women stopping by at night for this exact reason.  I know the neighborhood and feel safe here, so I come rain or shine.

Fatburger is a California chain of burgers founded in the '50s and has expanded since then to include this branch in Deerfoot Meadows. Kat and I first visited here probably close to three years ago and were pleased with a new alternative to McDonald's. The burgers here take time to make, and the servers bring the trays to your table. It is on the more expensive side, but you get a tremendous bang for your buck: the burgers are massive, with fresh buns, and a huge slab of fries on the side.

I tend to get a Kingburger because it is something I will never be: I leave the lettuce out, and get everything else (tomatoes, pickles, relish, mustard, mayo, the whole shebang!), sometimes even throwing in some mushrooms or onions for flavor. Kat never strays from her combo of ketchup, tomatoes, relish and onions. You can also substitute your fries for their freshly made onion rings, and the shakes are most likely the best burger joint shakes in the city. The vinegar and Tabasco on each table is a welcome addition. Definitely worth your money!

Occasionally, I'll stop by here when I'm on my way to work.  Which I did last week.  Food is consistantly good, but on my last visit, the place was far from clean and everywhere I walked on the floor was super sticky.  Kinda makes you wonder how they keep the kitchen,...

One of the best burgers in Vegas! 

The service was fast and everyone had a nice attitude. They ask if you want everything on the burger or anything removed. I think that is impressive since it's nothing worse than getting a burger and not liking what's on it and picking at it instead of eating it. The burger isn't just a regular patty. It's like they take a handfull of hamburger meat, season it and throw it on the grill. Got a shake with the meal and that was just as tasty! 

I am a new fan of this place!
Awesome burgers!  Nothing fancy just great tasting hamburgers. And nice people watching location.

Put it like this..... You come to Vegas and expect nothing but the best! 

This restaurant lives up to that! The bartender is super friendly and drinks are reasonable! By far one of the best places on the strip so far! 

If your into drinking stick to the outdoor bar!

I know, I know... I'm supposed to keep my food consumption controlled if I am to either lose some of this weight or maintain.  I couldn't help but try out Fatburger again after the whole discussion between In&Out and Fatburger.  I wanted to make sure that my choice between the two were correct.  And, hands down I will choose In&Out over Fatburger.  Sorry Fatburger fans.

I chose this location just because of convenience.  What I like about Fatburger is the fact they take call ins, the patties are fatter and thicker, and the choice to have an egg in your burger is available.  Mmmm, such a delight to have egg in a burger.

Downfalls are that the meat is somewhat hard and dry, the relish on the burger doesn't do anything for my pallet, and the taste just doesn't do it for me.  There's just something missing.  I thought the onion rings were good but all that oil just lost me.  

Staff were great and awesome.  Lady calling out names when the order is up seems cheerful and willing to go above and beyond.  I liked her enthusiasm.  :D

Bought a groupon right in front of the cashier. Once it got confirmed he tells us that they don't take groupons at this location. Really? couldn't tell us that before we bought the Groupon. 1 star review for an incompetent employee.

So sorry so many people have had such a bad experience here - we had a good meal.
An excellent inexpensive alternative while at the Red Rock Resort.
We split a medium cheeseburger meal - enough for two - and we loved the variety of toppings.
Hope others will have as good a meal as we did!

This is definitely my guilty pleasure burger spot, as it is not healthy in any way. They do have the best vegan BOCA burger in Vegas. A few other spots have the BOCA patty but all the other elements that make their burgers come no where close to taste and portions like Fat Burger does. They also offer a GARDEN patty but something about the hearty taste of the BOCA wins. They use a 5oz patty instead of the 3oz like the other places use, it's meatier and filling. A giant plus. 

Their combination of mustard, lettuce, tomato, pickles, relish & onion are simple and delicious. I order mine with extra pickles and both raw and grilled onions with no mayo, so satisfying. Order with fat fries and you won't regret it.

One complaint, get a gluten free bun that doesn't have egg in it!!!

Nothing to write home, as they cook their burger til it burnt crisp,  no juicy burgers  and I forgot while I waited in line they kill the meat, til it has no pink - no more hamburgers, yuck. 
It just taste like burnt crispy salted jerky.
It's just convenient,  because it's here in the casino.

I would rate this place 2.5 stars. food was delish, but service sucks balls. 

We went here for dinner on Friday night, a quick stop for "fast food" on the way to the airport.  Is Fat Burger fast food? because this place was anything but fast!

There were 4 people working, 1 cashier and 3 ppl prepping food. It took 15-20 minutes for our order (2 burgers, shake, drink, fat fries) to come out.  The server brought us our food and I asked "will my shake be coming out?" and the chick gave me a blank stare and walked away muttering "I don't even know what's going on."  Really?!  Did I just witness that?  My shake came out...5 minutes later.  My burger with cheese and chopped up bacon was bomb-tastic btw. So freakin good.  Too bad the service here sucks though.

Fat-burger is the best burger you can ever taste in your whole life. I say that because its so dam true . once you try the xxxx burger it will literally put you on your back . the meat is thick with very nice and tasty flavors and once you take a big bite of the burger you can taste the freshness of the bun, to the lettuce to the tomatoes and onions and the melted cheese . don't forget about the speechless chill cheese fries  and the great one and only milkshake is to die for. if you never been to fat burgers your missing out so much. Its truly a must to go their . you truly need to go if your a big time hamburger eater . its truly a big time must for-real. Don't miss out on the greatest hamburger you'll ever eat in your entire life.
No thanks this restaurant is very overrated & overpriced i was a big fan , In & Out will always be better
Totally unimpressed. They didn't even make the burger as I ordered it. I was the only person in line, and they rushed me to take my order. Then got it wrong. Way over-priced.

This was my first time going and it was awful service and negative energy. There was one other family there with little kids as well for my self I have a child and the blond girl cursed more times then I can count and was screaming at one of the gentalmen there. I assume she was the manager from her counting the money. I will never be attending this place again or will I suggest it.
Service was very friendly. But this location needs a deep cleaning. It is very dirty with dirty bathrooms. Cleanliness is not a priority for this location

Sure this review is from a very blurry 2:00 a.m. need of food on the strip. But come to think of it that is most my reviews from Vegas. I have come here everytime I go to Vegas. I have never had a bad burger or fries. Yes It's a little more pricey then typical chain burger joints. But when in need a food 24 hour Fat Burger is worth it. I loved the add of the outdoor seating area/bar. I will be back again for sure.

I have been a Fatburger fan for years, but this is only the second time I have visited this particular location.  The quality of the hamburger was excellent, however the fries were barely warm and when I asked for a replacement the server just dropped the tray on the table, turned and walked away.  There are lot of establishments out there that offer much better service.  I won't stop eating at Fatburger, just not this one.  A sister location at the Fiesta Hotel Casino has a friendly staff with the same food.  Lesson learned!

Fat Burger has been a mainstay to our family since we moved to the Las Vegas valley more than 20 years ago.  Their quality has been pretty good across the various locations.  Food is great but sometimes the service...not so much.

There is a restaurant inside Fiesta Hotel and Casino that sets a new standard for service, regardless the fare. The Fat Burger there, who's assistant manager is Robert, sets a new standard.  The food quality is superb.  Hot and fresh fries, burgers, and very tasty shakes.  He stopped by our table twice and cleaned our area before we could do it ourselves.

I highly recommend this place for food AND a lesson in customer service!

Used to frequent this location at least once per week or more. Service was friendly and the place was clean and well kept. Stopping in tonight on a whim has cured me of going back. Slow counter/order service, very slow in delivery orderd at 5:09 and received at 5:34 and I know it is fresh but when drive in always take precedent dine in customers suffer. Delivered order to table was wrong and condiment bar was under filled and the large ketchup dispenser empty until I brought it to their attention.
The last issue is what happened to the Fatburger theme of Rock and Roll and light hearted upbeat music. I am not a fan of Rap and Hip Hop and listening to this music just ruined the whole visit. Might as well remove the Icon pictures off the wall and replace them with BIG, Tupac, Snoop and all the other gangsters of music. I can go to Five Guys and a host of other places where we are not ignored and the service is faster with a smile and helpful attitude.

OK, I am writing this review out of spite.  That's right, you heard me!  I am writing this review to merely point out how much better this place is than the new competition across the street, Five Guys!  

I have been eating here consistently since it opened, and it does not disappoint.  The restaurant is very clean, bathrooms included.  There is a fun "Hard Rock Cafe"-lite ambiance, that is just good fun.  Burgers are very precisely and neatly made, and there is always a good "special burger" on offer.  The seating at the tables is comfortable, well-spaced, and interesting, and there is a summer patio.  The facility is licensed, so you can also get a brew with your burger, draft as well.  Even their fries are great.  I won't deny that it is slightly on the pricey side, but you get what you pay for.

Alright I'm going to make a bold statement here - as far as just FOOD is concerned, Fatburger is superior to In n Out.The burgers are tasty and SO FRESH. They don't taste like fast food burgers at all. The fries are great, and OMG avoid the milkshakes - they are insanely delicious and addicting (a bad habit to start I tell you!).

However , these tasty made to order burgers come with quite a few pitfalls. This place take an insanely long time (think 10+ minutes for "fast food")! They do have an online ordering system but who the hell thinks to do that? 

Additionally they are really pricey for what you get (over double the cost of In n out). Lastly, I hate the sizes of the burgers. In n Out serves the perfect burger size (at least for me!). At Fatburger I can either eat a tiny 2.5 oz burger or jump up to like 5.5 oz. Where's my reasonable 3-4.5 oz burger options people??! It's cool you offer many sizes, but not cool that none of them are a 'Normal' sized burger ! 

Overall if I was in GVR (which I am quite often), this is a great option. In general when I'm out and about I reach for In n Out as it's cheaper, faster, and the portion size is better.

A tad scary... (yes, I've seen women of the night at this establishment), and pretty expensive for burgers... but this place is a solid greasy option for your late night burger fix on the strip. I'm always glad these guys are around when I bust out of the poker table or craps game at 3 AM and want something yummy to eat.

Fat burger is definitely up there when it comes to burgers. They are juicy, fresh and hearty! I go through so many phases when it comes to burgers and lately I've noticed that it usually takes some convincing for me to want to eat one. Other times, I crave them and when I crave them, its bad. This burger hit the spot although I wish the bacon as a little crispier. Mind you, I probably could have requested that. Haha. Any who, I'll be back and I recommend the old fashioned bacon cheddar!

I am a big fan of Fatburger..but this location was disapointing ,  they got our orders wrong, burgers were dry and overcooked . The sizes of the burgers are smaller than other fat burgers I've been to.

I'm still disappointed in this server. My friend ordered us some burgers and mine is always a cheese burger with mustard only. He came back to the table and we chit chatted for a bit and I looked at the receipt and it said a cheese burger with everything but mustard. I told my friend and he went back up to catch them before they made the burger and right away before he opened his mouth she said "We are already cooking the burgers so you can't change your order", he said ok I was just wanting to tell you that the burger is suppose to be a cheeseburger with mustard only and it's wrong on the ticket. This server had the nerve to tell him that he was lying and didn't tell her that. 

Wow I couldn't believe it when he told me. If it were me she wouldn't have said it again that is for sure. What in the world has happened to customer care and satisfaction? It was such a simple thing that all she had to say was I'm sorry for the mix up and it will be no problem. I really don't think she should be waiting on customers.

Rudeness is not tolerated by this customer and they have lost 2 good customers.

PS: I have her name but I don't think I need to mention that as I'm sure anyone that frequents there knows who I am talking about.

The burger was excellent, their fries and onions rings are just as excellent and their piña colada and strawberry drink was beyond great!!! Big thanks to the fellow who helped us! He made us feel very welcomed!

went to fatburger a few weeks ago.
love the food here. they have beer as well. burgers are very tasty and the price is very reasonable!

Damn! That burger was good! Seasoned to perfection to. Quick and easy order, and they will bring you the food. I was full but I kept eating til it was gone. The price was about $7.50 for my burger not sure how much my lemonade was.

Called them to see if they were open and the guy said yes. I said great I will call you back with an order to go. Called back 3 minutes later and went to voicemail. Waited a few more minutes and called again still went to voicemail. So I called from my husband's phone and wouldn't you know, they answered. I said I was calling to place an order and the guy straight up hung up on me. Can't tell you how much I love Fatburger, but this definitely pissed me off. Definitely not going back. Called 5 guys across the street, 10 minutes before closing and they happily took my order and had a smile on their faces. Love spending my money on places that deserve it! Bye bye Fatburger.

I came here (fully sober) mid day on a Friday. The place wasn't overly packed but still a good amount of people were there. I've never had a Fatburger mostly because all of the ones I know of in the Midwest closed. 

We split a L burger and fat fries. The fat fries are what most places call "steak fries" they were really good and freshly made. We ordered the burger the way they normally make it and add cheese. The burger was decent but nothing life changing. It was heavy on the mustard also. 

It took 20 minutes to get our food, which was longer than I expected but it wasn't that big of a deal. 

I've heard this place is great when you're drunk so maybe I came at the wrong time

Perhaps the people at the drive-thru window are not the most engaging at this Fatburger location. Who cares? All their energy and efforts go into making a flavorful, juicy, fat burger. The fat content in this burger is superb -although I don't know the actual percentage of fat. Just know that the burger juice will run down your arm. 

The burgers are dressed with lettuce, tomatoes, onions (ask for grilled), pickles, relish, and mustard. For an additional cost, you can add-on eggs, cheese, bacon, onion rings, or chili. While most fast-food establishments only offer beef burgers, Fatburger has always had turkey burgers on the menu too. They've even included vegetarian patties and glutten-free buns.

The burger sizes range from small to XXXL. For some reason, the small fat is no longer on the drive-thru menu - but it's still available. 

The sides range from onion rings to skinny fries to fat fries and even chili cheese fries. I personally think it's silly for anyone to come to FATburger and get SKINNY fries. My go-to are the fat fries or the onion rings. There's also hand-scooped shakes, but they are not my favorites. Plus, the burger and fries alone will keep you pretty satisfied.

Note: If there is no one else ahead of you, then it will take them approximately 10 minutes to prepare your order.

First and last time I'll eat at fat burger! Came out of the movie Theater and ordered two cheese burgers order of fat fries and a soda $19. Dollars. The burger was dry and tasteless, fries were tasty! After we got home felt sick and lots of indigestion! Very disappointed!!

I'm an East Coaster and don't understand or care for In n Out.  I do however enjoy Fatburger.  I can choose my size and customize- I'm all about that option.  My staple, medium, sautéed onions, mushrooms, Swiss and NO mustard and NO mayo here- ketchup only please!  Their shakes are always undeniably tasty! I go for the lasted limited edition shake;). The staff here is always friendly and all have a smile on their faces and make sure you enjoy what you ordered!  
Please tip them and wait, wait and listen;)

Wwwooowiee! So colorful inside! So much going on on the menu. Where to look first?! Fatburger gives off a jolly vibe - maybe because of all the signs and colors everywhere. And the fact that you can smell the aroma of fat juicy burgers. 

The bf's original burger tasted bland and dry. I added mushroom to mine and it gave the burger a good amount of juuuice and flavor. I then regret ordering just a original burger. Perhaps we should've ordered something with lots of toppings and add ons. Oh well! The fries were average. Not as good as other places that's for sure. Next time, I'm going for the onion rings or chili cheese fries.

Be sure to add toppings or you'll end up with a dry burger! I'll be back for more someday!

Had a Groupon for 2 cheeseburger combos. Asked to sub one with turkey patty as I don't eat beef. While the beef and turkey burgers are the same price on the menu, we would have been willing to pay a bit of an up charge if necessary. The worker had to call someone who said no. Bad mistake. We left and won't be coming back.

After a night of singing and dancing at New York New York's piano bar, FATBURGER was our next stop. 24 hours of awesome burger deliciousness!!!

Very busy even at 3am... and after the food it was understandable. It might have been all the rum, but the wait seemed to take 20 mins. It was definitely worthwhile. I love to eat. And I love to eat burgers. But man, this one took all my effort. 

Be careful, they only take cash!

I went with the XXXL after a full day of walking Vegas. I finished the whole thing easily since I was so hungry. I didn't try anything else for the XXXL is pretty darn big. Plenty. 

Service was great by Deebo who was tending the outside bar. The patio is heated with TVs right there  along the strip. 

The burger was good. It hit the spot after miles of walking. Nice atmosphere but Vegas prices for a big burger. After tip, the bill was around $22 for just myself.

Came here late night, and had a burger, skinny fries, and onion rings. All three was subpar to me, very average, and nothing special. They do have a nice outside bar (which includes selling the 100 oz frozen drinks) and yeah thats pretty much it ( and they do also offer veggie and turkey burgers).
I used to come here all the time and loved the atmosphere and service. Figured I would give an old star another go...I was not dissatisfied

I usually don't leave such negative reviews, but this place SUCKS!!! They close early, have NO interest in customer service, are WAY overpriced and are just an overall underwhelming & negative experience... I'll never return here again... In & Out Burgers are less expensive, faster & tastier... How does this Fatburger stay in business?!?

My friend Bill and I went to #Fatburger for lunch today at Bankers Hall. Had a 1/4 lb Angus burger, lg fries and unlimited pop for $12.98 The fries were so big that we split one order. I had originally thought that this was a sit in restaurant but instead was a food court kiosk. I'll definitely be going back sometime or another.

I went to Las Vegas for the first time in June, it was also my first trip to Fatburger. I cam here a couple weeks after Mayweather had his infamous melee here. Anyhow, back to the food. I came here twice during my stay and it was excellent. I went with the cheeseburger and fries. They allow you to choose the size of your burger and fries, which I liked. The burger was well seasoned and the prices are reasonable. I will definitely eat at this place when I visit Vegas again!!!

Looking for a thick juicy greasy burger where you don't have to sit inside the restaurant.  Fat burger is your place.  It's always scary bc it's always empty inside but fat burger delivers on big burgers. The 1lb burger is the size of my head.  But he prepared to wait for your food bc ours always takes a good 15-20 min in the drive thru no less.  But they always get our order correct so that's a plus

Usually we really enjoy eating at Fatburger.  The last two visits have left us disappointed....The place is not crowded and yet our food comes out warm.  No excuse when ours is the only order being made.  Tonight not only were the burgers just warm, they were extremely salty and even the fries were not the usual piping hot.  Not sure why the quality is going down, but we will be trying other burger places for a while.

LATE NITE SNACK! 
For a light night snack we turned up in the Texas it was after 12 and we just finished bowling! We were starving and guess who saved the day FAT BURGA! 
My wife got the XXL With egg, bacon and cheese and I got the XXL burger with just cheese ketchup and mustard . Also we ordered chillie cheese fries that were amazing! No complaints... this was a classic late nite stop and I was ultimately satisfied with the service.

We got into a taxi before 4 am and asked to take us somewhere that was open for food. Our taxi driver was pretty useless. I know there was a Fatburger across from our hotel (Aria) so directed idiot driver there. 

There was no line and we placed our orders. A medium burger for me and I splurged on onion rings. Our food was cooked in a reasonable amount of time. Our to go bags were filled with napkins and ketchup.

my burger was very good and I LOVED all the toppings. I was skeptical of yellow onion rings as I'mused to closer to orange form heavy batter and deep frying. Lightly battered and good.

And this place is 24 hours. And the employee danced for us while handing us our food. Service and entertainment!

PS: Get the coupon for $5 off a huge slushie. And Sundays / Mondays during football, supposedly $22 unlimited beer and a basket of wings.
very bland in my opinion, It's a skip just a heads up

We happened to notice Fatburger when going down the Vegas strip.  There aren't any near where I live so I was happy to give it a try. I was happy I did. I had a KingBurger with everything on it and a side of homemade onion rings. The burger was awesome. Big...Juicy...Messy....Perfect!!!  The onion rings were great too.

My complaint is not about the food. It's generally ok. My complaint is when you through drive thru your forced to go inside to figure the prices. I brought this to the attention of management some weeks ago. It apparently fell on deaf ears. I'm not surprised.

I'm not sure what it is about FatBurger that's caused it to fall out of my good graces so, but here we are at two lowly stars. Maybe it's because my first FB experience was at the Las Vegas Strip FatBurger, at three in the morning, surrounded by hookers, pimps, punters, johns, pushers, bookies, trannies, and all remaining manner of late-night underbelly. It added charm, whimsy, and terrifying people watching.

Since then, every time I've been progressively more disappointed. We've reached the nadir here, with burgers that lack any real flavor to me, unless I punch them up with the tasty cholesterol of a fried egg on them. I don't know what they're NOT doing, but when Smashburger just down the street is creating a burger of kings, jam-packed with SMASH flavor, I can't help but be disappointed at the lifeless patty of beef crying out for a savior of spice. Alas, none to be found, it forces its way down my gullet, falling into a heap of shame and indigestion.

The fries are, well, they're run-of-the-mill frozen steak fries.

I suppose for someone that bills themselves as the last great hamburger stand, I really wish they'd focus on, you know, making great hamburgers. For now, I'll swing down to Smashburger or, in a pinch, shame-eat at Five Guys.

We stopped by here after going to the after hours club, Empire. It was around 4:00am-5:00am, we were drunk and hungry so we ate here. Like what everyone else said, is this place ever clean? My friends and I came back here three times during the week (usually in the late night, early morning) and it was always dirty. They have tons of ingredients on the burger: mustard, relish, onions, pickles, tomato, lettuce, mayo, and cheese, bacon, egg, chili (which cost extra). Ate at this place in Vegas and SoCal and came to realize, I'm not a huge fan of it and only eat it due to its convenience and because we didn't know where else to eat in Vegas during that time. Onion rings and steak fries were mediocre. Could barely finish a king burger to myself, fat burger was pretty easy to kill by myself. Also, at the bottom of your receipt, they usually offer free onion rings for your next burger purchase...keep in mind, the onion rings aren't that great.

Don't try to order late night because that crew is lazy and will not take your order. They say they are open until 1am, she said no 12, we gotta clean and we will be her till 1 but you cant get no food.They were rude and unprofessional. This is the second time this happened, first time to complain. I wont be back.

Haven't has a fat burger is over a decade so I needed something fast so I decided to get a burger. I settled on fat burger and ordered a 1/2 Patty burger and fat fries combo. The burger was juicy and quite large to my surprise. The drinks are help yourself with unlimited refills. The burger, fries and drink combo came out be like $14 a decent price for the quality and quantity. I was definitely full after eating the 1/2 pound burger. They also grill the buns which is a nice touch.

It does take a bit to get your order once you place it. This isn't a bad thing since you know your getting a freshly cooked burger.

Right across the street from work, so when I'm in need of some juicy meat, I go here. I think it's a little pricey but if you want a burger and not go to a sit down restaurant, this will do. The few times I've gone the food has been tasty and fresh. Yes, I will go back!

Another one of my go to fast food restaurants in Las Vegas. I haven't been to this location for years but it was delicious, especially after a night of booze. Fat burger with cheese and fries, we skipped the shake this time but they are yummy. Staff was friendly. Prices of course are higher since it's on The Strip. Bathroom was surprisingly clean for a Friday night. (lol).

Been going here for years. I've never had a problem with Fatburger or this location. The burgers are always good, yes you may wait a few minutes longer than other fast food places but they make everything fresh to order. I don't eat fast food burgers very often but this Fatburger is one of the places I will go when I hanker for a cheeseburger and I'm close by. (The only other fast food burgers I eat are In n Out and Smashburger)

Now THIS is a burger! The turkey burger with cheese on a gluten free bun...sheer happiness!! Please come to Dallas. They pile on the lettuce, tomatoes & etc as well. & mmm pickles! Great patio & bar area too. Keep it on your list of spots to hit up while in Vegas.

While in Vegas, I ate Fatburger 4 times.....my heart still hurts. Looking back on it, it was totally worth it. The only thing I can say is that the burgers are freaking slamming, especially after having some beer flavored drinks. 

The burgers range all the way from medium to XXXL and I went with a medium every single time (make fun of me if you want). If you are feeling tough, go ahead and get the XXXL. My buddy did it and almost died on the spot from cholesterol overload...but he did say it was freaking awesome. Overall it's a slam dunk for fast food and maybe the sloppiest/greatest burger I've had....while in Vegas. BOoM!

wasn't a fan. the food was typical fast food. it look quite a while for someone to take care of us. which, i don't blame the waitress, she was obviously quite busy, but they should put more people on the floor at once. the drinks were also overpriced.
They don't close at 12pm they close whenever they feel like it past 11. Don't come here if you're looking for anything past that time or someone will come out and tell you they're closed.

Here's something I never expected to say since becoming a vegetarian: I can't get enough of Fatburger. My boyfriend, who is also a veghead, and I actively avoided this place until we found out last week that it serves a veggie burger. So, we put aside our judgment  and decided to try out the joint. And I'm so, so glad we did. 

The veggie burger is made with a premium Boca patty that is thick, juicy and flavorful. Fatburger also features a variety of toppings and customizing items is pretty easy. This is important because I don't like when restaurants have rigid topping standards for their sandwiches (I'm looking at you, Burger King).

I suppose my only complaints are the long wait time and high prices for what I consider a fast food joint. But the food is notches above your typical drive-thru eatery, and the wait is worth it.

The burgers here never disappoint. I have eaten here several times and while some may find it to be pricey for a burger joint, I firmly believe that you get what you pay for in an eating establishment. You want a .99 cheeseburger you get what you get it's all I'm saying. The service is great and the food is fantastic. My only gripe would be, and this is very minor, that the upholstery on some of the seating is starting to show its age.

I have kids that bowl at Santa Fe Station in the Saturday morning leagues, and this place (aside from Starbucks) is the only fast food joint open for breakfast inside the casino. I'll admit it is a bit pricey for a breakfast sandwich (they charge .99 extra for cheese). We usually get the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich and a drink, for 3 of us and it costs right around $20. If I would get my lazy butt out of bed earlier I would definitely go through a much less expensive Burger King or McDonald's drive thru, but when you're stuck for 3 hours in the morning at Santa Fe this option isn't bad. The sandwiches are actually quite tasty. The ladies that work there are always very courteous and quickly get to work on my order. My reason for taking 2 stars is the price and lack of variety.

We eat here for lunch whenever we visit. Great spot at the edge of the street to people watch and plenty of TVs to catch your favorite game.  Only thing that would make this place better is having different meat options for their burgers. A restaurant with "burger" in its name should have healthy (lean) ground beef options. After all, this isn't a fast food stop.

Three of us went in for lunch and waited more than thirty minutes before we asked for our money back and left. The manager was so disorganized it took nearly ten more minutes to get our money back. 

The kitchen was fighting audibly. They were not busy enough to merit this level of horrible service. 

If I could give an even worse review I would.

I visit this location at least once every couple weeks. I have never had a bad experience here with the food or the service. They so sometimes seem like they are short staffed and the wait is a bit long on those days. I however dont mind the wait because the food is great.
Great late night food and great bar to keep on partying, fries are good.  Can't beat being right off the strip especially when everything else is closed.

Today was my daughter-in-law's birthday. She is from California where Fatburger originated so we thought we'd give it a try after all the positive reviews.
What a disappointment! Firstly,walking in,although it was a Monday at 4pm,there were no people inside which was surprising. The restaurant itself is like a" hole in the wall." There is no atmosphere at all. I'd rather eat at Wendy's or McDonald's.
There is one table at the back and a few at the front.Then there is a long narrow hallway with single counter type chairs  where you face the wall if you eat alone,very unappealing.
The table area where we sat at the front was so cold. I asked the server if she could put up the heat a bit but she said it was as high as it could go.Also,she said the cold is from the type of building it is.Huh?
The food itself is average.The hamburgers are pretty average,and my relative said that most of the lettuce in her bun was brown & soggy and removed it.The fries were frozen, and what you would find at any fast food place, nothing special. There is no comparison to Fatburger in the U.S.
The prices are absolutely exorbitant for what you get! We were four people;one baby burger for $5.99 no fries/drink included, two combos for $11.49 each,and one original burger for $6.99 with fries/drink extra. Tax on all these burgers was extra. To top all this off,the pop machine didn't work so we couldn't have soda. Instead we were given water bottles. We should have been given free water bottles and have the soft drink prices credited.What decent restaurant doesn't check to see if their equipment is working properly. And where is the customer service? No soda to be had with our meal?
After we received the bill of close to $50,I felt we were all "taken" for a ride. To spend this amount of hard earned money by pretending this restaurant is so gourmet/special when all it really is,is fast food,is ludicrous to me.
Your food is served  on a small black plastic throw away container.
If you want a pleasant dining experience even in a fast food place, with value for your dollar,you're better off going to Timmy's,Wendy's or even McDonald's.If you want an average hamburger, not great atmosphere,where everything is a la cart and a very overpriced meal, then try Fatburger. I,nor my family will be back there very soon.

Disgusting, and miserable. The first two things that come to mind. Girl Stromee rolled her eyes when she had to stop to help us. Another girl who walked in whose shift was just started had two cigarettes hanging out of her mouth when she walked passed. She went past the grill and to the back. Just filthy. I can definitely tell we aren't in California anymore...

Was getting my car washed next door and realized it was gonna be a while so i walked to Fatburger. I had never had it before so i figured I'd give it a shot.  There were three people in front of me making some sort of group order. They ordered everything and then when they were told the total, they started arguing with the poor cashier about the prices as if he makes them. They even talked about letting me go before them but then they continued to complain about the orders price total. I will admit that Fatburgers prices were VERY HIGH but i ended up walking back to the car wash because it was taking so long, oh yea and also the fact that the second i walked inside the place it smelled like something was rotting or molded or something gross. Gonna get chick fila instead.

We went here late at night because most of the food inside the food court at the MGM was closed. It was a short walk from the MGM. Outside the have a Fat Bar. We went inside and there was no wait. This Fatburger doesn't have kids meals. We ordered the smallest burgers, fat fries, and skinny fries. We also got root beer floats. They give you a cup with ice cream and you can put any kind of soda into it. My kids were happy. You can also get refills on the soda part of the float. Our burgers seemed small and less tasty than most Fatburgers and the bun wasn't super fresh. They also don't have stamp cards but were willing to stamp mine that I had.

OMG...YUM...DELICIOUS... I must say, much better then Five Guys and In and Out (sorry guys)... Just yummy... although the fries with chili and cheese left me sad.. The chili wasn't that great.. otherwise Yum

Worst Fatbutger location ever, Love the Burger though. 
1- They can't hear the order properly at the drive thru window.
2- Rude and to the point greeting and no smile.
3- Didn't label the burger (had regular, veggie and turkey)

ALWAYS  takes a long time. It seems they're understaffed. Food was and is always decent but there was a hair in my fries. Science shows staph bacteria can be found in hair. And that just went into my mouth. Thankfully they gave me a new fry

The Fatburger is one of the best burgers in town, and the best fries ever! They also have super quick service so you have your food in no time. You can't go wrong with a Fat deal! It's a heart attac waiting to happen, but oh so good!

This is another vegas guilty pleasure of mine (and it's a wonder why my swimsuit never fits the same at Rehab on sunday!)  

Steak fries.. yummy.  Burger.. really yummy. I'm not a huge milkshake fan, so I washed it all down with a diet coke (cause you know, gotta keep it 'light')

I like mine with mustard, and pickles, lots and lots and lots and lots of pickles, but have tried it with chili too(also delish) of course with a side of pickles, and a little mustard.  :0)
This place is awesome!! The burgers are delicious and really good! In the past year I visited Las Vegas and also visited Fatburger. I was completely in love
Very good food and service the people were very nice but when I looked down I saw the floor.was dirty  but I will be back you you

WOW! Question - how much would you expect to pay for a 1/3lb single burger with cheese, fries and coke? $6-8?? I just paid $13.58 through this Fat Burger's drive-thru! Ridiculous! I should have just kept on going and gone somewhere else. I even questioned the drive-thru attendant thinking maybe he didn't ring up the meal correctly. Nope, he said it's correct because I "ordered a meal." When I ordered, the drive-thru sign did not have the meal combo prices posted and some of the pricing looked covered up and hand written - which was all faded - but SERIOUSLY, almost $14 for one little burger meal! Twice the price of other fast food burger joints (Carls Jr. and In-and-Out) and not any tastier or better quality! Even Red Robin down the street has $6.99 double burgers with unlimited? fries! I was hungry, I paid, I ate and now I'm gonna complain... Never again! Be ware of this place and their crazy prices!!

We were going to Shake Shack a lot for lunch so we decided to shake it up and head on over here instead. I'm glad we did! They also have Gluten Free options!!!!

The atmosphere/vibe/decor: We sat outside, it was really nice and fun to watch all the people walking the strip. It was clean, casual, and I liked that we were shaded by an umbrella because that sun can get hot!

The Food: I was really surprised to see that they had Gluten Free buns! That was awesome, and they were delicious so that's always a plus. Their burgers range from normal to gigantic size and it's all really delicious and tastes fresh. The French fries were crispy and the beer was cold and delicious!

The Service: The girl serving us was really friendly and personable, she answered all of our questions and was very accommodating which we appreciated. Though, at the end of our meal as we were paying the bill, it was about $43 and we paid with a $50... she grabbed the bill & said, "I'll be right back with your change" and we waited for 12 minutes as we finished our drinks then waited another 5 minutes. She never came back and avoided us at all costs until we finally gave up and started to leave. She waved at us and said, "thanks guys! Have a good one!" Of course we were going to tip her, but the fact that she just took the money and never came back is really, wrong. That was really sort of frustrating.

Overall: the food was great, the service was good but sort of an odd experience. Next time, I'll pay with my card I guess...
Not my favorite burger joint but they are open 24 hours if you are nearby and having a burger fix. Location is not the nicest as others have stated.
Worst service ever! brought the burger no fries...didn't care. Sent back the entire meal and no manager. waiter didnt even offer to bring me a new meal. Will go to McDonalds or In n Out next time.

This place is right across the street from the Monte Carlo.  

Pretty decent burger.  The have 4 sizes to choose from and four add-ins (cheese, bacon, chili, and an egge). I opted for everything but the chili and I was quite happy.  This burger is a step up from In-N-Out but still not as good as a Royal Robin Burger.  

The fries come in two cuts skinny or steak fries.  Nothing too special here. The onion rings were ok.  

The Maui-banana shake is very good.

3.5 stars

In n out being 2.5 stars.

My daughter and I stopped at the drive-thru about 4:00pm, Friday, March 10, 2017 and ordered two medium burgers, one with cheese and no onions and a side of curly fries.  I thought that $5.09 was an excessive charge for a hamburger, but, I heard they were good, so thought that I would give it a try.   The woman with a strong accent (possibly hispanic) at the loud-speaker took our order and told me that the total was "$20.00".  I said "that's not correct, two hambergers total $10.18 an none order of fries is just over three dollars."  She said "cheese for one hamburger".  I asked if one slice of cheese was $5.00 and she told me that it was.  
WHAT A RIP OFF.
We left and went elsewhere.  Will never go there!

So as a kid I came here with my friend, and we watched in horror as her patty was accidentally flopped on the counter. Only just a bit. At least according to the guy who put it right back onto the grill. Maybe he thought we didn't see. Maybe he thought ten year olds wouldn't care. But my friends' mom sure did, and demanded another patty be made. 
I didn't go back for many years, until after high school, when I decided to try their veggie burger. Which turned out to be nothing but a Boca burger. For basically the same price as a regular one. It is fine that they offer it at all, but do not kid yourself into thinking that makes it ok to act like it is takes just as much time and effort as the meat patties, and therefore should be priced like them. Five dollars. Five dollars. Really?

Nothing special. The beef is packed on just like a fat patty should be. I think, I enjoyed the skinny ass chili cheese fries a lot more.  

First time for everything!

after several fatburgers i feel it is still to come clean and admit i have become a really big fan. i have never had a bad burger. This is my favorite and only place that i do eat a burger at. 

i was a hater at first yes. But Fatburger worked its way into my heart and i admit they know how to make a delicious f-ing burger here!!


Consistency in their food is solid here, and nothing better than being able to count on a place where you will always get a good meal...over and over again.

Kudos Fatburger

I've tried this Fatburger location twice now. Both times just a 3 star. While they do have HUGH burgers, they also have little burgers for the kids & the lil eaters. Burgers have all sorts of items you can put on. I have felt both time that their burgers are a little bland and very greasy, and their chili cheese fries are about par. 24 hr DT.
Very friendly, good service. The food was excellent and will be going back. Great selection of burgers and made the way you want it.

It's about 3 a.m.-- you and your party is super-drunk from a night at Pure at Caesar's Palace-- where do you go? FATTBURGER- the last great hamburger stand! For me, all it takes is a turkey burger with the works, fries, and a chocolate milkshake to revive the evening's memories. Open 24 Hours. Thank you Vegas.

I like Fatburger, usually. I walked down the strip and was accosted by people handing out cards - buy one drink, get one free. Sounds good, right? 

I go inside to order my burger, and try to order my drafts (the tap is right next to the cash register). She tells me I have to go outside to the bar to order the drinks. Whatever. So I go outside. I try and order two shock tops. No deal. She says the second draft has to be a domestic. I remind her it's made in America. Still no deal. I look at the card and it says nothing about this. So, I'm forced to order a bud light to comply with their unwritten policy. 

I like the food, but hate having to jump through hoops just to claim an offer they're handing out. Fix the service, and I'm happy.

Love coming here for the veggie burger on my lunch break. Larger than your typical veggie burger, so it works out great on those days I have a huge appetite. I am also a big fan of their fries, skinny style or fat style!

Stopped in with the mom to grab a quick dinner. The place was a ghost town. Not complaining. It was a Sunday and it meant quick and speedy service. I think we all know how long you can wait for a Fatburger to be cooked when the place is packed!

Anyway, I got the veggie burger and mom got the regular. Both were pretty good and the fries were awesome! Best fries I've had from a fast food chain to date. I say this because it had been YEARS since I've eaten at Fatburger, let alone ordered their fries because the burger always seemed to be enough. I was starving this day! lol!

Staff was very friendly and the cashier working that day was pretty darn cute, I might add. ;)

I recommend. Yup....sure do!

So I'm at a beer festival and someone walks by with a bag of Fatburger and the smell just makes me want some. So my buddies and I head over to get some grub. It's clean and not too expensive. They are the place if you want a big burger. I was hungry so I got the size large with skinny fries and a chocolate shake. The large has to be around 8oz so that's a decent size for a burger when your hungry. My friend got herself the medium. The burger was nice and juicy and they make to order so everything was hot. I like that I can choose whats on the burger. The shake is so good but after the burger and fries it was hard to finish ha ha. Nothing to special about the fries. They weren't bad or have an amazing twist on them so if you like potatoes you will like them.
