Been many years since last visit which wasn't that impressive.
The store is very clean and staff were very nice. Open kitchen with diner counter is nice.
Ordered the mushroom Swiss burger with skinny fries and reg drink. $14.47 They deliver to table your order.
Burger wasn't large, had a thick juicy patty..but..way over seasoned and paper thin mushrooms. Fries were bland..no seasoning. Coke was good!
Honestly $14.47 for lunch is way too expensive for this. $7.69 for burger, $3 for fries, almost $3 for reg soda...wow that's what a hamburgers all about...not

BEWARE. THEY USE LEAN MEAT!!
haha, Just sayin', the burger was kinda dry. but definately a pretty good burger and fries. got 2 burgers, and shared a thing of fries. total bill $30. Not bad, wouldn't go back though

Just finished eating here. service was great, didn't catch the dude's name but the guy who rung me up amd cooked/served my food was cool and seemed liked he took pride in his job. Food was served fairly quick seeing as how the food is made to order and fresh. Burger was big and juicy (I ordered the XXL 1lb burger) the veggies were fresh. The only thing I suggest they do is get heartier buns that can hold up when topped with 16oz of juicy beef (half way thru the bun wasnt sloppy soaked but it was pretty weak) the beef had a great seasoning to it and the fries, which are my favorite kind steak fries (fat fries) were cooked perfectly. It was pretty empty in the building I dont see why but the joint was clean. Overall the service, food, and the fact it took me back 9years since high school when I used to eat fat burger every other week this place scores a solid 5

Food | 3 out of 5
Value | 3 out of 5 
Service | 5 out of 5
Location | 4 out of 5
Recommended | Go crazy on the toppings or else you'll have a dry burger
________________

Another hidden gem in the heart of Thornhill right beside Promenade Mall! If you're in the area and craving a burger, check this out. However, if you are closer to other notable burger joints, I wouldn't suggest a trek all the way here.

The burger itself (bun and patty) was pretty dry despite their brand's claim to have "the biggest and juiciest burgers you'll ever taste." Let's just say I had pretty high expectations for a big and juicy burger until I took my first bite. The pro-tip here is to add as many toppings as you can to compensate for the dry burger. This isn't necessarily a bad thing to overload on toppings, but I also don't want to force myself to ask for more lettuce and tomatoes just to add moisture to my burger. I did enjoy the option to add an onion ring!

The price is comparable to other burger joints in this fast-casual space. There was once a Groupon, which I am upset I didn't snag. If it comes up and you are in the area, I think the deal is worth it for this place.

The service is the best part about this place! The staff are so friendly and attentive. They brought our food and drinks to the table and cleaned it right after we were done. Definitely a nice surprise for a fast casual place like this!

Awful service. 

Ordered a large with cheese and a milkshake. The guy goes " I'll take the shake out right away". 

10 minutes goes by... the burger arrives and as the delivery person takes away the number in the stick thing I mention I still have a shake coming. Well She mumbled something took the stick and walked away... obviously not giving a shit. 

Another 10 minutes goes by and I finish the entire burger and don't you know it? I'm thirsty! I walk up to the counter and ask for the milkshake. Someone turns around and pulls it out of refrigerator and hands it to me? Really wtf? Did they assume I abandoned it after not searching for it's destination? And they weren't even that apologetic about it either. Oh and I should mention they weren't that busy... I'd be more sympathetic if they were being overrun by customers. 

Guess I'll grab a burger at Five guys next time and every time from now on.
love fat burger....staff is super nice..food is awesome...my favourite: mushroom swiss melt burger with chocolate shake and skinny fries...yum yum

Not too many good Fat Burgers left around Vegas. This one is still decent. We only opt for burgers and fat fries/onion rings. Couldn't speak for the rest of the menu. Staff is hit or miss but good as of now. Pamela is nice and efficient.
Still the best burgers, order take out but food cold! Good thing for toaster ovens to reheat, next time ask for extra hot!

The two stars is for service alone.  The employees that work here are very pleasant and helpful.  

The food is... in a word... disgusting.

I hadn't eaten at Fatburger since the nineties, and now I remember why.  The burgers are grossly under-seasoned and do not taste good.  

In fact, I think Fatburger makes the worst burger I have ever had in my life.  

The fries were fine - nothing special.  

I ended up leaving my burger after just two bites.  I HATE wasting food, but I could not stomach it.  

Do yourself a favor and walk a block or so over to Five Guys.
Overpriced for burger and service was terrible.  Waitress was rude and not friendly at all.  No kids menu.  1/3 lbs is way to big for a child.  Not recommended for families.

Worst Fatburger ever.

Honestly, it took about 30 mins to get 2 milkshakes.

A lot of the customers in the restaurant seemed unhappy with their service.

I get that it was 1am at night, but it took over 3 mins for me to pay with a credit card.


I love the Fatburger franchise, but this location does it shame.

Have had breakfast and lunch at this location. Both times the food was great. Was actually very surprised with the breakfast. Never would have thought it would be so good. The staff is awesome. Very friendly. Fast service. Will be back again.
I was tired of buffets and wanted a great burger! It was juicy and tasty! I had the medium and hubby had the large burger! This place never close on Vegas strip. Nice meal  after hours!

I LOVE Fatburger! I went to this location in the afternoon it was after 6pm, and service was good, cashier with a smile and helpful. The cook was very friendly and food was delicious. Great job guys keep up the good work!!! I would definitely come back.
Food was super on point! But! Lucero, the lady that took my order, was a bit rude and pushy. And! Got my order wrong! Other than that, it was ok.

I like them for having the option of a veggie burger that dosent taste like cardboard, I always get the curly fries with The garlic pepper seasoning. The one lady who usually works the counter is super friendly.  They have "all day" breakfast which is actually tons of food for the price. Toast, eggs, hashbrows Ang your choice of meat or pancakes for under $8

Summary/TLDR - Wonderful service, $40 for 2 people (pricey), good burger but could use more flavor. It's a higher class Steak n Shake. Would visit again.

Food - 6/10
Service - 10/10
Atmosphere - 8/10
Wait Time - 8/10

Stopped in because I heard this place was decent. Ordered a 1/3# breakfast burger (burger, egg, bacon, cheddar) and they had an advertisement for free fries with a purchase of a draft beer, so naturally, I jumped on this offer. We ended up getting charged for the fries, went back up, the cashier had recognized us and his mistake, apologized and admitted he got a bit flustered with the line that was forming behind us. The fact that he straight up admitted he made a mistake, without trying to dance around the issue, really made me appreciate the service here. So he called over the manager and they were going to refund us, which I know can be a pain, so I asked if we could get onion rings instead, and the manager (without hesitation) said yes. FANTASTIC SERVICE. The onion rings were brought right over.

I'm pretty picky when it comes to breakfast burgers. I can say this wasn't the best I've ever had, but it was better than some of the worst. The meat could've used more flavor, but regardless, a good burger!

It was a tad bit expensive though. For 2 breakfast burgers, 1 beer, and fries was $40...
